column1: Nociceptin / orphanin FQ and nocistatin on learning and memory impairment induced by scopolamine in mice .
column2: chem* Nociceptin *chem / chem* orphanin FQ *chem and chem* nocistatin *chem on learning and memory impairment induced by chem* scopolamine *chem in mice .

column1: Nociceptin , also known as orphanin FQ , is an endogenous ligand for the orphan opioid receptor - like receptor 1 ( ORL1 ) and involves in various functions in the central nervous system ( CNS ) .
column2: chem* Nociceptin *chem , also known as chem* orphanin FQ *chem , is an endogenous ligand for the orphan opioid receptor - like receptor 1 ( ORL1 ) and involves in various functions in the central nervous system ( CNS ) .

column1: On the other hand , nocistatin is recently isolated from the same precursor as nociceptin and blocks nociceptin - induced allodynia and hyperalgesia .
column2: On the other hand , chem* nocistatin *chem is recently isolated from the same precursor as chem* nociceptin *chem and blocks chem* nociceptin *chem - induced allodynia and hyperalgesia .

column1: Although ORL1 receptors which display a high degree of sequence homology with classical opioid receptors are abundant in the hippocampus , little is known regarding their role in learning and memory .
column2: Although ORL1 receptors which display a high degree of sequence homology with classical opioid receptors are abundant in the hippocampus , little is known regarding their role in learning and memory .

column1: The present study was designed to investigate whether nociceptin / orphanin FQ and nocistatin could modulate impairment of learning and memory induced by scopolamine , a muscarinic cholinergic receptor antagonist , using spontaneous alternation of Y - maze and step - down type passive avoidance tasks in mice .
column2: The present study was designed to investigate whether chem* nociceptin *chem / chem* orphanin FQ *chem and chem* nocistatin *chem could modulate impairment of learning and memory induced by chem* scopolamine *chem , a muscarinic cholinergic receptor antagonist , using spontaneous alternation of Y - maze and step - down type passive avoidance tasks in mice .

column1: While nocistatin ( 0 . 5 - 5 . 0 nmol mouse - 1 , i . c . v . ) administered 30 min before spontaneous alternation performance or the training session of the passive avoidance task , had no effect on spontaneous alternation or passive avoidance behaviours , a lower per cent alternation and shorter median step - down latency in the retention test were obtained in nociceptin ( 1 . 5 and / or 5 . 0 nmol mouse - 1 , i . c . v . ) - treated normal mice .
column2: While chem* nocistatin *chem ( 0 . 5 - 5 . 0 nmol mouse - 1 , i . c . v . ) administered 30 min before spontaneous alternation performance or the training session of the passive avoidance task , had no effect on spontaneous alternation or passive avoidance behaviours , a lower per cent alternation and shorter median step - down latency in the retention test were obtained in chem* nociceptin *chem ( 1 . 5 and / or 5 . 0 nmol mouse - 1 , i . c . v . ) - treated normal mice .

column1: Administration of nocistatin ( 1 . 5 and / or 5 . 0 nmol mouse - 1 , i . c . v . ) 30 min before spontaneous alternation performance or the training session of the passive avoidance task , attenuated the scopolamine - induced impairment of spontaneous alternation and passive avoidance behaviours .
column2: Administration of chem* nocistatin *chem ( 1 . 5 and / or 5 . 0 nmol mouse - 1 , i . c . v . ) 30 min before spontaneous alternation performance or the training session of the passive avoidance task , attenuated the chem* scopolamine *chem - induced impairment of spontaneous alternation and passive avoidance behaviours .

column1: These results indicated that nocistatin , a new biologically active peptide , ameliorates impairments of spontaneous alternation and passive avoidance induced by scopolamine , and suggested that these peptides play opposite roles in learning and memory .
column2: These results indicated that chem* nocistatin *chem , a new biologically active peptide , ameliorates impairments of spontaneous alternation and passive avoidance induced by chem* scopolamine *chem , and suggested that these peptides play opposite roles in learning and memory .

column1: Induction of apoptosis by remoxipride metabolites in HL60 and CD34 + / CD19 - human bone marrow progenitor cells : potential relevance to remoxipride - induced aplastic anemia .

column1: The antipsychotic agent , remoxipride [ ( S ) - ( - ) - 3 - bromo - N - [ ( 1 - ethyl - 2 - pyrrolidinyl ) methyl ] - 2 , 6 - dimethoxybenz amide ] has been associated with acquired aplastic anemia .

column1: We have examined the ability of remoxipride , three pyrrolidine ring metabolites and five aromatic ring metabolites of the parent compound to induce apoptosis in HL60 cells and human bone marrow progenitor ( HBMP ) cells .
column2: We have examined the ability of chem* remoxipride *chem , three chem* pyrrolidine *chem ring metabolites and five aromatic ring metabolites of the parent compound to induce apoptosis in HL60 cells and human bone marrow progenitor ( HBMP ) cells .

column1: Apoptosis was assessed by fluorescence microscopy in Hoechst 33342 - and propidium iodide stained cell samples .
column2: Apoptosis was assessed by fluorescence microscopy in chem* Hoechst 33342 *chem - and chem* propidium iodide *chem stained cell samples .

column1: Results were confirmed by determination of internucleosomal DNA fragmentation using gel electrophoresis for HL60 cell samples and terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase assay in HBMP cells .
column2: Results were confirmed by determination of internucleosomal DNA fragmentation using gel electrophoresis for HL60 cell samples and terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase assay in HBMP cells .

column1: The catechol and hydroquinone metabolites , NCQ436 and NCQ344 , induced apoptosis in HL60 and HBMP cells in a time - and concentration dependent manner , while the phenols , NCR181 , FLA873 , and FLA797 , and the derivatives formed by oxidation of the pyrrolidine ring , FLA838 , NCM001 , and NCL118 , had no effect .
column2: The chem* catechol *chem and chem* hydroquinone *chem metabolites , chem* NCQ436 *chem and chem* NCQ344 *chem , induced apoptosis in HL60 and HBMP cells in a time - and concentration dependent manner , while the chem* phenols *chem , NCR181 , FLA873 , and chem* FLA797 *chem , and the derivatives formed by oxidation of the chem* pyrrolidine *chem ring , FLA838 , NCM001 , and NCL118 , had no effect .

column1: No necrosis was observed in cells treated with NCQ436 but NCQ344 had a biphasic effect in both cell types , inducing apoptosis at lower concentrations and necrosis at higher concentrations .
column2: No necrosis was observed in cells treated with chem* NCQ436 *chem but chem* NCQ344 *chem had a biphasic effect in both cell types , inducing apoptosis at lower concentrations and necrosis at higher concentrations .

column1: These data show that the catechol and hydroquinone metabolites of remoxipride have direct toxic effects in HL60 and HBMP cells , leading to apoptosis , while the phenol metabolites were inactive .
column2: These data show that the chem* catechol *chem and chem* hydroquinone *chem metabolites of chem* remoxipride *chem have direct toxic effects in HL60 and HBMP cells , leading to apoptosis , while the chem* phenol *chem metabolites were inactive .

column1: Similarly , benzene - derived catechol and hydroquinone , but not phenol , induce apoptosis in HBMP cells [ Moran et al . , Mol . Pharmacol . , 50 ( 1996 ) 610 - 615 ] .

column1: We propose that remoxipride and benzene may induce aplastic anemia via production of similar reactive metabolites and that the ability of NCQ436 and NCQ344 to induce apoptosis in HBMP cells may contribute to the mechanism underlying acquired aplastic anemia that has been associated with remoxipride .

column2: OBJECTIVE : To determine whether pharmacological stress leads to prolonged but reversible left ventricular dysfunction in patients with coronary artery disease , similar to that seen after exercise .

column1: Anorexigens and pulmonary hypertension in the United States : results from the surveillance of North American pulmonary hypertension .

column1: BACKGROUND : The use of appetite suppressants in Europe has been associated with the development of primary pulmonary hypertension ( PPH ) .
column2: BACKGROUND : The use of appetite suppressants in Europe has been associated with the development of primary pulmonary hypertension ( PPH ) .

column2: A history of drug exposure also was taken with special attention on the use of antidepressants , anorexigens , and chem* amphetamines *chem .

column1: RESULTS : Five hundred seventy - nine patients were studied , 205 with PPH and 374 with pulmonary hypertension from other causes ( secondary pulmonary hypertension [ SPH ] ) .
column2: RESULTS : Five hundred seventy - nine patients were studied , 205 with PPH and 374 with pulmonary hypertension from other causes ( secondary pulmonary hypertension [ SPH ] ) .

column1: The use of anorexigens was common in both groups .
column2: The use of anorexigens was common in both groups .

column1: However , of the medications surveyed , only the fenfluramines had a significant preferential association with PPH as compared with SPH ( adjusted odds ratio for use > 6 months , 7 . 5 ; 95 % confidence interval , 1 . 7 to 32 . 4 ) .
column2: However , of the medications surveyed , only the chem* fenfluramines *chem had a significant preferential association with PPH as compared with SPH ( adjusted odds ratio for use > 6 months , 7 . 5 ; 95 % confidence interval , 1 . 7 to 32 . 4 ) .

column1: The association was stronger with longer duration of use when compared to shorter duration of use and was more pronounced in recent users than in remote users .
column2: The association was stronger with longer duration of use when compared to shorter duration of use and was more pronounced in recent users than in remote users .

column1: An unexpectedly high ( 11 . 4 % ) number of patients with SPH had used anorexigens .
column2: An unexpectedly high ( 11 . 4 % ) number of patients with SPH had used anorexigens .

column1: CONCLUSION : The magnitude of the association with PPH , the increase of association with increasing duration of use , and the specificity for fenfluramines are consistent with previous studies indicating that fenfluramines are causally related to PPH .
column2: CONCLUSION : The magnitude of the association with PPH , the increase of association with increasing duration of use , and the specificity for chem* fenfluramines *chem are consistent with previous studies indicating that chem* fenfluramines *chem are causally related to PPH .

column1: The high prevalence of anorexigen use in patients with SPH also raises the possibility that these drugs precipitate pulmonary hypertension in patients with underlying conditions associated with SPH .

column1: Clinical aspects of heparin - induced thrombocytopenia and thrombosis and other side effects of heparin therapy .
column2: Clinical aspects of chem* heparin *chem - induced thrombocytopenia and thrombosis and other side effects of chem* heparin *chem therapy .

column1: Heparin , first used to prevent the clotting of blood in vitro , has been clinically used to treat thrombosis for more than 50 years .
column2: chem* Heparin *chem , first used to prevent the clotting of blood in vitro , has been clinically used to treat thrombosis for more than 50 years .

column1: Although several new anticoagulant drugs are in development , heparin remains the anticoagulant of choice to treat acute thrombotic episodes .
column2: Although several new anticoagulant drugs are in development , chem* heparin *chem remains the anticoagulant of choice to treat acute thrombotic episodes .

column1: The clinical effects of heparin are meritorious , but side effects do exist .
column2: The clinical effects of chem* heparin *chem are meritorious , but side effects do exist .

column1: Bleeding is the primary untoward effect of heparin .
column2: Bleeding is the primary untoward effect of chem* heparin *chem .

column1: Major bleeding is of primary concern in patients receiving heparin therapy .
column2: Major bleeding is of primary concern in patients receiving chem* heparin *chem therapy .

column1: However , additional important untoward effects of heparin therapy include heparin - induced thrombocytopenia , heparin - associated osteoporosis , eosinophilia , skin reactions , allergic reactions other than thrombocytopenia , alopecia , transaminasemia , hyperkalemia , hypoaldosteronism , and priapism .
column2: However , additional important untoward effects of chem* heparin *chem therapy include chem* heparin *chem - induced thrombocytopenia , chem* heparin *chem - associated osteoporosis , eosinophilia , skin reactions , allergic reactions other than thrombocytopenia , alopecia , transaminasemia , hyperkalemia , hypoaldosteronism , and priapism .

column1: These side effects are relatively rare in a given individual , but given the extremely widespread use of heparin , some are quite common , particularly HITT and osteoporosis .
column2: These side effects are relatively rare in a given individual , but given the extremely widespread use of chem* heparin *chem , some are quite common , particularly HITT and osteoporosis .

column1: Although reasonable incidences of many of these side effects can be " softly " deduced from current reports dealing with unfractionated heparin , at present the incidences of these side effects with newer low molecular weight heparins appear to be much less common .
column2: Although reasonable incidences of many of these side effects can be " softly " deduced from current reports dealing with unfractionated chem* heparin *chem , at present the incidences of these side effects with newer low molecular weight chem* heparins *chem appear to be much less common .

column1: However , only longer experience will more clearly define the incidence of each side effect with low molecular weight preparations .
column2: However , only longer experience will more clearly define the incidence of each side effect with low molecular weight preparations .

column1: A case of bilateral optic neuropathy in a patient on tacrolimus ( FK506 ) therapy after liver transplantation .
column2: A case of bilateral optic neuropathy in a patient on chem* tacrolimus *chem ( chem* FK506 *chem ) therapy after liver transplantation .

column1: PURPOSE : To report a case of bilateral optic neuropathy in a patient receiving tacrolimus ( FK 506 , Prograf ; Fujisawa USA , Inc , Deerfield , Illinois ) for immunosuppression after orthotropic liver transplantation .
column2: PURPOSE : To report a case of bilateral optic neuropathy in a patient receiving chem* tacrolimus *chem ( chem* FK 506 *chem , Prograf ; Fujisawa USA , Inc , Deerfield , Illinois ) for immunosuppression after orthotropic liver transplantation .

column1: METHOD : Case report .
column2: METHOD : Case report .

column1: In a 58 - year - old man receiving tacrolimus after orthotropic liver transplantation , serial neuro - ophthalmologic examinations and laboratory studies were performed .
column2: In a 58 - year - old man receiving chem* tacrolimus *chem after orthotropic liver transplantation , serial neuro - ophthalmologic examinations and laboratory studies were performed .

column1: RESULTS : The patient had episodic deterioration of vision in both eyes , with clinical features resembling ischemic optic neuropathies .
column2: RESULTS : The patient had episodic deterioration of vision in both eyes , with clinical features resembling ischemic optic neuropathies .

column1: Deterioration of vision occurred despite discontinuation of the tacrolimus .
column2: Deterioration of vision occurred despite discontinuation of the chem* tacrolimus *chem .

column1: CONCLUSION : Tacrolimus and other immunosuppressive agents may be associated with optic nerve toxicity .
column2: CONCLUSION : chem* Tacrolimus *chem and other immunosuppressive agents may be associated with optic nerve toxicity .

column1: Hypercalcemia , arrhythmia , and mood stabilizers .
column2: Hypercalcemia , arrhythmia , and mood stabilizers .

column1: Recent findings in a bipolar patient receiving maintenance lithium therapy who developed hypercalcemia and severe bradyarrhythmia prompted the authors to conduct a retrospective study of bipolar patients with lithium - associated hypercalcemia .
column2: Recent findings in a bipolar patient receiving maintenance chem* lithium *chem therapy who developed hypercalcemia and severe bradyarrhythmia prompted the authors to conduct a retrospective study of bipolar patients with chem* lithium *chem - associated hypercalcemia .

column1: A printout of all cases of hypercalcemia that presented during a 1 - year period was generated .
column2: A printout of all cases of hypercalcemia that presented during a 1 - year period was generated .

column1: After eliminating spurious hypercalcemias or those associated with intravenous fluids , the authors identified 18 non - lithium - treated patients with hypercalcemias related to malignancies and other medical conditions ( group A ) and 12 patients with lithium - associated hypercalcemia ( group B ) .
column2: After eliminating spurious hypercalcemias or those associated with intravenous fluids , the authors identified 18 non - chem* lithium *chem - treated patients with hypercalcemias related to malignancies and other medical conditions ( group A ) and 12 patients with chem* lithium *chem - associated hypercalcemia ( group B ) .

column1: Patients in group B were not comparable to those in group A , as the latter were medically compromised and were receiving multiple pharmacotherapies .
column2: Patients in group B were not comparable to those in group A , as the latter were medically compromised and were receiving multiple pharmacotherapies .

column1: Thus , two control groups were generated : group C1 , which included age - and sex - comparable lithium - treated bipolar normocalcemic patients , and group C2 , which included bipolar normocalcemic patients treated with anticonvulsant mood stabilizers .
column2: Thus , two control groups were generated : group C1 , which included age - and sex - comparable chem* lithium *chem - treated bipolar normocalcemic patients , and group C2 , which included bipolar normocalcemic patients treated with anticonvulsant mood stabilizers .

column1: The electrocardiographic ( ECG ) findings for patients in group B were compared with those of patients in groups C1 and C2 .
column2: The electrocardiographic ( ECG ) findings for patients in group B were compared with those of patients in groups C1 and C2 .

column1: It was found that these groups did not differ in their overall frequency of ECG abnormalities ; however , there were significant differences in the frequency of conduction defects .
column2: It was found that these groups did not differ in their overall frequency of ECG abnormalities ; however , there were significant differences in the frequency of conduction defects .

column1: Patients with hypercalcemia resulting from medical diseases and bipolar patients with lithium - associated hypercalcemia had significantly higher frequencies of conduction defects .
column2: Patients with hypercalcemia resulting from medical diseases and bipolar patients with chem* lithium *chem - associated hypercalcemia had significantly higher frequencies of conduction defects .

column1: Patients in group A had significant mortality at 2 - year follow - up ( 28 % ) , in contrast to zero mortality in the other three groups .
column2: Patients in group A had significant mortality at 2 - year follow - up ( 28 % ) , in contrast to zero mortality in the other three groups .

column1: The clinical implications of these findings are discussed .
column2: The clinical implications of these findings are discussed .

column1: Attenuation of nephrotoxicity by a novel lipid nanosphere ( NS - 718 ) incorporating amphotericin B .
column2: Attenuation of nephrotoxicity by a novel lipid nanosphere ( NS - 718 ) incorporating chem* amphotericin B *chem .

column1: NS - 718 , a lipid nanosphere incorporating amphotericin B , is effective against pathogenic fungi and has low toxicity .
column2: NS - 718 , a lipid nanosphere incorporating chem* amphotericin B *chem , is effective against pathogenic fungi and has low toxicity .

column1: We compared the toxicity of NS - 718 with that of Fungizone ( amphotericin B - sodium deoxycholate ; D - AmB ) in vitro using renal cell cultures and in vivo by biochemical analysis , histopathological study of the kidney and pharmacokinetic study of amphotericin B following intravenous infusion of the formulation in rats .
column2: We compared the toxicity of NS - 718 with that of chem* Fungizone *chem ( chem* amphotericin B - sodium deoxycholate *chem ; chem* D - AmB *chem ) in vitro using renal cell cultures and in vivo by biochemical analysis , histopathological study of the kidney and pharmacokinetic study of chem* amphotericin B *chem following intravenous infusion of the formulation in rats .

column2: Incubation with NS - 718 resulted in significantly less damage of cultured human renal proximal tubular epithelial cells compared with chem* D - AmB *chem .

column1: Serum blood urea and creatinine concentrations increased significantly in rats given an iv infusion of D - AmB 3 mg / kg but not in those given the same dose of NS - 718 .
column2: Serum blood chem* urea *chem and chem* creatinine *chem concentrations increased significantly in rats given an iv infusion of chem* D - AmB *chem 3 mg / kg but not in those given the same dose of NS - 718 .

column1: Histopathological examination of the kidney showed tubular necrosis in D - AmB - treated rats but no change in NS - 718 - treated rats .
column2: Histopathological examination of the kidney showed tubular necrosis in chem* D - AmB *chem - treated rats but no change in NS - 718 - treated rats .

column1: Amphotericin B concentrations in the kidney in NS - 718 - treated rats were higher than those in D - AmB - treated rats .
column2: chem* Amphotericin B *chem concentrations in the kidney in NS - 718 - treated rats were higher than those in chem* D - AmB *chem - treated rats .

column1: Our in vitro and in vivo results suggest that incorporation of amphotericin B into lipid nanospheres of NS - 718 attenuates the nephrotoxicity of amphotericin B .
column2: Our in vitro and in vivo results suggest that incorporation of chem* amphotericin B *chem into lipid nanospheres of NS - 718 attenuates the nephrotoxicity of chem* amphotericin B *chem .

column2: chem* Sulfadiazine *chem acute nephrotoxicity is reviving specially because of its use in toxoplasmosis in HIV - positive patients .

column2: We report 4 cases , one of them in a previously healthy person .

column2: Under treatment with chem* sulfadiazine *chem they developed oliguria , abdominal pain , renal failure and showed multiple radiolucent renal calculi in echography .

column1: Hemodynamic and antiadrenergic effects of dronedarone and amiodarone in animals with a healed myocardial infarction .
column2: Hemodynamic and antiadrenergic effects of chem* dronedarone *chem and chem* amiodarone *chem in animals with a healed myocardial infarction .

column1: The hemodynamic and antiadrenergic effects of dronedarone , a noniodinated compound structurally related to amiodarone , were compared with those of amiodarone after prolonged oral administration , both at rest and during sympathetic stimulation in conscious dogs with a healed myocardial infarction .
column2: The hemodynamic and antiadrenergic effects of chem* dronedarone *chem , a noniodinated compound structurally related to chem* amiodarone *chem , were compared with those of chem* amiodarone *chem after prolonged oral administration , both at rest and during sympathetic stimulation in conscious dogs with a healed myocardial infarction .

column1: All dogs ( n = 6 ) randomly received orally dronedarone ( 10 and 30 mg / kg ) , amiodarone ( 10 and 30 mg / kg ) , and placebo twice daily for 7 days , with a 3 - week washout between consecutive treatments .
column2: All dogs ( n = 6 ) randomly received orally chem* dronedarone *chem ( 10 and 30 mg / kg ) , chem* amiodarone *chem ( 10 and 30 mg / kg ) , and placebo twice daily for 7 days , with a 3 - week washout between consecutive treatments .

column1: Heart rate ( HR ) , mean arterial pressure ( MBP ) , positive rate of increase of left ventricular pressure ( + LVdP / dt ) , echocardiographically assessed left ventricular ejection fraction ( LVEF ) , and fractional shortening ( FS ) , as well as chronotropic response to isoproterenol and exercise - induced sympathetic stimulation were evaluated under baseline and posttreatment conditions .
column2: Heart rate ( HR ) , mean arterial pressure ( MBP ) , positive rate of increase of left ventricular pressure ( + LVdP / dt ) , echocardiographically assessed left ventricular ejection fraction ( LVEF ) , and fractional shortening ( FS ) , as well as chronotropic response to chem* isoproterenol *chem and exercise - induced sympathetic stimulation were evaluated under baseline and posttreatment conditions .

column1: Resting values of LVEF , FS , + LVdP / dt , and MBP remained unchanged whatever the drug and the dosing regimen , whereas resting HR was significantly and dose - dependently lowered after dronedarone and to a lesser extent after amiodarone .
column2: Resting values of LVEF , FS , + LVdP / dt , and MBP remained unchanged whatever the drug and the dosing regimen , whereas resting HR was significantly and dose - dependently lowered after chem* dronedarone *chem and to a lesser extent after chem* amiodarone *chem .

column1: Both dronedarone and amiodarone significantly reduced the exercise - induced tachycardia and , at the highest dose , decreased the isoproterenol - induced tachycardia .
column2: Both chem* dronedarone *chem and chem* amiodarone *chem significantly reduced the exercise - induced tachycardia and , at the highest dose , decreased the chem* isoproterenol *chem - induced tachycardia .

column1: Thus , dronedarone and amiodarone displayed a similar level of antiadrenergic effect and did not impair the resting left ventricular function .
column2: Thus , chem* dronedarone *chem and chem* amiodarone *chem displayed a similar level of antiadrenergic effect and did not impair the resting left ventricular function .

column1: Consequently , dronedarone might be particularly suitable for the treatment and prevention of various clinical arrhythmias , without compromising the left ventricular function .
column2: Consequently , chem* dronedarone *chem might be particularly suitable for the treatment and prevention of various clinical arrhythmias , without compromising the left ventricular function .

column1: Phase 2 trial of liposomal doxorubicin ( 40 mg / m ( 2 ) ) in platinum / paclitaxel - refractory ovarian and fallopian tube cancers and primary carcinoma of the peritoneum .
column2: Phase 2 trial of liposomal chem* doxorubicin *chem ( 40 mg / m ( 2 ) ) in chem* platinum *chem / chem* paclitaxel *chem - refractory ovarian and fallopian tube cancers and primary carcinoma of the peritoneum .

column1: BACKGROUND : Several studies have demonstrated liposomal doxorubicin ( Doxil ) to be an active antineoplastic agent in platinum - resistant ovarian cancer , with dose limiting toxicity of the standard dosing regimen ( 50 mg / m ( 2 ) q 4 weeks ) being severe erythrodysesthesia ( " hand - foot syndrome " ) and stomatitis .
column2: BACKGROUND : Several studies have demonstrated liposomal chem* doxorubicin *chem ( chem* Doxil *chem ) to be an active antineoplastic agent in chem* platinum *chem - resistant ovarian cancer , with dose limiting toxicity of the standard dosing regimen ( 50 mg / m ( 2 ) q 4 weeks ) being severe erythrodysesthesia ( " hand - foot syndrome " ) and stomatitis .

column1: We wished to develop a more tolerable liposomal doxorubicin treatment regimen and document its level of activity in a well - defined patient population with platinum / paclitaxel - refractory disease .
column2: We wished to develop a more tolerable liposomal chem* doxorubicin *chem treatment regimen and document its level of activity in a well - defined patient population with chem* platinum *chem / chem* paclitaxel *chem - refractory disease .

column1: METHODS AND MATERIALS : Patients with ovarian or fallopian tube cancers or primary peritoneal carcinoma with platinum / paclitaxel - refractory disease ( stable or progressive disease following treatment with these agents or previous objective response < 3 months in duration ) were treated with liposomal doxorubicin at a dose of 40 mg / m ( 2 ) q 4 weeks .
column2: METHODS AND MATERIALS : Patients with ovarian or fallopian tube cancers or primary peritoneal carcinoma with chem* platinum *chem / chem* paclitaxel *chem - refractory disease ( stable or progressive disease following treatment with these agents or previous objective response < 3 months in duration ) were treated with liposomal chem* doxorubicin *chem at a dose of 40 mg / m ( 2 ) q 4 weeks .

column1: RESULTS : A total of 49 patients ( median age : 60 ; range 41 - 81 ) entered this phase 2 trial .
column2: RESULTS : A total of 49 patients ( median age : 60 ; range 41 - 81 ) entered this phase 2 trial .

column1: The median number of prior regimens was 2 ( range : 1 - 6 ) .
column2: The median number of prior regimens was 2 ( range : 1 - 6 ) .

column1: Six ( 12 % ) and 4 ( 8 % ) patients experienced grade 2 hand - foot syndrome and stomatitis , respectively ( no episodes of grade 3 ) .
column2: Six ( 12 % ) and 4 ( 8 % ) patients experienced grade 2 hand - foot syndrome and stomatitis , respectively ( no episodes of grade 3 ) .

column1: One patient developed grade 3 diarrhea requiring hospitalization for hydration .
column2: One patient developed grade 3 diarrhea requiring hospitalization for hydration .

column1: Six ( 12 % ) individuals required dose reductions .
column2: Six ( 12 % ) individuals required dose reductions .

column1: The median number of courses of liposomal doxorubicin administered on this protocol was 2 ( range : 1 - 12 ) .
column2: The median number of courses of liposomal chem* doxorubicin *chem administered on this protocol was 2 ( range : 1 - 12 ) .

column1: Four of 44 patients ( 9 % ) evaluable for response exhibited objective and subjective evidence of an antineoplastic effect of therapy .
column2: Four of 44 patients ( 9 % ) evaluable for response exhibited objective and subjective evidence of an antineoplastic effect of therapy .

column1: CONCLUSION : This modified liposomal doxorubicin regimen results in less toxicity ( stomatitis , hand - foot syndrome ) than the standard FDA - approved dose schedule .
column2: CONCLUSION : This modified liposomal chem* doxorubicin *chem regimen results in less toxicity ( stomatitis , hand - foot syndrome ) than the standard FDA - approved dose schedule .

column1: Definite , although limited , antineoplastic activity is observed in patients with well - defined platinum - and paclitaxel - refractory ovarian cancer .
column2: Definite , although limited , antineoplastic activity is observed in patients with well - defined chem* platinum *chem - and chem* paclitaxel *chem - refractory ovarian cancer .

column1: Efficacy of olanzapine in acute bipolar mania : a double - blind , placebo - controlled study .
column2: Efficacy of chem* olanzapine *chem in acute bipolar mania : a double - blind , placebo - controlled study .

column1: The Olanzipine HGGW Study Group .
column2: The chem* Olanzipine *chem HGGW Study Group .

column1: BACKGROUND : We compared the efficacy and safety of olanzapine vs placebo for the treatment of acute bipolar mania .
column2: BACKGROUND : We compared the efficacy and safety of chem* olanzapine *chem vs placebo for the treatment of acute bipolar mania .

column1: METHODS : Four - week , randomized , double - blind , parallel study .
column2: METHODS : Four - week , randomized , double - blind , parallel study .

column1: A total of 115 patients with a DSM - IV diagnosis of bipolar disorder , manic or mixed , were randomized to olanzapine , 5 to 20 mg / d ( n = 55 ) , or placebo ( n = 60 ) .
column2: A total of 115 patients with a DSM - IV diagnosis of bipolar disorder , manic or mixed , were randomized to chem* olanzapine *chem , 5 to 20 mg / d ( n = 55 ) , or placebo ( n = 60 ) .

column1: The primary efficacy measure was the Young - Mania Rating Scale ( Y - MRS ) total score .
column2: The primary efficacy measure was the Young - Mania Rating Scale ( Y - MRS ) total score .

column1: Response and euthymia were defined , a priori , as at least a 50 % improvement from baseline to end point and as a score of no less than 12 at end point in the Y - MRS total score , respectively .
column2: Response and euthymia were defined , a priori , as at least a 50 % improvement from baseline to end point and as a score of no less than 12 at end point in the Y - MRS total score , respectively .

column1: Safety was assessed using adverse events , Extrapyramidal Symptom ( EPS ) rating scales , laboratory values , electrocardiograms , vital signs , and weight change .
column2: Safety was assessed using adverse events , Extrapyramidal Symptom ( EPS ) rating scales , laboratory values , electrocardiograms , vital signs , and weight change .

column1: RESULTS : Olanzapine - treated patients demonstrated a statistically significant greater mean ( + / - SD ) improvement in Y - MRS total score than placebo - treated patients ( - 14 . 8 + / - 12 . 5 and - 8 . 1 + / - 12 . 7 , respectively ; P < . 001 ) , which was evident at the first postbaseline observation 1 week after randomization and was maintained throughout the study ( last observation carried forward ) .
column2: RESULTS : chem* Olanzapine *chem - treated patients demonstrated a statistically significant greater mean ( + / - SD ) improvement in Y - MRS total score than placebo - treated patients ( - 14 . 8 + / - 12 . 5 and - 8 . 1 + / - 12 . 7 , respectively ; P < . 001 ) , which was evident at the first postbaseline observation 1 week after randomization and was maintained throughout the study ( last observation carried forward ) .

column1: Olanzapine - treated patients demonstrated a higher rate of response ( 65 % vs 43 % , respectively ; P = . 02 ) and euthymia ( 61 % vs 36 % , respectively ; P = . 01 ) than placebo - treated patients .
column2: chem* Olanzapine *chem - treated patients demonstrated a higher rate of response ( 65 % vs 43 % , respectively ; P = . 02 ) and euthymia ( 61 % vs 36 % , respectively ; P = . 01 ) than placebo - treated patients .

column1: There were no statistically significant differences in EPSs between groups .
column2: There were no statistically significant differences in EPSs between groups .

column1: However , olanzapine - treated patients had a statistically significant greater mean ( + / - SD ) weight gain than placebo - treated patients ( 2 . 1 + / - 2 . 8 vs 0 . 45 + / - 2 . 3 kg , respectively ) and also experienced more treatment - emergent somnolence ( 21 patients [ 38 . 2 % ] vs 5 [ 8 . 3 % ] , respectively ) .
column2: However , chem* olanzapine *chem - treated patients had a statistically significant greater mean ( + / - SD ) weight gain than placebo - treated patients ( 2 . 1 + / - 2 . 8 vs 0 . 45 + / - 2 . 3 kg , respectively ) and also experienced more treatment - emergent somnolence ( 21 patients [ 38 . 2 % ] vs 5 [ 8 . 3 % ] , respectively ) .

column1: CONCLUSION : Olanzapine demonstrated greater efficacy than placebo in the treatment of acute bipolar mania and was generally well tolerated .
column2: CONCLUSION : chem* Olanzapine *chem demonstrated greater efficacy than placebo in the treatment of acute bipolar mania and was generally well tolerated .

column1: The effect of pupil dilation with tropicamide on vision and driving simulator performance .

column1: PURPOSE : To assess the effect of pupil dilation on vision and driving ability .
column2: PURPOSE : To assess the effect of pupil dilation on vision and driving ability .

column1: METHODS : A series of tests on various parameters of visual function and driving simulator performance were performed on 12 healthy drivers , before and after pupil dilation using guttae tropicamide 1 % .
column2: METHODS : A series of tests on various parameters of visual function and driving simulator performance were performed on 12 healthy drivers , before and after pupil dilation using guttae chem* tropicamide *chem 1 % .

column1: A driving simulator ( Transport Research Laboratory ) was used to measure reaction time ( RT ) , speed maintenance and steering accuracy .
column2: A driving simulator ( Transport Research Laboratory ) was used to measure reaction time ( RT ) , speed maintenance and steering accuracy .

column1: Tests of basic visual function included high - and low - contrast visual acuity ( HCVA and LCVA ) , Pelli - Robson contrast threshold ( CT ) and Goldmann perimetry ( FIELDS ) .
column2: Tests of basic visual function included high - and low - contrast visual acuity ( HCVA and LCVA ) , Pelli - Robson contrast threshold ( CT ) and Goldmann perimetry ( FIELDS ) .

column2: Useful Field of View ( UFOV - - a test of visual attention ) was also undertaken .

column1: The mean differences in the pre - and post - dilatation measurements were tested for statistical significance at the 95 % level using one - tail paired t - tests .
column2: The mean differences in the pre - and post - dilatation measurements were tested for statistical significance at the 95 % level using one - tail paired t - tests .

column1: RESULTS : Pupillary dilation resulted in a statistically significant deterioration in CT and HCVA only .
column2: RESULTS : Pupillary dilation resulted in a statistically significant deterioration in CT and HCVA only .

column1: Five of 12 drivers also exhibited deterioration in LCVA , CT and RT .
column2: Five of 12 drivers also exhibited deterioration in LCVA , CT and RT .

column1: Little evidence emerged for deterioration in FIELDS and UFOV .
column2: Little evidence emerged for deterioration in FIELDS and UFOV .

column1: Also , 7 of 12 drivers appeared to adjust their driving behaviour by reducing their speed on the driving simulator , leading to improved steering accuracy .
column2: Also , 7 of 12 drivers appeared to adjust their driving behaviour by reducing their speed on the driving simulator , leading to improved steering accuracy .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Pupillary dilation may lead to a decrease in vision and daylight driving performance in young people .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Pupillary dilation may lead to a decrease in vision and daylight driving performance in young people .

column1: Toleration of high doses of angiotensin - converting enzyme inhibitors in patients with chronic heart failure : results from the ATLAS trial .

column1: The Assessment of Treatment with Lisinopril and Survival .
column2: The Assessment of Treatment with chem* Lisinopril *chem and Survival .

column1: BACKGROUND : Treatment with angiotensin - converting enzyme ( ACE ) inhibitors reduces mortality and morbidity in patients with chronic heart failure ( CHF ) , but most affected patients are not receiving these agents or are being treated with doses lower than those found to be efficacious in trials , primarily because of concerns about the safety and tolerability of these agents , especially at the recommended doses .
column2: BACKGROUND : Treatment with chem* angiotensin - converting enzyme ( ACE ) inhibitors *chem reduces mortality and morbidity in patients with chronic heart failure ( CHF ) , but most affected patients are not receiving these agents or are being treated with doses lower than those found to be efficacious in trials , primarily because of concerns about the safety and tolerability of these agents , especially at the recommended doses .

column1: The present study examines the safety and tolerability of high - compared with low - dose lisinopril in CHF .
column2: The present study examines the safety and tolerability of high - compared with low - dose chem* lisinopril *chem in CHF .

column1: METHODS : The Assessment of Lisinopril and Survival study was a multicenter , randomized , double - blind trial in which patients with or without previous ACE inhibitor treatment were stabilized receiving medium - dose lisinopril ( 12 . 5 or 15 . 0 mg once daily [ OD ] ) for 2 to 4 weeks and then randomized to high - ( 35 . 0 or 32 . 5 mg OD ) or low - dose ( 5 . 0 or 2 . 5 mg OD ) groups .
column2: METHODS : The Assessment of chem* Lisinopril *chem and Survival study was a multicenter , randomized , double - blind trial in which patients with or without previous chem* ACE inhibitor *chem treatment were stabilized receiving medium - dose chem* lisinopril *chem ( 12 . 5 or 15 . 0 mg once daily [ OD ] ) for 2 to 4 weeks and then randomized to high - ( 35 . 0 or 32 . 5 mg OD ) or low - dose ( 5 . 0 or 2 . 5 mg OD ) groups .

column1: Patients with New York Heart Association classes II to IV CHF and left ventricular ejection fractions of no greater than 0 . 30 ( n = 3164 ) were randomized and followed up for a median of 46 months .
column2: Patients with New York Heart Association classes II to IV CHF and left ventricular ejection fractions of no greater than 0 . 30 ( n = 3164 ) were randomized and followed up for a median of 46 months .

column1: We examined the occurrence of adverse events and the need for discontinuation and dose reduction during treatment , with a focus on hypotension and renal dysfunction .
column2: We examined the occurrence of adverse events and the need for discontinuation and dose reduction during treatment , with a focus on hypotension and renal dysfunction .

column1: RESULTS : Of 405 patients not previously receiving an ACE inhibitor , doses in only 4 . 2 % could not be titrated to the medium doses required for randomization because of symptoms possibly related to hypotension ( 2 . 0 % ) or because of renal dysfunction or hyperkalemia ( 2 . 3 % ) .
column2: RESULTS : Of 405 patients not previously receiving an chem* ACE inhibitor *chem , doses in only 4 . 2 % could not be titrated to the medium doses required for randomization because of symptoms possibly related to hypotension ( 2 . 0 % ) or because of renal dysfunction or hyperkalemia ( 2 . 3 % ) .

column1: Doses in more than 90 % of randomized patients in the high - and low - dose groups were titrated to their assigned target , and the mean doses of blinded medication in both groups remained similar throughout the study .
column2: Doses in more than 90 % of randomized patients in the high - and low - dose groups were titrated to their assigned target , and the mean doses of blinded medication in both groups remained similar throughout the study .

column1: Withdrawals occurred in 27 . 1 % of the high - and 30 . 7 % of the low - dose groups .
column2: Withdrawals occurred in 27 . 1 % of the high - and 30 . 7 % of the low - dose groups .

column1: Subgroups presumed to be at higher risk for ACE inhibitor intolerance ( blood pressure , < 120 mm Hg ; creatinine , > or = 132 . 6 micromol / L [ > or = 1 . 5 mg / dL ] ; age , > or = 70 years ; and patients with diabetes ) generally tolerated the high - dose strategy .
column2: Subgroups presumed to be at higher risk for chem* ACE inhibitor *chem intolerance ( blood pressure , < 120 mm Hg ; chem* creatinine *chem , > or = 132 . 6 micromol / L [ > or = 1 . 5 mg / dL ] ; age , > or = 70 years ; and patients with diabetes ) generally tolerated the high - dose strategy .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : These findings demonstrate that ACE inhibitor therapy in most patients with CHF can be successfully titrated to and maintained at high doses , and that more aggressive use of these agents is warranted .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : These findings demonstrate that chem* ACE inhibitor *chem therapy in most patients with CHF can be successfully titrated to and maintained at high doses , and that more aggressive use of these agents is warranted .

column1: OBJECTIVES : Simultaneous abuse of cocaine and ethanol affects 12 million Americans annually .
column2: OBJECTIVES : Simultaneous abuse of cocaine and ethanol affects 12 million Americans annually .

column1: In combination , these substances are substantially more toxic than either drug alone .
column2: In combination , these substances are substantially more toxic than either drug alone .

column1: Their combined cardiac toxicity may be due to independent effects of each drug ; however , they may also be due to cocaethylene ( CE ) , a cocaine metabolite formed only in the presence of ethanol .
column2: Their combined cardiac toxicity may be due to independent effects of each drug ; however , they may also be due to chem* cocaethylene *chem ( chem* CE *chem ) , a chem* cocaine *chem metabolite formed only in the presence of chem* ethanol *chem .

column1: The purpose of this study was to delineate the role of CE in the combined cardiotoxicity of cocaine and ethanol in a model simulating their abuse .
column2: The purpose of this study was to delineate the role of chem* CE *chem in the combined cardiotoxicity of chem* cocaine *chem and chem* ethanol *chem in a model simulating their abuse .

column1: METHODS : Twenty - three dogs were randomized to receive either 1 ) three intravenous ( IV ) boluses of cocaine 7 . 5 mg / kg with ethanol ( 1 g / kg ) as an IV infusion ( C + E , n = 8 ) , 2 ) three cocaine boluses only ( C , n = 6 ) , 3 ) ethanol infusion only ( E , n = 5 ) , or 4 ) placebo boluses and infusion ( n = 4 ) .

column1: Hemodynamic measurements , electrocardiograms , and serum drug concentrations were obtained at baseline , and then at fixed time intervals after each drug was administered .
column2: Hemodynamic measurements , electrocardiograms , and serum drug concentrations were obtained at baseline , and then at fixed time intervals after each drug was administered .

column1: RESULTS : Two of eight dogs in the C + E group experienced cardiovascular collapse .
column2: RESULTS : Two of eight dogs in the C + E group experienced cardiovascular collapse .

column1: The most dramatic hemodynamic changes occurred after each cocaine bolus in the C + E and C only groups ; however , persistent hemodynamic changes occurred in the C + E group .
column2: The most dramatic hemodynamic changes occurred after each chem* cocaine *chem bolus in the C + E and C only groups ; however , persistent hemodynamic changes occurred in the C + E group .

column1: Peak CE levels were associated with a 45 % ( SD + / - 22 % , 95 % CI = 22 % to 69 % ) decrease in cardiac output ( p < 0 . 05 ) , a 56 % ( SD + / - 23 % , 95 % CI = 32 % to 80 % ) decrease in dP / dt ( max ) ( p < . 006 ) , and a 23 % ( SD + / - 15 % , 95 % CI = 7 % to 49 % ) decrease in SVO ( 2 ) ( p < 0 . 025 ) .

column1: Ventricular arrhythmias were primarily observed in the C + E group , in which four of eight dogs experienced ventricular tachycardia .
column2: Ventricular arrhythmias were primarily observed in the C + E group , in which four of eight dogs experienced ventricular tachycardia .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Cocaine and ethanol in combination were more toxic than either substance alone .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : chem* Cocaine *chem and chem* ethanol *chem in combination were more toxic than either substance alone .

column1: Frequency of appearance of myeloperoxidase - antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibody ( MPO - ANCA ) in Graves ' disease patients treated with propylthiouracil and the relationship between MPO - ANCA and clinical manifestations .
column2: Frequency of appearance of myeloperoxidase - antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibody ( MPO - ANCA ) in Graves ' disease patients treated with chem* propylthiouracil *chem and the relationship between MPO - ANCA and clinical manifestations .

column1: OBJECTIVE : Myeloperoxidase antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibody ( MPO - ANCA ) - positive vasculitis has been reported in patients with Graves ' disease who were treated with propylthiouracil ( PTU ) .
column2: OBJECTIVE : Myeloperoxidase antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibody ( MPO - ANCA ) - positive vasculitis has been reported in patients with Graves ' disease who were treated with chem* propylthiouracil *chem ( chem* PTU *chem ) .

column1: The appearance of MPO - ANCA in these cases was suspected of being related to PTU because the titres of MPO - ANCA decreased when PTU was stopped .
column2: The appearance of MPO - ANCA in these cases was suspected of being related to chem* PTU *chem because the titres of MPO - ANCA decreased when chem* PTU *chem was stopped .

column1: Nevertheless , there have been no studies on the temporal relationship between the appearance of MPO - ANCA and vasculitis during PTU therapy , or on the incidence of MPO - ANCA in untreated Graves ' disease patients .
column2: Nevertheless , there have been no studies on the temporal relationship between the appearance of MPO - ANCA and vasculitis during chem* PTU *chem therapy , or on the incidence of MPO - ANCA in untreated Graves ' disease patients .

column1: Therefore , we sought to address these parameters in patients with Graves ' disease .
column2: Therefore , we sought to address these parameters in patients with Graves ' disease .

column1: PATIENTS : We investigated 102 untreated patients with hyperthyroidism due to Graves ' disease for the presence of MPO - ANCA , and for the development vasculitis after starting PTU therapy .
column2: PATIENTS : We investigated 102 untreated patients with hyperthyroidism due to Graves ' disease for the presence of MPO - ANCA , and for the development vasculitis after starting chem* PTU *chem therapy .

column1: Twenty - nine of them were later excluded because of adverse effects of PTU or because the observation period was less than 3 months .
column2: Twenty - nine of them were later excluded because of adverse effects of chem* PTU *chem or because the observation period was less than 3 months .

column1: The remaining 73 patients ( 55 women and 18 men ) , all of whom were examined for more than 3 months , were adopted as the subjects of the investigation .
column2: The remaining 73 patients ( 55 women and 18 men ) , all of whom were examined for more than 3 months , were adopted as the subjects of the investigation .

column1: The median observation period was 23 . 6 months ( range : 3 - 37 months ) .
column2: The median observation period was 23 . 6 months ( range : 3 - 37 months ) .

column1: MEASUREMENTS : MPO - ANCA was measured at intervals of 2 - 6 months .
column2: MEASUREMENTS : MPO - ANCA was measured at intervals of 2 - 6 months .

column1: RESULTS : Before treatment , the MPO - ANCA titres of all 102 untreated Graves ' disease patients were within the reference range ( below 10 U / ml ) .
column2: RESULTS : Before treatment , the MPO - ANCA titres of all 102 untreated Graves ' disease patients were within the reference range ( below 10 U / ml ) .

column1: Three ( 4 . 1 % ) of the 73 patients were positive for MPO - ANCA at 13 , 16 and 17 months , respectively , after the start of PTU therapy .
column2: Three ( 4 . 1 % ) of the 73 patients were positive for MPO - ANCA at 13 , 16 and 17 months , respectively , after the start of chem* PTU *chem therapy .

column1: In two of them , the MPO - ANCA titres transiently increased to 12 . 8 and 15 . 0 U / ml , respectively , despite continued PTU therapy , but no vasculitic disorders developed .
column2: In two of them , the MPO - ANCA titres transiently increased to 12 . 8 and 15 . 0 U / ml , respectively , despite continued chem* PTU *chem therapy , but no vasculitic disorders developed .

column1: In the third patient , the MPO - ANCA titre increased to 204 U / ml and she developed a higher fever , oral ulcers and polyarthralgia , but the symptoms resolved 2 weeks after stopping PTU therapy , and the MPO - ANCA titre decreased to 20 . 7 U / ml by 4 months after discontinuing PTU .
column2: In the third patient , the MPO - ANCA titre increased to 204 U / ml and she developed a higher fever , oral ulcers and polyarthralgia , but the symptoms resolved 2 weeks after stopping chem* PTU *chem therapy , and the MPO - ANCA titre decreased to 20 . 7 U / ml by 4 months after discontinuing chem* PTU *chem .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : PTU therapy may be related to the appearance of MPO - ANCA , but MPO - ANCA does not appear to be closely related to vasculitis .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : chem* PTU *chem therapy may be related to the appearance of MPO - ANCA , but MPO - ANCA does not appear to be closely related to vasculitis .

column1: Prevalence of heart disease in asymptomatic chronic cocaine users .
column2: Prevalence of heart disease in asymptomatic chronic chem* cocaine *chem users .

column1: To determine the prevalence of heart disease in outpatient young asymptomatic chronic cocaine users , 35 cocaine users and 32 age - matched controls underwent resting and exercise electrocardiography ( ECG ) and Doppler echocardiography .
column2: To determine the prevalence of heart disease in outpatient young asymptomatic chronic chem* cocaine *chem users , 35 chem* cocaine *chem users and 32 age - matched controls underwent resting and exercise electrocardiography ( ECG ) and Doppler echocardiography .

column1: Findings consistent with coronary artery disease were detected in 12 ( 34 % ) patients and 3 ( 9 % ) controls ( p = 0 . 01 ) .
column2: Findings consistent with coronary artery disease were detected in 12 ( 34 % ) patients and 3 ( 9 % ) controls ( p = 0 . 01 ) .

column1: Decreased left ventricular systolic function was demonstrated in 5 ( 14 % ) patients , but in none of the controls ( p = 0 . 055 ) .
column2: Decreased left ventricular systolic function was demonstrated in 5 ( 14 % ) patients , but in none of the controls ( p = 0 . 055 ) .

column1: Finally , resting and peak exercise abnormal left ventricular filling was detected in 38 and 35 % of patients as compared to 19 and 9 % of controls , respectively ( p = 0 . 11 and 0 . 02 , respectively ) .
column2: Finally , resting and peak exercise abnormal left ventricular filling was detected in 38 and 35 % of patients as compared to 19 and 9 % of controls , respectively ( p = 0 . 11 and 0 . 02 , respectively ) .

column1: We conclude that coronary artery or myocardial disease is common ( 38 % ) in young asymptomatic chronic cocaine users .
column2: We conclude that coronary artery or myocardial disease is common ( 38 % ) in young asymptomatic chronic chem* cocaine *chem users .

column1: Therefore , screening ECG and echocardiography may be warranted in these patients .
column2: Therefore , screening ECG and echocardiography may be warranted in these patients .

column2: Cardioprotective effects of Picrorrhiza kurroa against chem* isoproterenol *chem - induced myocardial stress in rats .

column2: The cardioprotective effect of the chem* ethanol *chem extract of Picrorrhiza kurroa rhizomes and roots ( PK ) on chem* isoproterenol *chem - induced myocardial infarction in rats with respect to lipid metabolism in serum and heart tissue has been investigated .

column2: Oral pre - treatment with PK ( 80 mg kg ( - 1 ) day ( - 1 ) for 15 days ) significantly prevented the chem* isoproterenol *chem - induced myocardial infarction and maintained the rats at near normal status .

column1: Phase 2 early afterdepolarization as a trigger of polymorphic ventricular tachycardia in acquired long - QT syndrome : direct evidence from intracellular recordings in the intact left ventricular wall .
column2: Phase 2 early afterdepolarization as a trigger of polymorphic ventricular tachycardia in acquired long - QT syndrome : direct evidence from intracellular recordings in the intact left ventricular wall .

column1: BACKGROUND : This study examined the role of phase 2 early afterdepolarization ( EAD ) in producing a trigger to initiate torsade de pointes ( TdP ) with QT prolongation induced by dl - sotalol and azimilide .
column2: BACKGROUND : This study examined the role of phase 2 early afterdepolarization ( EAD ) in producing a trigger to initiate torsade de pointes ( TdP ) with QT prolongation induced by dl - chem* sotalol *chem and chem* azimilide *chem .

column1: The contribution of transmural dispersion of repolarization ( TDR ) to transmural propagation of EAD and the maintenance of TdP was also evaluated .
column2: The contribution of transmural dispersion of repolarization ( TDR ) to transmural propagation of EAD and the maintenance of TdP was also evaluated .

column1: METHODS AND RESULTS : Transmembrane action potentials from epicardium , midmyocardium , and endocardium were recorded simultaneously , together with a transmural ECG , in arterially perfused canine and rabbit left ventricular preparations .
column2: METHODS AND RESULTS : Transmembrane action potentials from epicardium , midmyocardium , and endocardium were recorded simultaneously , together with a transmural ECG , in arterially perfused canine and rabbit left ventricular preparations .

column1: dl - Sotalol preferentially prolonged action potential duration ( APD ) in M cells dose - dependently ( 1 to 100 micromol / L ) , leading to QT prolongation and an increase in TDR .
column2: dl - chem* Sotalol *chem preferentially prolonged action potential duration ( APD ) in M cells dose - dependently ( 1 to 100 micromol / L ) , leading to QT prolongation and an increase in TDR .

column1: Azimilide , however , significantly prolonged APD and QT interval at concentrations from 0 . 1 to 10 micromol / L but shortened them at 30 micromol / L .
column2: chem* Azimilide *chem , however , significantly prolonged APD and QT interval at concentrations from 0 . 1 to 10 micromol / L but shortened them at 30 micromol / L .

column1: Unlike dl - sotalol , azimilide ( > 3 micromol / L ) increased epicardial APD markedly , causing a diminished TDR .
column2: Unlike dl - chem* sotalol *chem , chem* azimilide *chem ( > 3 micromol / L ) increased epicardial APD markedly , causing a diminished TDR .

column1: Although both dl - sotalol and azimilide rarely induced EADs in canine left ventricles , they produced frequent EADs in rabbits , in which more pronounced QT prolongation was seen .
column2: Although both dl - chem* sotalol *chem and chem* azimilide *chem rarely induced EADs in canine left ventricles , they produced frequent EADs in rabbits , in which more pronounced QT prolongation was seen .

column1: An increase in TDR by dl - sotalol facilitated transmural propagation of EADs that initiated multiple episodes of spontaneous TdP in 3 of 6 rabbit left ventricles .
column2: An increase in TDR by dl - chem* sotalol *chem facilitated transmural propagation of EADs that initiated multiple episodes of spontaneous TdP in 3 of 6 rabbit left ventricles .

column1: Of note , although azimilide ( 3 to 10 micromol / L ) increased APD more than dl - sotalol , its EADs often failed to propagate transmurally , probably because of a diminished TDR .
column2: Of note , although chem* azimilide *chem ( 3 to 10 micromol / L ) increased APD more than dl - chem* sotalol *chem , its EADs often failed to propagate transmurally , probably because of a diminished TDR .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : This study provides the first direct evidence from intracellular action potential recordings that phase 2 EAD can be generated from intact ventricular wall and produce a trigger to initiate the onset of TdP under QT prolongation .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : This study provides the first direct evidence from intracellular action potential recordings that phase 2 EAD can be generated from intact ventricular wall and produce a trigger to initiate the onset of TdP under QT prolongation .

column1: A pilot study to assess the safety of dobutamine stress echocardiography in the emergency department evaluation of cocaine - associated chest pain .
column2: A pilot study to assess the safety of chem* dobutamine *chem stress echocardiography in the emergency department evaluation of chem* cocaine *chem - associated chest pain .

column1: STUDY OBJECTIVE : Chest pain in the setting of cocaine use poses a diagnostic dilemma .
column2: STUDY OBJECTIVE : Chest pain in the setting of chem* cocaine *chem use poses a diagnostic dilemma .

column1: Dobutamine stress echocardiography ( DSE ) is a widely available and sensitive test for evaluating cardiac ischemia .
column2: chem* Dobutamine *chem stress echocardiography ( DSE ) is a widely available and sensitive test for evaluating cardiac ischemia .

column1: Because of the theoretical concern regarding administration of dobutamine in the setting of cocaine use , we conducted a pilot study to assess the safety of DSE in emergency department patients with cocaine - associated chest pain .
column2: Because of the theoretical concern regarding administration of chem* dobutamine *chem in the setting of chem* cocaine *chem use , we conducted a pilot study to assess the safety of DSE in emergency department patients with chem* cocaine *chem - associated chest pain .

column1: METHODS : A prospective case series was conducted in the intensive diagnostic and treatment unit in the ED of an urban tertiary - care teaching hospital .
column2: METHODS : A prospective case series was conducted in the intensive diagnostic and treatment unit in the ED of an urban tertiary - care teaching hospital .

column1: Patients were eligible for DSE if they had used cocaine within 24 hours preceding the onset of chest pain and had a normal ECG and tropinin I level .
column2: Patients were eligible for DSE if they had used chem* cocaine *chem within 24 hours preceding the onset of chest pain and had a normal ECG and tropinin I level .

column1: Patients exhibiting signs of continuing cocaine toxicity were excluded from the study .
column2: Patients exhibiting signs of continuing chem* cocaine *chem toxicity were excluded from the study .

column1: All patients were admitted to the hospital for serial testing after the DSE testing in the intensive diagnostic and treatment unit .
column2: All patients were admitted to the hospital for serial testing after the DSE testing in the intensive diagnostic and treatment unit .

column1: RESULTS : Twenty - four patients were enrolled .
column2: RESULTS : Twenty - four patients were enrolled .

column1: Two patients had inadequate resting images , one DSE was terminated because of inferior hypokinesis , another DSE was terminated because of a rate - related atrial conduction deficit , and 1 patient did not reach the target heart rate .
column2: Two patients had inadequate resting images , one DSE was terminated because of inferior hypokinesis , another DSE was terminated because of a rate - related atrial conduction deficit , and 1 patient did not reach the target heart rate .

column1: Thus , 19 patients completed a DSE and reached their target heart rates .
column2: Thus , 19 patients completed a DSE and reached their target heart rates .

column1: None of the patients experienced signs of exaggerated adrenergic response , which was defined as a systolic blood pressure of greater than 200 mm Hg or the occurrence of tachydysrhythmias ( excluding sinus tachycardia ) .
column2: None of the patients experienced signs of exaggerated adrenergic response , which was defined as a systolic blood pressure of greater than 200 mm Hg or the occurrence of tachydysrhythmias ( excluding sinus tachycardia ) .

column1: Further suggesting lack of exaggerated adrenergic response , 13 ( 65 % ) of 20 patients required supplemental atropine to reach their target heart rates .
column2: Further suggesting lack of exaggerated adrenergic response , 13 ( 65 % ) of 20 patients required supplemental chem* atropine *chem to reach their target heart rates .

column1: CONCLUSION : No exaggerated adrenergic response was detected when dobutamine was administered to patients with cocaine - related chest pain .
column2: CONCLUSION : No exaggerated adrenergic response was detected when chem* dobutamine *chem was administered to patients with chem* cocaine *chem - related chest pain .

column1: Prenatal cocaine exposure and cranial sonographic findings in preterm infants .
column2: Prenatal chem* cocaine *chem exposure and cranial sonographic findings in preterm infants .

column1: PURPOSE : Prenatal cocaine exposure has been linked with subependymal hemorrhage and the formation of cysts that are detectable on cranial sonography in neonates born at term .
column2: PURPOSE : Prenatal chem* cocaine *chem exposure has been linked with subependymal hemorrhage and the formation of cysts that are detectable on cranial sonography in neonates born at term .

column1: We sought to determine if prenatal cocaine exposure increases the incidence of subependymal cysts in preterm infants .
column2: We sought to determine if prenatal chem* cocaine *chem exposure increases the incidence of subependymal cysts in preterm infants .

column1: METHODS : We retrospectively reviewed the medical records and cranial sonograms obtained during a 1 - year period on 122 premature ( < 36 weeks of gestation ) infants .
column2: METHODS : We retrospectively reviewed the medical records and cranial sonograms obtained during a 1 - year period on 122 premature ( < 36 weeks of gestation ) infants .

column1: Infants were categorized into 1 of 2 groups : those exposed to cocaine and those not exposed to cocaine .
column2: Infants were categorized into 1 of 2 groups : those exposed to chem* cocaine *chem and those not exposed to chem* cocaine *chem .

column1: Infants were assigned to the cocaine - exposed group if there was a maternal history of cocaine abuse during pregnancy or if maternal or neonatal urine toxicology results were positive at the time of delivery .
column2: Infants were assigned to the chem* cocaine *chem - exposed group if there was a maternal history of cocaine abuse during pregnancy or if maternal or neonatal urine toxicology results were positive at the time of delivery .

column1: RESULTS : Five of the 122 infants were excluded from the study because of insufficient medical and drug histories .
column2: RESULTS : Five of the 122 infants were excluded from the study because of insufficient medical and drug histories .

column1: The incidence of subependymal cysts in the 117 remaining infants was 14 % ( 16 of 117 ) .
column2: The incidence of subependymal cysts in the 117 remaining infants was 14 % ( 16 of 117 ) .

column1: The incidence of subependymal cysts in infants exposed to cocaine prenatally was 44 % ( 8 of 18 ) compared with 8 % ( 8 of 99 ) in the unexposed group ( p < 0 . 01 ) .
column2: The incidence of subependymal cysts in infants exposed to chem* cocaine *chem prenatally was 44 % ( 8 of 18 ) compared with 8 % ( 8 of 99 ) in the unexposed group ( p < 0 . 01 ) .
