column1: PURPOSE : This retrospective study used a pharmaceutical company ' s global safety database to determine the reporting rate of hyponatremia and / or syndrome of inappropriate secretion of anti - diuretic hormone ( SIADH ) among vincristine - treated patients and to explore the possibility of at - risk population subgroups .
column2: PURPOSE : This retrospective study used a pharmaceutical company ' s global safety database to determine the reporting rate of hyponatremia and / or syndrome of inappropriate secretion of anti - diuretic hormone ( SIADH ) among chem* vincristine *chem - treated patients and to explore the possibility of at - risk population subgroups .

column1: METHOD : We searched the Eli Lilly and Company ' s computerized adverse event database for all reported cases of hyponatremia and / or SIADH as of 1 November 1999 that had been reported during the use of vincristine .
column2: METHOD : We searched the Eli Lilly and Company ' s computerized adverse event database for all reported cases of hyponatremia and / or SIADH as of 1 November 1999 that had been reported during the use of chem* vincristine *chem .

column1: RESULTS : A total of 76 cases of hyponatremia and / or SIADH associated with vincristine use were identified .
column2: RESULTS : A total of 76 cases of hyponatremia and / or SIADH associated with chem* vincristine *chem use were identified .

column1: The overall reporting rate was estimated to be 1 . 3 / 100 , 000 treated patients .
column2: The overall reporting rate was estimated to be 1 . 3 / 100 , 000 treated patients .

column1: The average age of patients was 35 . 6 + / - 28 . 3 years , and 62 % were males .
column2: The average age of patients was 35 . 6 + / - 28 . 3 years , and 62 % were males .

column1: Approximately 75 % of the patients were receiving treatment for leukemia or lymphoma .
column2: Approximately 75 % of the patients were receiving treatment for leukemia or lymphoma .

column1: Among the 39 reports that included information on race , the racial distribution was : 1 Black , 3 Caucasian , and 35 Asian .
column2: Among the 39 reports that included information on race , the racial distribution was : 1 Black , 3 Caucasian , and 35 Asian .

column1: CONCLUSION : Our data suggest that Asian patients may be at increased risk of hyponatremia and / or SIADH associated with vincristine use .
column2: CONCLUSION : Our data suggest that Asian patients may be at increased risk of hyponatremia and / or SIADH associated with chem* vincristine *chem use .

column1: Although the overall reported rate of SIADH associated with vincristine is very low , physicians caring for Asian oncology patients should be aware of this potential serious but reversible adverse event .
column2: Although the overall reported rate of SIADH associated with chem* vincristine *chem is very low , physicians caring for Asian oncology patients should be aware of this potential serious but reversible adverse event .

column1: Delayed toxicity of cyclophosphamide on the bladder of DBA / 2 and C57BL / 6 female mouse .
column2: Delayed toxicity of chem* cyclophosphamide *chem on the bladder of DBA / 2 and C57BL / 6 female mouse .

column1: The present study describes the delayed development of a severe bladder pathology in a susceptible strain of mice ( DBA / 2 ) but not in a resistant strain ( C57BL / 6 ) when both were treated with a single 300 mg / kg dose of cyclophosphamide ( CY ) .
column2: The present study describes the delayed development of a severe bladder pathology in a susceptible strain of mice ( DBA / 2 ) but not in a resistant strain ( C57BL / 6 ) when both were treated with a single 300 mg / kg dose of chem* cyclophosphamide *chem ( chem* CY *chem ) .

column1: Inbred DBA / 2 and C57BL / 6 female mice were injected with CY , and the effect of the drug on the bladder was assessed during 100 days by light microscopy using different staining procedures , and after 30 days by conventional electron microscopy .
column2: Inbred DBA / 2 and C57BL / 6 female mice were injected with chem* CY *chem , and the effect of the drug on the bladder was assessed during 100 days by light microscopy using different staining procedures , and after 30 days by conventional electron microscopy .

column1: Early CY toxicity caused a typical haemorrhagic cystitis in both strains that was completely repaired in about 7 - 10 days .
column2: Early chem* CY *chem toxicity caused a typical haemorrhagic cystitis in both strains that was completely repaired in about 7 - 10 days .

column1: After 30 days of CY injection ulcerous and non - ulcerous forms of chronic cystitis appeared in 86 % of DBA / 2 mice but only in 4 % of C57BL / 6 mice .
column2: After 30 days of chem* CY *chem injection ulcerous and non - ulcerous forms of chronic cystitis appeared in 86 % of DBA / 2 mice but only in 4 % of C57BL / 6 mice .

column1: Delayed cystitis was characterized by infiltration and transepithelial passage into the lumen of inflammatory cells and by frequent exfoliation of the urothelium .
column2: Delayed cystitis was characterized by infiltration and transepithelial passage into the lumen of inflammatory cells and by frequent exfoliation of the urothelium .

column1: Mast cells appeared in the connective and muscular layers of the bladder at a much higher number in DBA / 2 mice than in C57BL / 6 mice or untreated controls .
column2: Mast cells appeared in the connective and muscular layers of the bladder at a much higher number in DBA / 2 mice than in C57BL / 6 mice or untreated controls .

column1: Electron microscopy disclosed the absence of the typical discoidal vesicles normally present in the cytoplasm of surface cells .
column2: Electron microscopy disclosed the absence of the typical discoidal vesicles normally present in the cytoplasm of surface cells .

column1: Instead , numerous abnormal vesicles containing one or several dark granules were observed in the cytoplasm of cells from all the epithelial layers .
column2: Instead , numerous abnormal vesicles containing one or several dark granules were observed in the cytoplasm of cells from all the epithelial layers .

column1: Delayed cystitis still persisted in DBA / 2 mice 100 days after treatment .
column2: Delayed cystitis still persisted in DBA / 2 mice 100 days after treatment .

column1: These results indicate that delayed toxicity of CY in female DBA / 2 mice causes a bladder pathology that is not observed in C57BL / 6 mice .
column2: These results indicate that delayed toxicity of chem* CY *chem in female DBA / 2 mice causes a bladder pathology that is not observed in C57BL / 6 mice .

column1: This pathology resembles interstitial cystitis in humans and could perhaps be used as an animal model for studies on the disease .
column2: This pathology resembles interstitial cystitis in humans and could perhaps be used as an animal model for studies on the disease .

column1: High - dose 5 - fluorouracil / folinic acid in combination with three - weekly mitomycin C in the treatment of advanced gastric cancer .
column2: High - dose chem* 5 - fluorouracil *chem / chem* folinic acid *chem in combination with three - weekly chem* mitomycin C *chem in the treatment of advanced gastric cancer .

column1: A phase II study .
column2: A phase II study .

column1: BACKGROUND : The 24 - hour continuous infusion of 5 - fluorouracil ( 5 - FU ) and folinic acid ( FA ) as part of several new multidrug chemotherapy regimens in advanced gastric cancer ( AGC ) has shown to be effective , with low toxicity .
column2: BACKGROUND : The 24 - hour continuous infusion of chem* 5 - fluorouracil *chem ( chem* 5 - FU *chem ) and chem* folinic acid *chem ( chem* FA *chem ) as part of several new multidrug chemotherapy regimens in advanced gastric cancer ( AGC ) has shown to be effective , with low toxicity .

column1: In a previous phase II study with 3 - weekly bolus 5 - FU , FA and mitomycin C ( MMC ) we found a low toxicity rate and response rates comparable to those of regimens such as ELF , FAM or FAMTX , and a promising median overall survival .
column2: In a previous phase II study with 3 - weekly bolus chem* 5 - FU *chem , chem* FA *chem and chem* mitomycin C *chem ( chem* MMC *chem ) we found a low toxicity rate and response rates comparable to those of regimens such as ELF , FAM or FAMTX , and a promising median overall survival .

column1: In order to improve this MMC - dependent schedule we initiated a phase II study with high - dose 5 - FU / FA and 3 - weekly bolus MMC .
column2: In order to improve this chem* MMC *chem - dependent schedule we initiated a phase II study with high - dose chem* 5 - FU *chem / chem* FA *chem and 3 - weekly bolus chem* MMC *chem .

column1: PATIENTS AND METHODS : From February , 1998 to September , 2000 we recruited 33 patients with AGC to receive weekly 24 - hour 5 - FU 2 , 600 mg / m ( 2 ) preceded by 2 - hour FA 500 mg / m ( 2 ) for 6 weeks , followed by a 2 - week rest period .
column2: PATIENTS AND METHODS : From February , 1998 to September , 2000 we recruited 33 patients with AGC to receive weekly 24 - hour chem* 5 - FU *chem 2 , 600 mg / m ( 2 ) preceded by 2 - hour chem* FA *chem 500 mg / m ( 2 ) for 6 weeks , followed by a 2 - week rest period .

column1: Bolus MMC 10 mg / m ( 2 ) was added in 3 - weekly intervals .
column2: Bolus chem* MMC *chem 10 mg / m ( 2 ) was added in 3 - weekly intervals .

column1: Treatment given on an outpatient basis , using portable pump systems , was repeated on day 57 .
column2: Treatment given on an outpatient basis , using portable pump systems , was repeated on day 57 .

column1: Patients ' characteristics were : male / female ratio 20 / 13 ; median age 57 ( 27 - 75 ) years ; median WHO status 1 ( 0 - 2 ) .
column2: Patients ' characteristics were : male / female ratio 20 / 13 ; median age 57 ( 27 - 75 ) years ; median WHO status 1 ( 0 - 2 ) .

column1: 18 patients had a primary AGC , and 15 showed a relapsed AGC .
column2: 18 patients had a primary AGC , and 15 showed a relapsed AGC .

column1: Median follow - up was 11 . 8 months ( range of those surviving : 2 . 7 - 11 . 8 months ) .
column2: Median follow - up was 11 . 8 months ( range of those surviving : 2 . 7 - 11 . 8 months ) .

column1: RESULTS : 32 patients were evaluable for response - complete remission 9 . 1 % ( n = 3 ) , partial remission 45 . 5 % ( n = 15 ) , no change 27 . 3 % ( n = 9 ) , progressive disease 15 . 1 % ( n = 5 ) .
column2: RESULTS : 32 patients were evaluable for response - complete remission 9 . 1 % ( n = 3 ) , partial remission 45 . 5 % ( n = 15 ) , no change 27 . 3 % ( n = 9 ) , progressive disease 15 . 1 % ( n = 5 ) .

column1: Median overall survival time was 10 . 2 months [ 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) : 8 . 7 - 11 . 6 ] , and median progression - free survival time was 7 . 6 months ( 95 % CI : 4 . 4 - 10 . 9 ) .
column2: Median overall survival time was 10 . 2 months [ 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) : 8 . 7 - 11 . 6 ] , and median progression - free survival time was 7 . 6 months ( 95 % CI : 4 . 4 - 10 . 9 ) .

column1: The worst toxicities ( % ) observed were ( CTC - NCI 1 / 2 / 3 ) : leukopenia 45 . 5 / 18 . 2 / 6 . 1 , thrombocytopenia 33 . 3 / 9 . 1 / 6 . 1 , vomitus 24 . 2 / 9 . 1 / 0 , diarrhea 36 . 4 / 6 . 1 / 3 . 0 , stomatitis 18 . 2 / 9 . 1 / 0 , hand - foot syndrome 12 . 1 / 0 / 0 .
column2: The worst toxicities ( % ) observed were ( CTC - NCI 1 / 2 / 3 ) : leukopenia 45 . 5 / 18 . 2 / 6 . 1 , thrombocytopenia 33 . 3 / 9 . 1 / 6 . 1 , vomitus 24 . 2 / 9 . 1 / 0 , diarrhea 36 . 4 / 6 . 1 / 3 . 0 , stomatitis 18 . 2 / 9 . 1 / 0 , hand - foot syndrome 12 . 1 / 0 / 0 .

column1: Two patients developed hemolytic - uremic syndrome ( HUS ) .
column2: Two patients developed hemolytic - uremic syndrome ( HUS ) .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : High - dose 5 - FU / FA / MMC is an effective and well - tolerated outpatient regimen for AGC ( objective response rate 54 . 6 % ) .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : High - dose chem* 5 - FU *chem / chem* FA *chem / chem* MMC *chem is an effective and well - tolerated outpatient regimen for AGC ( objective response rate 54 . 6 % ) .

column1: It may serve as an alternative to cisplatin - containing regimens ; however , it has to be considered that possibly HUS may occur .
column2: It may serve as an alternative to chem* cisplatin *chem - containing regimens ; however , it has to be considered that possibly HUS may occur .

column1: Persistent sterile leukocyturia is associated with impaired renal function in human immunodeficiency virus type 1 - infected children treated with indinavir .
column2: Persistent sterile leukocyturia is associated with impaired renal function in human immunodeficiency virus type 1 - infected children treated with chem* indinavir *chem .

column1: BACKGROUND : Prolonged administration of indinavir is associated with the occurrence of a variety of renal complications in adults .
column2: BACKGROUND : Prolonged administration of chem* indinavir *chem is associated with the occurrence of a variety of renal complications in adults .

column1: These well - documented side effects have restricted the use of this potent protease inhibitor in children .
column2: These well - documented side effects have restricted the use of this potent protease inhibitor in children .

column1: DESIGN : A prospective study to monitor indinavir - related nephrotoxicity in a cohort of 30 human immunodeficiency virus type 1 - infected children treated with indinavir .
column2: DESIGN : A prospective study to monitor chem* indinavir *chem - related nephrotoxicity in a cohort of 30 human immunodeficiency virus type 1 - infected children treated with chem* indinavir *chem .

column1: METHODS : Urinary pH , albumin , creatinine , the presence of erythrocytes , leukocytes , bacteria and crystals , and culture were analyzed every 3 months for 96 weeks .
column2: METHODS : Urinary pH , albumin , chem* creatinine *chem , the presence of erythrocytes , leukocytes , bacteria and crystals , and culture were analyzed every 3 months for 96 weeks .

column1: Serum creatinine levels were routinely determined at the same time points .
column2: Serum chem* creatinine *chem levels were routinely determined at the same time points .

column1: Steady - state pharmacokinetics of indinavir were done at week 4 after the initiation of indinavir .
column2: Steady - state pharmacokinetics of chem* indinavir *chem were done at week 4 after the initiation of chem* indinavir *chem .

column1: RESULTS : The cumulative incidence of persistent sterile leukocyturia ( > or = 75 cells / micro L in at least 2 consecutive visits ) after 96 weeks was 53 % .
column2: RESULTS : The cumulative incidence of persistent sterile leukocyturia ( > or = 75 cells / micro L in at least 2 consecutive visits ) after 96 weeks was 53 % .

column1: Persistent sterile leukocyturia was frequently associated with a mild increase in the urine albumin / creatinine ratio and by microscopic hematuria .
column2: Persistent sterile leukocyturia was frequently associated with a mild increase in the urine albumin / chem* creatinine *chem ratio and by microscopic hematuria .

column1: The cumulative incidence of serum creatinine levels > 50 % above normal was 33 % after 96 weeks .
column2: The cumulative incidence of serum chem* creatinine *chem levels > 50 % above normal was 33 % after 96 weeks .

column1: Children with persistent sterile leukocyturia more frequently had serum creatinine levels of 50 % above normal than those children without persistent sterile leukocyturia .
column2: Children with persistent sterile leukocyturia more frequently had serum chem* creatinine *chem levels of 50 % above normal than those children without persistent sterile leukocyturia .

column1: In children younger than 5 . 6 years , persistent sterile leukocyturia was significantly more frequent than in older children .
column2: In children younger than 5 . 6 years , persistent sterile leukocyturia was significantly more frequent than in older children .

column1: A higher cumulative incidence of persistent leukocyturia was found in children with an area under the curve > 19 mg / L x h or a peak serum level of indinavir > 12 mg / L .
column2: A higher cumulative incidence of persistent leukocyturia was found in children with an area under the curve > 19 mg / L x h or a peak serum level of chem* indinavir *chem > 12 mg / L .

column1: In 4 children , indinavir was discontinued because of nephrotoxicity .
column2: In 4 children , chem* indinavir *chem was discontinued because of nephrotoxicity .

column1: Subsequently , the serum creatinine levels decreased , the urine albumin / creatinine ratios returned to zero , and the leukocyturia disappeared within 3 months .
column2: Subsequently , the serum chem* creatinine *chem levels decreased , the urine albumin / chem* creatinine *chem ratios returned to zero , and the leukocyturia disappeared within 3 months .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Children treated with indinavir have a high cumulative incidence of persistent sterile leukocyturia .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Children treated with chem* indinavir *chem have a high cumulative incidence of persistent sterile leukocyturia .

column1: Children with persistent sterile leukocyturia more frequently had an increase in serum creatinine levels of > 50 % above normal .
column2: Children with persistent sterile leukocyturia more frequently had an increase in serum chem* creatinine *chem levels of > 50 % above normal .

column1: Younger children have an additional risk for renal complications .
column2: Younger children have an additional risk for renal complications .

column1: The impairment of the renal function in these children occurred in the absence of clinical symptoms of nephrolithiasis .
column2: The impairment of the renal function in these children occurred in the absence of clinical symptoms of nephrolithiasis .

column1: Indinavir - associated nephrotoxicity must be monitored closely , especially in children with risk factors such as persistent sterile leukocyturia , age < 5 . 6 years , an area under the curve of indinavir > 19 mg / L x h , and a C ( max ) > 12 mg / L .
column2: chem* Indinavir *chem - associated nephrotoxicity must be monitored closely , especially in children with risk factors such as persistent sterile leukocyturia , age < 5 . 6 years , an area under the curve of chem* indinavir *chem > 19 mg / L x h , and a C ( max ) > 12 mg / L .

column1: Utility of troponin I in patients with cocaine - associated chest pain .
column2: Utility of troponin I in patients with chem* cocaine *chem - associated chest pain .

column1: Baseline electrocardiogram abnormalities and market elevations not associated with myocardial necrosis make accurate diagnosis of myocardial infarction ( MI ) difficult in patients with cocaine - associated chest pain .
column2: Baseline electrocardiogram abnormalities and market elevations not associated with myocardial necrosis make accurate diagnosis of myocardial infarction ( MI ) difficult in patients with chem* cocaine *chem - associated chest pain .

column1: Troponin sampling may offer greater diagnostic utility in these patients .
column2: Troponin sampling may offer greater diagnostic utility in these patients .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To assess outcomes based on troponin positivity in patients with cocaine chest pain admitted for exclusion of MI .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To assess outcomes based on troponin positivity in patients with chem* cocaine *chem chest pain admitted for exclusion of MI .

column1: METHODS : Outcomes were examined in patients admitted for possible MI after cocaine use .
column2: METHODS : Outcomes were examined in patients admitted for possible MI after chem* cocaine *chem use .

column1: All patients underwent a rapid rule - in protocol that included serial sampling of creatine kinase ( CK ) , CK - MB , and cardiac troponin I ( cTnI ) over eight hours .
column2: All patients underwent a rapid rule - in protocol that included serial sampling of chem* creatine *chem kinase ( CK ) , CK - MB , and cardiac troponin I ( cTnI ) over eight hours .

column1: Outcomes included CK - MB MI ( CK - MB > or = 8 ng / mL with a relative index [ ( CK - MB x 100 ) / total CK ] > or = 4 , cardiac death , and significant coronary disease ( > or = 50 % ) .
column2: Outcomes included CK - MB MI ( CK - MB > or = 8 ng / mL with a relative index [ ( CK - MB x 100 ) / total CK ] > or = 4 , cardiac death , and significant coronary disease ( > or = 50 % ) .

column1: RESULTS : Of the 246 admitted patients , 34 ( 14 % ) met CK - MB criteria for MI and 38 ( 16 % ) had cTnI elevations .
column2: RESULTS : Of the 246 admitted patients , 34 ( 14 % ) met CK - MB criteria for MI and 38 ( 16 % ) had cTnI elevations .

column1: Angiography was performed in 29 of 38 patients who were cTnI - positive , with significant disease present in 25 ( 86 % ) .
column2: Angiography was performed in 29 of 38 patients who were cTnI - positive , with significant disease present in 25 ( 86 % ) .

column1: Three of the four patients without significant disease who had cTnI elevations met CK - MB criteria for MI , and the other had a peak CK - MB level of 13 ng / mL .
column2: Three of the four patients without significant disease who had cTnI elevations met CK - MB criteria for MI , and the other had a peak CK - MB level of 13 ng / mL .

column1: Sensitivities , specificities , and positive and negative likelihood ratios for predicting cardiac death or significant disease were high for both CK - MB MI and cTnI and were not significantly different .
column2: Sensitivities , specificities , and positive and negative likelihood ratios for predicting cardiac death or significant disease were high for both CK - MB MI and cTnI and were not significantly different .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Most patients with cTnI elevations meet CK - MB criteria for MI , as well as have a high incidence of underlying significant disease .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Most patients with cTnI elevations meet CK - MB criteria for MI , as well as have a high incidence of underlying significant disease .

column1: Troponin appears to have an equivalent diagnostic accuracy compared with CK - MB for diagnosing necrosis in patients with cocaine - associated chest pain and suspected MI .
column2: Troponin appears to have an equivalent diagnostic accuracy compared with CK - MB for diagnosing necrosis in patients with chem* cocaine *chem - associated chest pain and suspected MI .

column1: Acute interstitial nephritis due to nicergoline ( Sermion ) .
column2: Acute interstitial nephritis due to chem* nicergoline *chem ( chem* Sermion *chem ) .

column1: We report a case of acute interstitial nephritis ( AIN ) due to nicergoline ( Sermion ) .
column2: We report a case of acute interstitial nephritis ( AIN ) due to chem* nicergoline *chem ( chem* Sermion *chem ) .

column1: A 50 - year - old patient admitted to our hospital for fever and acute renal failure .
column2: A 50 - year - old patient admitted to our hospital for fever and acute renal failure .

column1: Before admission , he had been taking nicergoline and bendazac lysine due to retinal vein occlusion at ophthalmologic department .
column2: Before admission , he had been taking chem* nicergoline *chem and chem* bendazac lysine *chem due to retinal vein occlusion at ophthalmologic department .

column1: Thereafter , he experienced intermittent fever and skin rash .
column2: Thereafter , he experienced intermittent fever and skin rash .

column1: On admission , clinical symptoms ( i . e . arthralgia and fever ) and laboratory findings ( i . e . eosinophilia and renal failure ) suggested AIN , and which was confirmed by pathologic findings on renal biopsy .
column2: On admission , clinical symptoms ( i . e . arthralgia and fever ) and laboratory findings ( i . e . eosinophilia and renal failure ) suggested AIN , and which was confirmed by pathologic findings on renal biopsy .

column1: A lymphocyte transformation test demonstrated a positive result against nicergoline .
column2: A lymphocyte transformation test demonstrated a positive result against chem* nicergoline *chem .

column1: Treatment was consisted of withdrawal of nicergoline and intravenous methylprednisolone , and his renal function was completely recovered .
column2: Treatment was consisted of withdrawal of chem* nicergoline *chem and intravenous chem* methylprednisolone *chem , and his renal function was completely recovered .

column1: To our knowledge , this is the first report of nicergoline - associated AIN .
column2: To our knowledge , this is the first report of chem* nicergoline *chem - associated AIN .

column1: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome complicated by massive intestinal bleeding in a patient with chronic renal failure .
column2: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome complicated by massive intestinal bleeding in a patient with chronic renal failure .

column1: A patient with chronic renal failure ( CRF ) developed neuroleptic malignant syndrome ( NMS ) after administration of risperidone and levomepromazine .
column2: A patient with chronic renal failure ( CRF ) developed neuroleptic malignant syndrome ( NMS ) after administration of chem* risperidone *chem and chem* levomepromazine *chem .

column1: In addition to the typical symptoms of NMS , massive intestinal bleeding was observed during the episode .
column2: In addition to the typical symptoms of NMS , massive intestinal bleeding was observed during the episode .

column1: This report suggests that NMS in a patient with CRF may be complicated by intestinal bleeding and needs special caution for this complication .
column2: This report suggests that NMS in a patient with CRF may be complicated by intestinal bleeding and needs special caution for this complication .

column1: Blood brain barrier in right - and left - pawed female rats assessed by a new staining method .
column2: Blood brain barrier in right - and left - pawed female rats assessed by a new staining method .

column1: The asymmetrical breakdown of the blood - brain barrier ( BBB ) was studied in female rats .
column2: The asymmetrical breakdown of the blood - brain barrier ( BBB ) was studied in female rats .

column1: Paw preference was assessed by a food reaching test .
column2: Paw preference was assessed by a food reaching test .

column1: Adrenaline - induced hypertension was used to destroy the BBB , which was evaluated using triphenyltetrazolium ( TTC ) staining of the brain slices just after giving adrenaline for 30 s .
column2: chem* Adrenaline *chem - induced hypertension was used to destroy the BBB , which was evaluated using chem* triphenyltetrazolium *chem ( chem* TTC *chem ) staining of the brain slices just after giving chem* adrenaline *chem for 30 s .

column1: In normal rats , the whole brain sections exhibited complete staining with TTC .
column2: In normal rats , the whole brain sections exhibited complete staining with chem* TTC *chem .

column1: After adrenaline infusion for 30 s , there were large unstained areas in the left brain in right - pawed animals , and vice versa in left - pawed animals .
column2: After chem* adrenaline *chem infusion for 30 s , there were large unstained areas in the left brain in right - pawed animals , and vice versa in left - pawed animals .

column1: Similar results were obtained in seizure - induced breakdown of BBB .
column2: Similar results were obtained in seizure - induced breakdown of BBB .

column1: These results were explained by an asymmetric cerebral blood flow depending upon the paw preference in rats .
column2: These results were explained by an asymmetric cerebral blood flow depending upon the paw preference in rats .

column1: It was suggested that this new method and the results are consistent with contralateral motor control that may be important in determining the dominant cerebral hemisphere in animals .
column2: It was suggested that this new method and the results are consistent with contralateral motor control that may be important in determining the dominant cerebral hemisphere in animals .

column1: Carvedilol protects against doxorubicin - induced mitochondrial cardiomyopathy .
column2: chem* Carvedilol *chem protects against chem* doxorubicin *chem - induced mitochondrial cardiomyopathy .

column1: Several cytopathic mechanisms have been suggested to mediate the dose - limiting cumulative and irreversible cardiomyopathy caused by doxorubicin .
column2: Several cytopathic mechanisms have been suggested to mediate the dose - limiting cumulative and irreversible cardiomyopathy caused by chem* doxorubicin *chem .

column1: Recent evidence indicates that oxidative stress and mitochondrial dysfunction are key factors in the pathogenic process .
column2: Recent evidence indicates that oxidative stress and mitochondrial dysfunction are key factors in the pathogenic process .

column1: The objective of this investigation was to test the hypothesis that carvedilol , a nonselective beta - adrenergic receptor antagonist with potent antioxidant properties , protects against the cardiac and hepatic mitochondrial bioenergetic dysfunction associated with subchronic doxorubicin toxicity .
column2: The objective of this investigation was to test the hypothesis that chem* carvedilol *chem , a nonselective beta - adrenergic receptor antagonist with potent antioxidant properties , protects against the cardiac and hepatic mitochondrial bioenergetic dysfunction associated with subchronic chem* doxorubicin *chem toxicity .

column1: Heart and liver mitochondria were isolated from rats treated for 7 weeks with doxorubicin ( 2 mg / kg sc / week ) , carvedilol ( 1 mg / kg ip / week ) , or the combination of the two drugs .
column2: Heart and liver mitochondria were isolated from rats treated for 7 weeks with chem* doxorubicin *chem ( 2 mg / kg sc / week ) , chem* carvedilol *chem ( 1 mg / kg ip / week ) , or the combination of the two drugs .

column1: Heart mitochondria isolated from doxorubicin - treated rats exhibited depressed rates for state 3 respiration ( 336 + / - 26 versus 425 + / - 53 natom O / min / mg protein ) and a lower respiratory control ratio ( RCR ) ( 4 . 3 + / - 0 . 6 versus 5 . 8 + / - 0 . 4 ) compared with cardiac mitochondria isolated from saline - treated rats .
column2: Heart mitochondria isolated from chem* doxorubicin *chem - treated rats exhibited depressed rates for state 3 respiration ( 336 + / - 26 versus 425 + / - 53 natom O / min / mg protein ) and a lower respiratory control ratio ( RCR ) ( 4 . 3 + / - 0 . 6 versus 5 . 8 + / - 0 . 4 ) compared with cardiac mitochondria isolated from saline - treated rats .

column1: Mitochondrial calcium - loading capacity and the activity of NADH - dehydrogenase were also suppressed in cardiac mitochondria from doxorubicin - treated rats .
column2: Mitochondrial chem* calcium *chem - loading capacity and the activity of NADH - dehydrogenase were also suppressed in cardiac mitochondria from chem* doxorubicin *chem - treated rats .

column1: Doxorubicin treatment also caused a decrease in RCR for liver mitochondria ( 3 . 9 + / - 0 . 9 versus 5 . 6 + / - 0 . 7 for control rats ) and inhibition of hepatic cytochrome oxidase activity .
column2: chem* Doxorubicin *chem treatment also caused a decrease in RCR for liver mitochondria ( 3 . 9 + / - 0 . 9 versus 5 . 6 + / - 0 . 7 for control rats ) and inhibition of hepatic cytochrome oxidase activity .

column1: Coadministration of carvedilol decreased the extent of cellular vacuolization in cardiac myocytes and prevented the inhibitory effect of doxorubicin on mitochondrial respiration in both heart and liver .
column2: Coadministration of chem* carvedilol *chem decreased the extent of cellular vacuolization in cardiac myocytes and prevented the inhibitory effect of chem* doxorubicin *chem on mitochondrial respiration in both heart and liver .

column1: Carvedilol also prevented the decrease in mitochondrial Ca ( 2 + ) loading capacity and the inhibition of the respiratory complexes of heart mitochondria caused by doxorubicin .
column2: chem* Carvedilol *chem also prevented the decrease in mitochondrial chem* Ca *chem ( 2 + ) loading capacity and the inhibition of the respiratory complexes of heart mitochondria caused by chem* doxorubicin *chem .

column1: Carvedilol by itself did not affect any of the parameters measured for heart or liver mitochondria .
column2: chem* Carvedilol *chem by itself did not affect any of the parameters measured for heart or liver mitochondria .

column1: It is concluded that this protection by carvedilol against both the structural and functional cardiac tissue damage may afford significant clinical advantage in minimizing the dose - limiting mitochondrial dysfunction and cardiomyopathy that accompanies long - term doxorubicin therapy in cancer patients .
column2: It is concluded that this protection by chem* carvedilol *chem against both the structural and functional cardiac tissue damage may afford significant clinical advantage in minimizing the dose - limiting mitochondrial dysfunction and cardiomyopathy that accompanies long - term chem* doxorubicin *chem therapy in cancer patients .

column1: Cocaine - induced hyperactivity is more influenced by adenosine receptor agonists than amphetamine - induced hyperactivity .
column2: chem* Cocaine *chem - induced hyperactivity is more influenced by chem* adenosine *chem receptor agonists than chem* amphetamine *chem - induced hyperactivity .

column1: The influence of adenosine receptor agonists and antagonists on cocaine - and amphetamine - induced hyperactivity was examined in mice .
column2: The influence of chem* adenosine *chem receptor agonists and antagonists on chem* cocaine *chem - and chem* amphetamine *chem - induced hyperactivity was examined in mice .

column1: All adenosine receptor agonists significantly decreased the locomotor activity in mice , and the effects were dose - dependent .
column2: All chem* adenosine *chem receptor agonists significantly decreased the locomotor activity in mice , and the effects were dose - dependent .

column1: It seems that adenosine A1 and A2 receptors might be involved in this reaction .
column2: It seems that chem* adenosine *chem A1 and A2 receptors might be involved in this reaction .

column1: Moreover , all adenosine receptor agonists : 2 - p - ( 2 - carboxyethyl ) phenethylamino - 5 ' - N - ethylcarboxamidoadenosine ( CGS 21680 ) , A2A receptor agonist , N6 - cyclopentyladenosine ( CPA ) , A1 receptor agonist , and 5 ' - N - ethylcarboxamidoadenosine ( NECA ) , A2 / A1 receptor agonist significantly and dose - dependently decreased cocaine - induced locomotor activity .

column1: Amiodarone and the risk of bradyarrhythmia requiring permanent pacemaker in elderly patients with atrial fibrillation and prior myocardial infarction .
column2: chem* Amiodarone *chem and the risk of bradyarrhythmia requiring permanent pacemaker in elderly patients with atrial fibrillation and prior myocardial infarction .

column1: OBJECTIVES : The aim of this study was to determine whether the use of amiodarone in patients with atrial fibrillation ( AF ) increases the risk of bradyarrhythmia requiring a permanent pacemaker .
column2: OBJECTIVES : The aim of this study was to determine whether the use of chem* amiodarone *chem in patients with atrial fibrillation ( AF ) increases the risk of bradyarrhythmia requiring a permanent pacemaker .

column1: BACKGROUND : Reports of severe bradyarrhythmia during amiodarone therapy are infrequent and limited to studies assessing the therapy ' s use in the management of patients with ventricular arrhythmias .
column2: BACKGROUND : Reports of severe bradyarrhythmia during chem* amiodarone *chem therapy are infrequent and limited to studies assessing the therapy ' s use in the management of patients with ventricular arrhythmias .

column1: METHODS : A study cohort of 8 , 770 patients age > or = 65 years with a new diagnosis of AF was identified from a provincewide database of Quebec residents with a myocardial infarction ( MI ) between 1991 and 1999 .
column2: METHODS : A study cohort of 8 , 770 patients age > or = 65 years with a new diagnosis of AF was identified from a provincewide database of Quebec residents with a myocardial infarction ( MI ) between 1991 and 1999 .

column1: Using a nested case - control design , 477 cases of bradyarrhythmia requiring a permanent pacemaker were matched ( 1 : 4 ) to 1 , 908 controls .
column2: Using a nested case - control design , 477 cases of bradyarrhythmia requiring a permanent pacemaker were matched ( 1 : 4 ) to 1 , 908 controls .

column1: Multivariable logistic regression was used to estimate the odds ratio ( OR ) of pacemaker insertion associated with amiodarone use , controlling for baseline risk factors and exposure to sotalol , Class I antiarrhythmic agents , beta - blockers , calcium channel blockers , and digoxin .
column2: Multivariable logistic regression was used to estimate the odds ratio ( OR ) of pacemaker insertion associated with chem* amiodarone *chem use , controlling for baseline risk factors and exposure to chem* sotalol *chem , Class I antiarrhythmic agents , beta - blockers , chem* calcium *chem channel blockers , and chem* digoxin *chem .

column1: RESULTS : amiodarone use was associated with an increased risk of pacemaker insertion ( OR : 2 . 14 , 95 % confidence interval [ CI ] : 1 . 30 to 3 . 54 ) .
column2: RESULTS : chem* amiodarone *chem use was associated with an increased risk of pacemaker insertion ( OR : 2 . 14 , 95 % confidence interval [ CI ] : 1 . 30 to 3 . 54 ) .

column1: This effect was modified by gender , with a greater risk in women versus men ( OR : 3 . 86 , 95 % CI : 1 . 70 to 8 . 75 vs . OR : 1 . 52 , 95 % CI : 0 . 80 to 2 . 89 ) .
column2: This effect was modified by gender , with a greater risk in women versus men ( OR : 3 . 86 , 95 % CI : 1 . 70 to 8 . 75 vs . OR : 1 . 52 , 95 % CI : 0 . 80 to 2 . 89 ) .

column1: Digoxin was the only other medication associated with an increased risk of pacemaker insertion ( OR : 1 . 78 , 95 % CI : 1 . 37 to 2 . 31 ) .
column2: chem* Digoxin *chem was the only other medication associated with an increased risk of pacemaker insertion ( OR : 1 . 78 , 95 % CI : 1 . 37 to 2 . 31 ) .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : This study suggests that the use of amiodarone in elderly patients with AF and a previous MI increases the risk of bradyarrhythmia requiring a permanent pacemaker .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : This study suggests that the use of chem* amiodarone *chem in elderly patients with AF and a previous MI increases the risk of bradyarrhythmia requiring a permanent pacemaker .

column1: The finding of an augmented risk of pacemaker insertion in elderly women receiving amiodarone requires further investigation .
column2: The finding of an augmented risk of pacemaker insertion in elderly women receiving chem* amiodarone *chem requires further investigation .

column1: OBJECTIVES : To evaluate the morphologic changes in rat urothelium induced by indomethacin .

column1: Nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory drug - induced cystitis is a poorly recognized and under - reported condition .
column2: Nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory drug - induced cystitis is a poorly recognized and under - reported condition .

column1: In addition to tiaprofenic acid , indomethacin has been reported to be associated with this condition .
column2: In addition to chem* tiaprofenic acid *chem , chem* indomethacin *chem has been reported to be associated with this condition .

column1: METHODS : Three groups were established : a control group ( n = 10 ) , a high - dose group ( n = 10 ) , treated with one intraperitoneal injection of indomethacin 20 mg / kg , and a therapeutic dose group ( n = 10 ) in which oral indomethacin was administered 3 . 25 mg / kg body weight daily for 3 weeks .
column2: METHODS : Three groups were established : a control group ( n = 10 ) , a high - dose group ( n = 10 ) , treated with one intraperitoneal injection of chem* indomethacin *chem 20 mg / kg , and a therapeutic dose group ( n = 10 ) in which oral chem* indomethacin *chem was administered 3 . 25 mg / kg body weight daily for 3 weeks .

column1: The animals were then killed and the bladders removed for light and electron microscopic studies .
column2: The animals were then killed and the bladders removed for light and electron microscopic studies .

column1: RESULTS : The light microscopic findings showed some focal epithelial degeneration that was more prominent in the high - dose group .
column2: RESULTS : The light microscopic findings showed some focal epithelial degeneration that was more prominent in the high - dose group .

column1: When compared with the control group , both indomethacin groups revealed statistically increased numbers of mast cells in the mucosa ( P < 0 . 0001 ) and penetration of lanthanum nitrate through intercellular areas of the epithelium .
column2: When compared with the control group , both chem* indomethacin *chem groups revealed statistically increased numbers of mast cells in the mucosa ( P < 0 . 0001 ) and penetration of chem* lanthanum nitrate *chem through intercellular areas of the epithelium .

column1: Furthermore , the difference in mast cell counts between the high and therapeutic dose groups was also statistically significant ( P < 0 . 0001 ) .
column2: Furthermore , the difference in mast cell counts between the high and therapeutic dose groups was also statistically significant ( P < 0 . 0001 ) .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Indomethacin resulted in histopathologic findings typical of interstitial cystitis , such as leaky bladder epithelium and mucosal mastocytosis .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : chem* Indomethacin *chem resulted in histopathologic findings typical of interstitial cystitis , such as leaky bladder epithelium and mucosal mastocytosis .

column1: The true incidence of nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory drug - induced cystitis in humans must be clarified by prospective clinical trials .
column2: The true incidence of nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory drug - induced cystitis in humans must be clarified by prospective clinical trials .

column1: Three men ( 15 % ) showed a decline in serum PSA of at least 50 % , sustained throughout treatment .
column2: Three men ( 15 % ) showed a decline in serum PSA of at least 50 % , sustained throughout treatment .

column2: Of 16 men treated for at least 2 months , six ( 37 . 5 % ) showed a fall in absolute PSA by a median of 48 % .

column1: Increasing levels of serum bFGF and VEGF were associated with progressive disease ; five of six men who demonstrated a fall in PSA also showed a decline in bFGF and VEGF levels , and three of four men with a rising PSA showed an increase in both growth factors .
column2: Increasing levels of serum bFGF and VEGF were associated with progressive disease ; five of six men who demonstrated a fall in PSA also showed a decline in bFGF and VEGF levels , and three of four men with a rising PSA showed an increase in both growth factors .

column2: Adverse effects included constipation , morning drowsiness , dizziness and rash , and resulted in withdrawal from the study by three men .

column1: Evidence of peripheral sensory neuropathy was found in nine of 13 men before treatment .
column2: Evidence of peripheral sensory neuropathy was found in nine of 13 men before treatment .

column2: In the seven men who completed six months on chem* thalidomide *chem , subclinical evidence of peripheral neuropathy was found in four before treatment , but in all seven at repeat testing .

column1: Central nervous system toxicity following the administration of levobupivacaine for lumbar plexus block : A report of two cases .
column2: Central nervous system toxicity following the administration of chem* levobupivacaine *chem for lumbar plexus block : A report of two cases .

column1: BACKGROUND AND OBJECTIVES : Central nervous system and cardiac toxicity following the administration of local anesthetics is a recognized complication of regional anesthesia .
column2: BACKGROUND AND OBJECTIVES : Central nervous system and cardiac toxicity following the administration of local anesthetics is a recognized complication of regional anesthesia .

column1: Levobupivacaine , the pure S ( - ) enantiomer of bupivacaine , was developed to improve the cardiac safety profile of bupivacaine .
column2: chem* Levobupivacaine *chem , the pure S ( - ) enantiomer of chem* bupivacaine *chem , was developed to improve the cardiac safety profile of chem* bupivacaine *chem .

column1: We describe 2 cases of grand mal seizures following accidental intravascular injection of levobupivacaine .
column2: We describe 2 cases of grand mal seizures following accidental intravascular injection of chem* levobupivacaine *chem .

column1: CASE REPORT : Two patients presenting for elective orthopedic surgery of the lower limb underwent blockade of the lumbar plexus via the posterior approach .
column2: CASE REPORT : Two patients presenting for elective orthopedic surgery of the lower limb underwent blockade of the lumbar plexus via the posterior approach .

column1: Immediately after the administration of levobupivacaine 0 . 5 % with epinephrine 2 . 5 microgram / mL , the patients developed grand mal seizures , despite negative aspiration for blood and no clinical signs of intravenous epinephrine administration .
column2: Immediately after the administration of chem* levobupivacaine *chem 0 . 5 % with chem* epinephrine *chem 2 . 5 microgram / mL , the patients developed grand mal seizures , despite negative aspiration for blood and no clinical signs of intravenous chem* epinephrine *chem administration .

column1: The seizures were successfully treated with sodium thiopental in addition to succinylcholine in 1 patient .
column2: The seizures were successfully treated with chem* sodium thiopental *chem in addition to chem* succinylcholine *chem in 1 patient .

column1: Neither patient developed signs of cardiovascular toxicity .
column2: Neither patient developed signs of cardiovascular toxicity .

column1: Both patients were treated preoperatively with beta - adrenergic antagonist medications , which may have masked the cardiovascular signs of the unintentional intravascular administration of levobupivacaine with epinephrine .
column2: Both patients were treated preoperatively with beta - adrenergic antagonist medications , which may have masked the cardiovascular signs of the unintentional intravascular administration of chem* levobupivacaine *chem with chem* epinephrine *chem .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Although levobupivacaine may have a safer cardiac toxicity profile than racemic bupivacaine , if adequate amounts of levobupivacaine reach the circulation , it will result in convulsions .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Although chem* levobupivacaine *chem may have a safer cardiac toxicity profile than racemic chem* bupivacaine *chem , if adequate amounts of chem* levobupivacaine *chem reach the circulation , it will result in convulsions .

column1: Respiratory pattern in a rat model of epilepsy .

column1: PURPOSE : Apnea is known to occur during seizures , but systematic studies of ictal respiratory changes in adults are few .
column2: PURPOSE : Apnea is known to occur during seizures , but systematic studies of ictal respiratory changes in adults are few .

column1: Here we sought to generate information with regard to the interictal period in animals with pilocarpine - induced epilepsy .
column2: Here we sought to generate information with regard to the interictal period in animals with chem* pilocarpine *chem - induced epilepsy .

column1: METHODS : Twelve rats ( six chronically epileptic animals and six controls ) were anesthetized , given tracheotomies , and subjected to hyperventilation or hypoventilation conditions .
column2: METHODS : Twelve rats ( six chronically epileptic animals and six controls ) were anesthetized , given tracheotomies , and subjected to hyperventilation or hypoventilation conditions .

column1: Breathing movements caused changes in thoracic volume and forced air to flow tidally through a pneumotachograph .
column2: Breathing movements caused changes in thoracic volume and forced air to flow tidally through a pneumotachograph .

column1: This flow was measured by using a differential pressure transducer , passed through a polygraph , and from this to a computer with custom software that derived ventilation ( VE ) , tidal volume ( VT ) , inspiratory time ( TI ) , expiratory time ( TE ) , breathing frequency ( f ) , and mean inspiratory flow ( VT / TI ) on a breath - by - breath basis .
column2: This flow was measured by using a differential pressure transducer , passed through a polygraph , and from this to a computer with custom software that derived ventilation ( VE ) , tidal volume ( VT ) , inspiratory time ( TI ) , expiratory time ( TE ) , breathing frequency ( f ) , and mean inspiratory flow ( VT / TI ) on a breath - by - breath basis .

column1: RESULTS : The hyperventilation maneuver caused a decrease in spontaneous ventilation in pilocarpine - treated and control rats .
column2: RESULTS : The hyperventilation maneuver caused a decrease in spontaneous ventilation in chem* pilocarpine *chem - treated and control rats .

column1: Although VE had a similar decrease in both groups , in the epileptic group , the decrease in VE was due to a significant ( p < 0 . 05 ) increase in TE peak in relation to that of the control animals .

column1: The hypoventilation maneuver led to an increase in the arterial Paco2 , followed by an increase in VE .
column2: The hypoventilation maneuver led to an increase in the arterial Paco2 , followed by an increase in VE .

column1: In the epileptic group , the increase in VE was mediated by a significant ( p < 0 . 05 ) decrease in TE peak compared with the control group .
column2: In the epileptic group , the increase in VE was mediated by a significant ( p < 0 . 05 ) decrease in TE peak compared with the control group .

column2: Systemic application of KCN , to evaluate the effects of peripheral chemoreception activation on ventilation , led to a similar increase in VE for both groups .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : The data indicate that pilocarpine - treated animals have an altered ability to react to ( or compensate for ) blood gas changes with changes in ventilation and suggest that it is centrally determined .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : The data indicate that chem* pilocarpine *chem - treated animals have an altered ability to react to ( or compensate for ) blood gas changes with changes in ventilation and suggest that it is centrally determined .

column1: Vinorelbine - related cardiac events : a meta - analysis of randomized clinical trials .

column1: Several cases of cardiac adverse reactions related to vinorelbine ( VNR ) have been reported in the literature .
column2: Several cases of cardiac adverse reactions related to chem* vinorelbine *chem ( chem* VNR *chem ) have been reported in the literature .

column1: In order to quantify the incidence of these cardiac events , we performed a meta - analysis of clinical trials comparing VNR with other chemotherapeutic agents in the treatment of various malignancies .
column2: In order to quantify the incidence of these cardiac events , we performed a meta - analysis of clinical trials comparing chem* VNR *chem with other chemotherapeutic agents in the treatment of various malignancies .

column1: Randomized clinical trials comparing VNR with other drugs in the treatment of cancer were searched in Medline , Embase , Evidence - based Medicine Reviews databases and the Cochrane library from 1987 to 2002 .
column2: Randomized clinical trials comparing chem* VNR *chem with other drugs in the treatment of cancer were searched in Medline , Embase , Evidence - based Medicine Reviews databases and the Cochrane library from 1987 to 2002 .

column1: Outcomes of interest were severe cardiac events , toxic deaths and cardiac event - related deaths reported in each publication .
column2: Outcomes of interest were severe cardiac events , toxic deaths and cardiac event - related deaths reported in each publication .

column1: We found 19 trials , involving 2441 patients treated by VNR and 2050 control patients .
column2: We found 19 trials , involving 2441 patients treated by chem* VNR *chem and 2050 control patients .

column1: The incidence of cardiac events with VNR was 1 . 19 % [ 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) ( 0 . 75 ; 1 . 67 ) ] .
column2: The incidence of cardiac events with chem* VNR *chem was 1 . 19 % [ 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) ( 0 . 75 ; 1 . 67 ) ] .

column1: There was no difference in the risk of cardiac events between VNR and other drugs [ odds ratio : 0 . 92 , 95 % CI ( 0 . 54 ; 1 . 55 ) ] .
column2: There was no difference in the risk of cardiac events between chem* VNR *chem and other drugs [ odds ratio : 0 . 92 , 95 % CI ( 0 . 54 ; 1 . 55 ) ] .

column1: The risk of VNR cardiac events was similar to vindesine ( VDS ) and other cardiotoxic drugs [ fluorouracil , anthracyclines , gemcitabine ( GEM ) em leader ] .
column2: The risk of chem* VNR *chem cardiac events was similar to chem* vindesine *chem ( chem* VDS *chem ) and other cardiotoxic drugs [ chem* fluorouracil *chem , chem* anthracyclines *chem , chem* gemcitabine *chem ( chem* GEM *chem ) em leader ] .

column1: Even if it did not reach statistical significance because of a few number of cases , the risk was lower in trials excluding patients with cardiac history , and seemed to be higher in trials including patients with pre - existing cardiac diseases .
column2: Even if it did not reach statistical significance because of a few number of cases , the risk was lower in trials excluding patients with cardiac history , and seemed to be higher in trials including patients with pre - existing cardiac diseases .

column1: Vinorelbine - related cardiac events concern about 1 % of treated patients in clinical trials .
column2: chem* Vinorelbine *chem - related cardiac events concern about 1 % of treated patients in clinical trials .

column1: However , the risk associated with VNR seems to be similar to that of other chemotherapeutic agents in the same indications .

column2: The natural history of chem* Vigabatrin *chem associated visual field defects in patients electing to continue their medication .

column1: PURPOSE : To determine the natural history of visual field defects in a group of patients known to have Vigabatrin - associated changes who elected to continue the medication because of good seizure control .
column2: PURPOSE : To determine the natural history of visual field defects in a group of patients known to have chem* Vigabatrin *chem - associated changes who elected to continue the medication because of good seizure control .

column1: METHODS : All patients taking Vigabatrin alone or in combination with other antiepileptic drugs for at least 5 years ( range 5 - 12 years ) were entered into a visual surveillance programme .
column2: METHODS : All patients taking chem* Vigabatrin *chem alone or in combination with other antiepileptic drugs for at least 5 years ( range 5 - 12 years ) were entered into a visual surveillance programme .

column1: Patients were followed up at 6 - monthly intervals for not less than 18 months ( range 18 - 43 months ) .
column2: Patients were followed up at 6 - monthly intervals for not less than 18 months ( range 18 - 43 months ) .

column1: In all , 16 patients with unequivocal defects continued the medication .
column2: In all , 16 patients with unequivocal defects continued the medication .

column1: Following already published methodology ( Eye 2002 ; 16 ; 567 - 571 ) monocular mean radial degrees ( MRDs ) to the I / 4e isopter on Goldmann perimetry was calculated for the right eye at the time of discovery of a visual field defect and again after not less than 18 months follow - up .
column2: Following already published methodology ( Eye 2002 ; 16 ; 567 - 571 ) monocular mean radial degrees ( MRDs ) to the I / 4e isopter on Goldmann perimetry was calculated for the right eye at the time of discovery of a visual field defect and again after not less than 18 months follow - up .

column1: RESULTS : Mean right eye MRD at presentation was 36 . 98 degrees ( range 22 . 25 - 51 . 0 ) , compared to 38 . 40 degrees ( range 22 . 5 - 49 . 75 ) after follow - up ; P = 0 . 338 unpaired t - test .
column2: RESULTS : Mean right eye MRD at presentation was 36 . 98 degrees ( range 22 . 25 - 51 . 0 ) , compared to 38 . 40 degrees ( range 22 . 5 - 49 . 75 ) after follow - up ; P = 0 . 338 unpaired t - test .

column1: Only one patient demonstrated a deterioration in visual field during the study period and discontinued treatment .
column2: Only one patient demonstrated a deterioration in visual field during the study period and discontinued treatment .

column1: CONCLUSION : Established visual field defects presumed to be due to Vigabatrin therapy did not usually progress in spite of continuing use of the medication .
column2: CONCLUSION : Established visual field defects presumed to be due to chem* Vigabatrin *chem therapy did not usually progress in spite of continuing use of the medication .

column1: These data give support to the hypothesis that the pathogenesis of Vigabatrin - associated visual field defects may be an idiosyncratic adverse drug reaction rather than dose - dependent toxicity .
column2: These data give support to the hypothesis that the pathogenesis of chem* Vigabatrin *chem - associated visual field defects may be an idiosyncratic adverse drug reaction rather than dose - dependent toxicity .

column1: Induction of rosaceiform dermatitis during treatment of facial inflammatory dermatoses with tacrolimus ointment .

column1: BACKGROUND : Tacrolimus ointment is increasingly used for anti - inflammatory treatment of sensitive areas such as the face , and recent observations indicate that the treatment is effective in steroid - aggravated rosacea and perioral dermatitis .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* Tacrolimus *chem ointment is increasingly used for anti - inflammatory treatment of sensitive areas such as the face , and recent observations indicate that the treatment is effective in chem* steroid *chem - aggravated rosacea and perioral dermatitis .

column1: We report on rosaceiform dermatitis as a complication of treatment with tacrolimus ointment .
column2: We report on rosaceiform dermatitis as a complication of treatment with chem* tacrolimus *chem ointment .

column2: OBSERVATIONS : Six adult patients with inflammatory facial dermatoses were treated with chem* tacrolimus *chem ointment because of the ineffectiveness of standard treatments .

column1: Within 2 to 3 weeks of initially effective and well - tolerated treatment , 3 patients with a history of rosacea and 1 with a history of acne experienced sudden worsening with pustular rosaceiform lesions .
column2: Within 2 to 3 weeks of initially effective and well - tolerated treatment , 3 patients with a history of rosacea and 1 with a history of acne experienced sudden worsening with pustular rosaceiform lesions .

column2: Biopsy revealed an abundance of Demodex mites in 2 of these patients .

column2: In 1 patient with eyelid eczema , rosaceiform periocular dermatitis gradually appeared after 3 weeks of treatment .

column1: In 1 patient with atopic dermatitis , telangiectatic and papular rosacea insidiously appeared after 5 months of treatment .
column2: In 1 patient with atopic dermatitis , telangiectatic and papular rosacea insidiously appeared after 5 months of treatment .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Our observations suggest that the spectrum of rosaceiform dermatitis as a complication of treatment with tacrolimus ointment is heterogeneous .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Our observations suggest that the spectrum of rosaceiform dermatitis as a complication of treatment with chem* tacrolimus *chem ointment is heterogeneous .

column1: A variety of factors , such as vasoactive properties of tacrolimus , proliferation of Demodex due to local immunosuppression , and the occlusive properties of the ointment , may be involved in the observed phenomena .

column1: Structural abnormalities in the brains of human subjects who use methamphetamine .
column2: Structural abnormalities in the brains of human subjects who use chem* methamphetamine *chem .

column1: We visualize , for the first time , the profile of structural deficits in the human brain associated with chronic methamphetamine ( MA ) abuse .
column2: We visualize , for the first time , the profile of structural deficits in the human brain associated with chronic chem* methamphetamine *chem ( chem* MA *chem ) abuse .

column1: Studies of human subjects who have used MA chronically have revealed deficits in dopaminergic and serotonergic systems and cerebral metabolic abnormalities .
column2: Studies of human subjects who have used chem* MA *chem chronically have revealed deficits in dopaminergic and serotonergic systems and cerebral metabolic abnormalities .

column1: Using magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) and new computational brain - mapping techniques , we determined the pattern of structural brain alterations associated with chronic MA abuse in human subjects and related these deficits to cognitive impairment .
column2: Using magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) and new computational brain - mapping techniques , we determined the pattern of structural brain alterations associated with chronic chem* MA *chem abuse in human subjects and related these deficits to cognitive impairment .

column1: We used high - resolution MRI and surface - based computational image analyses to map regional abnormalities in the cortex , hippocampus , white matter , and ventricles in 22 human subjects who used MA and 21 age - matched , healthy controls .
column2: We used high - resolution MRI and surface - based computational image analyses to map regional abnormalities in the cortex , hippocampus , white matter , and ventricles in 22 human subjects who used chem* MA *chem and 21 age - matched , healthy controls .

column1: Cortical maps revealed severe gray - matter deficits in the cingulate , limbic , and paralimbic cortices of MA abusers ( averaging 11 . 3 % below control ; p < 0 . 05 ) .
column2: Cortical maps revealed severe gray - matter deficits in the cingulate , limbic , and paralimbic cortices of chem* MA *chem abusers ( averaging 11 . 3 % below control ; p < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: On average , MA abusers had 7 . 8 % smaller hippocampal volumes than control subjects ( p < 0 . 01 ; left , p = 0 . 01 ; right , p < 0 . 05 ) and significant white - matter hypertrophy ( 7 . 0 % ; p < 0 . 01 ) .
column2: On average , chem* MA *chem abusers had 7 . 8 % smaller hippocampal volumes than control subjects ( p < 0 . 01 ; left , p = 0 . 01 ; right , p < 0 . 05 ) and significant white - matter hypertrophy ( 7 . 0 % ; p < 0 . 01 ) .

column1: Hippocampal deficits were mapped and correlated with memory performance on a word - recall test ( p < 0 . 05 ) .
column2: Hippocampal deficits were mapped and correlated with memory performance on a word - recall test ( p < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: MRI - based maps suggest that chronic methamphetamine abuse causes a selective pattern of cerebral deterioration that contributes to impaired memory performance .
column2: MRI - based maps suggest that chronic chem* methamphetamine *chem abuse causes a selective pattern of cerebral deterioration that contributes to impaired memory performance .

column1: MA may selectively damage the medial temporal lobe and , consistent with metabolic studies , the cingulate - limbic cortex , inducing neuroadaptation , neuropil reduction , or cell death .
column2: chem* MA *chem may selectively damage the medial temporal lobe and , consistent with metabolic studies , the cingulate - limbic cortex , inducing neuroadaptation , neuropil reduction , or cell death .

column1: Prominent white - matter hypertrophy may result from altered myelination and adaptive glial changes , including gliosis secondary to neuronal damage .
column2: Prominent white - matter hypertrophy may result from altered myelination and adaptive glial changes , including gliosis secondary to neuronal damage .

column1: These brain substrates may help account for the symptoms of MA abuse , providing therapeutic targets for drug - induced brain injury .
column2: These brain substrates may help account for the symptoms of chem* MA *chem abuse , providing therapeutic targets for drug - induced brain injury .

column1: Disruption of hepatic lipid homeostasis in mice after amiodarone treatment is associated with peroxisome proliferator - activated receptor - alpha target gene activation .
column2: Disruption of hepatic lipid homeostasis in mice after chem* amiodarone *chem treatment is associated with peroxisome proliferator - activated receptor - alpha target gene activation .

column1: Amiodarone , an efficacious and widely used antiarrhythmic agent , has been reported to cause hepatotoxicity in some patients .
column2: chem* Amiodarone *chem , an efficacious and widely used antiarrhythmic agent , has been reported to cause hepatotoxicity in some patients .

column1: To gain insight into the mechanism of this unwanted effect , mice were administered various doses of amiodarone and examined for changes in hepatic histology and gene regulation .
column2: To gain insight into the mechanism of this unwanted effect , mice were administered various doses of chem* amiodarone *chem and examined for changes in hepatic histology and gene regulation .

column1: Amiodarone induced hepatomegaly , hepatocyte microvesicular lipid accumulation , and a significant decrease in serum triglycerides and glucose .
column2: chem* Amiodarone *chem induced hepatomegaly , hepatocyte microvesicular lipid accumulation , and a significant decrease in serum chem* triglycerides *chem and chem* glucose *chem .

column1: Northern blot analysis of hepatic RNA revealed a dose - dependent increase in the expression of a number of genes critical for fatty acid oxidation , lipoprotein assembly , and lipid transport .
column2: Northern blot analysis of hepatic RNA revealed a dose - dependent increase in the expression of a number of genes critical for chem* fatty acid *chem oxidation , lipoprotein assembly , and lipid transport .

column1: Many of these genes are regulated by the peroxisome proliferator - activated receptor - alpha ( PPARalpha ) , a ligand - activated nuclear hormone receptor transcription factor .
column2: Many of these genes are regulated by the peroxisome proliferator - activated receptor - alpha ( PPARalpha ) , a ligand - activated nuclear hormone receptor transcription factor .

column1: The absence of induction of these genes as well as hepatomegaly in PPARalpha knockout [ PPARalpha - / - ] mice indicated that the effects of amiodarone were dependent upon the presence of a functional PPARalpha gene .
column2: The absence of induction of these genes as well as hepatomegaly in PPARalpha knockout [ PPARalpha - / - ] mice indicated that the effects of chem* amiodarone *chem were dependent upon the presence of a functional PPARalpha gene .

column1: Compared to wild - type mice , treatment of PPARalpha - / - mice with amiodarone resulted in an increased rate and extent of total body weight loss .
column2: Compared to wild - type mice , treatment of PPARalpha - / - mice with chem* amiodarone *chem resulted in an increased rate and extent of total body weight loss .

column1: The inability of amiodarone to directly activate either human or mouse PPARalpha transiently expressed in human HepG2 hepatoma cells indicates that the effects of amiodarone on the function of this receptor were indirect .
column2: The inability of chem* amiodarone *chem to directly activate either human or mouse PPARalpha transiently expressed in human HepG2 hepatoma cells indicates that the effects of chem* amiodarone *chem on the function of this receptor were indirect .

column1: Based upon these results , we conclude that amiodarone disrupts hepatic lipid homeostasis and that the increased expression of PPARalpha target genes is secondary to this toxic effect .
column2: Based upon these results , we conclude that chem* amiodarone *chem disrupts hepatic lipid homeostasis and that the increased expression of PPARalpha target genes is secondary to this toxic effect .

column1: These results provide important new mechanistic information regarding the hepatotoxic effects of amiodarone and indicate that PPARalpha protects against amiodarone - induced hepatotoxicity .
column2: These results provide important new mechanistic information regarding the hepatotoxic effects of chem* amiodarone *chem and indicate that PPARalpha protects against chem* amiodarone *chem - induced hepatotoxicity .

column2: The hemoglobin concentration in patients with > or = 2 g / dL decrease at week 2 was observed to be significantly lower even after week 2 than in patients with < 2 g / dL decrease ( P < 0 . 01 ) .

column1: Oxidative damage precedes nitrative damage in adriamycin - induced cardiac mitochondrial injury .

column1: The purpose of the present study was to determine if elevated reactive oxygen ( ROS ) / nitrogen species ( RNS ) reported to be present in adriamycin ( ADR ) - induced cardiotoxicity actually resulted in cardiomyocyte oxidative / nitrative damage , and to quantitatively determine the time course and subcellular localization of these postulated damage products using an in vivo approach .

column1: Ultrastructural damage and levels of 4 - hydroxy - 2 - nonenal ( 4HNE ) - protein adducts and 3 - nitrotyrosine ( 3NT ) were analyzed .

column1: Quantitative ultrastructural damage using computerized image techniques showed cardiomyocyte injury as early as 3 hours , with mitochondria being the most extensively and progressively injured subcellular organelle .
column2: Quantitative ultrastructural damage using computerized image techniques showed cardiomyocyte injury as early as 3 hours , with mitochondria being the most extensively and progressively injured subcellular organelle .

column1: Analysis of 4HNE protein adducts by immunogold electron microscopy showed appearance of 4HNE protein adducts in mitochondria as early as 3 hours , with a peak at 6 hours and subsequent decline at 24 hours .
column2: Analysis of chem* 4HNE *chem protein adducts by immunogold electron microscopy showed appearance of chem* 4HNE *chem protein adducts in mitochondria as early as 3 hours , with a peak at 6 hours and subsequent decline at 24 hours .

column1: 3NT levels were significantly increased in all subcellular compartments at 6 hours and subsequently declined at 24 hours .
column2: chem* 3NT *chem levels were significantly increased in all subcellular compartments at 6 hours and subsequently declined at 24 hours .

column1: Our data showed ADR induced 4HNE - protein adducts in mitochondria at the same time point as when mitochondrial injury initially appeared .

column1: These results document for the first time in vivo that mitochondrial oxidative damage precedes nitrative damage .
column2: These results document for the first time in vivo that mitochondrial oxidative damage precedes nitrative damage .

column1: The progressive nature of mitochondrial injury suggests that mitochondria , not other subcellular organelles , are the major site of intracellular injury .

column1: RATIONALE : 5 - Hydroxytryptamine , via stimulation of 5 - HT 2C receptors , exerts a tonic inhibitory influence on dopaminergic neurotransmission , whereas activation of 5 - HT 2A receptors enhances stimulated DAergic neurotransmission .
column2: RATIONALE : chem* 5 - Hydroxytryptamine *chem , via stimulation of chem* 5 - HT *chem 2C receptors , exerts a tonic inhibitory influence on dopaminergic neurotransmission , whereas activation of chem* 5 - HT *chem 2A receptors enhances stimulated DAergic neurotransmission .

column1: The antidepressant trazodone is a 5 - HT 2A / 2C receptor antagonist .
column2: The antidepressant chem* trazodone *chem is a chem* 5 - HT *chem 2A / 2C receptor antagonist .

column1: OBJECTIVES : To evaluate the effect of trazodone treatment on behaviors dependent on the functional status of the nigrostriatal DAergic system .
column2: OBJECTIVES : To evaluate the effect of chem* trazodone *chem treatment on behaviors dependent on the functional status of the nigrostriatal DAergic system .

column1: METHODS : The effect of pretreatment with trazodone on dexamphetamine - and apomorphine - induced oral stereotypies , on catalepsy induced by haloperidol and apomorphine ( 0 . 05 mg / kg , i . p . ) , on ergometrine - induced wet dog shake ( WDS ) behavior and fluoxetine - induced penile erections was studied in rats .
column2: METHODS : The effect of pretreatment with chem* trazodone *chem on chem* dexamphetamine *chem - and chem* apomorphine *chem - induced oral stereotypies , on catalepsy induced by chem* haloperidol *chem and chem* apomorphine *chem ( 0 . 05 mg / kg , i . p . ) , on chem* ergometrine *chem - induced wet dog shake ( WDS ) behavior and chem* fluoxetine *chem - induced penile erections was studied in rats .

column1: We also investigated whether trazodone induces catalepsy in rats .
column2: We also investigated whether chem* trazodone *chem induces catalepsy in rats .

column1: RESULTS : Trazodone at 2 . 5 - 20 mg / kg i . p . did not induce catalepsy , and did not antagonize apomorphine ( 1 . 5 and 3 mg / kg ) stereotypy and apomorphine ( 0 . 05 mg / kg ) - induced catalepsy .
column2: RESULTS : chem* Trazodone *chem at 2 . 5 - 20 mg / kg i . p . did not induce catalepsy , and did not antagonize chem* apomorphine *chem ( 1 . 5 and 3 mg / kg ) stereotypy and chem* apomorphine *chem ( 0 . 05 mg / kg ) - induced catalepsy .

column1: However , pretreatment with 5 , 10 and 20 mg / kg i . p . trazodone enhanced dexamphetamine stereotypy , and antagonized haloperidol catalepsy , ergometrine - induced WDS behavior and fluoxetine - induced penile erections .
column2: However , pretreatment with 5 , 10 and 20 mg / kg i . p . chem* trazodone *chem enhanced chem* dexamphetamine *chem stereotypy , and antagonized chem* haloperidol *chem catalepsy , chem* ergometrine *chem - induced WDS behavior and chem* fluoxetine *chem - induced penile erections .

column1: Trazodone at 30 , 40 and 50 mg / kg i . p . induced catalepsy and antagonized apomorphine and dexamphetamine stereotypies .
column2: chem* Trazodone *chem at 30 , 40 and 50 mg / kg i . p . induced catalepsy and antagonized chem* apomorphine *chem and chem* dexamphetamine *chem stereotypies .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Our results indicate that trazodone at 2 . 5 - 20 mg / kg does not block pre - and postsynaptic striatal D2 DA receptors , while at 30 , 40 and 50 mg / kg it blocks postsynaptic striatal D2 DA receptors .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Our results indicate that chem* trazodone *chem at 2 . 5 - 20 mg / kg does not block pre - and postsynaptic striatal D2 DA receptors , while at 30 , 40 and 50 mg / kg it blocks postsynaptic striatal D2 DA receptors .

column1: Furthermore , at 5 , 10 and 20 mg / kg , trazodone blocks 5 - HT 2A and 5 - HT 2C receptors .
column2: Furthermore , at 5 , 10 and 20 mg / kg , chem* trazodone *chem blocks chem* 5 - HT *chem 2A and chem* 5 - HT *chem 2C receptors .

column1: We suggest that trazodone ( 5 , 10 and 20 mg / kg ) , by blocking the 5 - HT 2C receptors , releases the nigrostriatal DAergic neurons from tonic inhibition caused by 5 - HT , and thereby potentiates dexamphetamine stereotypy and antagonizes haloperidol catalepsy .
column2: We suggest that chem* trazodone *chem ( 5 , 10 and 20 mg / kg ) , by blocking the chem* 5 - HT *chem 2C receptors , releases the nigrostriatal DAergic neurons from tonic inhibition caused by chem* 5 - HT *chem , and thereby potentiates chem* dexamphetamine *chem stereotypy and antagonizes chem* haloperidol *chem catalepsy .

column1: Swallowing abnormalities and dyskinesia in Parkinson ' s disease .

column2: Gastrointestinal abnormalities in Parkinson ' s disease ( PD ) have been known for almost two centuries , but many aspects concerning their pathophysiology have not been completely clarified .

column2: Patients were asked about dysphagia and evaluated with the Unified Parkinson ' s Disease Rating Scale Parts II and III and the Hoehn and Yahr scale .

column2: Dyskinetic patients tended to have a greater OPSE than nondyskinetic ( Dunnett , P = 0 . 06 ) .

column2: Patients who were using a higher dose of chem* levodopa *chem had a greater OPSE and a trend toward a smaller oral transit time ( Pearson ' s correlation , P = 0 . 01 and 0 . 08 , respectively ) .

column2: Neither the report of dysphagia nor any of the PD severity parameters correlated to the videofluoroscopic variables .

column2: In the current study , dyskinetic patients performed better in swallowing function , which could be explained on the basis of a greater chem* levodopa *chem dose .

column1: Our results suggest a role for levodopa in the oral phase of deglutition and confirm that dysphagia is not a good predictor of deglutition alterations in PD .
column2: Our results suggest a role for chem* levodopa *chem in the oral phase of deglutition and confirm that dysphagia is not a good predictor of deglutition alterations in PD .

column1: Glucose metabolism in patients with schizophrenia treated with atypical antipsychotic agents : a frequently sampled intravenous glucose tolerance test and minimal model analysis .

column1: BACKGROUND : While the incidence of new - onset diabetes mellitus may be increasing in patients with schizophrenia treated with certain atypical antipsychotic agents , it remains unclear whether atypical agents are directly affecting glucose metabolism or simply increasing known risk factors for diabetes .
column2: BACKGROUND : While the incidence of new - onset diabetes mellitus may be increasing in patients with schizophrenia treated with certain atypical antipsychotic agents , it remains unclear whether atypical agents are directly affecting chem* glucose *chem metabolism or simply increasing known risk factors for diabetes .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To study the 2 drugs most clearly implicated ( clozapine and olanzapine ) and risperidone using a frequently sampled intravenous glucose tolerance test .
