column1: RESULTS : The mean + / - SD duration of treatment with the identified atypical antipsychotic agent was 68 . 3 + / - 28 . 9 months ( clozapine ) , 29 . 5 + / - 17 . 5 months ( olanzapine ) , and 40 . 9 + / - 33 . 7 ( risperidone ) .
column2: RESULTS : The mean + / - SD duration of treatment with the identified atypical antipsychotic agent was 68 . 3 + / - 28 . 9 months ( chem* clozapine *chem ) , 29 . 5 + / - 17 . 5 months ( chem* olanzapine *chem ) , and 40 . 9 + / - 33 . 7 ( chem* risperidone *chem ) .

column1: Fasting serum insulin concentrations differed among groups ( F ( 33 ) = 3 . 35 ; P = . 047 ) ( clozapine > olanzapine > risperidone ) with significant differences between clozapine and risperidone ( t ( 33 ) = 2 . 32 ; P = . 03 ) and olanzapine and risperidone ( t ( 33 ) = 2 . 15 ; P = . 04 ) .
column2: Fasting serum insulin concentrations differed among groups ( F ( 33 ) = 3 . 35 ; P = . 047 ) ( chem* clozapine *chem > chem* olanzapine *chem > chem* risperidone *chem ) with significant differences between chem* clozapine *chem and chem* risperidone *chem ( t ( 33 ) = 2 . 32 ; P = . 03 ) and chem* olanzapine *chem and chem* risperidone *chem ( t ( 33 ) = 2 . 15 ; P = . 04 ) .

column1: There was a significant difference in insulin sensitivity index among groups ( F ( 33 ) = 10 . 66 ; P < . 001 ) ( clozapine < olanzapine < risperidone ) , with subjects who received clozapine and olanzapine exhibiting significant insulin resistance compared with subjects who were treated with risperidone ( clozapine vs risperidone , t ( 33 ) = - 4 . 29 ; P < . 001 ; olanzapine vs risperidone , t ( 33 ) = - 3 . 62 ; P = . 001 [ P < . 001 ] ) .
column2: There was a significant difference in insulin sensitivity index among groups ( F ( 33 ) = 10 . 66 ; P < . 001 ) ( chem* clozapine *chem < chem* olanzapine *chem < chem* risperidone *chem ) , with subjects who received chem* clozapine *chem and chem* olanzapine *chem exhibiting significant insulin resistance compared with subjects who were treated with chem* risperidone *chem ( chem* clozapine *chem vs chem* risperidone *chem , t ( 33 ) = - 4 . 29 ; P < . 001 ; chem* olanzapine *chem vs chem* risperidone *chem , t ( 33 ) = - 3 . 62 ; P = . 001 [ P < . 001 ] ) .

column1: The homeostasis model assessment of insulin resistance also differed significantly among groups ( F ( 33 ) = 4 . 92 ; P = . 01 ) ( clozapine > olanzapine > risperidone ) ( clozapine vs risperidone , t ( 33 ) = 2 . 94 ; P = . 006 ; olanzapine vs risperidone , t ( 33 ) = 2 . 42 ; P = . 02 ) .
column2: The homeostasis model assessment of insulin resistance also differed significantly among groups ( F ( 33 ) = 4 . 92 ; P = . 01 ) ( chem* clozapine *chem > chem* olanzapine *chem > chem* risperidone *chem ) ( chem* clozapine *chem vs chem* risperidone *chem , t ( 33 ) = 2 . 94 ; P = . 006 ; chem* olanzapine *chem vs chem* risperidone *chem , t ( 33 ) = 2 . 42 ; P = . 02 ) .

column1: There was a significant difference among groups in glucose effectiveness ( F ( 30 ) = 4 . 18 ; P = . 02 ) ( clozapine < olanzapine < risperidone ) with significant differences between clozapine and risperidone ( t ( 30 ) = - 2 . 59 ; P = . 02 ) and olanzapine and risperidone ( t ( 30 ) = - 2 . 34 , P = . 03 ) .
column2: There was a significant difference among groups in chem* glucose *chem effectiveness ( F ( 30 ) = 4 . 18 ; P = . 02 ) ( chem* clozapine *chem < chem* olanzapine *chem < chem* risperidone *chem ) with significant differences between chem* clozapine *chem and chem* risperidone *chem ( t ( 30 ) = - 2 . 59 ; P = . 02 ) and chem* olanzapine *chem and chem* risperidone *chem ( t ( 30 ) = - 2 . 34 , P = . 03 ) .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Both nonobese clozapine - and olanzapine - treated groups displayed significant insulin resistance and impairment of glucose effectiveness compared with risperidone - treated subjects .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Both nonobese chem* clozapine *chem - and chem* olanzapine *chem - treated groups displayed significant insulin resistance and impairment of chem* glucose *chem effectiveness compared with chem* risperidone *chem - treated subjects .

column1: Patients taking clozapine and olanzapine must be examined for insulin resistance and its consequences .

column2: Generally safe and well tolerated by adults , chem* fluoxetine *chem has been reported to induce mania .

column1: The cases of five depressed adolescents , 14 - 16 years of age , who developed mania during pharmacotherapy with fluoxetine , are reported here .

column1: Apparent risk factors for the development of mania or hypomania during fluoxetine pharmacotherapy in this population were the combination of attention - deficit hyperactivity disorder and affective instability ; major depression with psychotic features ; a family history of affective disorder , especially bipolar disorder ; and a diagnosis of bipolar disorder .

column1: Acute renal insufficiency after high - dose melphalan in patients with primary systemic amyloidosis during stem cell transplantation .

column1: BACKGROUND : Patients with primary systemic amyloidosis ( AL ) have a poor prognosis .
column2: BACKGROUND : Patients with primary systemic amyloidosis ( AL ) have a poor prognosis .

column1: Median survival time from standard treatments is only 17 months .
column2: Median survival time from standard treatments is only 17 months .

column1: High - dose intravenous melphalan followed by peripheral blood stem cell transplant ( PBSCT ) appears to be the most promising therapy , but treatment mortality can be high .
column2: High - dose intravenous chem* melphalan *chem followed by peripheral blood stem cell transplant ( PBSCT ) appears to be the most promising therapy , but treatment mortality can be high .

column1: The authors have noted the development of acute renal insufficiency immediately after melphalan conditioning .
column2: The authors have noted the development of acute renal insufficiency immediately after chem* melphalan *chem conditioning .

column1: This study was undertaken to further examine its risk factors and impact on posttransplant mortality .
column2: This study was undertaken to further examine its risk factors and impact on posttransplant mortality .

column1: METHODS : Consecutive AL patients who underwent PBSCT were studied retrospectively .
column2: METHODS : Consecutive AL patients who underwent PBSCT were studied retrospectively .

column1: Acute renal insufficiency ( ARI ) after high - dose melphalan was defined by a minimum increase of 0 . 5 mg / dL ( 44 micromol / L ) in the serum creatinine level that is greater than 50 % of baseline immediately after conditioning .
column2: Acute renal insufficiency ( ARI ) after high - dose chem* melphalan *chem was defined by a minimum increase of 0 . 5 mg / dL ( 44 micromol / L ) in the serum chem* creatinine *chem level that is greater than 50 % of baseline immediately after conditioning .

column1: Urine sediment score was the sum of the individual types of sediment identified on urine microscopy .
column2: Urine sediment score was the sum of the individual types of sediment identified on urine microscopy .

column1: RESULTS : Of the 80 patients studied , ARI developed in 18 . 8 % of the patients after high - dose melphalan .
column2: RESULTS : Of the 80 patients studied , ARI developed in 18 . 8 % of the patients after high - dose chem* melphalan *chem .

column1: Univariate analysis identified age , hypoalbuminemia , heavy proteinuria , diuretic use , and urine sediment score ( > 3 ) as risk factors .
column2: Univariate analysis identified age , hypoalbuminemia , heavy proteinuria , diuretic use , and urine sediment score ( > 3 ) as risk factors .

column1: Age and urine sediment score remained independently significant risk factors in the multivariate analysis .
column2: Age and urine sediment score remained independently significant risk factors in the multivariate analysis .

column1: Patients who had ARI after high - dose melphalan underwent dialysis more often ( P = 0 . 007 ) , and had a worse 1 - year survival ( P = 0 . 03 ) .
column2: Patients who had ARI after high - dose chem* melphalan *chem underwent dialysis more often ( P = 0 . 007 ) , and had a worse 1 - year survival ( P = 0 . 03 ) .

column1: CONCLUSION : The timing of renal injury strongly suggests melphalan as the causative agent .
column2: CONCLUSION : The timing of renal injury strongly suggests chem* melphalan *chem as the causative agent .

column1: Ongoing tubular injury may be a prerequisite for renal injury by melphalan as evidenced by the active urinary sediment .
column2: Ongoing tubular injury may be a prerequisite for renal injury by chem* melphalan *chem as evidenced by the active urinary sediment .

column1: Development of ARI adversely affected the outcome after PBSCT .
column2: Development of ARI adversely affected the outcome after PBSCT .

column1: Effective preventive measures may help decrease the treatment mortality of PBSCT in AL patients .
column2: Effective preventive measures may help decrease the treatment mortality of PBSCT in AL patients .

column1: Focal cerebral ischemia in rats : effect of phenylephrine - induced hypertension during reperfusion .

column2: After 180 min of temporary middle cerebral artery occlusion in spontaneously hypertensive rats , the effect of chem* phenylephrine *chem - induced hypertension on ischemic brain injury and blood - brain barrier permeability was determined .

column1: Blood pressure was manipulated by one of the following schedules during 120 min of reperfusion : Control , normotensive reperfusion ; 90 / hypertension ( 90 / HTN ) , blood pressure was increased by 35 mm Hg during the initial 90 min of reperfusion only ; 15 / hypertension ( 15 / HTN ) , normotensive reperfusion for 30 min followed by 15 min of hypertension and 75 min of normotension .
column2: Blood pressure was manipulated by one of the following schedules during 120 min of reperfusion : Control , normotensive reperfusion ; 90 / hypertension ( 90 / HTN ) , blood pressure was increased by 35 mm Hg during the initial 90 min of reperfusion only ; 15 / hypertension ( 15 / HTN ) , normotensive reperfusion for 30 min followed by 15 min of hypertension and 75 min of normotension .

column1: Part A , for eight rats in each group brain injury was evaluated by staining tissue using 2 , 3 , 5 - triphenyltetrazolium chloride and edema was evaluated by microgravimetry .
column2: Part A , for eight rats in each group brain injury was evaluated by staining tissue using chem* 2 , 3 , 5 - triphenyltetrazolium chloride *chem and edema was evaluated by microgravimetry .

column1: Part B , for eight different rats in each group blood - brain barrier permeability was evaluated by measuring the amount and extent of extravasation of Evans Blue dye .
column2: Part B , for eight different rats in each group blood - brain barrier permeability was evaluated by measuring the amount and extent of extravasation of Evans Blue dye .

column1: Brain injury ( percentage of the ischemic hemisphere ) was less in the 15 / HTN group ( 16 + / - 6 , mean + / - SD ) versus the 90 / HTN group ( 30 + / - 6 ) , which was in turn less than the control group ( 42 + / - 5 ) .
column2: Brain injury ( percentage of the ischemic hemisphere ) was less in the 15 / HTN group ( 16 + / - 6 , mean + / - SD ) versus the 90 / HTN group ( 30 + / - 6 ) , which was in turn less than the control group ( 42 + / - 5 ) .

column1: Specific gravity was greater in the 15 / HTN group ( 1 . 043 + / - 0 . 002 ) versus the 90 / HTN ( 1 . 036 + / - 0 . 003 ) and control ( 1 . 037 + / - 0 . 003 ) groups .
column2: Specific gravity was greater in the 15 / HTN group ( 1 . 043 + / - 0 . 002 ) versus the 90 / HTN ( 1 . 036 + / - 0 . 003 ) and control ( 1 . 037 + / - 0 . 003 ) groups .

column1: Evans Blue ( mug g - 1 of brain tissue ) was greater in the 90 / HTN group ( 24 . 4 + / - 6 . 0 ) versus the control group ( 12 . 3 + / - 4 . 1 ) , which was in turn greater than the 15 / HTN group ( 7 . 3 + / - 3 . 2 ) .
column2: chem* Evans Blue *chem ( mug g - 1 of brain tissue ) was greater in the 90 / HTN group ( 24 . 4 + / - 6 . 0 ) versus the control group ( 12 . 3 + / - 4 . 1 ) , which was in turn greater than the 15 / HTN group ( 7 . 3 + / - 3 . 2 ) .

column1: This study supports a hypothesis that during reperfusion , a short interval of hypertension decreases brain injury and edema ; and that sustained hypertension increases the risk of vasogenic edema .
column2: This study supports a hypothesis that during reperfusion , a short interval of hypertension decreases brain injury and edema ; and that sustained hypertension increases the risk of vasogenic edema .

column1: People aged over 75 in atrial fibrillation on warfarin : the rate of major hemorrhage and stroke in more than 500 patient - years of follow - up .
column2: People aged over 75 in atrial fibrillation on chem* warfarin *chem : the rate of major hemorrhage and stroke in more than 500 patient - years of follow - up .

column1: OBJECTIVES : To determine the incidence of major hemorrhage and stroke in people aged 76 and older with atrial fibrillation on adjusted - dose warfarin who had been recently been admitted to hospital .
column2: OBJECTIVES : To determine the incidence of major hemorrhage and stroke in people aged 76 and older with atrial fibrillation on adjusted - dose chem* warfarin *chem who had been recently been admitted to hospital .

column1: DESIGN : A retrospective observational cohort study .
column2: DESIGN : A retrospective observational cohort study .

column1: SETTING : A major healthcare network involving four tertiary hospitals .
column2: SETTING : A major healthcare network involving four tertiary hospitals .

column1: PARTICIPANTS : Two hundred thirty - five patients aged 76 and older admitted to a major healthcare network between July 1 , 2001 , and June 30 , 2002 , with atrial fibrillation on warfarin were enrolled .
column2: PARTICIPANTS : Two hundred thirty - five patients aged 76 and older admitted to a major healthcare network between July 1 , 2001 , and June 30 , 2002 , with atrial fibrillation on chem* warfarin *chem were enrolled .

column1: MEASUREMENTS : Information regarding major bleeding episodes , strokes , and warfarin use was obtained from patients , relatives , primary physicians , and medical records .
column2: MEASUREMENTS : Information regarding major bleeding episodes , strokes , and chem* warfarin *chem use was obtained from patients , relatives , primary physicians , and medical records .

column1: RESULTS : Two hundred twenty - eight patients ( 42 % men ) with a mean age of 81 . 1 ( range 76 - 94 ) were included in the analysis .
column2: RESULTS : Two hundred twenty - eight patients ( 42 % men ) with a mean age of 81 . 1 ( range 76 - 94 ) were included in the analysis .

column1: Total follow - up on warfarin was 530 years ( mean 28 months ) .
column2: Total follow - up on chem* warfarin *chem was 530 years ( mean 28 months ) .

column1: There were 53 major hemorrhages , for an annual rate of 10 . 0 % , including 24 ( 45 . 3 % ) life - threatening and five ( 9 . 4 % ) fatal bleeds .
column2: There were 53 major hemorrhages , for an annual rate of 10 . 0 % , including 24 ( 45 . 3 % ) life - threatening and five ( 9 . 4 % ) fatal bleeds .

column1: The annual stroke rate after initiation of warfarin was 2 . 6 % .
column2: The annual stroke rate after initiation of chem* warfarin *chem was 2 . 6 % .

column1: CONCLUSION : The rate of major hemorrhage was high in this old , frail group , but excluding fatalities , resulted in no long - term sequelae , and the stroke rate on warfarin was low , demonstrating how effective warfarin treatment is .
column2: CONCLUSION : The rate of major hemorrhage was high in this old , frail group , but excluding fatalities , resulted in no long - term sequelae , and the stroke rate on chem* warfarin *chem was low , demonstrating how effective chem* warfarin *chem treatment is .

column1: Safety of celecoxib in patients with adverse skin reactions to acetaminophen ( paracetamol ) and nimesulide associated or not with common non - steroidal anti - inflammatory drugs .
column2: Safety of chem* celecoxib *chem in patients with adverse skin reactions to chem* acetaminophen *chem ( chem* paracetamol *chem ) and chem* nimesulide *chem associated or not with common non - steroidal anti - inflammatory drugs .

column1: BACKGROUND : Acetaminophen ( paracetamol - - P ) and Nimesulide ( N ) are widely used analgesic - antipyretic / anti - inflammatory drugs .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* Acetaminophen *chem ( chem* paracetamol *chem - - chem* P *chem ) and chem* Nimesulide *chem ( chem* N *chem ) are widely used analgesic - antipyretic / anti - inflammatory drugs .

column1: The rate of adverse hypersensitivity reactions to these agents is generally low .
column2: The rate of adverse hypersensitivity reactions to these agents is generally low .

column1: On the contrary non - steroidal anti - inflammatory drugs ( NSAIDs ) are commonly involved in such reactions .
column2: On the contrary non - steroidal anti - inflammatory drugs ( NSAIDs ) are commonly involved in such reactions .

column1: Celecoxib ( CE ) is a novel drug , with high selectivity and affinity for COX - 2 enzyme .
column2: chem* Celecoxib *chem ( chem* CE *chem ) is a novel drug , with high selectivity and affinity for COX - 2 enzyme .

column1: OBJECTIVE : We evaluated the tolerability of CE in a group of patients with documented history of adverse cutaneous reactions to P and N associated or not to classic NSAIDs .
column2: OBJECTIVE : We evaluated the tolerability of chem* CE *chem in a group of patients with documented history of adverse cutaneous reactions to chem* P *chem and chem* N *chem associated or not to classic NSAIDs .

column1: METHODS : We studied 9 patients with hypersensitivity to P and N with or without associated reactions to classic NSAIDs .
column2: METHODS : We studied 9 patients with hypersensitivity to chem* P *chem and chem* N *chem with or without associated reactions to classic NSAIDs .

column1: The diagnosis of P and N - induced skin reactions was based in vivo challenge .
column2: The diagnosis of chem* P *chem and chem* N *chem - induced skin reactions was based in vivo challenge .

column1: The placebo was blindly administered at the beginning of each challenge .
column2: The placebo was blindly administered at the beginning of each challenge .

column1: After three days , a cumulative dosage of 200 mg of CE in refracted doses were given .
column2: After three days , a cumulative dosage of 200 mg of chem* CE *chem in refracted doses were given .

column1: After 2 - 3 days , a single dose of 200 mg was administered .
column2: After 2 - 3 days , a single dose of 200 mg was administered .

column1: All patients were observed for 6 hours after each challenge , and controlled again after 24 hours to exclude delayed reactions .
column2: All patients were observed for 6 hours after each challenge , and controlled again after 24 hours to exclude delayed reactions .

column1: The challenge was considered positive if one or more of the following appeared : erythema , rush or urticaria - angioedema .
column2: The challenge was considered positive if one or more of the following appeared : erythema , rush or urticaria - angioedema .

column1: RESULTS : No reaction was observed with placebo and eight patients ( 88 . 8 % ) tolerated CE .
column2: RESULTS : No reaction was observed with placebo and eight patients ( 88 . 8 % ) tolerated chem* CE *chem .

column1: Only one patient developed a moderate angioedema of the lips .
column2: Only one patient developed a moderate angioedema of the lips .

column1: CONCLUSION : Only one hypersensitivity reaction to CE was documented among 9 P and N - highly NSAIDs intolerant patients .
column2: CONCLUSION : Only one hypersensitivity reaction to chem* CE *chem was documented among 9 chem* P *chem and chem* N *chem - highly NSAIDs intolerant patients .

column1: Thus , we conclude that CE is a reasonably safe alternative to be used in subjects who do not tolerate P and N .
column2: Thus , we conclude that chem* CE *chem is a reasonably safe alternative to be used in subjects who do not tolerate chem* P *chem and chem* N *chem .

column1: Case - control study of regular analgesic and nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory use and end - stage renal disease .
column2: Case - control study of regular analgesic and nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory use and end - stage renal disease .

column1: BACKGROUND : Studies on the association between the long - term use of aspirin and other analgesic and nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory drugs ( NSAIDs ) and end - stage renal disease ( ESRD ) have given conflicting results .
column2: BACKGROUND : Studies on the association between the long - term use of chem* aspirin *chem and other analgesic and nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory drugs ( NSAIDs ) and end - stage renal disease ( ESRD ) have given conflicting results .

column1: In order to examine this association , a case - control study with incident cases of ESRD was carried out .
column2: In order to examine this association , a case - control study with incident cases of ESRD was carried out .

column1: METHODS : The cases were all patients entering the local dialysis program because of ESRD in the study area between June 1 , 1995 and November 30 , 1997 .
column2: METHODS : The cases were all patients entering the local dialysis program because of ESRD in the study area between June 1 , 1995 and November 30 , 1997 .

column1: They were classified according to the underlying disease , which had presumably led them to ESRD .
column2: They were classified according to the underlying disease , which had presumably led them to ESRD .

column1: Controls were patients admitted to the same hospitals from where the cases arose , also matched by age and sex .
column2: Controls were patients admitted to the same hospitals from where the cases arose , also matched by age and sex .

column1: Odds ratios were calculated using a conditional logistic model , including potential confounding factors , both for the whole study population and for the various underlying diseases .
column2: Odds ratios were calculated using a conditional logistic model , including potential confounding factors , both for the whole study population and for the various underlying diseases .

column1: RESULTS : Five hundred and eighty - three cases and 1190 controls were included in the analysis .
column2: RESULTS : Five hundred and eighty - three cases and 1190 controls were included in the analysis .

column1: Long - term use of any analgesic was associated with an overall odds ratio of 1 . 22 ( 95 % CI , 0 . 89 - 1 . 66 ) .
column2: Long - term use of any analgesic was associated with an overall odds ratio of 1 . 22 ( 95 % CI , 0 . 89 - 1 . 66 ) .

column1: For specific groups of drugs , the risks were 1 . 56 ( 1 . 05 - 2 . 30 ) for aspirin , 1 . 03 ( 0 . 60 - 1 . 76 ) for pyrazolones , 0 . 80 ( 0 . 39 - 1 . 63 ) for paracetamol , and 0 . 94 ( 0 . 57 - 1 . 56 ) for nonaspirin NSAIDs .
column2: For specific groups of drugs , the risks were 1 . 56 ( 1 . 05 - 2 . 30 ) for chem* aspirin *chem , 1 . 03 ( 0 . 60 - 1 . 76 ) for chem* pyrazolones *chem , 0 . 80 ( 0 . 39 - 1 . 63 ) for chem* paracetamol *chem , and 0 . 94 ( 0 . 57 - 1 . 56 ) for nonaspirin NSAIDs .

column1: The risk of ESRD associated with aspirin was related to the cumulated dose and duration of use , and it was particularly high among the subset of patients with vascular nephropathy as underlying disease [ 2 . 35 ( 1 . 17 - 4 . 72 ) ] .
column2: The risk of ESRD associated with chem* aspirin *chem was related to the cumulated dose and duration of use , and it was particularly high among the subset of patients with vascular nephropathy as underlying disease [ 2 . 35 ( 1 . 17 - 4 . 72 ) ] .

column1: CONCLUSION : Our data indicate that long - term use of nonaspirin analgesic drugs and NSAIDs is not associated with an increased risk of ESRD .
column2: CONCLUSION : Our data indicate that long - term use of nonaspirin analgesic drugs and NSAIDs is not associated with an increased risk of ESRD .

column1: However , the chronic use of aspirin may increase the risk of ESRD .
column2: However , the chronic use of chem* aspirin *chem may increase the risk of ESRD .

column1: Two cases of amisulpride overdose : a cause for prolonged QT syndrome .
column2: Two cases of chem* amisulpride *chem overdose : a cause for prolonged QT syndrome .

column1: Two cases of deliberate self - poisoning with 5 g and 3 . 6 g of amisulpride , respectively , are reported .
column2: Two cases of deliberate self - poisoning with 5 g and 3 . 6 g of chem* amisulpride *chem , respectively , are reported .

column1: In both cases , QT prolongation and hypocalcaemia were noted .
column2: In both cases , QT prolongation and hypocalcaemia were noted .

column1: The QT prolongation appeared to respond to administration of i . v . calcium gluconate .
column2: The QT prolongation appeared to respond to administration of i . v . chem* calcium gluconate *chem .

column1: Growth - associated protein 43 expression in hippocampal molecular layer of chronic epileptic rats treated with cycloheximide .
column2: Growth - associated protein 43 expression in hippocampal molecular layer of chronic epileptic rats treated with chem* cycloheximide *chem .

column1: PURPOSE : GAP43 has been thought to be linked with mossy fiber sprouting ( MFS ) in various experimental models of epilepsy .
column2: PURPOSE : GAP43 has been thought to be linked with mossy fiber sprouting ( MFS ) in various experimental models of epilepsy .

column1: To investigate how GAP43 expression ( GAP43 - ir ) correlates with MFS , we assessed the intensity ( densitometry ) and extension ( width ) of GAP43 - ir in the inner molecular layer of the dentate gyrus ( IML ) of rats subject to status epilepticus induced by pilocarpine ( Pilo ) , previously injected or not with cycloheximide ( CHX ) , which has been shown to inhibit MFS .
column2: To investigate how GAP43 expression ( GAP43 - ir ) correlates with MFS , we assessed the intensity ( densitometry ) and extension ( width ) of GAP43 - ir in the inner molecular layer of the dentate gyrus ( IML ) of rats subject to status epilepticus induced by chem* pilocarpine *chem ( chem* Pilo *chem ) , previously injected or not with chem* cycloheximide *chem ( chem* CHX *chem ) , which has been shown to inhibit MFS .

column1: METHODS : CHX was injected before the Pilo injection in adult Wistar rats .
column2: METHODS : chem* CHX *chem was injected before the chem* Pilo *chem injection in adult Wistar rats .

column1: The Pilo group was injected with the same drugs , except for CHX .
column2: The chem* Pilo *chem group was injected with the same drugs , except for chem* CHX *chem .

column1: Animals were killed between 30 and 60 days later , and brain sections were processed for GAP43 immunohistochemistry .
column2: Animals were killed between 30 and 60 days later , and brain sections were processed for GAP43 immunohistochemistry .

column1: RESULTS : Densitometry showed no significant difference regarding GAP43 - ir in the IML between Pilo , CHX + Pilo , and control groups .
column2: RESULTS : Densitometry showed no significant difference regarding GAP43 - ir in the IML between chem* Pilo *chem , chem* CHX *chem + chem* Pilo *chem , and control groups .

column1: However , the results of the width of the GAP43 - ir band in the IML showed that CHX + Pilo and control animals had a significantly larger band ( p = 0 . 03 ) as compared with that in the Pilo group .
column2: However , the results of the width of the GAP43 - ir band in the IML showed that chem* CHX *chem + chem* Pilo *chem and control animals had a significantly larger band ( p = 0 . 03 ) as compared with that in the chem* Pilo *chem group .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Our current finding that animals in the CHX + Pilo group have a GAP43 - ir band in the IML , similar to that of controls , reinforces prior data on the blockade of MFS in these animals .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Our current finding that animals in the chem* CHX *chem + chem* Pilo *chem group have a GAP43 - ir band in the IML , similar to that of controls , reinforces prior data on the blockade of MFS in these animals .

column1: The change in GAP43 - ir present in Pilo - treated animals was a thinning of the band to a very narrow layer just above the granule cell layer that is likely to be associated with the loss of hilar cell projections that express GAP - 43 .
column2: The change in GAP43 - ir present in chem* Pilo *chem - treated animals was a thinning of the band to a very narrow layer just above the granule cell layer that is likely to be associated with the loss of hilar cell projections that express GAP - 43 .

column1: Nicotine antagonizes caffeine - but not pentylenetetrazole - induced anxiogenic effect in mice .
column2: chem* Nicotine *chem antagonizes chem* caffeine *chem - but not chem* pentylenetetrazole *chem - induced anxiogenic effect in mice .

column1: RATIONALE : Nicotine and caffeine are widely consumed licit psychoactive drugs worldwide .
column2: RATIONALE : chem* Nicotine *chem and chem* caffeine *chem are widely consumed licit psychoactive drugs worldwide .

column1: Epidemiological studies showed that they were generally used concurrently .
column2: Epidemiological studies showed that they were generally used concurrently .

column1: Although some studies in experimental animals indicate clear pharmacological interactions between them , no studies have shown a specific interaction on anxiety responses .
column2: Although some studies in experimental animals indicate clear pharmacological interactions between them , no studies have shown a specific interaction on anxiety responses .

column1: OBJECTIVES : The present study investigates the effects of nicotine on anxiety induced by caffeine and another anxiogenic drug , pentylenetetrazole , in mice .
column2: OBJECTIVES : The present study investigates the effects of chem* nicotine *chem on anxiety induced by chem* caffeine *chem and another anxiogenic drug , chem* pentylenetetrazole *chem , in mice .

column1: The elevated plus - maze ( EPM ) test was used to evaluate the effects of drugs on anxiety .
column2: The elevated plus - maze ( EPM ) test was used to evaluate the effects of drugs on anxiety .

column1: METHODS : Adult male Swiss Webster mice ( 25 - 32 g ) were given nicotine ( 0 . 05 - 0 . 25 mg / kg s . c . ) or saline 10 min before caffeine ( 70 mg / kg i . p . ) or pentylenetetrazole ( 15 and 30 mg / kg i . p . ) injections .
column2: METHODS : Adult male Swiss Webster mice ( 25 - 32 g ) were given chem* nicotine *chem ( 0 . 05 - 0 . 25 mg / kg s . c . ) or saline 10 min before chem* caffeine *chem ( 70 mg / kg i . p . ) or chem* pentylenetetrazole *chem ( 15 and 30 mg / kg i . p . ) injections .

column1: After 15 min , mice were evaluated for their open - and closed - arm time and entries on the EPM for a 10 - min session .
column2: After 15 min , mice were evaluated for their open - and closed - arm time and entries on the EPM for a 10 - min session .

column1: Locomotor activity was recorded for individual groups by using the same treatment protocol with the EPM test .
column2: Locomotor activity was recorded for individual groups by using the same treatment protocol with the EPM test .

column1: RESULTS : Nicotine ( 0 . 05 - 0 . 25 mg / kg ) itself did not produce any significant effect in the EPM test , whereas caffeine ( 70 mg / kg ) and pentylenetetrazole ( 30 mg / kg ) produced an anxiogenic effect , apparent with decreases in open - arm time and entry .
column2: RESULTS : chem* Nicotine *chem ( 0 . 05 - 0 . 25 mg / kg ) itself did not produce any significant effect in the EPM test , whereas chem* caffeine *chem ( 70 mg / kg ) and chem* pentylenetetrazole *chem ( 30 mg / kg ) produced an anxiogenic effect , apparent with decreases in open - arm time and entry .

column1: Nicotine ( 0 . 25 mg / kg ) pretreatment blocked the caffeine - but not pentylenetetrazole - induced anxiety .
column2: chem* Nicotine *chem ( 0 . 25 mg / kg ) pretreatment blocked the chem* caffeine *chem - but not chem* pentylenetetrazole *chem - induced anxiety .

column1: Administration of each drug and their combinations did not produce any effect on locomotor activity .
column2: Administration of each drug and their combinations did not produce any effect on locomotor activity .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Our results suggest that the antagonistic effect of nicotine on caffeine - induced anxiety is specific to caffeine , instead of a non - specific anxiolytic effect .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Our results suggest that the antagonistic effect of chem* nicotine *chem on chem* caffeine *chem - induced anxiety is specific to chem* caffeine *chem , instead of a non - specific anxiolytic effect .

column1: Thus , it may extend the current findings on the interaction between nicotine and caffeine .
column2: Thus , it may extend the current findings on the interaction between chem* nicotine *chem and chem* caffeine *chem .

column1: Long term hormone therapy for perimenopausal and postmenopausal women .
column2: Long term hormone therapy for perimenopausal and postmenopausal women .

column1: BACKGROUND : Hormone therapy ( HT ) is widely used for controlling menopausal symptoms .
column2: BACKGROUND : Hormone therapy ( HT ) is widely used for controlling menopausal symptoms .

column1: It has also been used for the management and prevention of cardiovascular disease , osteoporosis and dementia in older women but the evidence supporting its use for these indications is largely observational .
column2: It has also been used for the management and prevention of cardiovascular disease , osteoporosis and dementia in older women but the evidence supporting its use for these indications is largely observational .

column1: OBJECTIVES : To assess the effect of long - term HT on mortality , heart disease , venous thromboembolism , stroke , transient ischaemic attacks , breast cancer , colorectal cancer , ovarian cancer , endometrial cancer , gallbladder disease , cognitive function , dementia , fractures and quality of life .
column2: OBJECTIVES : To assess the effect of long - term HT on mortality , heart disease , venous thromboembolism , stroke , transient ischaemic attacks , breast cancer , colorectal cancer , ovarian cancer , endometrial cancer , gallbladder disease , cognitive function , dementia , fractures and quality of life .

column1: SEARCH STRATEGY : We searched the following databases up to November 2004 : the Cochrane Menstrual Disorders and Subfertility Group Trials Register , Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials ( CENTRAL ) , MEDLINE , EMBASE , Biological Abstracts .
column2: SEARCH STRATEGY : We searched the following databases up to November 2004 : the Cochrane Menstrual Disorders and Subfertility Group Trials Register , Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials ( CENTRAL ) , MEDLINE , EMBASE , Biological Abstracts .

column1: Relevant non - indexed journals and conference abstracts were also searched .
column2: Relevant non - indexed journals and conference abstracts were also searched .

column1: SELECTION CRITERIA : Randomised double - blind trials of HT ( oestrogens with or without progestogens ) versus placebo , taken for at least one year by perimenopausal or postmenopausal women .
column2: SELECTION CRITERIA : Randomised double - blind trials of HT ( chem* oestrogens *chem with or without chem* progestogens *chem ) versus placebo , taken for at least one year by perimenopausal or postmenopausal women .

column1: DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS : Fifteen RCTs were included .
column2: DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS : Fifteen RCTs were included .

column1: Trials were assessed for quality and two review authors extracted data independently .
column2: Trials were assessed for quality and two review authors extracted data independently .

column1: They calculated risk ratios for dichotomous outcomes and weighted mean differences for continuous outcomes .
column2: They calculated risk ratios for dichotomous outcomes and weighted mean differences for continuous outcomes .

column1: Clinical heterogeneity precluded meta - analysis for most outcomes .
column2: Clinical heterogeneity precluded meta - analysis for most outcomes .

column1: MAIN RESULTS : All the statistically significant results were derived from the two biggest trials .
column2: MAIN RESULTS : All the statistically significant results were derived from the two biggest trials .

column1: In relatively healthy women , combined continuous HT significantly increased the risk of venous thromboembolism or coronary event ( after one year ' s use ) , stroke ( after 3 years ) , breast cancer ( after 5 years ) and gallbladder disease .
column2: In relatively healthy women , combined continuous HT significantly increased the risk of venous thromboembolism or coronary event ( after one year ' s use ) , stroke ( after 3 years ) , breast cancer ( after 5 years ) and gallbladder disease .

column1: Long - term oestrogen - only HT also significantly increased the risk of stroke and gallbladder disease .
column2: Long - term chem* oestrogen *chem - only HT also significantly increased the risk of stroke and gallbladder disease .

column1: Overall , the only statistically significant benefits of HT were a decreased incidence of fractures and colon cancer with long - term use .
column2: Overall , the only statistically significant benefits of HT were a decreased incidence of fractures and colon cancer with long - term use .

column1: Among relatively healthy women over 65 years taking continuous combined HT , there was a statistically significant increase in the incidence of dementia .
column2: Among relatively healthy women over 65 years taking continuous combined HT , there was a statistically significant increase in the incidence of dementia .

column1: Among women with cardiovascular disease , long - term use of combined continuous HT significantly increased the risk of venous thromboembolism .
column2: Among women with cardiovascular disease , long - term use of combined continuous HT significantly increased the risk of venous thromboembolism .

column1: No trials focussed specifically on younger women .
column2: No trials focussed specifically on younger women .

column1: However , one trial analysed subgroups of 2839 relatively healthy 50 to 59 year - old women taking combined continuous HT and 1637 taking oestrogen - only HT , versus similar - sized placebo groups .
column2: However , one trial analysed subgroups of 2839 relatively healthy 50 to 59 year - old women taking combined continuous HT and 1637 taking chem* oestrogen *chem - only HT , versus similar - sized placebo groups .

column1: The only significantly increased risk reported was for venous thromboembolism in women taking combined continuous HT ; their absolute risk remained very low .
column2: The only significantly increased risk reported was for venous thromboembolism in women taking combined continuous HT ; their absolute risk remained very low .

column1: AUTHORS ' CONCLUSIONS : HT is not indicated for the routine management of chronic disease .
column2: AUTHORS ' CONCLUSIONS : HT is not indicated for the routine management of chronic disease .

column1: We need more evidence on the safety of HT for menopausal symptom control , though short - term use appears to be relatively safe for healthy younger women .
column2: We need more evidence on the safety of HT for menopausal symptom control , though short - term use appears to be relatively safe for healthy younger women .

column1: Drug - induced liver injury : an analysis of 461 incidences submitted to the Spanish registry over a 10 - year period .
column2: Drug - induced liver injury : an analysis of 461 incidences submitted to the Spanish registry over a 10 - year period .

column1: BACKGROUND & AIMS : Progress in the understanding of susceptibility factors to drug - induced liver injury ( DILI ) and outcome predictability are hampered by the lack of systematic programs to detect bona fide cases .
column2: BACKGROUND & AIMS : Progress in the understanding of susceptibility factors to drug - induced liver injury ( DILI ) and outcome predictability are hampered by the lack of systematic programs to detect bona fide cases .

column1: METHODS : A cooperative network was created in 1994 in Spain to identify all suspicions of DILI following a prospective structured report form .
column2: METHODS : A cooperative network was created in 1994 in Spain to identify all suspicions of DILI following a prospective structured report form .

column1: The liver damage was characterized according to hepatocellular , cholestatic , and mixed laboratory criteria and to histologic criteria when available .
column2: The liver damage was characterized according to hepatocellular , cholestatic , and mixed laboratory criteria and to histologic criteria when available .

column1: Further evaluation of causality assessment was centrally performed .
column2: Further evaluation of causality assessment was centrally performed .

column1: RESULTS : Since April 1994 to August 2004 , 461 out of 570 submitted cases , involving 505 drugs , were deemed to be related to DILI .
column2: RESULTS : Since April 1994 to August 2004 , 461 out of 570 submitted cases , involving 505 drugs , were deemed to be related to DILI .

column1: The antiinfective group of drugs was the more frequently incriminated , amoxicillin - clavulanate accounting for the 12 . 8 % of the whole series .
column2: The antiinfective group of drugs was the more frequently incriminated , chem* amoxicillin - clavulanate *chem accounting for the 12 . 8 % of the whole series .

column1: In vivo evidences suggesting the role of oxidative stress in pathogenesis of vancomycin - induced nephrotoxicity : protection by erdosteine .
column2: In vivo evidences suggesting the role of oxidative stress in pathogenesis of chem* vancomycin *chem - induced nephrotoxicity : protection by chem* erdosteine *chem .

column1: The aims of this study were to examine vancomycin ( VCM ) - induced oxidative stress that promotes production of reactive oxygen species ( ROS ) and to investigate the role of erdosteine , an expectorant agent , which has also antioxidant properties , on kidney tissue against the possible VCM - induced renal impairment in rats .
column2: The aims of this study were to examine chem* vancomycin *chem ( chem* VCM *chem ) - induced oxidative stress that promotes production of reactive chem* oxygen *chem species ( ROS ) and to investigate the role of chem* erdosteine *chem , an expectorant agent , which has also antioxidant properties , on kidney tissue against the possible chem* VCM *chem - induced renal impairment in rats .

column1: Rats were divided into three groups : sham , VCM and VCM plus erdosteine .
column2: Rats were divided into three groups : sham , chem* VCM *chem and chem* VCM *chem plus chem* erdosteine *chem .

column1: VCM was administrated intraperitoneally ( i . p . ) with 200mgkg ( - 1 ) twice daily for 7 days .
column2: chem* VCM *chem was administrated intraperitoneally ( i . p . ) with 200mgkg ( - 1 ) twice daily for 7 days .

column1: Erdosteine was administered orally .
column2: chem* Erdosteine *chem was administered orally .

column1: VCM administration to control rats significantly increased renal malondialdehyde ( MDA ) and urinary N - acetyl - beta - d - glucosaminidase ( NAG , a marker of renal tubular injury ) excretion but decreased superoxide dismutase ( SOD ) and catalase ( CAT ) activities .
column2: chem* VCM *chem administration to control rats significantly increased renal chem* malondialdehyde *chem ( chem* MDA *chem ) and urinary N - acetyl - beta - d - glucosaminidase ( NAG , a marker of renal tubular injury ) excretion but decreased chem* superoxide *chem dismutase ( SOD ) and catalase ( CAT ) activities .

column1: Erdosteine administration with VCM injections caused significantly decreased renal MDA and urinary NAG excretion , and increased SOD activity , but not CAT activity in renal tissue when compared with VCM alone .
column2: chem* Erdosteine *chem administration with chem* VCM *chem injections caused significantly decreased renal chem* MDA *chem and urinary NAG excretion , and increased SOD activity , but not CAT activity in renal tissue when compared with chem* VCM *chem alone .

column1: Erdosteine showed histopathological protection against VCM - induced nephrotoxicity .
column2: chem* Erdosteine *chem showed histopathological protection against chem* VCM *chem - induced nephrotoxicity .

column1: There were a significant dilatation of tubular lumens , extensive epithelial cell vacuolization , atrophy , desquamation , and necrosis in VCM - treated rats more than those of the control and the erdosteine groups .
column2: There were a significant dilatation of tubular lumens , extensive epithelial cell vacuolization , atrophy , desquamation , and necrosis in chem* VCM *chem - treated rats more than those of the control and the chem* erdosteine *chem groups .

column1: Erdosteine caused a marked reduction in the extent of tubular damage .
column2: chem* Erdosteine *chem caused a marked reduction in the extent of tubular damage .

column1: It is concluded that oxidative tubular damage plays an important role in the VCM - induced nephrotoxicity and the modulation of oxidative stress with erdosteine reduces the VCM - induced kidney damage both at the biochemical and histological levels .
column2: It is concluded that oxidative tubular damage plays an important role in the chem* VCM *chem - induced nephrotoxicity and the modulation of oxidative stress with chem* erdosteine *chem reduces the chem* VCM *chem - induced kidney damage both at the biochemical and histological levels .

column1: Gemfibrozil - lovastatin therapy for primary hyperlipoproteinemias .
column2: chem* Gemfibrozil *chem - chem* lovastatin *chem therapy for primary hyperlipoproteinemias .

column1: The specific aim of this retrospective , observational study was to assess safety and efficacy of long - term ( 21 months / patient ) , open - label , gemfibrozil - lovastatin treatment in 80 patients with primary mixed hyperlipidemia ( 68 % of whom had atherosclerotic vascular disease ) .
column2: The specific aim of this retrospective , observational study was to assess safety and efficacy of long - term ( 21 months / patient ) , open - label , chem* gemfibrozil *chem - chem* lovastatin *chem treatment in 80 patients with primary mixed hyperlipidemia ( 68 % of whom had atherosclerotic vascular disease ) .

column1: Because ideal lipid targets were not reached ( low - density lipoprotein ( LDL ) cholesterol less than 130 mg / dl , high - density lipoprotein ( HDL ) cholesterol greater than 35 mg / dl , or total cholesterol / HDL cholesterol less than 4 . 5 mg / dl ) with diet plus a single drug , gemfibrozil ( 1 . 2 g / day ) - lovastatin ( primarily 20 or 40 mg ) treatment was given .

column1: Follow - up visits were scheduled with 2 - drug therapy every 6 to 8 weeks , an average of 10 . 3 visits per patient , with 741 batteries of 6 liver function tests and 714 creatine phosphokinase levels measured .
column2: Follow - up visits were scheduled with 2 - drug therapy every 6 to 8 weeks , an average of 10 . 3 visits per patient , with 741 batteries of 6 liver function tests and 714 chem* creatine *chem phosphokinase levels measured .

column2: Of the 714 chem* creatine *chem phosphokinase levels , 9 % were high ; only 1 ( 0 . 1 % ) was greater than or equal to 3 times the upper normal limit .

column1: Does domperidone potentiate mirtazapine - associated restless legs syndrome ?
column2: Does chem* domperidone *chem potentiate chem* mirtazapine *chem - associated restless legs syndrome ?

column1: There is now evidence to suggest a central role for the dopaminergic system in restless legs syndrome ( RLS ) .
column2: There is now evidence to suggest a central role for the dopaminergic system in restless legs syndrome ( RLS ) .

column1: For example , the symptoms of RLS can be dramatically improved by levodopa and dopamine agonists , whereas central dopamine D2 receptor antagonists can induce or aggravate RLS symptoms .
column2: For example , the symptoms of RLS can be dramatically improved by chem* levodopa *chem and chem* dopamine *chem agonists , whereas central chem* dopamine *chem D2 receptor antagonists can induce or aggravate RLS symptoms .

column1: To our knowledge , there is no previous report regarding whether domperidone , a peripheral dopamine D2 receptor antagonist , can also induce or aggravate symptoms of RLS .
column2: To our knowledge , there is no previous report regarding whether chem* domperidone *chem , a peripheral chem* dopamine *chem D2 receptor antagonist , can also induce or aggravate symptoms of RLS .

column1: Mirtazapine , the first noradrenergic and specific serotonergic antidepressant ( NaSSA ) , has been associated with RLS in several recent publications .
column2: chem* Mirtazapine *chem , the first noradrenergic and specific serotonergic antidepressant ( NaSSA ) , has been associated with RLS in several recent publications .

column1: The authors report here a depressed patient comorbid with postprandial dyspepsia who developed RLS after mirtazapine had been added to his domperidone therapy .
column2: The authors report here a depressed patient comorbid with postprandial dyspepsia who developed RLS after chem* mirtazapine *chem had been added to his chem* domperidone *chem therapy .

column1: Our patient started to have symptoms of RLS only after he had been treated with mirtazapine , and his RLS symptoms resolved completely upon discontinuation of his mirtazapine .
column2: Our patient started to have symptoms of RLS only after he had been treated with chem* mirtazapine *chem , and his RLS symptoms resolved completely upon discontinuation of his chem* mirtazapine *chem .

column1: Such a temporal relationship between the use of mirtazapine and the symptoms of RLS in our patient did not support a potentiating effect of domperione on mirtazapine - associated RLS .
column2: Such a temporal relationship between the use of chem* mirtazapine *chem and the symptoms of RLS in our patient did not support a potentiating effect of chem* domperione *chem on chem* mirtazapine *chem - associated RLS .

column1: However , physicians should be aware of the possibility that mirtazapine can be associated with RLS in some individuals , especially those receiving concomitant dopamine D2 receptor antagonists .
column2: However , physicians should be aware of the possibility that chem* mirtazapine *chem can be associated with RLS in some individuals , especially those receiving concomitant chem* dopamine *chem D2 receptor antagonists .

column1: Antiandrogenic therapy can cause coronary arterial disease .
column2: Antiandrogenic therapy can cause coronary arterial disease .

column1: AIM : To study the change of lipid metabolism by antiandrogen therapy in patients with prostate cancer .
column2: AIM : To study the change of lipid metabolism by antiandrogen therapy in patients with prostate cancer .

column1: MATERIALS AND METHODS : We studied with a 2 . 5 years follow - up the changes in plasma cholesterols ( C ) , triglycerides ( TG ) , lipoproteins ( LP ) , and apolipoproteins ( Apo ) B - 100 , A - I , and A - II pro fi les in 24 patients of mean age 60 years with low risk prostate cancer ( stage : T1cN0M0 , Gleason score : 2 - 5 ) during treatment with cyproterone acetate ( CPA ) without surgical management or radiation therapy .
column2: MATERIALS AND METHODS : We studied with a 2 . 5 years follow - up the changes in plasma chem* cholesterols *chem ( chem* C *chem ) , chem* triglycerides *chem ( chem* TG *chem ) , lipoproteins ( LP ) , and apolipoproteins ( Apo ) B - 100 , A - I , and A - II pro fi les in 24 patients of mean age 60 years with low risk prostate cancer ( stage : T1cN0M0 , Gleason score : 2 - 5 ) during treatment with chem* cyproterone acetate *chem ( chem* CPA *chem ) without surgical management or radiation therapy .

column1: RESULTS : Significant decreases of HDL - C , Apo A - I and Apo A - II and an increase of triglyceride levels in VLDL were induced by CPA .
column2: RESULTS : Significant decreases of HDL - C , Apo A - I and Apo A - II and an increase of chem* triglyceride *chem levels in VLDL were induced by chem* CPA *chem .

column1: After a period of 2 . 5 years on CPA treatment , four patients out of twenty - four were found to be affected by coronary heart disease .
column2: After a period of 2 . 5 years on chem* CPA *chem treatment , four patients out of twenty - four were found to be affected by coronary heart disease .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Ischaemic coronary arteriosclerosis with an incidence rate of 16 . 6 % as caused by prolonged CPA therapy is mediated through changes in HDL cholesterol , Apo A - I and Apo A - II pro fi les , other than the well - known hyperglyceridemic effect caused by estrogen .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Ischaemic coronary arteriosclerosis with an incidence rate of 16 . 6 % as caused by prolonged chem* CPA *chem therapy is mediated through changes in HDL chem* cholesterol *chem , Apo A - I and Apo A - II pro fi les , other than the well - known hyperglyceridemic effect caused by chem* estrogen *chem .

column1: 5 - Fluorouracil cardiotoxicity induced by alpha - fluoro - beta - alanine .
column2: chem* 5 - Fluorouracil *chem cardiotoxicity induced by chem* alpha - fluoro - beta - alanine *chem .

column1: Cardiotoxicity is a rare complication occurring during 5 - fluorouracil ( 5 - FU ) treatment for malignancies .
column2: Cardiotoxicity is a rare complication occurring during chem* 5 - fluorouracil *chem ( chem* 5 - FU *chem ) treatment for malignancies .

column1: We herein report the case of a 70 - year - old man with 5 - FU - induced cardiotoxicity , in whom a high serum level of alpha - fluoro - beta - alanine ( FBAL ) was observed .
column2: We herein report the case of a 70 - year - old man with chem* 5 - FU *chem - induced cardiotoxicity , in whom a high serum level of chem* alpha - fluoro - beta - alanine *chem ( chem* FBAL *chem ) was observed .

column1: The patient , who had unresectable colon cancer metastases to the liver and lung , was referred to us for chemotherapy from an affiliated hospital ; he had no cardiac history .
column2: The patient , who had unresectable colon cancer metastases to the liver and lung , was referred to us for chemotherapy from an affiliated hospital ; he had no cardiac history .

column1: After admission , the patient received a continuous intravenous infusion of 5 - FU ( 1000 mg / day ) , during which precordial pain with right bundle branch block occurred concomitantly with a high serum FBAL concentration of 1955 ng / ml .
column2: After admission , the patient received a continuous intravenous infusion of chem* 5 - FU *chem ( 1000 mg / day ) , during which precordial pain with right bundle branch block occurred concomitantly with a high serum chem* FBAL *chem concentration of 1955 ng / ml .

column1: Both the precordial pain and the electrocardiographic changes disappeared spontaneously after the discontinuation of 5 - FU .
column2: Both the precordial pain and the electrocardiographic changes disappeared spontaneously after the discontinuation of chem* 5 - FU *chem .

column1: As the precordial pain in this patient was considered to have been due to 5 - FU - induced cardiotoxicity , the administration of 5 - FU was abandoned .
column2: As the precordial pain in this patient was considered to have been due to chem* 5 - FU *chem - induced cardiotoxicity , the administration of chem* 5 - FU *chem was abandoned .

column1: Instead , oral administration of S - 1 ( a derivative of 5 - FU ) , at 200 mg / day twice a week , was instituted , because S - 1 has a strong inhibitory effect on dihydropyrimidine dehydrogenase , which catalyzes the degradative of 5 - FU into FBAL .
column2: Instead , oral administration of S - 1 ( a derivative of chem* 5 - FU *chem ) , at 200 mg / day twice a week , was instituted , because S - 1 has a strong inhibitory effect on chem* dihydropyrimidine *chem dehydrogenase , which catalyzes the degradative of chem* 5 - FU *chem into chem* FBAL *chem .

column1: The serum FBAL concentration subsequently decreased to 352 ng / ml , the same as the value measured on the first day of S - 1 administration .
column2: The serum chem* FBAL *chem concentration subsequently decreased to 352 ng / ml , the same as the value measured on the first day of S - 1 administration .

column1: Thereafter , no cardiac symptoms were observed .
column2: Thereafter , no cardiac symptoms were observed .

column1: The patient achieved a partial response 6 months after the initiation of the S - 1 treatment .
column2: The patient achieved a partial response 6 months after the initiation of the S - 1 treatment .

column1: The experience of this case , together with a review of the literature , suggests that FBAL is related to 5 - FU - induced cardiotoxicity .
column2: The experience of this case , together with a review of the literature , suggests that chem* FBAL *chem is related to chem* 5 - FU *chem - induced cardiotoxicity .

column1: S - 1 may be administered safely to patients with 5 - FU - induced cardiotoxicity .
column2: S - 1 may be administered safely to patients with chem* 5 - FU *chem - induced cardiotoxicity .

column1: Hepatocellular carcinoma in Fanconi ' s anemia treated with androgen and corticosteroid .
column2: Hepatocellular carcinoma in Fanconi ' s anemia treated with chem* androgen *chem and chem* corticosteroid *chem .

column1: The case of an 11 - year - old boy is reported who was known to have Fanconi ' s anemia for 3 years and was treated with androgens , corticosteroids and transfusions .
column2: The case of an 11 - year - old boy is reported who was known to have Fanconi ' s anemia for 3 years and was treated with chem* androgens *chem , chem* corticosteroids *chem and transfusions .

column1: Two weeks before his death he was readmitted because of aplastic crisis with septicemia and marked abnormalities in liver function and died of hemorrhagic bronchopneumonia .
column2: Two weeks before his death he was readmitted because of aplastic crisis with septicemia and marked abnormalities in liver function and died of hemorrhagic bronchopneumonia .

column1: At autopsy peliosis and multiple hepatic tumors were found which histologically proved to be well - differentiated hepatocellular carcinoma .
column2: At autopsy peliosis and multiple hepatic tumors were found which histologically proved to be well - differentiated hepatocellular carcinoma .

column1: This case contributes to the previous observations that non - metastasizing hepatic neoplasms and peliosis can develop in patients with androgen - and corticosteroid - treated Fanconi ' s anemia .
column2: This case contributes to the previous observations that non - metastasizing hepatic neoplasms and peliosis can develop in patients with chem* androgen *chem - and chem* corticosteroid *chem - treated Fanconi ' s anemia .

column1: The influence of the time interval between monoHER and doxorubicin administration on the protection against doxorubicin - induced cardiotoxicity in mice .
column2: The influence of the time interval between chem* monoHER *chem and chem* doxorubicin *chem administration on the protection against chem* doxorubicin *chem - induced cardiotoxicity in mice .

column1: PURPOSE : Despite its well - known cardiotoxicity , the anthracyclin doxorubicin ( DOX ) continues to be an effective and widely used chemotherapeutic agent .
column2: PURPOSE : Despite its well - known cardiotoxicity , the anthracyclin chem* doxorubicin *chem ( chem* DOX *chem ) continues to be an effective and widely used chemotherapeutic agent .

column1: DOX - induced cardiac damage presumably results from the formation of free radicals by DOX .
column2: chem* DOX *chem - induced cardiac damage presumably results from the formation of free radicals by chem* DOX *chem .

column1: Reactive oxygen species particularly affect the cardiac myocytes because these cells seem to have a relatively poor antioxidant defense system .
column2: Reactive chem* oxygen *chem species particularly affect the cardiac myocytes because these cells seem to have a relatively poor antioxidant defense system .

column1: The semisynthetic flavonoid monohydroxyethylrutoside ( monoHER ) showed cardioprotection against DOX - induced cardiotoxicity through its radical scavenging and iron chelating properties .
column2: The semisynthetic chem* flavonoid chem* monohydroxyethylrutoside *chem ( chem* monoHER *chem ) showed cardioprotection against chem* DOX *chem - induced cardiotoxicity through its radical scavenging and chem* iron *chem chelating properties .

column1: Because of the relatively short final half - life of monoHER ( about 30 min ) , it is expected that the time interval between monoHER and DOX might be of influence on the cardioprotective effect of monoHER .
column2: Because of the relatively short final half - life of chem* monoHER *chem ( about 30 min ) , it is expected that the time interval between chem* monoHER *chem and chem* DOX *chem might be of influence on the cardioprotective effect of chem* monoHER *chem .

column1: Therefore , the aim of the present study was to investigate this possible effect .
column2: Therefore , the aim of the present study was to investigate this possible effect .

column1: METHODS : Six groups of 6 BALB / c mice were treated with saline , DOX alone or DOX ( 4 mg / kg i . v . ) preceded by monoHER ( 500 mg / kg i . p . ) with an interval of 10 , 30 , 60 or 120 min .
column2: METHODS : Six groups of 6 BALB / c mice were treated with saline , chem* DOX *chem alone or chem* DOX *chem ( 4 mg / kg i . v . ) preceded by chem* monoHER *chem ( 500 mg / kg i . p . ) with an interval of 10 , 30 , 60 or 120 min .

column1: After a 6 - week treatment period and additional observation for 2 weeks , the mice were sacrificed .
column2: After a 6 - week treatment period and additional observation for 2 weeks , the mice were sacrificed .

column1: Their cardiac tissues were processed for light microscopy , after which cardiomyocyte damage was evaluated according to Billingham ( in Cancer Treat Rep 62 ( 6 ) : 865 - 872 , 1978 ) .
column2: Their cardiac tissues were processed for light microscopy , after which cardiomyocyte damage was evaluated according to Billingham ( in Cancer Treat Rep 62 ( 6 ) : 865 - 872 , 1978 ) .

column1: Microscopic evaluation revealed that treatment with DOX alone induced significant cardiac damage in comparison to the saline control group ( P < 0 . 001 ) .
column2: Microscopic evaluation revealed that treatment with chem* DOX *chem alone induced significant cardiac damage in comparison to the saline control group ( P < 0 . 001 ) .

column1: RESULTS : The number of damaged cardiomyocytes was 9 . 6 - fold ( 95 % CI 4 . 4 - 21 . 0 ) higher in mice treated with DOX alone than that in animals of the control group .
column2: RESULTS : The number of damaged cardiomyocytes was 9 . 6 - fold ( 95 % CI 4 . 4 - 21 . 0 ) higher in mice treated with chem* DOX *chem alone than that in animals of the control group .

column1: The ratio of aberrant cardiomyocytes in mice treated with DOX preceded by monoHER and those in mice treated with saline ranged from 1 . 6 to 2 . 8 ( mean 2 . 2 , 95 % CI 1 . 2 - 4 . 1 , P = 0 . 019 ) .
column2: The ratio of aberrant cardiomyocytes in mice treated with chem* DOX *chem preceded by chem* monoHER *chem and those in mice treated with saline ranged from 1 . 6 to 2 . 8 ( mean 2 . 2 , 95 % CI 1 . 2 - 4 . 1 , P = 0 . 019 ) .

column1: The mean protective effect by adding monoHER before DOX led to a significant 4 . 4 - fold reduction ( P < 0 . 001 , 95 % CI 2 . 3 - 8 . 2 ) of abnormal cardiomyocytes .
column2: The mean protective effect by adding chem* monoHER *chem before chem* DOX *chem led to a significant 4 . 4 - fold reduction ( P < 0 . 001 , 95 % CI 2 . 3 - 8 . 2 ) of abnormal cardiomyocytes .

column1: This protective effect did not depend on the time interval between monoHER and DOX administration ( P = 0 . 345 ) .

column1: CONCLUSION : The results indicate that in an outpatient clinical setting monoHER may be administered shortly before DOX .
column2: CONCLUSION : The results indicate that in an outpatient clinical setting chem* monoHER *chem may be administered shortly before chem* DOX *chem .

column1: Clinical evaluation of adverse effects during bepridil administration for atrial fibrillation and flutter .
column2: Clinical evaluation of adverse effects during chem* bepridil *chem administration for atrial fibrillation and flutter .

column1: BACKGROUND : Bepridil hydrochloride ( Bpd ) has attracted attention as an effective drug for atrial fibrillation ( AF ) and atrial flutter ( AFL ) .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* Bepridil hydrochloride *chem ( chem* Bpd *chem ) has attracted attention as an effective drug for atrial fibrillation ( AF ) and atrial flutter ( AFL ) .

column2: However , serious adverse effects , including torsade de pointes ( Tdp ) , have been reported .

column1: METHODS AND RESULTS : Adverse effects of Bpd requiring discontinuation of treatment were evaluated .
column2: METHODS AND RESULTS : Adverse effects of chem* Bpd *chem requiring discontinuation of treatment were evaluated .

column1: Bpd was administered to 459 patients ( 361 males , 63 + / - 12 years old ) comprising 378 AF and 81 AFL cases .
column2: chem* Bpd *chem was administered to 459 patients ( 361 males , 63 + / - 12 years old ) comprising 378 AF and 81 AFL cases .

column1: Mean left ventricular ejection fraction and atrial dimension ( LAD ) were 66 + / - 11 % and 40 + / - 6 mm , respectively .
column2: Mean left ventricular ejection fraction and atrial dimension ( LAD ) were 66 + / - 11 % and 40 + / - 6 mm , respectively .

column1: Adverse effects were observed in 19 patients ( 4 % ) during an average follow - up of 20 months .
column2: Adverse effects were observed in 19 patients ( 4 % ) during an average follow - up of 20 months .

column1: There was marked QT prolongation greater than 0 . 55 s in 13 patients , bradycardia less than 40 beats / min in 6 patients , dizziness and general fatigue in 1 patient each .
column2: There was marked QT prolongation greater than 0 . 55 s in 13 patients , bradycardia less than 40 beats / min in 6 patients , dizziness and general fatigue in 1 patient each .

column1: In 4 of 13 patients with QT prolongation , Tdp occurred .
column2: In 4 of 13 patients with QT prolongation , Tdp occurred .

column1: The major triggering factors of Tdp were hypokalemia and sudden decrease in heart rate .
column2: The major triggering factors of Tdp were hypokalemia and sudden decrease in heart rate .

column2: There were no differences in the clinical backgrounds of the patients with and without Tdp other than LAD and age , which were larger and older in the patients with Tdp .

column1: Enhanced isoproterenol - induced cardiac hypertrophy in transgenic rats with low brain angiotensinogen .
column2: Enhanced chem* isoproterenol *chem - induced cardiac hypertrophy in transgenic rats with low brain angiotensinogen .

column1: We have previously shown that a permanent deficiency in the brain renin - angiotensin system ( RAS ) may increase the sensitivity of the baroreflex control of heart rate .
column2: We have previously shown that a permanent deficiency in the brain renin - chem* angiotensin *chem system ( RAS ) may increase the sensitivity of the baroreflex control of heart rate .

column1: In this study we aimed at studying the involvement of the brain RAS in the cardiac reactivity to the beta - adrenoceptor ( beta - AR ) agonist isoproterenol ( Iso ) .
column2: In this study we aimed at studying the involvement of the brain RAS in the cardiac reactivity to the beta - adrenoceptor ( beta - AR ) agonist chem* isoproterenol *chem ( chem* Iso *chem ) .

column1: Transgenic rats with low brain angiotensinogen ( TGR ) were used .
column2: Transgenic rats with low brain angiotensinogen ( TGR ) were used .

column1: In isolated hearts , Iso induced a significantly greater increase in left ventricular ( LV ) pressure and maximal contraction ( + dP / dt ( max ) ) in the TGR than in the Sprague - Dawley ( SD ) rats .
column2: In isolated hearts , chem* Iso *chem induced a significantly greater increase in left ventricular ( LV ) pressure and maximal contraction ( + dP / dt ( max ) ) in the TGR than in the Sprague - Dawley ( SD ) rats .

column1: LV hypertrophy induced by Iso treatment was significantly higher in TGR than in SD rats ( in g LV wt / 100 g body wt , 0 . 28 + / - 0 . 004 vs . 0 . 24 + / - 0 . 004 , respectively ) .
column2: LV hypertrophy induced by chem* Iso *chem treatment was significantly higher in TGR than in SD rats ( in g LV wt / 100 g body wt , 0 . 28 + / - 0 . 004 vs . 0 . 24 + / - 0 . 004 , respectively ) .

column1: The greater LV hypertrophy in TGR rats was associated with more pronounced downregulation of beta - AR and upregulation of LV beta - AR kinase - 1 mRNA levels compared with those in SD rats .
column2: The greater LV hypertrophy in TGR rats was associated with more pronounced downregulation of beta - AR and upregulation of LV beta - AR kinase - 1 mRNA levels compared with those in SD rats .

column1: The decrease in the heart rate ( HR ) induced by the beta - AR antagonist metoprolol in conscious rats was significantly attenuated in TGR compared with SD rats ( - 9 . 9 + / - 1 . 7 % vs . - 18 . 1 + / - 1 . 5 % ) , whereas the effect of parasympathetic blockade by atropine on HR was similar in both strains .
column2: The decrease in the heart rate ( HR ) induced by the beta - AR antagonist chem* metoprolol *chem in conscious rats was significantly attenuated in TGR compared with SD rats ( - 9 . 9 + / - 1 . 7 % vs . - 18 . 1 + / - 1 . 5 % ) , whereas the effect of parasympathetic blockade by chem* atropine *chem on HR was similar in both strains .

column1: These results indicate that TGR are more sensitive to beta - AR agonist - induced cardiac inotropic response and hypertrophy , possibly due to chronically low sympathetic outflow directed to the heart .
column2: These results indicate that TGR are more sensitive to beta - AR agonist - induced cardiac inotropic response and hypertrophy , possibly due to chronically low sympathetic outflow directed to the heart .

column1: Drug - induced long QT syndrome in injection drug users receiving methadone : high frequency in hospitalized patients and risk factors .

column1: BACKGROUND : Drug - induced long QT syndrome is a serious adverse drug reaction .
column2: BACKGROUND : Drug - induced long QT syndrome is a serious adverse drug reaction .

column1: Methadone prolongs the QT interval in vitro in a dose - dependent manner .
column2: chem* Methadone *chem prolongs the QT interval in vitro in a dose - dependent manner .

column1: In the inpatient setting , the frequency of QT interval prolongation with methadone treatment , its dose dependence , and the importance of cofactors such as drug - drug interactions remain unknown .
column2: In the inpatient setting , the frequency of QT interval prolongation with chem* methadone *chem treatment , its dose dependence , and the importance of cofactors such as drug - drug interactions remain unknown .

column1: METHODS : We performed a systematic , retrospective study comparing active or former intravenous drug users receiving methadone and those not receiving methadone among all patients hospitalized over a 5 - year period in a tertiary care hospital .
column2: METHODS : We performed a systematic , retrospective study comparing active or former intravenous drug users receiving chem* methadone *chem and those not receiving chem* methadone *chem among all patients hospitalized over a 5 - year period in a tertiary care hospital .

column1: A total of 167 patients receiving methadone fulfilled the inclusion criteria and were compared with a control group of 80 injection drug users not receiving methadone .
column2: A total of 167 patients receiving chem* methadone *chem fulfilled the inclusion criteria and were compared with a control group of 80 injection drug users not receiving chem* methadone *chem .

column1: In addition to methadone dose , 15 demographic , biological , and pharmacological variables were considered as potential risk factors for QT prolongation .
column2: In addition to chem* methadone *chem dose , 15 demographic , biological , and pharmacological variables were considered as potential risk factors for QT prolongation .

column1: RESULTS : Among 167 methadone maintenance patients , the prevalence of QTc prolongation to 0 . 50 second ( ( 1 / 2 ) ) or longer was 16 . 2 % compared with 0 % in 80 control subjects .
column2: RESULTS : Among 167 chem* methadone *chem maintenance patients , the prevalence of QTc prolongation to 0 . 50 second ( ( 1 / 2 ) ) or longer was 16 . 2 % compared with 0 % in 80 control subjects .

column1: Six patients ( 3 . 6 % ) in the methadone group presented torsades de pointes .
column2: Six patients ( 3 . 6 % ) in the chem* methadone *chem group presented torsades de pointes .

column1: QTc length was weakly but significantly associated with methadone daily dose ( Spearman rank correlation coefficient , 0 . 20 ; P < . 01 ) .
column2: QTc length was weakly but significantly associated with chem* methadone *chem daily dose ( Spearman rank correlation coefficient , 0 . 20 ; P < . 01 ) .

column1: Multivariate regression analysis allowed attribution of 31 . 8 % of QTc variability to methadone dose , cytochrome P - 450 3A4 drug - drug interactions , hypokalemia , and altered liver function .
column2: Multivariate regression analysis allowed attribution of 31 . 8 % of QTc variability to chem* methadone *chem dose , cytochrome P - 450 3A4 drug - drug interactions , hypokalemia , and altered liver function .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : QT interval prolongation in methadone maintenance patients hospitalized in a tertiary care center is a frequent finding .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : QT interval prolongation in chem* methadone *chem maintenance patients hospitalized in a tertiary care center is a frequent finding .

column2: chem* Methadone *chem dose , presence of cytochrome P - 450 3A4 inhibitors , chem* potassium *chem level , and liver function contribute to QT prolongation .

column1: Long QT syndrome can occur with low doses of methadone .
column2: Long QT syndrome can occur with low doses of chem* methadone *chem .

column1: Mechanisms of hypertension induced by nitric oxide ( NO ) deficiency : focus on venous function .

column1: Loss of endothelial cell - derived nitric oxide ( NO ) in hypertension is a hallmark of arterial dysfunction .
column2: Loss of endothelial cell - derived chem* nitric oxide *chem ( chem* NO *chem ) in hypertension is a hallmark of arterial dysfunction .

column1: Experimental hypertension created by the removal of NO , however , involves mechanisms in addition to decreased arterial vasodilator activity .
column2: Experimental hypertension created by the removal of chem* NO *chem , however , involves mechanisms in addition to decreased arterial vasodilator activity .

column1: These include augmented endothelin - 1 ( ET - 1 ) release , increased sympathetic nervous system activity , and elevated tissue oxidative stress .
column2: These include augmented endothelin - 1 ( ET - 1 ) release , increased sympathetic nervous system activity , and elevated tissue oxidative stress .

column2: We hypothesized that increased venous smooth muscle ( venomotor ) tone plays a role in chem* Nomega - nitro - L - arginine *chem ( chem* LNNA *chem ) hypertension through these mechanisms .

column2: Rats were treated with the chem* NO *chem synthase inhibitor chem* LNNA *chem ( 0 . 5 g / L in drinking water ) for 2 weeks .

column2: Mean arterial pressure of conscious rats was 119 + / - 2 mm Hg in control and 194 + / - 5 mm Hg in chem* LNNA *chem rats ( P < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: Carotid arteries and vena cava were removed for measurement of isometric contraction .
column2: Carotid arteries and vena cava were removed for measurement of isometric contraction .

column1: Maximal contraction to norepinephrine was modestly reduced in arteries from LNNA compared with control rats whereas the maximum contraction to ET - 1 was significantly reduced ( 54 % control ) .
column2: Maximal contraction to chem* norepinephrine *chem was modestly reduced in arteries from chem* LNNA *chem compared with control rats whereas the maximum contraction to ET - 1 was significantly reduced ( 54 % control ) .

column2: Maximum contraction of vena cava to chem* norepinephrine *chem ( 37 % control ) also was reduced but no change in response to ET - 1 was observed .

column1: Mean circulatory filling pressure , an in vivo measure of venomotor tone , was not elevated in LNNA hypertension at 1 or 2 weeks after LNNA .
column2: Mean circulatory filling pressure , an in vivo measure of venomotor tone , was not elevated in chem* LNNA *chem hypertension at 1 or 2 weeks after chem* LNNA *chem .

column1: The superoxide scavenger tempol ( 30 , 100 , and 300 micromol kg ( - 1 ) , IV ) did not change arterial pressure in control rats but caused a dose - dependent decrease in LNNA rats ( - 18 + / - 8 , - 26 + / - 15 , and - 54 + / - 11 mm Hg ) .
column2: The chem* superoxide *chem scavenger chem* tempol *chem ( 30 , 100 , and 300 micromol kg ( - 1 ) , IV ) did not change arterial pressure in control rats but caused a dose - dependent decrease in chem* LNNA *chem rats ( - 18 + / - 8 , - 26 + / - 15 , and - 54 + / - 11 mm Hg ) .

column1: Similarly , ganglionic blockade with hexamethonium caused a significantly greater fall in LNNA hypertensive rats ( 76 + / - 9 mm Hg ) compared with control rats ( 35 + / - 10 mm Hg ) .

column2: Carotid arteries , vena cava , and sympathetic ganglia from chem* LNNA *chem rats had higher basal levels of chem* superoxide *chem compared with those from control rats .

column1: These data suggest that while NO deficiency increases oxidative stress and sympathetic activity in both arterial and venous vessels , the impact on veins does not make a major contribution to this form of hypertension .
column2: These data suggest that while chem* NO *chem deficiency increases oxidative stress and sympathetic activity in both arterial and venous vessels , the impact on veins does not make a major contribution to this form of hypertension .

column1: Association of DRD2 polymorphisms and chlorpromazine - induced extrapyramidal syndrome in Chinese schizophrenic patients .
