column1: AIM : Extrapyramidal syndrome ( EPS ) is most commonly affected by typical antipsychotic drugs that have a high affinity with the D2 receptor .
column2: AIM : Extrapyramidal syndrome ( EPS ) is most commonly affected by typical antipsychotic drugs that have a high affinity with the D2 receptor .

column1: Recently , many research groups have reported on the positive relationship between the genetic variations in the DRD2 gene and the therapeutic response in schizophrenia patients as a result of the role of variations in the receptor in modulating receptor expression .
column2: Recently , many research groups have reported on the positive relationship between the genetic variations in the DRD2 gene and the therapeutic response in schizophrenia patients as a result of the role of variations in the receptor in modulating receptor expression .

column1: In this study , we evaluate the role DRD2 plays in chlorpromazine - induced EPS in schizophrenic patients .
column2: In this study , we evaluate the role DRD2 plays in chem* chlorpromazine *chem - induced EPS in schizophrenic patients .

column1: METHODS : We identified seven SNP ( single nucleotide polymorphism ) ( - 141Cins > del , TaqIB , TaqID , Ser311Cys , rs6275 , rs6277 and TaqIA ) in the DRD2 gene in 146 schizophrenic inpatients ( 59 with EPS and 87 without EPS according to the Simpson - Angus Scale ) treated with chlorpromazine after 8 weeks .
column2: METHODS : We identified seven SNP ( single nucleotide polymorphism ) ( - 141Cins > del , TaqIB , TaqID , Ser311Cys , rs6275 , rs6277 and TaqIA ) in the DRD2 gene in 146 schizophrenic inpatients ( 59 with EPS and 87 without EPS according to the Simpson - Angus Scale ) treated with chem* chlorpromazine *chem after 8 weeks .

column1: The alleles of all loci were determined by PCR ( polymerase chain reaction ) .
column2: The alleles of all loci were determined by PCR ( polymerase chain reaction ) .

column1: RESULTS : Polymorphisms TaqID , Ser311Cys and rs6277 were not polymorphic in the population recruited in the present study .
column2: RESULTS : Polymorphisms TaqID , Ser311Cys and rs6277 were not polymorphic in the population recruited in the present study .

column1: No statistical significance was found in the allele distribution of - 141Cins > del , TaqIB , rs6275 and TaqIA or in the estimated haplotypes ( constituted by TaqIB , rs6275 and TaqIA ) in linkage disequilibrium between the two groups .
column2: No statistical significance was found in the allele distribution of - 141Cins > del , TaqIB , rs6275 and TaqIA or in the estimated haplotypes ( constituted by TaqIB , rs6275 and TaqIA ) in linkage disequilibrium between the two groups .

column1: CONCLUSION : Our results did not lend strong support to the view that the genetic variation of the DRD2 gene plays a major role in the individually variable adverse effect induced by chlorpromazine , at least in Chinese patients with schizophrenia .
column2: CONCLUSION : Our results did not lend strong support to the view that the genetic variation of the DRD2 gene plays a major role in the individually variable adverse effect induced by chem* chlorpromazine *chem , at least in Chinese patients with schizophrenia .

column1: Tonic dopaminergic stimulation impairs associative learning in healthy subjects .
column2: Tonic dopaminergic stimulation impairs associative learning in healthy subjects .

column1: Endogenous dopamine plays a central role in salience coding during associative learning .
column2: Endogenous chem* dopamine *chem plays a central role in salience coding during associative learning .

column1: Administration of the dopamine precursor levodopa enhances learning in healthy subjects and stroke patients .
column2: Administration of the chem* dopamine *chem precursor chem* levodopa *chem enhances learning in healthy subjects and stroke patients .

column1: Because levodopa increases both phasic and tonic dopaminergic neurotransmission , the critical mechanism mediating the enhancement of learning is unresolved .
column2: Because chem* levodopa *chem increases both phasic and tonic dopaminergic neurotransmission , the critical mechanism mediating the enhancement of learning is unresolved .

column1: We here probed how selective tonic dopaminergic stimulation affects associative learning .
column2: We here probed how selective tonic dopaminergic stimulation affects associative learning .

column1: Forty healthy subjects were trained in a novel vocabulary of 45 concrete nouns over the course of 5 consecutive training days in a prospective , randomized , double - blind , placebo - controlled design .

column2: Subjects received the tonically stimulating chem* dopamine *chem - receptor agonist chem* pergolide *chem ( 0 . 1 mg ) vs placebo 120 min before training on each training day .

column1: The dopamine agonist significantly impaired novel word learning compared to placebo .
column2: The chem* dopamine *chem agonist significantly impaired novel word learning compared to placebo .

column1: This learning decrement persisted up to the last follow - up 4 weeks post - training .
column2: This learning decrement persisted up to the last follow - up 4 weeks post - training .

column1: Subjects treated with pergolide also showed restricted emotional responses compared to the PLACEBO group .
column2: Subjects treated with chem* pergolide *chem also showed restricted emotional responses compared to the PLACEBO group .

column1: The extent of ' flattened ' affect with pergolide was related to the degree of learning inhibition .
column2: The extent of ' flattened ' affect with chem* pergolide *chem was related to the degree of learning inhibition .

column1: These findings suggest that tonic occupation of dopamine receptors impairs learning by competition with phasic dopamine signals .
column2: These findings suggest that tonic occupation of chem* dopamine *chem receptors impairs learning by competition with phasic chem* dopamine *chem signals .

column1: Thus , phasic signaling seems to be the critical mechanism by which dopamine enhances associative learning in healthy subjects and stroke patients .
column2: Thus , phasic signaling seems to be the critical mechanism by which chem* dopamine *chem enhances associative learning in healthy subjects and stroke patients .

column1: Chinese herbal medicine preparations are widely available and often regarded by the public as natural and safe remedies for a variety of medical conditions .

column1: We report a 23 - year - old woman who developed acute renal failure following prolonged use of a proprietary Chinese herbal slimming pill that contained anthraquinone derivatives , extracted from Rhizoma Rhei ( rhubarb ) .
column2: We report a 23 - year - old woman who developed acute renal failure following prolonged use of a proprietary chem* Chinese herbal *chem slimming pill that contained chem* anthraquinone *chem derivatives , extracted from Rhizoma Rhei ( rhubarb ) .

column1: Renal pathology was that of hypocellular interstitial fibrosis .
column2: Renal pathology was that of hypocellular interstitial fibrosis .

column2: Spontaneous renal recovery occurred upon cessation of the slimming pills , but mild interstitial fibrosis and tubular atrophy was still evident histologically 4 months later .

column1: Although a causal relationship between the use of an anthraquinone - containing herbal agent and renal injury remains to be proven , phytotherapy - associated interstitial nephropathy should be considered in patients who present with unexplained renal failure .
column2: Although a causal relationship between the use of an chem* anthraquinone *chem - containing herbal agent and renal injury remains to be proven , phytotherapy - associated interstitial nephropathy should be considered in patients who present with unexplained renal failure .

column1: Chloroacetaldehyde ( CAA ) is a metabolite of the alkylating agent ifosfamide ( IFO ) and putatively responsible for renal damage following anti - tumor therapy with IFO .

column2: In this work the effect of chem* CAA *chem on human proximal tubule cells in primary culture ( hRPTEC ) was investigated .

column2: chem* CAA *chem reduced hRPTEC cell number and protein , induced a loss in free intracellular chem* thiols *chem and an increase in necrosis markers .

column1: Stereological methods reveal the robust size and stability of ectopic hilar granule cells after pilocarpine - induced status epilepticus in the adult rat .
column2: Stereological methods reveal the robust size and stability of ectopic hilar granule cells after chem* pilocarpine *chem - induced status epilepticus in the adult rat .

column1: Following status epilepticus in the rat , dentate granule cell neurogenesis increases greatly , and many of the new neurons appear to develop ectopically , in the hilar region of the hippocampal formation .
column2: Following status epilepticus in the rat , dentate granule cell neurogenesis increases greatly , and many of the new neurons appear to develop ectopically , in the hilar region of the hippocampal formation .

column1: It has been suggested that the ectopic hilar granule cells could contribute to the spontaneous seizures that ultimately develop after status epilepticus .
column2: It has been suggested that the ectopic hilar granule cells could contribute to the spontaneous seizures that ultimately develop after status epilepticus .

column1: However , the population has never been quantified , so it is unclear whether it is substantial enough to have a strong influence on epileptogenesis .
column2: However , the population has never been quantified , so it is unclear whether it is substantial enough to have a strong influence on epileptogenesis .

column1: To quantify this population , the total number of ectopic hilar granule cells was estimated using unbiased stereology at different times after pilocarpine - induced status epilepticus .
column2: To quantify this population , the total number of ectopic hilar granule cells was estimated using unbiased stereology at different times after chem* pilocarpine *chem - induced status epilepticus .

column1: The number of hilar neurons immunoreactive for Prox - 1 , a granule - cell - specific marker , was estimated using the optical fractionator method .
column2: The number of hilar neurons immunoreactive for Prox - 1 , a granule - cell - specific marker , was estimated using the optical fractionator method .

column1: The results indicate that the size of the hilar ectopic granule cell population after status epilepticus is substantial , and stable over time .
column2: The results indicate that the size of the hilar ectopic granule cell population after status epilepticus is substantial , and stable over time .

column1: Interestingly , the size of the population appears to be correlated with the frequency of behavioral seizures , because animals with more ectopic granule cells in the hilus have more frequent behavioral seizures .
column2: Interestingly , the size of the population appears to be correlated with the frequency of behavioral seizures , because animals with more ectopic granule cells in the hilus have more frequent behavioral seizures .

column1: The hilar ectopic granule cell population does not appear to vary systematically across the septotemporal axis , although it is associated with an increase in volume of the hilus .
column2: The hilar ectopic granule cell population does not appear to vary systematically across the septotemporal axis , although it is associated with an increase in volume of the hilus .

column1: The results provide new insight into the potential role of ectopic hilar granule cells in the pilocarpine model of temporal lobe epilepsy .
column2: The results provide new insight into the potential role of ectopic hilar granule cells in the chem* pilocarpine *chem model of temporal lobe epilepsy .

column1: A prospective , open - label trial of galantamine in autistic disorder .
column2: A prospective , open - label trial of chem* galantamine *chem in autistic disorder .

column1: OBJECTIVE : Post - mortem studies have reported abnormalities of the cholinergic system in autism .
column2: OBJECTIVE : Post - mortem studies have reported abnormalities of the cholinergic system in autism .

column1: The purpose of this study was to assess the use of galantamine , an acetylcholinesterase inhibitor and nicotinic receptor modulator , in the treatment of interfering behaviors in children with autism .
column2: The purpose of this study was to assess the use of chem* galantamine *chem , an acetylcholinesterase inhibitor and nicotinic receptor modulator , in the treatment of interfering behaviors in children with autism .

column1: METHODS : Thirteen medication - free children with autism ( mean age , 8 . 8 + / - 3 . 5 years ) participated in a 12 - week , open - label trial of galantamine .
column2: METHODS : Thirteen medication - free children with autism ( mean age , 8 . 8 + / - 3 . 5 years ) participated in a 12 - week , open - label trial of chem* galantamine *chem .

column1: Patients were rated monthly by parents on the Aberrant Behavior Checklist ( ABC ) and the Conners ' Parent Rating Scale - Revised , and by a physician using the Children ' s Psychiatric Rating Scale and the Clinical Global Impressions scale .
column2: Patients were rated monthly by parents on the Aberrant Behavior Checklist ( ABC ) and the Conners ' Parent Rating Scale - Revised , and by a physician using the Children ' s Psychiatric Rating Scale and the Clinical Global Impressions scale .

column1: RESULTS : Patients showed a significant reduction in parent - rated irritability and social withdrawal on the ABC as well as significant improvements in emotional lability and inattention on the Conners ' Parent Rating Scale - - Revised .
column2: RESULTS : Patients showed a significant reduction in parent - rated irritability and social withdrawal on the ABC as well as significant improvements in emotional lability and inattention on the Conners ' Parent Rating Scale - - Revised .

column1: Similarly , clinician ratings showed reductions in the anger subscale of the Children ' s Psychiatric Rating Scale .
column2: Similarly , clinician ratings showed reductions in the anger subscale of the Children ' s Psychiatric Rating Scale .

column1: Eight of 13 participants were rated as responders on the basis of their improvement scores on the Clinical Global Impressions scale .
column2: Eight of 13 participants were rated as responders on the basis of their improvement scores on the Clinical Global Impressions scale .

column1: Overall , galantamine was well - tolerated , with no significant adverse effects apart from headaches in one patient .
column2: Overall , chem* galantamine *chem was well - tolerated , with no significant adverse effects apart from headaches in one patient .

column1: CONCLUSION : In this open trial , galantamine was well - tolerated and appeared to be beneficial for the treatment of interfering behaviors in children with autism , particularly aggression , behavioral dyscontrol , and inattention .
column2: CONCLUSION : In this open trial , chem* galantamine *chem was well - tolerated and appeared to be beneficial for the treatment of interfering behaviors in children with autism , particularly aggression , behavioral dyscontrol , and inattention .

column1: Randomized comparison of olanzapine versus risperidone for the treatment of first - episode schizophrenia : 4 - month outcomes .

column1: OBJECTIVE : The authors compared 4 - month treatment outcomes for olanzapine versus risperidone in patients with first - episode schizophrenia spectrum disorders .
column2: OBJECTIVE : The authors compared 4 - month treatment outcomes for chem* olanzapine *chem versus chem* risperidone *chem in patients with first - episode schizophrenia spectrum disorders .

column1: METHOD : One hundred twelve subjects ( 70 % male ; mean age = 23 . 3 years [ SD = 5 . 1 ] ) with first - episode schizophrenia ( 75 % ) , schizophreniform disorder ( 17 % ) , or schizoaffective disorder ( 8 % ) were randomly assigned to treatment with olanzapine ( 2 . 5 - 20 mg / day ) or risperidone ( 1 - 6 mg / day ) .
column2: METHOD : One hundred twelve subjects ( 70 % male ; mean age = 23 . 3 years [ SD = 5 . 1 ] ) with first - episode schizophrenia ( 75 % ) , schizophreniform disorder ( 17 % ) , or schizoaffective disorder ( 8 % ) were randomly assigned to treatment with chem* olanzapine *chem ( 2 . 5 - 20 mg / day ) or chem* risperidone *chem ( 1 - 6 mg / day ) .

column1: RESULTS : Response rates did not significantly differ between olanzapine ( 43 . 7 % , 95 % CI = 28 . 8 % - 58 . 6 % ) and risperidone ( 54 . 3 % , 95 % CI = 39 . 9 % - 68 . 7 % ) .
column2: RESULTS : Response rates did not significantly differ between chem* olanzapine *chem ( 43 . 7 % , 95 % CI = 28 . 8 % - 58 . 6 % ) and chem* risperidone *chem ( 54 . 3 % , 95 % CI = 39 . 9 % - 68 . 7 % ) .

column1: Among those responding to treatment , more subjects in the olanzapine group ( 40 . 9 % , 95 % CI = 16 . 8 % - 65 . 0 % ) than in the risperidone group ( 18 . 9 % , 95 % CI = 0 % - 39 . 2 % ) had subsequent ratings not meeting response criteria .
column2: Among those responding to treatment , more subjects in the chem* olanzapine *chem group ( 40 . 9 % , 95 % CI = 16 . 8 % - 65 . 0 % ) than in the chem* risperidone *chem group ( 18 . 9 % , 95 % CI = 0 % - 39 . 2 % ) had subsequent ratings not meeting response criteria .

column1: Negative symptom outcomes and measures of parkinsonism and akathisia did not differ between medications .
column2: Negative symptom outcomes and measures of parkinsonism and akathisia did not differ between medications .

column1: Extrapyramidal symptom severity scores were 1 . 4 ( 95 % CI = 1 . 2 - 1 . 6 ) with risperidone and 1 . 2 ( 95 % CI = 1 . 0 - 1 . 4 ) with olanzapine .
column2: Extrapyramidal symptom severity scores were 1 . 4 ( 95 % CI = 1 . 2 - 1 . 6 ) with chem* risperidone *chem and 1 . 2 ( 95 % CI = 1 . 0 - 1 . 4 ) with chem* olanzapine *chem .

column1: Significantly more weight gain occurred with olanzapine than with risperidone : the increase in weight at 4 months relative to baseline weight was 17 . 3 % ( 95 % CI = 14 . 2 % - 20 . 5 % ) with olanzapine and 11 . 3 % ( 95 % CI = 8 . 4 % - 14 . 3 % ) with risperidone .
column2: Significantly more weight gain occurred with chem* olanzapine *chem than with chem* risperidone *chem : the increase in weight at 4 months relative to baseline weight was 17 . 3 % ( 95 % CI = 14 . 2 % - 20 . 5 % ) with chem* olanzapine *chem and 11 . 3 % ( 95 % CI = 8 . 4 % - 14 . 3 % ) with chem* risperidone *chem .

column1: Body mass index at baseline and at 4 months was 24 . 3 ( 95 % CI = 22 . 8 - 25 . 7 ) versus 28 . 2 ( 95 % CI = 26 . 7 - 29 . 7 ) with olanzapine and 23 . 9 ( 95 % CI = 22 . 5 - 25 . 3 ) versus 26 . 7 ( 95 % CI = 25 . 2 - 28 . 2 ) with risperidone .
column2: Body mass index at baseline and at 4 months was 24 . 3 ( 95 % CI = 22 . 8 - 25 . 7 ) versus 28 . 2 ( 95 % CI = 26 . 7 - 29 . 7 ) with chem* olanzapine *chem and 23 . 9 ( 95 % CI = 22 . 5 - 25 . 3 ) versus 26 . 7 ( 95 % CI = 25 . 2 - 28 . 2 ) with chem* risperidone *chem .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Clinical outcomes with risperidone were equal to those with olanzapine , and response may be more stable .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Clinical outcomes with chem* risperidone *chem were equal to those with chem* olanzapine *chem , and response may be more stable .

column1: Comparison of valsartan / hydrochlorothiazide combination therapy at doses up to 320 / 25 mg versus monotherapy : a double - blind , placebo - controlled study followed by long - term combination therapy in hypertensive adults .
column2: Comparison of chem* valsartan *chem / chem* hydrochlorothiazide *chem combination therapy at doses up to 320 / 25 mg versus monotherapy : a double - blind , placebo - controlled study followed by long - term combination therapy in hypertensive adults .

column1: BACKGROUND : One third of patients treated for hypertension attain adequate blood pressure ( BP ) control , and multidrug regimens are often required .
column2: BACKGROUND : One third of patients treated for hypertension attain adequate blood pressure ( BP ) control , and multidrug regimens are often required .

column1: Given the lifelong nature of hypertension , there is a need to evaluate the long - term efficacy and tolerability of higher doses of combination anti - hypertensive therapies .
column2: Given the lifelong nature of hypertension , there is a need to evaluate the long - term efficacy and tolerability of higher doses of combination anti - hypertensive therapies .

column1: OBJECTIVE : This study investigated the efficacy and tolerability of valsartan ( VAL ) or hydrochlorothiazide ( HCTZ ) - monotherapy and higher - dose combinations in patients with essential hypertension .
column2: OBJECTIVE : This study investigated the efficacy and tolerability of chem* valsartan *chem ( chem* VAL *chem ) or chem* hydrochlorothiazide *chem ( chem* HCTZ *chem ) - monotherapy and higher - dose combinations in patients with essential hypertension .

column1: METHODS : The first part of this study was an 8 - week , multicenter , randomized , double - blind , placebo controlled , parallel - group trial .
column2: METHODS : The first part of this study was an 8 - week , multicenter , randomized , double - blind , placebo controlled , parallel - group trial .

column1: Patients with essential hypertension ( mean sitting diastolic BP [ MSDBP ] , > or = 95 mm Hg and < 110 mm Hg ) were randomized to 1 of 8 treatment groups : VAL 160 or 320 mg ; HCTZ 12 . 5 or 25 mg ; VAL / HCTZ 160 / 12 . 5 , 320 / 12 . 5 , or 320 / 25 mg ; or placebo .
column2: Patients with essential hypertension ( mean sitting diastolic BP [ MSDBP ] , > or = 95 mm Hg and < 110 mm Hg ) were randomized to 1 of 8 treatment groups : chem* VAL *chem 160 or 320 mg ; chem* HCTZ *chem 12 . 5 or 25 mg ; chem* VAL *chem / chem* HCTZ *chem 160 / 12 . 5 , 320 / 12 . 5 , or 320 / 25 mg ; or placebo .

column1: Mean changes in MSDBP and mean sitting systolic BP ( MSSBP ) were analyzed at the 8 - week core study end point .
column2: Mean changes in MSDBP and mean sitting systolic BP ( MSSBP ) were analyzed at the 8 - week core study end point .

column1: VAL / HCTZ 320 / 12 . 5 and 320 / 25 mg were further investigated in a 54 - week , open - label extension .
column2: chem* VAL *chem / chem* HCTZ *chem 320 / 12 . 5 and 320 / 25 mg were further investigated in a 54 - week , open - label extension .

column1: Response was defined as MSDBP < 90 mm Hg or a > or = 10 mm Hg decrease compared to baseline .
column2: Response was defined as MSDBP < 90 mm Hg or a > or = 10 mm Hg decrease compared to baseline .

column1: Control was defined as MSDBP < 90 mm Hg compared with baseline .
column2: Control was defined as MSDBP < 90 mm Hg compared with baseline .

column1: Tolerability was assessed by monitoring adverse events at randomization and all subsequent study visits and regular evaluation of hematology and blood chemistry .
column2: Tolerability was assessed by monitoring adverse events at randomization and all subsequent study visits and regular evaluation of hematology and blood chemistry .

column1: RESULTS : A total of 1346 patients were randomized into the 8 - week core study ( 734 men , 612 women ; 924 white , 291 black , 23 Asian , 108 other ; mean age , 52 . 7 years ; mean weight , 92 . 6 kg ) .
column2: RESULTS : A total of 1346 patients were randomized into the 8 - week core study ( 734 men , 612 women ; 924 white , 291 black , 23 Asian , 108 other ; mean age , 52 . 7 years ; mean weight , 92 . 6 kg ) .

column1: All active treatments were associated with significantly reduced MSSBP and MSDBP during the core 8 - week study , with each monotherapy significantly contributing to the overall effect of combination therapy ( VAL and HCTZ , P < 0 . 001 ) .
column2: All active treatments were associated with significantly reduced MSSBP and MSDBP during the core 8 - week study , with each monotherapy significantly contributing to the overall effect of combination therapy ( chem* VAL *chem and chem* HCTZ *chem , P < 0 . 001 ) .

column1: Each combination was associated with significantly greater reductions in MSSBP and MSDBP compared with the monotherapies and placebo ( all , P < 0 . 001 ) .
column2: Each combination was associated with significantly greater reductions in MSSBP and MSDBP compared with the monotherapies and placebo ( all , P < 0 . 001 ) .

column1: The mean reduction in MSSBP / MSDBP with VAL / HCTZ 320 / 25 mg was 24 . 7 / 16 . 6 mm Hg , compared with 5 . 9 / 7 . 0 mm Hg with placebo .
column2: The mean reduction in MSSBP / MSDBP with chem* VAL *chem / chem* HCTZ *chem 320 / 25 mg was 24 . 7 / 16 . 6 mm Hg , compared with 5 . 9 / 7 . 0 mm Hg with placebo .

column1: Rates of response and BP control were significantly higher in the groups that received combination treatment compared with those that received monotherapy .
column2: Rates of response and BP control were significantly higher in the groups that received combination treatment compared with those that received monotherapy .

column1: The incidence of hypokalemia was lower with VAL / HCTZ combinations ( 1 . 8 % - 6 . 1 % ) than with HCTZ monotherapies ( 7 . 1 % - 13 . 3 % ) .
column2: The incidence of hypokalemia was lower with chem* VAL *chem / chem* HCTZ *chem combinations ( 1 . 8 % - 6 . 1 % ) than with chem* HCTZ *chem monotherapies ( 7 . 1 % - 13 . 3 % ) .

column1: The majority of adverse events in the core study were of mild to moderate severity .
column2: The majority of adverse events in the core study were of mild to moderate severity .

column2: The efficacy and tolerability of chem* VAL *chem / chem* HCTZ *chem combinations were maintained during the extension ( 797 patients ) .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : In this study population , combination therapies with VAL / HCTZ were associated with significantly greater BP reductions compared with either monotherapy , were well tolerated , and were associated with less hypokalemia than HCTZ alone .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : In this study population , combination therapies with chem* VAL *chem / chem* HCTZ *chem were associated with significantly greater BP reductions compared with either monotherapy , were well tolerated , and were associated with less hypokalemia than chem* HCTZ *chem alone .

column1: Succimer chelation improves learning , attention , and arousal regulation in lead - exposed rats but produces lasting cognitive impairment in the absence of lead exposure .
column2: chem* Succimer *chem chelation improves learning , attention , and arousal regulation in chem* lead *chem - exposed rats but produces lasting cognitive impairment in the absence of chem* lead *chem exposure .

column1: BACKGROUND : There is growing pressure for clinicians to prescribe chelation therapy at only slightly elevated blood lead levels .
column2: BACKGROUND : There is growing pressure for clinicians to prescribe chelation therapy at only slightly elevated blood chem* lead *chem levels .

column1: However , very few studies have evaluated whether chelation improves cognitive outcomes in Pb - exposed children , or whether these agents have adverse effects that may affect brain development in the absence of Pb exposure .
column2: However , very few studies have evaluated whether chelation improves cognitive outcomes in chem* Pb *chem - exposed children , or whether these agents have adverse effects that may affect brain development in the absence of chem* Pb *chem exposure .

column1: OBJECTIVES : The present study was designed to answer these questions , using a rodent model of early childhood Pb exposure and treatment with succimer , a widely used chelating agent for the treatment of Pb poisoning .
column2: OBJECTIVES : The present study was designed to answer these questions , using a rodent model of early childhood chem* Pb *chem exposure and treatment with chem* succimer *chem , a widely used chelating agent for the treatment of Pb poisoning .

column1: RESULTS : Pb exposure produced lasting impairments in learning , attention , inhibitory control , and arousal regulation , paralleling the areas of dysfunction seen in Pb - exposed children .
column2: RESULTS : chem* Pb *chem exposure produced lasting impairments in learning , attention , inhibitory control , and arousal regulation , paralleling the areas of dysfunction seen in chem* Pb *chem - exposed children .

column1: Succimer treatment of the Pb - exposed rats significantly improved learning , attention , and arousal regulation , although the efficacy of the treatment varied as a function of the Pb exposure level and the specific functional deficit .
column2: chem* Succimer *chem treatment of the chem* Pb *chem - exposed rats significantly improved learning , attention , and arousal regulation , although the efficacy of the treatment varied as a function of the chem* Pb *chem exposure level and the specific functional deficit .

column1: In contrast , succimer treatment of rats not previously exposed to Pb produced lasting and pervasive cognitive and affective dysfunction comparable in magnitude to that produced by the higher Pb exposure regimen .
column2: In contrast , chem* succimer *chem treatment of rats not previously exposed to chem* Pb *chem produced lasting and pervasive cognitive and affective dysfunction comparable in magnitude to that produced by the higher chem* Pb *chem exposure regimen .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : These are the first data , to our knowledge , to show that treatment with any chelating agent can alleviate cognitive deficits due to Pb exposure .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : These are the first data , to our knowledge , to show that treatment with any chelating agent can alleviate cognitive deficits due to chem* Pb *chem exposure .

column1: These findings suggest that it may be possible to identify a succimer treatment protocol that improves cognitive outcomes in Pb - exposed children .
column2: These findings suggest that it may be possible to identify a chem* succimer *chem treatment protocol that improves cognitive outcomes in chem* Pb *chem - exposed children .

column1: However , they also suggest that succimer treatment should be strongly discouraged for children who do not have elevated tissue levels of Pb or other heavy metals .
column2: However , they also suggest that chem* succimer *chem treatment should be strongly discouraged for children who do not have elevated tissue levels of chem* Pb *chem or other heavy metals .

column1: BACKGROUND AND AIM OF THE STUDY : Undersized mitral annuloplasty ( MAP ) is effective in patients with dilated cardiomyopathy and functional mitral regurgitation ( MR ) since , as well as addressing the MR , the MAP may also reshape the dilated left ventricular ( LV ) base .

column1: Frequency of transient ipsilateral vocal cord paralysis in patients undergoing carotid endarterectomy under local anesthesia .
column2: Frequency of transient ipsilateral vocal cord paralysis in patients undergoing carotid endarterectomy under local anesthesia .

column1: BACKGROUND : Especially because of improvements in clinical neurologic monitoring , carotid endarterectomy done under local anesthesia has become the technique of choice in several centers .
column2: BACKGROUND : Especially because of improvements in clinical neurologic monitoring , carotid endarterectomy done under local anesthesia has become the technique of choice in several centers .

column1: Temporary ipsilateral vocal nerve palsies due to local anesthetics have been described , however .
column2: Temporary ipsilateral vocal nerve palsies due to local anesthetics have been described , however .

column1: Such complications are most important in situations where there is a pre - existing contralateral paralysis .
column2: Such complications are most important in situations where there is a pre - existing contralateral paralysis .

column1: We therefore examined the effect of local anesthesia on vocal cord function to better understand its possible consequences .
column2: We therefore examined the effect of local anesthesia on vocal cord function to better understand its possible consequences .

column1: METHODS : This prospective study included 28 patients undergoing carotid endarterectomy under local anesthesia .
column2: METHODS : This prospective study included 28 patients undergoing carotid endarterectomy under local anesthesia .

column1: Vocal cord function was evaluated before , during , and after surgery ( postoperative day 1 ) using flexible laryngoscopy .
column2: Vocal cord function was evaluated before , during , and after surgery ( postoperative day 1 ) using flexible laryngoscopy .

column1: Anesthesia was performed by injecting 20 to 40 mL of a mixture of long - acting ( ropivacaine ) and short - acting ( prilocaine ) anesthetic .
column2: Anesthesia was performed by injecting 20 to 40 mL of a mixture of long - acting ( chem* ropivacaine *chem ) and short - acting ( chem* prilocaine *chem ) anesthetic .

column1: RESULTS : All patients had normal vocal cord function preoperatively .
column2: RESULTS : All patients had normal vocal cord function preoperatively .

column1: Twelve patients ( 43 % ) were found to have intraoperative ipsilateral vocal cord paralysis .
column2: Twelve patients ( 43 % ) were found to have intraoperative ipsilateral vocal cord paralysis .

column1: It resolved in all cases < or = 24 hours .
column2: It resolved in all cases < or = 24 hours .

column1: There were no significant differences in operating time or volume or frequency of anesthetic administration in patients with temporary vocal cord paralysis compared with those without .
column2: There were no significant differences in operating time or volume or frequency of anesthetic administration in patients with temporary vocal cord paralysis compared with those without .

column1: CONCLUSION : Local anesthesia led to temporary ipsilateral vocal cord paralysis in almost half of these patients .
column2: CONCLUSION : Local anesthesia led to temporary ipsilateral vocal cord paralysis in almost half of these patients .

column1: Because pre - existing paralysis is of a relevant frequency ( up to 3 % ) , a preoperative evaluation of vocal cord function before carotid endarterectomy under local anesthesia is recommended to avoid intraoperative bilateral paralysis .
column2: Because pre - existing paralysis is of a relevant frequency ( up to 3 % ) , a preoperative evaluation of vocal cord function before carotid endarterectomy under local anesthesia is recommended to avoid intraoperative bilateral paralysis .

column1: In patients with preoperative contralateral vocal cord paralysis , surgery under general anesthesia should be considered .
column2: In patients with preoperative contralateral vocal cord paralysis , surgery under general anesthesia should be considered .

column1: Impaired fear recognition in regular recreational cocaine users .

column1: INTRODUCTION : The ability to read facial expressions is essential for normal human social interaction .
column2: INTRODUCTION : The ability to read facial expressions is essential for normal human social interaction .

column1: The aim of the present study was to conduct the first investigation of facial expression recognition performance in recreational cocaine users .
column2: The aim of the present study was to conduct the first investigation of facial expression recognition performance in recreational chem* cocaine *chem users .

column1: MATERIALS AND METHODS : Three groups , comprised of 21 cocaine naive participants ( CN ) , 30 occasional cocaine ( OC ) , and 48 regular recreational cocaine ( RC ) users , were compared .
column2: MATERIALS AND METHODS : Three groups , comprised of 21 chem* cocaine *chem naive participants ( CN ) , 30 occasional chem* cocaine *chem ( OC ) , and 48 regular recreational chem* cocaine *chem ( RC ) users , were compared .

column1: An emotional facial expression ( EFE ) task consisting of a male and female face expressing six basic emotions ( happiness , surprise , sadness , anger , fear , and disgust ) was administered .
column2: An emotional facial expression ( EFE ) task consisting of a male and female face expressing six basic emotions ( happiness , surprise , sadness , anger , fear , and disgust ) was administered .

column1: Mean percent accuracy and latencies for correct responses across eight presentations of each basic emotion were derived .
column2: Mean percent accuracy and latencies for correct responses across eight presentations of each basic emotion were derived .

column1: Participants were also assessed with the " Eyes task " to investigate their ability to recognize more complex emotional states and the Symptom CheckList - 90 - Revised to measure psychopathology .
column2: Participants were also assessed with the " Eyes task " to investigate their ability to recognize more complex emotional states and the Symptom CheckList - 90 - Revised to measure psychopathology .

column1: RESULTS : There were no group differences in psychopathology or " eyes task " performance , but the RC group , who otherwise had similar illicit substance use histories to the OC group , exhibited impaired fear recognition accuracy compared to the OC and CN groups .
column2: RESULTS : There were no group differences in psychopathology or " eyes task " performance , but the RC group , who otherwise had similar illicit substance use histories to the OC group , exhibited impaired fear recognition accuracy compared to the OC and CN groups .

column1: The RC group also correctly identified anger , fear , happiness , and surprise , more slowly than CN , but not OC participants .
column2: The RC group also correctly identified anger , fear , happiness , and surprise , more slowly than CN , but not OC participants .

column1: The OC group was slower than CN when correctly identifying disgust .
column2: The OC group was slower than CN when correctly identifying disgust .

column1: The selective deficit in fear recognition accuracy manifested by the RC group cannot be explained by the subacute effects of cocaine , or ecstasy , because recent and less recent users of these drugs within this group were similarly impaired .
column2: The selective deficit in fear recognition accuracy manifested by the RC group cannot be explained by the subacute effects of chem* cocaine *chem , or chem* ecstasy *chem , because recent and less recent users of these drugs within this group were similarly impaired .

column1: Possible parallels between RC users and psychopaths with respect to impaired fear recognition , amygdala dysfunction , and etiology are discussed .
column2: Possible parallels between RC users and psychopaths with respect to impaired fear recognition , amygdala dysfunction , and etiology are discussed .

column1: This study was designed to evaluate the alterations in offspring rat cerebellum induced by maternal exposure to carmustine - [ 1 , 3 - bis ( 2 - chloroethyl ) - 1 - nitrosoure ] ( BCNU ) and to investigate the effects of exogenous melatonin upon cerebellar BCNU - induced cortical dysplasia , using histological and biochemical analyses .

column1: There was a marked increase in the number of TUNEL positive cells and nestin positive cells in BCNU - exposed group , but a decreased immunoreactivity to glial fibrillary acidic protein , synaptophysin and transforming growth factor beta1 was observed , indicating a delayed maturation , and melatonin significantly reversed these changes .

column1: A rat model was used to evaluate the general acute toxicity and the late cardiotoxicity of 4 mg / kg doxorubicin ( DOX ) given either as free drug or in the form of three N - ( 2 - hydroxypropyl ) methacrylamide ( HPMA ) copolymer conjugates .
column2: A rat model was used to evaluate the general acute toxicity and the late cardiotoxicity of 4 mg / kg chem* doxorubicin *chem ( chem* DOX *chem ) given either as free drug or in the form of three chem* N - ( 2 - hydroxypropyl ) methacrylamide *chem ( chem* HPMA *chem ) copolymer conjugates .

column2: In addition , one biodegradable conjugate containing chem* galactosamine *chem was used ; this residue was targeted to the liver .

column1: Over the first 3 weeks after the i . v . administration of free and polymer - bound DOX , all animals showed a transient reduction in body weight .
column2: Over the first 3 weeks after the i . v . administration of free and polymer - bound chem* DOX *chem , all animals showed a transient reduction in body weight .

column1: However , the maximal reduction in body weight seen in animals that received polymer - bound DOX ( 4 mg / kg ) was significantly lower than that observed in those that received free DOX ( 4 mg / kg ) or a mixture of the unmodified parent HPMA copolymer and free DOX ( 4 mg / kg ; P less than 0 . 01 ) .
column2: However , the maximal reduction in body weight seen in animals that received polymer - bound chem* DOX *chem ( 4 mg / kg ) was significantly lower than that observed in those that received free chem* DOX *chem ( 4 mg / kg ) or a mixture of the unmodified parent chem* HPMA *chem copolymer and free chem* DOX *chem ( 4 mg / kg ; P less than 0 . 01 ) .

column1: Throughout the study ( 20 weeks ) , deaths related to cardiotoxicity were observed only in animals that received either free DOX or the mixture of HPMA copolymer and free DOX ; in these cases , histological investigations revealed marked changes in the heart that were consistent with DOX - induced cardiotoxicity .

column1: Sequential measurements of cardiac output in surviving animals that received either free DOX or the mixture of HPMA copolymer and free DOX showed a reduction of approximately 30 % in function beginning at the 4th week after drug administration .
column2: Sequential measurements of cardiac output in surviving animals that received either free chem* DOX *chem or the mixture of chem* HPMA *chem copolymer and free chem* DOX *chem showed a reduction of approximately 30 % in function beginning at the 4th week after drug administration .

column1: Acute tubulo - interstitial nephritis ( ATIN ) is an important cause of acute renal failure resulting from a variety of insults , including immune complex - mediated tubulo - interstitial injury , but drugs such as non - steroidal anti - inflammatory drugs ( NSAIDs ) are a far more frequent cause .

column1: We report on a 14 - year - old boy who developed acute renal failure 2 weeks after aortic valve surgery .

column1: We describe a case of a patient with Staphylococcal IE who developed acute renal failure secondary to a segmental necrotising glomerulonephritis while being treated with rifampicin , and review the literature regarding this complication of rifampicin therapy .
column2: We describe a case of a patient with Staphylococcal IE who developed acute renal failure secondary to a segmental necrotising glomerulonephritis while being treated with chem* rifampicin *chem , and review the literature regarding this complication of chem* rifampicin *chem therapy .

column1: Rate of YMDD motif mutants in lamivudine - untreated Iranian patients with chronic hepatitis B virus infection .
column2: Rate of YMDD motif mutants in chem* lamivudine *chem - untreated Iranian patients with chronic hepatitis B virus infection .

column1: BACKGROUND : Lamivudine is used for the treatment of chronic hepatitis B patients .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* Lamivudine *chem is used for the treatment of chronic hepatitis B patients .

column1: Recent studies show that the YMDD motif mutants ( resistant hepatitis B virus ) occur as natural genome variability in lamivudine - untreated chronic hepatitis B patients .
column2: Recent studies show that the YMDD motif mutants ( resistant hepatitis B virus ) occur as natural genome variability in chem* lamivudine *chem - untreated chronic hepatitis B patients .

column1: In this study we aimed to determine the rate of YMDD motif mutants in lamivudine - untreated chronic hepatitis B patients in Iran .
column2: In this study we aimed to determine the rate of YMDD motif mutants in chem* lamivudine *chem - untreated chronic hepatitis B patients in Iran .

column1: PATIENTS AND METHODS : A total of 77 chronic hepatitis B patients who had not been treated with lamivudine were included in the study .
column2: PATIENTS AND METHODS : A total of 77 chronic hepatitis B patients who had not been treated with chem* lamivudine *chem were included in the study .

column1: Serum samples from patients were tested by polymerase chain reaction - restriction fragment length polymorphism ( PCR - RFLP ) for detection of YMDD motif mutants .
column2: Serum samples from patients were tested by polymerase chain reaction - restriction fragment length polymorphism ( PCR - RFLP ) for detection of YMDD motif mutants .

column1: All patients were also tested for liver enzymes , anti - HCV , HBeAg , and anti - HBe .
column2: All patients were also tested for liver enzymes , anti - HCV , chem* HBeAg *chem , and anti - HBe .

column1: RESULTS : Of the 77 patients enrolled in the study , 73 % were male and 27 % were female .
column2: RESULTS : Of the 77 patients enrolled in the study , 73 % were male and 27 % were female .

column1: Mean ALT and AST levels were 124 . 4 + / - 73 . 4 and 103 . 1 + / - 81 IU / l , respectively .
column2: Mean ALT and AST levels were 124 . 4 + / - 73 . 4 and 103 . 1 + / - 81 IU / l , respectively .

column1: HBeAg was positive in 40 % and anti - HBe in 60 % of the patients .
column2: chem* HBeAg *chem was positive in 40 % and anti - HBe in 60 % of the patients .

column1: Anti - HCV was negative in all of them .
column2: Anti - HCV was negative in all of them .

column1: YMDD motif mutants were not detected in any of the patients despite the liver enzyme levels and the presence of HBeAg or anti - HBe .
column2: YMDD motif mutants were not detected in any of the patients despite the liver enzyme levels and the presence of chem* HBeAg *chem or anti - HBe .

column1: CONCLUSION : Although the natural occurrence of YMDD motif mutants in lamivudine - untreated patients with chronic hepatitis B has been reported , these mutants were not detected in Iranian lamivudine - untreated chronic hepatitis B patients .
column2: CONCLUSION : Although the natural occurrence of YMDD motif mutants in chem* lamivudine *chem - untreated patients with chronic hepatitis B has been reported , these mutants were not detected in Iranian chem* lamivudine *chem - untreated chronic hepatitis B patients .

column1: Branch retinal vein occlusion and fluoxetine .
column2: Branch retinal vein occlusion and chem* fluoxetine *chem .

column1: A case of branch retinal vein occlusion associated with fluoxetine - induced secondary hypertension is described .
column2: A case of branch retinal vein occlusion associated with chem* fluoxetine *chem - induced secondary hypertension is described .

column1: Although an infrequent complication of selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor therapy , it is important that ophthalmologists are aware that these agents can cause hypertension because this class of drugs is widely prescribed .
column2: Although an infrequent complication of selective chem* serotonin *chem reuptake inhibitor therapy , it is important that ophthalmologists are aware that these agents can cause hypertension because this class of drugs is widely prescribed .

column1: The differential effects of bupivacaine and lidocaine on prostaglandin E2 release , cyclooxygenase gene expression and pain in a clinical pain model .
column2: The differential effects of chem* bupivacaine *chem and chem* lidocaine *chem on chem* prostaglandin E2 *chem release , cyclooxygenase gene expression and pain in a clinical pain model .

column1: BACKGROUND : In addition to blocking nociceptive input from surgical sites , long - acting local anesthetics might directly modulate inflammation .
column2: BACKGROUND : In addition to blocking nociceptive input from surgical sites , long - acting local anesthetics might directly modulate inflammation .

column1: In the present study , we describe the proinflammatory effects of bupivacaine on local prostaglandin E2 ( PGE2 ) production and cyclooxygenase ( COX ) gene expression that increases postoperative pain in human subjects .
column2: In the present study , we describe the proinflammatory effects of chem* bupivacaine *chem on local chem* prostaglandin E2 *chem ( chem* PGE2 *chem ) production and cyclooxygenase ( COX ) gene expression that increases postoperative pain in human subjects .

column1: METHODS : Subjects ( n = 114 ) undergoing extraction of impacted third molars received either 2 % lidocaine or 0 . 5 % bupivacaine before surgery and either rofecoxib 50 mg or placebo orally 90 min before surgery and for the following 48 h .
column2: METHODS : Subjects ( n = 114 ) undergoing extraction of impacted third molars received either 2 % chem* lidocaine *chem or 0 . 5 % chem* bupivacaine *chem before surgery and either chem* rofecoxib *chem 50 mg or placebo orally 90 min before surgery and for the following 48 h .

column1: Oral mucosal biopsies were taken before surgery and 48 h after surgery .
column2: Oral mucosal biopsies were taken before surgery and 48 h after surgery .

column1: After extraction , a microdialysis probe was placed at the surgical site for PGE2 and thromboxane B2 ( TXB2 ) measurements .
column2: After extraction , a microdialysis probe was placed at the surgical site for chem* PGE2 *chem and chem* thromboxane B2 *chem ( chem* TXB2 *chem ) measurements .

column1: RESULTS : The bupivacaine / rofecoxib group reported significantly less pain , as assessed by a visual analog scale , compared with the other three treatment groups over the first 4 h .
column2: RESULTS : The chem* bupivacaine *chem / chem* rofecoxib *chem group reported significantly less pain , as assessed by a visual analog scale , compared with the other three treatment groups over the first 4 h .

column1: However , the bupivacaine / placebo group reported significantly more pain at 24 h and PGE2 levels during the first 4 h were significantly higher than the other three treatment groups .
column2: However , the chem* bupivacaine *chem / placebo group reported significantly more pain at 24 h and chem* PGE2 *chem levels during the first 4 h were significantly higher than the other three treatment groups .

column1: Moreover , bupivacaine significantly increased COX - 2 gene expression at 48 h as compared with the lidocaine / placebo group .
column2: Moreover , chem* bupivacaine *chem significantly increased COX - 2 gene expression at 48 h as compared with the chem* lidocaine *chem / placebo group .

column1: Thromboxane levels were not significantly affected by any of the treatments , indicating that the effects seen were attributable to inhibition of COX - 2 , but not COX - 1 .
column2: chem* Thromboxane *chem levels were not significantly affected by any of the treatments , indicating that the effects seen were attributable to inhibition of COX - 2 , but not COX - 1 .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : These results suggest that bupivacaine stimulates COX - 2 gene expression after tissue injury , which is associated with higher PGE2 production and pain after the local anesthetic effect dissipates .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : These results suggest that chem* bupivacaine *chem stimulates COX - 2 gene expression after tissue injury , which is associated with higher chem* PGE2 *chem production and pain after the local anesthetic effect dissipates .

column1: p75NTR expression in rat urinary bladder sensory neurons and spinal cord with cyclophosphamide - induced cystitis .
column2: p75NTR expression in rat urinary bladder sensory neurons and spinal cord with chem* cyclophosphamide *chem - induced cystitis .

column1: A role for nerve growth factor ( NGF ) in contributing to increased voiding frequency and altered sensation from the urinary bladder has been suggested .
column2: A role for nerve growth factor ( NGF ) in contributing to increased voiding frequency and altered sensation from the urinary bladder has been suggested .

column1: Previous studies have examined the expression and regulation of tyrosine kinase receptors ( Trks ) in micturition reflexes with urinary bladder inflammation .
column2: Previous studies have examined the expression and regulation of chem* tyrosine *chem kinase receptors ( Trks ) in micturition reflexes with urinary bladder inflammation .

column1: The present studies examine the expression and regulation of another receptor known to bind NGF , p75 ( NTR ) , after various durations of bladder inflammation induced by cyclophosphamide ( CYP ) .
column2: The present studies examine the expression and regulation of another receptor known to bind NGF , p75 ( NTR ) , after various durations of bladder inflammation induced by chem* cyclophosphamide *chem ( chem* CYP *chem ) .

column1: CYP - induced cystitis increased ( P < or = 0 . 001 ) p75 ( NTR ) expression in the superficial lateral and medial dorsal horn in L1 - L2 and L6 - S1 spinal segments .
column2: chem* CYP *chem - induced cystitis increased ( P < or = 0 . 001 ) p75 ( NTR ) expression in the superficial lateral and medial dorsal horn in L1 - L2 and L6 - S1 spinal segments .

column1: The number of p75 ( NTR ) - immunoreactive ( - IR ) cells in the lumbosacral dorsal root ganglia ( DRG ) also increased ( P < or = 0 . 05 ) with CYP - induced cystitis ( acute , intermediate , and chronic ) .
column2: The number of p75 ( NTR ) - immunoreactive ( - IR ) cells in the lumbosacral dorsal root ganglia ( DRG ) also increased ( P < or = 0 . 05 ) with chem* CYP *chem - induced cystitis ( acute , intermediate , and chronic ) .

column1: Quantitative , real - time polymerase chain reaction also demonstrated significant increases ( P < or = 0 . 01 ) in p75 ( NTR ) mRNA in DRG with intermediate and chronic CYP - induced cystitis .
column2: Quantitative , real - time polymerase chain reaction also demonstrated significant increases ( P < or = 0 . 01 ) in p75 ( NTR ) mRNA in DRG with intermediate and chronic chem* CYP *chem - induced cystitis .

column1: Retrograde dye - tracing techniques with Fastblue were used to identify presumptive bladder afferent cells in the lumbosacral DRG .
column2: Retrograde dye - tracing techniques with Fastblue were used to identify presumptive bladder afferent cells in the lumbosacral DRG .

column1: In bladder afferent cells in DRG , p75 ( NTR ) - IR was also increased ( P < or = 0 . 01 ) with cystitis .
column2: In bladder afferent cells in DRG , p75 ( NTR ) - IR was also increased ( P < or = 0 . 01 ) with cystitis .

column1: In addition to increases in p75 ( NTR ) - IR in DRG cell bodies , increases ( P < or = 0 . 001 ) in pericellular ( encircling DRG cells ) p75 ( NTR ) - IR in DRG also increased .
column2: In addition to increases in p75 ( NTR ) - IR in DRG cell bodies , increases ( P < or = 0 . 001 ) in pericellular ( encircling DRG cells ) p75 ( NTR ) - IR in DRG also increased .

column1: Confocal analyses demonstrated that pericellular p75 ( NTR ) - IR was not colocalized with the glial marker , glial fibrillary acidic protein ( GFAP ) .
column2: Confocal analyses demonstrated that pericellular p75 ( NTR ) - IR was not colocalized with the glial marker , glial fibrillary acidic protein ( GFAP ) .

column1: These studies demonstrate that p75 ( NTR ) expression in micturition reflexes is present constitutively and modified by bladder inflammation .
column2: These studies demonstrate that p75 ( NTR ) expression in micturition reflexes is present constitutively and modified by bladder inflammation .

column1: The functional significance of p75 ( NTR ) expression in micturition reflexes remains to be determined .
column2: The functional significance of p75 ( NTR ) expression in micturition reflexes remains to be determined .

column1: Azathioprine - induced suicidal erythrocyte death .
column2: chem* Azathioprine *chem - induced suicidal erythrocyte death .

column1: BACKGROUND : Azathioprine is widely used as an immunosuppressive drug .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* Azathioprine *chem is widely used as an immunosuppressive drug .

column1: The side effects of azathioprine include anemia , which has been attributed to bone marrow suppression .
column2: The side effects of chem* azathioprine *chem include anemia , which has been attributed to bone marrow suppression .

column1: Alternatively , anemia could result from accelerated suicidal erythrocyte death or eryptosis , which is characterized by exposure of phosphatidylserine ( PS ) at the erythrocyte surface and by cell shrinkage .
column2: Alternatively , anemia could result from accelerated suicidal erythrocyte death or eryptosis , which is characterized by exposure of chem* phosphatidylserine *chem ( chem* PS *chem ) at the erythrocyte surface and by cell shrinkage .

column1: METHODS : The present experiments explored whether azathioprine influences eryptosis .
column2: METHODS : The present experiments explored whether chem* azathioprine *chem influences eryptosis .

column1: According to annexin V binding , erythrocytes from patients indeed showed a significant increase of PS exposure within 1 week of treatment with azathioprine .
column2: According to annexin V binding , erythrocytes from patients indeed showed a significant increase of chem* PS *chem exposure within 1 week of treatment with chem* azathioprine *chem .

column1: In a second series , cytosolic Ca2 + activity ( Fluo3 fluorescence ) , cell volume ( forward scatter ) , and PS - exposure ( annexin V binding ) were determined by FACS analysis in erythrocytes from healthy volunteers .
column2: In a second series , cytosolic chem* Ca2 *chem + activity ( chem* Fluo3 *chem fluorescence ) , cell volume ( forward scatter ) , and chem* PS *chem - exposure ( annexin V binding ) were determined by FACS analysis in erythrocytes from healthy volunteers .

column1: RESULTS : Exposure to azathioprine ( > or = 2 microg / mL ) for 48 hours increased cytosolic Ca2 + activity and annexin V binding and decreased forward scatter .
column2: RESULTS : Exposure to chem* azathioprine *chem ( > or = 2 microg / mL ) for 48 hours increased cytosolic chem* Ca2 *chem + activity and annexin V binding and decreased forward scatter .

column1: The effect of azathioprine on both annexin V binding and forward scatter was significantly blunted in the nominal absence of extracellular Ca2 + .
column2: The effect of chem* azathioprine *chem on both annexin V binding and forward scatter was significantly blunted in the nominal absence of extracellular chem* Ca2 *chem + .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Azathioprine triggers suicidal erythrocyte death , an effect presumably contributing to azathioprine - induced anemia .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : chem* Azathioprine *chem triggers suicidal erythrocyte death , an effect presumably contributing to chem* azathioprine *chem - induced anemia .

column1: Levetiracetam as an adjunct to phenobarbital treatment in cats with suspected idiopathic epilepsy .
column2: chem* Levetiracetam *chem as an adjunct to chem* phenobarbital *chem treatment in cats with suspected idiopathic epilepsy .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To assess pharmacokinetics , efficacy , and tolerability of oral levetiracetam administered as an adjunct to phenobarbital treatment in cats with poorly controlled suspected idiopathic epilepsy .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To assess pharmacokinetics , efficacy , and tolerability of oral chem* levetiracetam *chem administered as an adjunct to chem* phenobarbital *chem treatment in cats with poorly controlled suspected idiopathic epilepsy .

column1: DESIGN - Open - label , noncomparative clinical trial .
column2: DESIGN - Open - label , noncomparative clinical trial .

column1: ANIMALS : 12 cats suspected to have idiopathic epilepsy that was poorly controlled with phenobarbital or that had unacceptable adverse effects when treated with phenobarbital .
column2: ANIMALS : 12 cats suspected to have idiopathic epilepsy that was poorly controlled with chem* phenobarbital *chem or that had unacceptable adverse effects when treated with chem* phenobarbital *chem .

column1: PROCEDURES : Cats were treated with levetiracetam ( 20 mg / kg [ 9 . 1 mg / lb ] , PO , q 8 h ) .
column2: PROCEDURES : Cats were treated with chem* levetiracetam *chem ( 20 mg / kg [ 9 . 1 mg / lb ] , PO , q 8 h ) .

column1: After a minimum of 1 week of treatment , serum levetiracetam concentrations were measured before and 2 , 4 , and 6 hours after drug administration , and maximum and minimum serum concentrations and elimination half - life were calculated .
column2: After a minimum of 1 week of treatment , serum chem* levetiracetam *chem concentrations were measured before and 2 , 4 , and 6 hours after drug administration , and maximum and minimum serum concentrations and elimination half - life were calculated .

column1: Seizure frequencies before and after initiation of levetiracetam treatment were compared , and adverse effects were recorded .
column2: Seizure frequencies before and after initiation of chem* levetiracetam *chem treatment were compared , and adverse effects were recorded .

column1: RESULTS : Median maximum serum levetiracetam concentration was 25 . 5 microg / mL , median minimum serum levetiracetam concentration was 8 . 3 microg / mL , and median elimination half - life was 2 . 9 hours .
column2: RESULTS : Median maximum serum chem* levetiracetam *chem concentration was 25 . 5 microg / mL , median minimum serum chem* levetiracetam *chem concentration was 8 . 3 microg / mL , and median elimination half - life was 2 . 9 hours .

column1: Median seizure frequency prior to treatment with levetiracetam ( 2 . 1 seizures / mo ) was significantly higher than median seizure frequency after initiation of levetiracetam treatment ( 0 . 42 seizures / mo ) , and 7 of 10 cats were classified as having responded to levetiracetam treatment ( ie , reduction in seizure frequency of > or = 50 % ) .
column2: Median seizure frequency prior to treatment with chem* levetiracetam *chem ( 2 . 1 seizures / mo ) was significantly higher than median seizure frequency after initiation of chem* levetiracetam *chem treatment ( 0 . 42 seizures / mo ) , and 7 of 10 cats were classified as having responded to chem* levetiracetam *chem treatment ( ie , reduction in seizure frequency of > or = 50 % ) .

column1: Two cats had transient lethargy and inappetence .
column2: Two cats had transient lethargy and inappetence .

column1: CONCLUSIONS AND CLINICAL RELEVANCE : Results suggested that levetiracetam is well tolerated in cats and may be useful as an adjunct to phenobarbital treatment in cats with idiopathic epilepsy .
column2: CONCLUSIONS AND CLINICAL RELEVANCE : Results suggested that chem* levetiracetam *chem is well tolerated in cats and may be useful as an adjunct to chem* phenobarbital *chem treatment in cats with idiopathic epilepsy .

column1: Serotonin reuptake inhibitors , paranoia , and the ventral basal ganglia .
column2: chem* Serotonin *chem reuptake inhibitors , paranoia , and the ventral basal ganglia .

column1: Antidepressants have previously been associated with paranoid reactions in psychiatric patients .
column2: Antidepressants have previously been associated with paranoid reactions in psychiatric patients .

column1: Five cases of paranoid exacerbation with the serotonin reuptake inhibitors fluoxetine and amitriptyline are reported here .
column2: Five cases of paranoid exacerbation with the chem* serotonin *chem reuptake inhibitors chem* fluoxetine *chem and chem* amitriptyline *chem are reported here .

column1: Elements common to these cases included a history of paranoid symptomatology and the concomitant occurrence of depressive and psychotic symptoms .
column2: Elements common to these cases included a history of paranoid symptomatology and the concomitant occurrence of depressive and psychotic symptoms .

column1: Complicated depressive disorders ( including atypicality of course and symptomatology , chronicity , psychosis , bipolarity , and secondary onset in the course of a primary psychosis ) may present particular vulnerability to paranoid exacerbations associated with serotonin reuptake inhibitors .
column2: Complicated depressive disorders ( including atypicality of course and symptomatology , chronicity , psychosis , bipolarity , and secondary onset in the course of a primary psychosis ) may present particular vulnerability to paranoid exacerbations associated with chem* serotonin *chem reuptake inhibitors .

column1: Although the pharmacology and neurobiology of paranoia remain cryptic , several mechanisms , including 5HT3 receptor - mediated dopamine release , beta - noradrenergic receptor downregulation , or GABAB receptor upregulation acting in the vicinity of the ventral basal ganglia ( possibly in lateral orbitofrontal or anterior cingulate circuits ) , might apply to this phenomenon .
column2: Although the pharmacology and neurobiology of paranoia remain cryptic , several mechanisms , including 5HT3 receptor - mediated chem* dopamine *chem release , beta - noradrenergic receptor downregulation , or GABAB receptor upregulation acting in the vicinity of the ventral basal ganglia ( possibly in lateral orbitofrontal or anterior cingulate circuits ) , might apply to this phenomenon .

column1: These cases call attention to possible paranoid exacerbations with serotonin reuptake blockers in select patients and raise neurobiological considerations regarding paranoia .
column2: These cases call attention to possible paranoid exacerbations with chem* serotonin *chem reuptake blockers in select patients and raise neurobiological considerations regarding paranoia .

column1: Clinical comparison of cardiorespiratory effects during unilateral and conventional spinal anaesthesia .
column2: Clinical comparison of cardiorespiratory effects during unilateral and conventional spinal anaesthesia .

column1: BACKGROUND : Spinal anaesthesia is widely employed in clinical practice but has the main drawback of post - spinal block hypotension .
column2: BACKGROUND : Spinal anaesthesia is widely employed in clinical practice but has the main drawback of post - spinal block hypotension .

column1: Efforts must therefore continue to be made to obviate this setback OBJECTIVE : To evaluate the cardiovascular and respiratory changes during unilateral and conventional spinal anaesthesia .
column2: Efforts must therefore continue to be made to obviate this setback OBJECTIVE : To evaluate the cardiovascular and respiratory changes during unilateral and conventional spinal anaesthesia .

column1: METHODS : With ethical approval , we studied 74 American Society of Anesthesiologists ( ASA ) , physical status class 1 and 2 patients scheduled for elective unilateral lower limb surgery .
column2: METHODS : With ethical approval , we studied 74 American Society of Anesthesiologists ( ASA ) , physical status class 1 and 2 patients scheduled for elective unilateral lower limb surgery .

column1: Patients were randomly allocated into one of two groups : lateral and conventional spinal anaesthesia groups .
column2: Patients were randomly allocated into one of two groups : lateral and conventional spinal anaesthesia groups .

column1: In the lateral position with operative side down , patients recived 10 mg ( 2mls ) of 0 . 5 % hyperbaric bupivacaine through a 25 - gauge spinal needle .
column2: In the lateral position with operative side down , patients recived 10 mg ( 2mls ) of 0 . 5 % hyperbaric chem* bupivacaine *chem through a 25 - gauge spinal needle .

column1: Patients in the unilateral group were maintained in the lateral position for 15 minutes following spinal injection while those in the conventional group were turned supine immediately after injection .
column2: Patients in the unilateral group were maintained in the lateral position for 15 minutes following spinal injection while those in the conventional group were turned supine immediately after injection .

column1: Blood pressure , heart rate , respiratory rate and oxygen saturation were monitored over 1 hour .
column2: Blood pressure , heart rate , respiratory rate and chem* oxygen *chem saturation were monitored over 1 hour .

column1: RESULTS : Three patients ( 8 . 1 % ) in the unilateral group and 5 ( 13 . 5 % ) in the conventional group developed hypotension , P = 0 . 71 .
column2: RESULTS : Three patients ( 8 . 1 % ) in the unilateral group and 5 ( 13 . 5 % ) in the conventional group developed hypotension , P = 0 . 71 .

column1: Four ( 10 . 8 % ) patients in the conventional group and 1 ( 2 . 7 % ) in the unilateral group , P = 0 . 17 required epinephrine infusion to treat hypotension .
column2: Four ( 10 . 8 % ) patients in the conventional group and 1 ( 2 . 7 % ) in the unilateral group , P = 0 . 17 required chem* epinephrine *chem infusion to treat hypotension .

column1: Patients in the conventional group had statistically significant greater fall in the systolic blood pressures at 15 , 30 and 45 minutes when compared to the baseline ( P = 0 . 003 , 0 . 001 and 0 . 004 ) .
column2: Patients in the conventional group had statistically significant greater fall in the systolic blood pressures at 15 , 30 and 45 minutes when compared to the baseline ( P = 0 . 003 , 0 . 001 and 0 . 004 ) .

column1: The mean respiratory rate and oxygen saturations in the two groups were similar .
column2: The mean respiratory rate and chem* oxygen *chem saturations in the two groups were similar .

column1: CONCLUSION : Compared to conventional spinal anaesthesia , unilateral spinal anaesthesia was associated with fewer cardiovascular perturbations .
column2: CONCLUSION : Compared to conventional spinal anaesthesia , unilateral spinal anaesthesia was associated with fewer cardiovascular perturbations .

column1: Also , the type of spinal block instituted affected neither the respiratory rate nor the arterial oxygen saturation .
column2: Also , the type of spinal block instituted affected neither the respiratory rate nor the arterial chem* oxygen *chem saturation .

column1: Spectrum of adverse events after generic HAART in southern Indian HIV - infected patients .
column2: Spectrum of adverse events after generic HAART in southern Indian HIV - infected patients .

column1: To determine the incidence of clinically significant adverse events after long - term , fixed - dose , generic highly active antiretroviral therapy ( HAART ) use among HIV - infected individuals in South India , we examined the experiences of 3154 HIV - infected individuals who received a minimum of 3 months of generic HAART between February 1996 and December 2006 at a tertiary HIV care referral center in South India .
column2: To determine the incidence of clinically significant adverse events after long - term , fixed - dose , generic highly active antiretroviral therapy ( HAART ) use among HIV - infected individuals in South India , we examined the experiences of 3154 HIV - infected individuals who received a minimum of 3 months of generic HAART between February 1996 and December 2006 at a tertiary HIV care referral center in South India .

column1: The most common regimens were 3TC + d4T + nevirapine ( NVP ) ( 54 . 8 % ) , zidovudine ( AZT ) + 3TC + NVP ( 14 . 5 % ) , 3TC + d4T + efavirenz ( EFV ) ( 20 . 1 % ) , and AZT + 3TC + EFV ( 5 . 4 % ) .
column2: The most common regimens were chem* 3TC *chem + chem* d4T *chem + chem* nevirapine *chem ( chem* NVP *chem ) ( 54 . 8 % ) , chem* zidovudine *chem ( chem* AZT *chem ) + chem* 3TC *chem + chem* NVP *chem ( 14 . 5 % ) , chem* 3TC *chem + chem* d4T *chem + chem* efavirenz *chem ( chem* EFV *chem ) ( 20 . 1 % ) , and chem* AZT *chem + chem* 3TC *chem + chem* EFV *chem ( 5 . 4 % ) .

column1: The most common adverse events and median CD4 at time of event were rash ( 15 . 2 % ; CD4 , 285 cells / microL ) and peripheral neuropathy ( 9 . 0 % and 348 cells / microL ) .
column2: The most common adverse events and median CD4 at time of event were rash ( 15 . 2 % ; CD4 , 285 cells / microL ) and peripheral neuropathy ( 9 . 0 % and 348 cells / microL ) .

column1: Clinically significant anemia ( hemoglobin < 7 g / dL ) was observed in 5 . 4 % of patients ( CD4 , 165 cells / microL ) and hepatitis ( clinical jaundice with alanine aminotransferase > 5 times upper limits of normal ) in 3 . 5 % of patients ( CD4 , 260 cells / microL ) .
column2: Clinically significant anemia ( hemoglobin < 7 g / dL ) was observed in 5 . 4 % of patients ( CD4 , 165 cells / microL ) and hepatitis ( clinical jaundice with chem* alanine *chem aminotransferase > 5 times upper limits of normal ) in 3 . 5 % of patients ( CD4 , 260 cells / microL ) .

column1: Women were significantly more likely to experience lactic acidosis , while men were significantly more likely to experience immune reconstitution syndrome ( p < 0 . 05 ) .
column2: Women were significantly more likely to experience lactic acidosis , while men were significantly more likely to experience immune reconstitution syndrome ( p < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: Among the patients with 1 year of follow - up , NVP therapy was significantly associated with developing rash and d4T therapy with developing peripheral neuropathy ( p < 0 . 05 ) .
column2: Among the patients with 1 year of follow - up , chem* NVP *chem therapy was significantly associated with developing rash and chem* d4T *chem therapy with developing peripheral neuropathy ( p < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: Anemia and hepatitis often occur within 12 weeks of initiating generic HAART .
column2: Anemia and hepatitis often occur within 12 weeks of initiating generic HAART .

column1: Frequent and early monitoring for these toxicities is warranted in developing countries where generic HAART is increasingly available .
column2: Frequent and early monitoring for these toxicities is warranted in developing countries where generic HAART is increasingly available .

column1: Thalidomide and sensory neurotoxicity : a neurophysiological study .

column1: BACKGROUND : Recent studies confirmed a high incidence of sensory axonal neuropathy in patients treated with different doses of thalidomide .
column2: BACKGROUND : Recent studies confirmed a high incidence of sensory axonal neuropathy in patients treated with different doses of chem* thalidomide *chem .

column1: The study ' s aims were to measure variations in sural nerve sensory action potential ( SAP ) amplitude in patients with refractory cutaneous lupus erythematosus ( CLE ) treated with thalidomide and use these findings to identify the neurotoxic potential of thalidomide and the recovery capacity of sensory fibres after discontinuation of treatment .
column2: The study ' s aims were to measure variations in sural nerve sensory action potential ( SAP ) amplitude in patients with refractory cutaneous lupus erythematosus ( CLE ) treated with chem* thalidomide *chem and use these findings to identify the neurotoxic potential of chem* thalidomide *chem and the recovery capacity of sensory fibres after discontinuation of treatment .

column1: PATIENTS AND METHODS : Clinical and electrophysiological data in 12 female patients with CLE during treatment with thalidomide and up to 47 months after discontinuation of treatment were analysed .
column2: PATIENTS AND METHODS : Clinical and electrophysiological data in 12 female patients with CLE during treatment with chem* thalidomide *chem and up to 47 months after discontinuation of treatment were analysed .

column1: Sural nerve SAP amplitude reduction > or = 40 % was the criteria for discontinuing therapy .
column2: Sural nerve SAP amplitude reduction > or = 40 % was the criteria for discontinuing therapy .

column1: RESULTS : During treatment , 11 patients showed a reduction in sural nerve SAP amplitude compared to baseline values ( 9 with a reduction > or = 50 % and 2 < 50 % ) .
column2: RESULTS : During treatment , 11 patients showed a reduction in sural nerve SAP amplitude compared to baseline values ( 9 with a reduction > or = 50 % and 2 < 50 % ) .

column1: One patient showed no changes in SAP amplitude .
column2: One patient showed no changes in SAP amplitude .

column1: Five patients complained of paresthesias and leg cramps .
column2: Five patients complained of paresthesias and leg cramps .

column1: After thalidomide treatment , sural SAP amplitude recovered in 3 patients .
column2: After chem* thalidomide *chem treatment , sural SAP amplitude recovered in 3 patients .

column1: At detection of reduction in sural nerve SAP amplitude , the median thalidomide cumulative dose was 21 . 4 g .
column2: At detection of reduction in sural nerve SAP amplitude , the median chem* thalidomide *chem cumulative dose was 21 . 4 g .

column1: The threshold neurotoxic dosage is lower than previously reported .
column2: The threshold neurotoxic dosage is lower than previously reported .

column1: Posttransplant anemia : the role of sirolimus .
column2: Posttransplant anemia : the role of chem* sirolimus *chem .

column1: Posttransplant anemia is a common problem that may hinder patients ' quality of life .
column2: Posttransplant anemia is a common problem that may hinder patients ' quality of life .

column1: It occurs in 12 to 76 % of patients , and is most common in the immediate posttransplant period .
column2: It occurs in 12 to 76 % of patients , and is most common in the immediate posttransplant period .

column1: A variety of factors have been identified that increase the risk of posttransplant anemia , of which the level of renal function is most important .
column2: A variety of factors have been identified that increase the risk of posttransplant anemia , of which the level of renal function is most important .

column1: Sirolimus , a mammalian target of rapamycin inhibitor , has been implicated as playing a special role in posttransplant anemia .

column1: This review considers anemia associated with sirolimus , including its presentation , mechanisms , and management .
