column1: Coronary computerized tomography angiography for rapid discharge of low - risk patients with cocaine - associated chest pain .
column2: Coronary computerized tomography angiography for rapid discharge of low - risk patients with chem* cocaine *chem - associated chest pain .

column1: BACKGROUND : Most patients presenting to emergency departments ( EDs ) with cocaine - associated chest pain are admitted for at least 12 hours and receive a " rule out acute coronary syndrome " protocol , often with noninvasive testing prior to discharge .
column2: BACKGROUND : Most patients presenting to emergency departments ( EDs ) with chem* cocaine *chem - associated chest pain are admitted for at least 12 hours and receive a " rule out acute coronary syndrome " protocol , often with noninvasive testing prior to discharge .

column1: In patients without cocaine use , coronary computerized tomography angiography ( CTA ) has been shown to be useful for identifying a group of patients at low risk for cardiac events who can be safely discharged .
column2: In patients without chem* cocaine *chem use , coronary computerized tomography angiography ( CTA ) has been shown to be useful for identifying a group of patients at low risk for cardiac events who can be safely discharged .

column1: It is unclear whether a coronary CTA strategy would be efficacious in cocaine - associated chest pain , as coronary vasospasm may account for some of the ischemia .
column2: It is unclear whether a coronary CTA strategy would be efficacious in chem* cocaine *chem - associated chest pain , as coronary vasospasm may account for some of the ischemia .

column1: We studied whether a negative coronary CTA in patients with cocaine - associated chest pain could identify a subset safe for discharge .
column2: We studied whether a negative coronary CTA in patients with chem* cocaine *chem - associated chest pain could identify a subset safe for discharge .

column1: METHODS : We prospectively evaluated the safety of coronary CTA for low - risk patients who presented to the ED with cocaineassociated chest pain ( self - reported or positive urine test ) .
column2: METHODS : We prospectively evaluated the safety of coronary CTA for low - risk patients who presented to the ED with cocaineassociated chest pain ( self - reported or positive urine test ) .

column1: Consecutive patients received either immediate coronary CTA in the ED ( without serial markers ) or underwent coronary CTA after a brief observation period with serial cardiac marker measurements .
column2: Consecutive patients received either immediate coronary CTA in the ED ( without serial markers ) or underwent coronary CTA after a brief observation period with serial cardiac marker measurements .

column1: Patients with negative coronary CTA ( maximal stenosis less than 50 % ) were discharged .
column2: Patients with negative coronary CTA ( maximal stenosis less than 50 % ) were discharged .

column1: The main outcome was 30 - day cardiovascular death or myocardial infarction .
column2: The main outcome was 30 - day cardiovascular death or myocardial infarction .

column1: RESULTS : A total of 59 patients with cocaine - associated chest pain were evaluated .
column2: RESULTS : A total of 59 patients with chem* cocaine *chem - associated chest pain were evaluated .

column1: Patients had a mean age of 45 . 6 + / - 6 . 6 yrs and were 86 % black , 66 % male .
column2: Patients had a mean age of 45 . 6 + / - 6 . 6 yrs and were 86 % black , 66 % male .

column1: Seventy - nine percent had a normal or nonspecific ECG and 85 % had a TIMI score < 2 .
column2: Seventy - nine percent had a normal or nonspecific ECG and 85 % had a TIMI score < 2 .

column1: Twenty patients received coronary CTA immediately in the ED , 18 of whom were discharged following CTA ( 90 % ) .
column2: Twenty patients received coronary CTA immediately in the ED , 18 of whom were discharged following CTA ( 90 % ) .

column1: Thirty - nine received coronary CTA after a brief observation period , with 37 discharged home following CTA ( 95 % ) .
column2: Thirty - nine received coronary CTA after a brief observation period , with 37 discharged home following CTA ( 95 % ) .

column1: Six patients had coronary stenosis > or = 50 % .
column2: Six patients had coronary stenosis > or = 50 % .

column1: During the 30 - day follow - up period , no patients died of a cardiovascular event ( 0 % ; 95 % CI , 0 - 6 . 1 % ) and no patient sustained a nonfatal myocardial infarction ( 0 % ; 95 % CI , 0 - 6 . 1 % ) .
column2: During the 30 - day follow - up period , no patients died of a cardiovascular event ( 0 % ; 95 % CI , 0 - 6 . 1 % ) and no patient sustained a nonfatal myocardial infarction ( 0 % ; 95 % CI , 0 - 6 . 1 % ) .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Although cocaine - associated myocardial ischemia can result from coronary vasoconstriction , patients with cocaine associated chest pain , a non - ischemic ECG , and a TIMI risk score < 2 may be safely discharged from the ED after a negative coronary CTA with a low risk of 30 - day adverse events .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Although chem* cocaine *chem - associated myocardial ischemia can result from coronary vasoconstriction , patients with chem* cocaine *chem associated chest pain , a non - ischemic ECG , and a TIMI risk score < 2 may be safely discharged from the ED after a negative coronary CTA with a low risk of 30 - day adverse events .

column1: Bilateral haemorrhagic infarction of the globus pallidus after cocaine and alcohol intoxication .

column1: Cocaine is a risk factor for both ischemic and haemorrhagic stroke .

column2: We present the case of a 31 - year - old man with bilateral ischemia of the globus pallidus after excessive chem* alcohol *chem and intranasal chem* cocaine *chem use .

column2: Bilateral basal ganglia infarcts after the use of chem* cocaine *chem , without concurrent chem* heroin *chem use , have never been reported .

column1: Late fulminant posterior reversible encephalopathy syndrome after liver transplant .
column2: Late fulminant posterior reversible encephalopathy syndrome after liver transplant .

column1: OBJECTIVES : Posterior leukoencephalopathy due to calcineurin - inhibitor - related neurotoxicity is a rare but severe complication that results from treatment with immunosuppressive agents ( primarily those administered after a liver or kidney transplant ) .
column2: OBJECTIVES : Posterior leukoencephalopathy due to calcineurin - inhibitor - related neurotoxicity is a rare but severe complication that results from treatment with immunosuppressive agents ( primarily those administered after a liver or kidney transplant ) .

column1: The pathophysiologic mechanisms of that disorder remain unknown .
column2: The pathophysiologic mechanisms of that disorder remain unknown .

column1: CASE : We report the case of a 46 - year - old woman who received a liver transplant in our center as treatment for alcoholic cirrhosis and in whom either a fulminant course of posterior leukoencephalopathy or posterior reversible encephalopathy syndrome developed 110 days after transplant .
column2: CASE : We report the case of a 46 - year - old woman who received a liver transplant in our center as treatment for alcoholic cirrhosis and in whom either a fulminant course of posterior leukoencephalopathy or posterior reversible encephalopathy syndrome developed 110 days after transplant .

column1: After an initially uneventful course after the transplant , the patient rapidly fell into deep coma .
column2: After an initially uneventful course after the transplant , the patient rapidly fell into deep coma .

column1: RESULTS : Cerebral MRI scan showed typical signs of enhancement in the pontine and posterior regions .
column2: RESULTS : Cerebral MRI scan showed typical signs of enhancement in the pontine and posterior regions .

column1: Switching the immunosuppressive regimen from tacrolimus to cyclosporine did not improve the clinical situation .
column2: Switching the immunosuppressive regimen from chem* tacrolimus *chem to chem* cyclosporine *chem did not improve the clinical situation .

column1: The termination of treatment with any calcineurin inhibitor resulted in a complete resolution of that complication .
column2: The termination of treatment with any calcineurin inhibitor resulted in a complete resolution of that complication .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Posterior reversible encephalopathy syndrome after liver transplant is rare .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Posterior reversible encephalopathy syndrome after liver transplant is rare .

column1: We recommend a complete cessation of any calcineurin inhibitor rather than a dose reduction .
column2: We recommend a complete cessation of any calcineurin inhibitor rather than a dose reduction .

column1: Prolonged hypothermia as a bridge to recovery for cerebral edema and intracranial hypertension associated with fulminant hepatic failure .
column2: Prolonged hypothermia as a bridge to recovery for cerebral edema and intracranial hypertension associated with fulminant hepatic failure .

column1: BACKGROUND : To review evidence - based treatment options in patients with cerebral edema complicating fulminant hepatic failure ( FHF ) and discuss the potential applications of hypothermia .
column2: BACKGROUND : To review evidence - based treatment options in patients with cerebral edema complicating fulminant hepatic failure ( FHF ) and discuss the potential applications of hypothermia .

column1: METHOD : Case - based observations from a medical intensive care unit ( MICU ) in a tertiary care facility in a 27 - year - old female with FHF from acetaminophen and resultant cerebral edema .
column2: METHOD : Case - based observations from a medical intensive care unit ( MICU ) in a tertiary care facility in a 27 - year - old female with FHF from chem* acetaminophen *chem and resultant cerebral edema .

column1: RESULTS : Our patient was admitted to the MICU after being found unresponsive with presumed toxicity from acetaminophen which was ingested over a 2 - day period .
column2: RESULTS : Our patient was admitted to the MICU after being found unresponsive with presumed toxicity from chem* acetaminophen *chem which was ingested over a 2 - day period .

column1: The patient had depressed of mental status lasting at least 24 h prior to admission .
column2: The patient had depressed of mental status lasting at least 24 h prior to admission .

column1: Initial evaluation confirmed FHF from acetaminophen and cerebral edema .
column2: Initial evaluation confirmed FHF from chem* acetaminophen *chem and cerebral edema .

column1: The patient was treated with hyperosmolar therapy , hyperventilation , sedation , and chemical paralysis .
column2: The patient was treated with hyperosmolar therapy , hyperventilation , sedation , and chemical paralysis .

column1: Her intracranial pressure remained elevated despite maximal medical therapy .
column2: Her intracranial pressure remained elevated despite maximal medical therapy .

column1: We then initiated therapeutic hypothermia which was continued for 5 days .
column2: We then initiated therapeutic hypothermia which was continued for 5 days .

column1: At re - warming , patient had resolution of her cerebral edema and intracranial hypertension .
column2: At re - warming , patient had resolution of her cerebral edema and intracranial hypertension .

column1: At discharge , she had complete recovery of neurological and hepatic functions .
column2: At discharge , she had complete recovery of neurological and hepatic functions .

column1: CONCLUSION : In patients with FHF and cerebral edema from acetaminophen overdose , prolonged therapeutic hypothermia could potentially be used as a life saving therapy and a bridge to hepatic and neurological recovery .
column2: CONCLUSION : In patients with FHF and cerebral edema from chem* acetaminophen *chem overdose , prolonged therapeutic hypothermia could potentially be used as a life saving therapy and a bridge to hepatic and neurological recovery .

column1: A clinical trial of hypothermia in patients with this condition is warranted .
column2: A clinical trial of hypothermia in patients with this condition is warranted .

column1: Binasal visual field defects are not specific to vigabatrin .
column2: Binasal visual field defects are not specific to chem* vigabatrin *chem .

column1: This study investigated the visual defects associated with the antiepileptic drug vigabatrin ( VGB ) .
column2: This study investigated the visual defects associated with the antiepileptic drug chem* vigabatrin *chem ( chem* VGB *chem ) .

column2: Two hundred four people with epilepsy were grouped on the basis of antiepileptic drug therapy ( current , previous , or no exposure to chem* VGB *chem ) .

column1: Groups were matched with respect to age , gender , and seizure frequency .
column2: Groups were matched with respect to age , gender , and seizure frequency .

column2: All patients underwent objective assessment of electrophysiological function ( wide - field multifocal electroretinography ) and conventional visual field testing ( static perimetry ) .

column1: Bilateral visual field constriction was observed in 59 % of patients currently taking VGB , 43 % of patients who previously took VGB , and 24 % of patients with no exposure to VGB .
column2: Bilateral visual field constriction was observed in 59 % of patients currently taking chem* VGB *chem , 43 % of patients who previously took chem* VGB *chem , and 24 % of patients with no exposure to chem* VGB *chem .

column2: Assessment of retinal function revealed abnormal responses in 48 % of current chem* VGB *chem users and 22 % of prior chem* VGB *chem users , but in none of the patients without previous exposure to chem* VGB *chem .

column1: Bilateral visual field abnormalities are common in the treated epilepsy population , irrespective of drug history .
column2: Bilateral visual field abnormalities are common in the treated epilepsy population , irrespective of drug history .

column1: Assessment by conventional static perimetry may neither be sufficiently sensitive nor specific to reliably identify retinal toxicity associated with VGB .
column2: Assessment by conventional static perimetry may neither be sufficiently sensitive nor specific to reliably identify retinal toxicity associated with chem* VGB *chem .

column1: Smoking of crack cocaine as a risk factor for HIV infection among people who use injection drugs .
column2: Smoking of chem* crack cocaine *chem as a risk factor for HIV infection among people who use injection drugs .

column1: BACKGROUND : Little is known about the possible role that smoking crack cocaine has on the incidence of HIV infection .
column2: BACKGROUND : Little is known about the possible role that smoking chem* crack cocaine *chem has on the incidence of HIV infection .

column1: Given the increasing use of crack cocaine , we sought to examine whether use of this illicit drug has become a risk factor for HIV infection .
column2: Given the increasing use of chem* crack cocaine *chem , we sought to examine whether use of this illicit drug has become a risk factor for HIV infection .

column1: METHODS : We included data from people participating in the Vancouver Injection Drug Users Study who reported injecting illicit drugs at least once in the month before enrolment , lived in the greater Vancouver area , were HIV - negative at enrolment and completed at least 1 follow - up study visit .
column2: METHODS : We included data from people participating in the Vancouver Injection Drug Users Study who reported injecting illicit drugs at least once in the month before enrolment , lived in the greater Vancouver area , were HIV - negative at enrolment and completed at least 1 follow - up study visit .

column1: To determine whether the risk of HIV seroconversion among daily smokers of crack cocaine changed over time , we used Cox proportional hazards regression and divided the study into 3 periods : May 1 , 1996 - Nov .
column2: To determine whether the risk of HIV seroconversion among daily smokers of chem* crack cocaine *chem changed over time , we used Cox proportional hazards regression and divided the study into 3 periods : May 1 , 1996 - Nov .

column1: 30 , 1999 ( period 1 ) , Dec .
column2: 30 , 1999 ( period 1 ) , Dec .

column1: 30 , 2002 ( period 2 ) , and Dec .
column2: 30 , 2002 ( period 2 ) , and Dec .

column1: RESULTS : Overall , 1048 eligible injection drug users were included in our study .
column2: RESULTS : Overall , 1048 eligible injection drug users were included in our study .

column1: Of these , 137 acquired HIV infection during follow - up .
column2: Of these , 137 acquired HIV infection during follow - up .

column1: The mean proportion of participants who reported daily smoking of crack cocaine increased from 11 . 6 % in period 1 to 39 . 7 % in period 3 .
column2: The mean proportion of participants who reported daily smoking of chem* crack cocaine *chem increased from 11 . 6 % in period 1 to 39 . 7 % in period 3 .

column1: After adjusting for potential confounders , we found that the risk of HIV seroconversion among participants who were daily smokers of crack cocaine increased over time ( period 1 : hazard ratio [ HR ] 1 . 03 , 95 % confidence interval [ CI ] 0 . 57 - 1 . 85 ; period 2 : HR 1 . 68 , 95 % CI 1 . 01 - 2 . 80 ; and period 3 : HR 2 . 74 , 95 % CI 1 . 06 - 7 . 11 ) .
column2: After adjusting for potential confounders , we found that the risk of HIV seroconversion among participants who were daily smokers of chem* crack cocaine *chem increased over time ( period 1 : hazard ratio [ HR ] 1 . 03 , 95 % confidence interval [ CI ] 0 . 57 - 1 . 85 ; period 2 : HR 1 . 68 , 95 % CI 1 . 01 - 2 . 80 ; and period 3 : HR 2 . 74 , 95 % CI 1 . 06 - 7 . 11 ) .

column1: INTERPRETATION : Smoking of crack cocaine was found to be an independent risk factor for HIV seroconversion among people who were injection drug users .
column2: INTERPRETATION : Smoking of chem* crack cocaine *chem was found to be an independent risk factor for HIV seroconversion among people who were injection drug users .

column1: This finding points to the urgent need for evidence - based public health initiatives targeted at people who smoke crack cocaine .
column2: This finding points to the urgent need for evidence - based public health initiatives targeted at people who smoke chem* crack cocaine *chem .

column1: Fluoxetine improves the memory deficits caused by the chemotherapy agent 5 - fluorouracil .
column2: chem* Fluoxetine *chem improves the memory deficits caused by the chemotherapy agent chem* 5 - fluorouracil *chem .

column1: Cancer patients who have been treated with systemic adjuvant chemotherapy have described experiencing deteriorations in cognition .
column2: Cancer patients who have been treated with systemic adjuvant chemotherapy have described experiencing deteriorations in cognition .

column1: A widely used chemotherapeutic agent , 5 - fluorouracil ( 5 - FU ) , readily crosses the blood - brain barrier and so could have a direct effect on brain function .
column2: A widely used chemotherapeutic agent , chem* 5 - fluorouracil *chem ( chem* 5 - FU *chem ) , readily crosses the blood - brain barrier and so could have a direct effect on brain function .

column1: In particular this anti mitotic drug could reduce cell proliferation in the neurogenic regions of the adult brain .
column2: In particular this anti mitotic drug could reduce cell proliferation in the neurogenic regions of the adult brain .

column1: In contrast reports indicate that hippocampal dependent neurogenesis and cognition are enhanced by the SSRI antidepressant Fluoxetine .
column2: In contrast reports indicate that hippocampal dependent neurogenesis and cognition are enhanced by the chem* SSRI *chem antidepressant chem* Fluoxetine *chem .

column1: In this investigation the behavioural effects of chronic ( two week ) treatment with 5 - FU and ( three weeks ) with Fluoxetine either separately or in combination with 5 - FU were tested on adult Lister hooded rats .
column2: In this investigation the behavioural effects of chronic ( two week ) treatment with chem* 5 - FU *chem and ( three weeks ) with chem* Fluoxetine *chem either separately or in combination with chem* 5 - FU *chem were tested on adult Lister hooded rats .

column1: Behavioural effects were tested using a context dependent conditioned emotional response test ( CER ) which showed that animals treated with 5 - FU had a significant reduction in freezing time compared to controls .
column2: Behavioural effects were tested using a context dependent conditioned emotional response test ( CER ) which showed that animals treated with chem* 5 - FU *chem had a significant reduction in freezing time compared to controls .

column1: A separate group of animals was tested using a hippocampal dependent spatial working memory test , the object location recognition test ( OLR ) .
column2: A separate group of animals was tested using a hippocampal dependent spatial working memory test , the object location recognition test ( OLR ) .

column1: Animals treated only with 5 - FU showed significant deficits in their ability to carry out the OLR task but co administration of Fluoxetine improved their performance .
column2: Animals treated only with chem* 5 - FU *chem showed significant deficits in their ability to carry out the OLR task but co administration of chem* Fluoxetine *chem improved their performance .

column1: 5 - FU chemotherapy caused a significant reduction in the number of proliferating cells in the sub granular zone of the dentate gyrus compared to controls .
column2: chem* 5 - FU *chem chemotherapy caused a significant reduction in the number of proliferating cells in the sub granular zone of the dentate gyrus compared to controls .

column1: This reduction was eliminated when Fluoxetine was co administered with 5 - FU .
column2: This reduction was eliminated when chem* Fluoxetine *chem was co administered with chem* 5 - FU *chem .

column1: Fluoxetine on its own had no effect on proliferating cell number or behaviour .
column2: chem* Fluoxetine *chem on its own had no effect on proliferating cell number or behaviour .

column1: These findings suggest that 5 - FU can negatively affect both cell proliferation and hippocampal dependent working memory and that these deficits can be reversed by the simultaneous administration of the antidepressant Fluoxetine .
column2: These findings suggest that chem* 5 - FU *chem can negatively affect both cell proliferation and hippocampal dependent working memory and that these deficits can be reversed by the simultaneous administration of the antidepressant chem* Fluoxetine *chem .

column1: Liver - specific ablation of integrin - linked kinase in mice results in enhanced and prolonged cell proliferation and hepatomegaly after phenobarbital administration .
column2: Liver - specific ablation of integrin - linked kinase in mice results in enhanced and prolonged cell proliferation and hepatomegaly after chem* phenobarbital *chem administration .

column1: We have recently demonstrated that disruption of extracellular matrix ( ECM ) / integrin signaling via elimination of integrin - linked kinase ( ILK ) in hepatocytes interferes with signals leading to termination of liver regeneration .
column2: We have recently demonstrated that disruption of extracellular matrix ( ECM ) / integrin signaling via elimination of integrin - linked kinase ( ILK ) in hepatocytes interferes with signals leading to termination of liver regeneration .

column1: This study investigates the role of ILK in liver enlargement induced by phenobarbital ( PB ) .
column2: This study investigates the role of ILK in liver enlargement induced by chem* phenobarbital *chem ( chem* PB *chem ) .

column2: Wild - type ( WT ) and ILK : liver - / - mice were given chem* PB *chem ( 0 . 1 % in drinking water ) for 10 days .

column1: Livers were harvested on 2 , 5 , and 10 days during PB administration .
column2: Livers were harvested on 2 , 5 , and 10 days during chem* PB *chem administration .

column1: In the hepatocyte - specific ILK / liver - / - mice , the liver : body weight ratio was more than double as compared to 0 h at day 2 ( 2 . 5 times ) , while at days 5 and 10 , it was enlarged three times .
column2: In the hepatocyte - specific ILK / liver - / - mice , the liver : body weight ratio was more than double as compared to 0 h at day 2 ( 2 . 5 times ) , while at days 5 and 10 , it was enlarged three times .

column1: In the WT mice , the increase was as expected from previous literature ( 1 . 8 times ) and seems to have leveled off after day 2 .
column2: In the WT mice , the increase was as expected from previous literature ( 1 . 8 times ) and seems to have leveled off after day 2 .

column2: There were slightly increased proliferating cell nuclear antigen - positive cells in the ILK / liver - / - animals at day 2 as compared to WT after chem* PB *chem administration .

column1: In the WT animals , the proliferative response had come back to normal by days 5 and 10 .
column2: In the WT animals , the proliferative response had come back to normal by days 5 and 10 .

column1: Hepatocytes of the ILK / liver - / - mice continued to proliferate up until day 10 .
column2: Hepatocytes of the ILK / liver - / - mice continued to proliferate up until day 10 .

column1: ILK / liver - / - mice also showed increased expression of key genes involved in hepatocyte proliferation at different time points during PB administration .
column2: ILK / liver - / - mice also showed increased expression of key genes involved in hepatocyte proliferation at different time points during chem* PB *chem administration .

column1: In summary , ECM proteins communicate with the signaling machinery of dividing cells via ILK to regulate hepatocyte proliferation and termination of the proliferative response .
column2: In summary , ECM proteins communicate with the signaling machinery of dividing cells via ILK to regulate hepatocyte proliferation and termination of the proliferative response .

column2: Lack of ILK in the hepatocytes imparts prolonged proliferative response not only to stimuli related to liver regeneration but also to xenobiotic chemical mitogens , such as chem* PB *chem .

column1: Neuropsychiatric behaviors in the MPTP marmoset model of Parkinson ' s disease .

column1: OBJECTIVES : Neuropsychiatric symptoms are increasingly recognised as a significant problem in patients with Parkinson ' s disease ( PD ) .
column2: OBJECTIVES : Neuropsychiatric symptoms are increasingly recognised as a significant problem in patients with Parkinson ' s disease ( PD ) .

column1: These symptoms may be due to ' sensitisation ' following repeated levodopa treatment or a direct effect of dopamine on the disease state .
column2: These symptoms may be due to ' sensitisation ' following repeated chem* levodopa *chem treatment or a direct effect of chem* dopamine *chem on the disease state .

column2: The chem* levodopa *chem - treated chem* MPTP *chem - lesioned marmoset was used as a model of neuropsychiatric symptoms in PD patients .

column1: Here we compare the time course of levodopa - induced motor fluctuations and neuropsychiatric - like behaviors to determine the relationship between duration of treatment and onset of symptoms .

column1: b . i . d , was administered for 30 days .

column1: Animals were evaluated for parkinsonian disability , dyskinesia and on - time ( motor fluctuations ) and neuropsychiatric - like behaviors on Day 0 ( prior to levodopa ) and on Days 1 , 7 , 13 , 27 and 30 of treatment using post hoc DVD analysis by a trained rater , blind to the treatment day .
column2: Animals were evaluated for parkinsonian disability , dyskinesia and on - time ( motor fluctuations ) and neuropsychiatric - like behaviors on Day 0 ( prior to chem* levodopa *chem ) and on Days 1 , 7 , 13 , 27 and 30 of treatment using post hoc DVD analysis by a trained rater , blind to the treatment day .

column1: RESULTS : The neuropsychiatric - like behavior rating scale demonstrated high interrater reliability between three trained raters of differing professional backgrounds .
column2: RESULTS : The neuropsychiatric - like behavior rating scale demonstrated high interrater reliability between three trained raters of differing professional backgrounds .

column1: As anticipated , animals exhibited a progressive increase in levodopa - induced motor fluctuations , dyskinesia and wearing - off , that correlated with the duration of levodopa therapy .

column2: In contrast , chem* levodopa *chem - induced neuropsychiatric - like behaviors were present on Day 1 of chem* levodopa *chem treatment and their severity did not correlate with duration of treatment .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : The data suggest that neuropsychiatric disorders in PD are more likely an interaction between levodopa and the disease state than a consequence of sensitisation to repeated dopaminergic therapy .

column1: Contrast medium nephrotoxicity after renal artery and coronary angioplasty .

column1: BACKGROUND : Renal dysfunction induced by iodinated contrast medium ( CM ) administration can minimize the benefit of the interventional procedure in patients undergoing renal angioplasty ( PTRA ) .
column2: BACKGROUND : Renal dysfunction induced by iodinated chem* contrast medium *chem ( chem* CM *chem ) administration can minimize the benefit of the interventional procedure in patients undergoing renal angioplasty ( PTRA ) .

column1: PURPOSE : To compare the susceptibility to nephrotoxic effect of CM in patients undergoing PTRA with that of patients submitted to percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) .
column2: PURPOSE : To compare the susceptibility to nephrotoxic effect of chem* CM *chem in patients undergoing PTRA with that of patients submitted to percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) .

column1: MATERIAL AND METHODS : A total of 33 patients successfully treated with PTRA ( PTRA group , mean age 70 + / - 12 years , 23 female , basal creatinine 1 . 46 + / - 0 . 79 , range 0 . 7 - 4 . 9 mg / dl ) were compared with 33 patients undergoing successful PCI ( PCI group ) , matched for basal creatinine ( 1 . 44 + / - 0 . 6 , range 0 . 7 - 3 . 4 mg / dl ) , gender , and age .
column2: MATERIAL AND METHODS : A total of 33 patients successfully treated with PTRA ( PTRA group , mean age 70 + / - 12 years , 23 female , basal chem* creatinine *chem 1 . 46 + / - 0 . 79 , range 0 . 7 - 4 . 9 mg / dl ) were compared with 33 patients undergoing successful PCI ( PCI group ) , matched for basal chem* creatinine *chem ( 1 . 44 + / - 0 . 6 , range 0 . 7 - 3 . 4 mg / dl ) , gender , and age .

column1: In both groups postprocedural ( 48 h ) serum creatinine was measured .
column2: In both groups postprocedural ( 48 h ) serum chem* creatinine *chem was measured .

column1: RESULTS : Postprocedural creatinine level decreased nonsignificantly in the PTRA group ( 1 . 46 + / - 0 . 8 vs . 1 . 34 + / - 0 . 5 mg / dl , P = NS ) and increased significantly in the PCI group ( 1 . 44 + / - 0 . 6 vs . 1 . 57 + / - 0 . 7 mg / dl , P < 0 . 02 ) .
column2: RESULTS : Postprocedural chem* creatinine *chem level decreased nonsignificantly in the PTRA group ( 1 . 46 + / - 0 . 8 vs . 1 . 34 + / - 0 . 5 mg / dl , P = NS ) and increased significantly in the PCI group ( 1 . 44 + / - 0 . 6 vs . 1 . 57 + / - 0 . 7 mg / dl , P < 0 . 02 ) .

column1: Changes in serum creatinine after intervention ( after - before ) were significantly different between the PTRA and PCI groups ( - 0 . 12 + / - 0 . 5 vs . 0 . 13 + / - 0 . 3 , P = 0 . 014 ) .
column2: Changes in serum chem* creatinine *chem after intervention ( after - before ) were significantly different between the PTRA and PCI groups ( - 0 . 12 + / - 0 . 5 vs . 0 . 13 + / - 0 . 3 , P = 0 . 014 ) .

column1: This difference was not related to either a different clinical risk profile or to the volume of CM administered .
column2: This difference was not related to either a different clinical risk profile or to the volume of chem* CM *chem administered .

column1: CONCLUSION : In this preliminary study patients submitted to PTRA showed a lower susceptibility to renal damage induced by CM administration than PCI patients .
column2: CONCLUSION : In this preliminary study patients submitted to PTRA showed a lower susceptibility to renal damage induced by chem* CM *chem administration than PCI patients .

column1: The effectiveness of PTRA on renal function seems to be barely influenced by CM toxicity .
column2: The effectiveness of PTRA on renal function seems to be barely influenced by chem* CM *chem toxicity .

column1: Diphenhydramine prevents the haemodynamic changes of cimetidine in ICU patients .
column2: chem* Diphenhydramine *chem prevents the haemodynamic changes of chem* cimetidine *chem in ICU patients .

column1: Cimetidine , a histamine 2 ( H2 ) antagonist , produces a decrease in arterial pressure due to vasodilatation , especially in critically ill patients .
column2: chem* Cimetidine *chem , a chem* histamine *chem 2 ( H2 ) antagonist , produces a decrease in arterial pressure due to vasodilatation , especially in critically ill patients .

column1: We , therefore , investigated the effects of the histamine 1 ( H1 ) receptor antagonist , diphenhydramine , on the haemodynamic changes observed after cimetidine in ICU patients .

column1: Each patient was studied on two separate days .

column1: In the non - pretreatment group , mean arterial pressure ( MAP ) decreased from 107 . 4 + / - 8 . 4 mmHg to 86 . 7 + / - 11 . 4 mmHg ( P less than 0 . 01 ) two minutes after cimetidine .

column2: Also , systemic vascular resistance ( SVR ) decreased during the eight - minute observation period ( P less than 0 . 01 ) .

column2: In contrast , in the pretreatment group , little haemodynamic change was seen .

column1: We conclude that an H1 antagonist may be useful in preventing hypotension caused by iv cimetidine , since the vasodilating activity of cimetidine is mediated , in part , through the H1 receptor .

column1: Medical and psychiatric outcomes for patients transplanted for acetaminophen - induced acute liver failure : a case - control study .
column2: Medical and psychiatric outcomes for patients transplanted for chem* acetaminophen *chem - induced acute liver failure : a case - control study .

column1: BACKGROUND : Acetaminophen - induced hepatotoxicity is the most common cause of acute liver failure ( ALF ) in the UK .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* Acetaminophen *chem - induced hepatotoxicity is the most common cause of acute liver failure ( ALF ) in the UK .

column1: Patients often consume the drug with suicidal intent or with a background of substance dependence .
column2: Patients often consume the drug with suicidal intent or with a background of substance dependence .

column1: AIMS AND METHODS : We compared the severity of pretransplant illness , psychiatric co - morbidity , medical and psychosocial outcomes of all patients who had undergone liver transplantation ( LT ) emergently between 1999 - 2004 for acetaminophen - induced ALF ( n = 36 ) with age - and sex - matched patients undergoing emergent LT for non - acetaminophen - induced ALF ( n = 35 ) and elective LT for chronic liver disease ( CLD , n = 34 ) .
column2: AIMS AND METHODS : We compared the severity of pretransplant illness , psychiatric co - morbidity , medical and psychosocial outcomes of all patients who had undergone liver transplantation ( LT ) emergently between 1999 - 2004 for chem* acetaminophen *chem - induced ALF ( n = 36 ) with age - and sex - matched patients undergoing emergent LT for non - chem* acetaminophen *chem - induced ALF ( n = 35 ) and elective LT for chronic liver disease ( CLD , n = 34 ) .

column1: RESULTS : Acetaminophen - induced ALF patients undergoing LT had a greater severity of pre - LT illness reflected by higher Acute Physiology and Chronic Health Evaluation II scores and requirement for organ support compared with the other two groups .
column2: RESULTS : chem* Acetaminophen *chem - induced ALF patients undergoing LT had a greater severity of pre - LT illness reflected by higher Acute Physiology and Chronic Health Evaluation II scores and requirement for organ support compared with the other two groups .

column1: Twenty ( 56 % ) acetaminophen - induced ALF patients had a formal psychiatric diagnosis before LT ( non - acetaminophen - induced ALF = 0 / 35 , CLD = 2 / 34 ; P < 0 . 01 for all ) and nine ( 25 % ) had a previous suicide attempt .
column2: Twenty ( 56 % ) chem* acetaminophen *chem - induced ALF patients had a formal psychiatric diagnosis before LT ( non - chem* acetaminophen *chem - induced ALF = 0 / 35 , CLD = 2 / 34 ; P < 0 . 01 for all ) and nine ( 25 % ) had a previous suicide attempt .

column1: During follow - up ( median 5 years ) , there were no significant differences in rejection ( acute and chronic ) , graft failure or survival between the groups ( acetaminophen - induced ALF 1 year 87 % , 5 years 75 % ; non - acetaminophen - induced ALF 88 % , 78 % ; CLD 93 % , 82 % : P > 0 . 6 log rank ) .
column2: During follow - up ( median 5 years ) , there were no significant differences in rejection ( acute and chronic ) , graft failure or survival between the groups ( chem* acetaminophen *chem - induced ALF 1 year 87 % , 5 years 75 % ; non - chem* acetaminophen *chem - induced ALF 88 % , 78 % ; CLD 93 % , 82 % : P > 0 . 6 log rank ) .

column2: Two chem* acetaminophen *chem - induced ALF patients reattempted suicide post - LT ( one died 8 years post - LT ) .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Despite a high prevalence of psychiatric disturbance , outcomes for patients transplanted emergently for acetaminophen - induced ALF were comparable to those transplanted for non - acetaminophen - induced ALF and electively for CLD .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Despite a high prevalence of psychiatric disturbance , outcomes for patients transplanted emergently for chem* acetaminophen *chem - induced ALF were comparable to those transplanted for non - chem* acetaminophen *chem - induced ALF and electively for CLD .

column1: Antithrombotic drug use , cerebral microbleeds , and intracerebral hemorrhage : a systematic review of published and unpublished studies .
column2: Antithrombotic drug use , cerebral microbleeds , and intracerebral hemorrhage : a systematic review of published and unpublished studies .

column1: BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE : Cerebral microbleeds ( MB ) are potential risk factors for intracerebral hemorrhage ( ICH ) , but it is unclear if they are a contraindication to using antithrombotic drugs .
column2: BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE : Cerebral microbleeds ( MB ) are potential risk factors for intracerebral hemorrhage ( ICH ) , but it is unclear if they are a contraindication to using antithrombotic drugs .

column1: Insights could be gained by pooling data on MB frequency stratified by antithrombotic use in cohorts with ICH and ischemic stroke ( IS ) / transient ischemic attack ( TIA ) .
column2: Insights could be gained by pooling data on MB frequency stratified by antithrombotic use in cohorts with ICH and ischemic stroke ( IS ) / transient ischemic attack ( TIA ) .

column1: METHODS : We performed a systematic review of published and unpublished data from cohorts with stroke or TIA to compare the presence of MB in : ( 1 ) antithrombotic users vs nonantithrombotic users with ICH ; ( 2 ) antithrombotic users vs nonusers with IS / TIA ; and ( 3 ) ICH vs ischemic events stratified by antithrombotic use .
column2: METHODS : We performed a systematic review of published and unpublished data from cohorts with stroke or TIA to compare the presence of MB in : ( 1 ) antithrombotic users vs nonantithrombotic users with ICH ; ( 2 ) antithrombotic users vs nonusers with IS / TIA ; and ( 3 ) ICH vs ischemic events stratified by antithrombotic use .

column1: We also analyzed published and unpublished follow - up data to determine the risk of ICH in antithrombotic users with MB .
column2: We also analyzed published and unpublished follow - up data to determine the risk of ICH in antithrombotic users with MB .

column1: RESULTS : In a pooled analysis of 1460 ICH and 3817 IS / TIA , MB were more frequent in ICH vs IS / TIA in all treatment groups , but the excess increased from 2 . 8 ( odds ratio ; range , 2 . 3 - 3 . 5 ) in nonantithrombotic users to 5 . 7 ( range , 3 . 4 - 9 . 7 ) in antiplatelet users and 8 . 0 ( range , 3 . 5 - 17 . 8 ) in warfarin users ( P difference = 0 . 01 ) .
column2: RESULTS : In a pooled analysis of 1460 ICH and 3817 IS / TIA , MB were more frequent in ICH vs IS / TIA in all treatment groups , but the excess increased from 2 . 8 ( odds ratio ; range , 2 . 3 - 3 . 5 ) in nonantithrombotic users to 5 . 7 ( range , 3 . 4 - 9 . 7 ) in antiplatelet users and 8 . 0 ( range , 3 . 5 - 17 . 8 ) in chem* warfarin *chem users ( P difference = 0 . 01 ) .

column1: There was also an excess of MB in warfarin users vs nonusers with ICH ( OR , 2 . 7 ; 95 % CI , 1 . 6 - 4 . 4 ; P < 0 . 001 ) but none in warfarin users with IS / TIA ( OR , 1 . 3 ; 95 % CI , 0 . 9 - 1 . 7 ; P = 0 . 33 ; P difference = 0 . 01 ) .
column2: There was also an excess of MB in chem* warfarin *chem users vs nonusers with ICH ( OR , 2 . 7 ; 95 % CI , 1 . 6 - 4 . 4 ; P < 0 . 001 ) but none in chem* warfarin *chem users with IS / TIA ( OR , 1 . 3 ; 95 % CI , 0 . 9 - 1 . 7 ; P = 0 . 33 ; P difference = 0 . 01 ) .

column1: There was a smaller excess of MB in antiplatelet users vs nonusers with ICH ( OR , 1 . 7 ; 95 % CI , 1 . 3 - 2 . 3 ; P < 0 . 001 ) , but findings were similar for antiplatelet users with IS / TIA ( OR , 1 . 4 ; 95 % CI , 1 . 2 - 1 . 7 ; P < 0 . 001 ; P difference = 0 . 25 ) .
column2: There was a smaller excess of MB in antiplatelet users vs nonusers with ICH ( OR , 1 . 7 ; 95 % CI , 1 . 3 - 2 . 3 ; P < 0 . 001 ) , but findings were similar for antiplatelet users with IS / TIA ( OR , 1 . 4 ; 95 % CI , 1 . 2 - 1 . 7 ; P < 0 . 001 ; P difference = 0 . 25 ) .

column1: In pooled follow - up data for 768 antithrombotic users , presence of MB at baseline was associated with a substantially increased risk of subsequent ICH ( OR , 12 . 1 ; 95 % CI , 3 . 4 - 42 . 5 ; P < 0 . 001 ) .
column2: In pooled follow - up data for 768 antithrombotic users , presence of MB at baseline was associated with a substantially increased risk of subsequent ICH ( OR , 12 . 1 ; 95 % CI , 3 . 4 - 42 . 5 ; P < 0 . 001 ) .

column1: Heparin - induced thrombocytopenia : a practical review .
column2: chem* Heparin *chem - induced thrombocytopenia : a practical review .

column1: Heparin - induced thrombocytopenia ( HIT ) remains under - recognized despite its potentially devastating outcomes .
column2: chem* Heparin *chem - induced thrombocytopenia ( HIT ) remains under - recognized despite its potentially devastating outcomes .

column1: It begins when heparin exposure stimulates the formation of heparin - platelet factor 4 antibodies , which in turn triggers the release of procoagulant platelet particles .
column2: It begins when chem* heparin *chem exposure stimulates the formation of chem* heparin *chem - platelet factor 4 antibodies , which in turn triggers the release of procoagulant platelet particles .

column1: Thrombosis and thrombocytopenia that follow comprise the 2 hallmark traits of HIT , with the former largely responsible for significant vascular complications .
column2: Thrombosis and thrombocytopenia that follow comprise the 2 hallmark traits of HIT , with the former largely responsible for significant vascular complications .

column1: The prevalence of HIT varies among several subgroups , with greater incidence in surgical as compared with medical populations .
column2: The prevalence of HIT varies among several subgroups , with greater incidence in surgical as compared with medical populations .

column1: HIT must be acknowledged for its intense predilection for thrombosis and suspected whenever thrombosis occurs after heparin exposure .
column2: HIT must be acknowledged for its intense predilection for thrombosis and suspected whenever thrombosis occurs after chem* heparin *chem exposure .

column1: Early recognition that incorporates the clinical and serologic clues is paramount to timely institution of treatment , as its delay may result in catastrophic outcomes .
column2: Early recognition that incorporates the clinical and serologic clues is paramount to timely institution of treatment , as its delay may result in catastrophic outcomes .

column1: The treatment of HIT mandates an immediate cessation of all heparin exposure and the institution of an antithrombotic therapy , most commonly using a direct thrombin inhibitor .
column2: The treatment of HIT mandates an immediate cessation of all chem* heparin *chem exposure and the institution of an antithrombotic therapy , most commonly using a chem* direct thrombin inhibitor *chem .

column1: Current " diagnostic " tests , which primarily include functional and antigenic assays , have more of a confirmatory than diagnostic role in the management of HIT .
column2: Current " diagnostic " tests , which primarily include functional and antigenic assays , have more of a confirmatory than diagnostic role in the management of HIT .

column1: Special attention must be paid to cardiac patients who are often exposed to heparin multiple times during their course of treatment .
column2: Special attention must be paid to cardiac patients who are often exposed to chem* heparin *chem multiple times during their course of treatment .

column1: Direct thrombin inhibitors are appropriate , evidence - based alternatives to heparin in patients with a history of HIT , who need to undergo percutaneous coronary intervention .
column2: chem* Direct thrombin inhibitors *chem are appropriate , evidence - based alternatives to chem* heparin *chem in patients with a history of HIT , who need to undergo percutaneous coronary intervention .

column1: As heparin remains one of the most frequently used medications today with potential for HIT with every heparin exposure , a close vigilance of platelet counts must be practiced whenever heparin is initiated .
column2: As chem* heparin *chem remains one of the most frequently used medications today with potential for HIT with every chem* heparin *chem exposure , a close vigilance of platelet counts must be practiced whenever chem* heparin *chem is initiated .

column1: Abductor paralysis after botox injection for adductor spasmodic dysphonia .

column1: OBJECTIVES / HYPOTHESIS : Botulinum toxin ( Botox ) injections into the thyroarytenoid muscles are the current standard of care for adductor spasmodic dysphonia ( ADSD ) .
column2: OBJECTIVES / HYPOTHESIS : Botulinum toxin ( chem* Botox *chem ) injections into the thyroarytenoid muscles are the current standard of care for adductor spasmodic dysphonia ( ADSD ) .

column1: Reported adverse effects include a period of breathiness , throat pain , and difficulty with swallowing liquids .
column2: Reported adverse effects include a period of breathiness , throat pain , and difficulty with swallowing liquids .

column1: Here we report multiple cases of bilateral abductor paralysis following Botox injections for ADSD , a complication previously unreported .
column2: Here we report multiple cases of bilateral abductor paralysis following chem* Botox *chem injections for ADSD , a complication previously unreported .

column1: STUDY DESIGN : Retrospective case series .
column2: STUDY DESIGN : Retrospective case series .

column1: METHODS : Patients that received Botox injections for spasmodic dysphonia between January 2000 and October 2009 were evaluated .
column2: METHODS : Patients that received chem* Botox *chem injections for spasmodic dysphonia between January 2000 and October 2009 were evaluated .

column1: Patients with ADSD were identified .
column2: Patients with ADSD were identified .

column1: The number of treatments received and adverse effects were noted .
column2: The number of treatments received and adverse effects were noted .

column1: For patients with bilateral abductor paralysis , age , sex , paralytic Botox dose , prior Botox dose , and course following paralysis were noted .
column2: For patients with bilateral abductor paralysis , age , sex , paralytic chem* Botox *chem dose , prior chem* Botox *chem dose , and course following paralysis were noted .

column1: RESULTS : From a database of 452 patients receiving Botox , 352 patients had been diagnosed with ADSD .
column2: RESULTS : From a database of 452 patients receiving chem* Botox *chem , 352 patients had been diagnosed with ADSD .

column1: Of these 352 patients , eight patients suffered bilateral abductor paralysis , and two suffered this complication twice .
column2: Of these 352 patients , eight patients suffered bilateral abductor paralysis , and two suffered this complication twice .

column1: All affected patients were females over the age of 50 years .
column2: All affected patients were females over the age of 50 years .

column1: Most patients had received treatments prior to abductor paralysis and continued receiving after paralysis .
column2: Most patients had received treatments prior to abductor paralysis and continued receiving after paralysis .

column1: Seven patients recovered after a brief period of activity restrictions , and one underwent a tracheotomy .
column2: Seven patients recovered after a brief period of activity restrictions , and one underwent a tracheotomy .

column1: The incidence of abductor paralysis after Botox injection for ADSD was 0 . 34 % .
column2: The incidence of abductor paralysis after chem* Botox *chem injection for ADSD was 0 . 34 % .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Bilateral abductor paralysis is a rare complication of Botox injections for ADSD , causing difficulty with breathing upon exertion .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Bilateral abductor paralysis is a rare complication of chem* Botox *chem injections for ADSD , causing difficulty with breathing upon exertion .

column1: The likely mechanism of paralysis is diffusion of Botox around the muscular process of the arytenoid to the posterior cricoarytenoid muscles .
column2: The likely mechanism of paralysis is diffusion of chem* Botox *chem around the muscular process of the arytenoid to the posterior cricoarytenoid muscles .

column1: The paralysis is temporary , and watchful waiting with restriction of activity is the recommended management .
column2: The paralysis is temporary , and watchful waiting with restriction of activity is the recommended management .

column1: Mitochondrial impairment contributes to cocaine - induced cardiac dysfunction : Prevention by the targeted antioxidant MitoQ .
column2: Mitochondrial impairment contributes to chem* cocaine *chem - induced cardiac dysfunction : Prevention by the targeted antioxidant chem* MitoQ *chem .

column1: The goal of this study was to assess mitochondrial function and ROS production in an experimental model of cocaine - induced cardiac dysfunction .
column2: The goal of this study was to assess mitochondrial function and ROS production in an experimental model of chem* cocaine *chem - induced cardiac dysfunction .

column1: We hypothesized that cocaine abuse may lead to altered mitochondrial function that in turn may cause left ventricular dysfunction .
column2: We hypothesized that cocaine abuse may lead to altered mitochondrial function that in turn may cause left ventricular dysfunction .

column1: Seven days of cocaine administration to rats led to an increased oxygen consumption detected in cardiac fibers , specifically through complex I and complex III .
column2: Seven days of chem* cocaine *chem administration to rats led to an increased chem* oxygen *chem consumption detected in cardiac fibers , specifically through complex I and complex III .

column1: ROS levels were increased , specifically in interfibrillar mitochondria .
column2: ROS levels were increased , specifically in interfibrillar mitochondria .

column1: In parallel there was a decrease in ATP synthesis , whereas no difference was observed in subsarcolemmal mitochondria .
column2: In parallel there was a decrease in chem* ATP *chem synthesis , whereas no difference was observed in subsarcolemmal mitochondria .

column1: This uncoupling effect on oxidative phosphorylation was not detectable after short - term exposure to cocaine , suggesting that these mitochondrial abnormalities were a late rather than a primary event in the pathological response to cocaine .
column2: This uncoupling effect on oxidative phosphorylation was not detectable after short - term exposure to chem* cocaine *chem , suggesting that these mitochondrial abnormalities were a late rather than a primary event in the pathological response to chem* cocaine *chem .

column1: MitoQ , a mitochondrial - targeted antioxidant , was shown to completely prevent these mitochondrial abnormalities as well as cardiac dysfunction characterized here by a diastolic dysfunction studied with a conductance catheter to obtain pressure - volume data .
column2: chem* MitoQ *chem , a mitochondrial - targeted antioxidant , was shown to completely prevent these mitochondrial abnormalities as well as cardiac dysfunction characterized here by a diastolic dysfunction studied with a conductance catheter to obtain pressure - volume data .

column1: Taken together , these results extend previous studies and demonstrate that cocaine - induced cardiac dysfunction may be due to a mitochondrial defect .
column2: Taken together , these results extend previous studies and demonstrate that chem* cocaine *chem - induced cardiac dysfunction may be due to a mitochondrial defect .

column1: Verapamil stimulation test in hyperprolactinemia : loss of prolactin response in anatomic or functional stalk effect .

column2: AIM : chem* Verapamil *chem stimulation test was previously investigated as a tool for differential diagnosis of hyperprolactinemia , but with conflicting results .

column1: Macroprolactinemia was never considered in those previous studies .
column2: Macroprolactinemia was never considered in those previous studies .

column1: Here , we aimed to re - investigate the diagnostic value of verapamil in a population who were all screened for macroprolactinemia .

column1: Prolactin responses to verapamil in 65 female patients ( age : 29 . 9 + / - 8 . 1 years ) with hyperprolactinemia were tested in a descriptive , matched case - control study .
column2: Prolactin responses to chem* verapamil *chem in 65 female patients ( age : 29 . 9 + / - 8 . 1 years ) with hyperprolactinemia were tested in a descriptive , matched case - control study .

column1: METHODS : Verapamil 80 mg , p . o . was administered , and then PRL levels were measured at 8th and 16th hours , by immunometric chemiluminescence .
column2: METHODS : chem* Verapamil *chem 80 mg , p . o . was administered , and then PRL levels were measured at 8th and 16th hours , by immunometric chemiluminescence .

column1: Verapamil responsiveness was determined by peak percent change in basal prolactin levels ( PRL ) .
column2: chem* Verapamil *chem responsiveness was determined by peak percent change in basal prolactin levels ( PRL ) .

column1: RESULTS : Verapamil significantly increased PRL levels in healthy controls ( N . 8 , PRL : 183 % ) , macroprolactinoma ( N . 8 , PRL : 7 % ) , microprolactinoma ( N . 19 , PRL : 21 % ) , macroprolactinemia ( N . 23 , PRL : 126 % ) , but not in pseudoprolactinoma ( N . 8 , PRL : 0 . 8 % ) , and risperidone - induced hyperprolactinemia ( N . 7 , PRL : 3 % ) .
column2: RESULTS : chem* Verapamil *chem significantly increased PRL levels in healthy controls ( N . 8 , PRL : 183 % ) , macroprolactinoma ( N . 8 , PRL : 7 % ) , microprolactinoma ( N . 19 , PRL : 21 % ) , macroprolactinemia ( N . 23 , PRL : 126 % ) , but not in pseudoprolactinoma ( N . 8 , PRL : 0 . 8 % ) , and chem* risperidone *chem - induced hyperprolactinemia ( N . 7 , PRL : 3 % ) .

column1: ROC curve analysis revealed that unresponsiveness to verapamil defined as PRL < 7 % , discriminated anatomical or functional stalk effect ( sensitivity : 74 % , specificity : 73 % , AUC : 0 . 855 + / - 0 . 04 , P < 0 . 001 , CI : 0 . 768 - 0 . 942 ) associated with pseudoprolactinoma or risperidone - induced hyperprolactinemia , respectively .
column2: ROC curve analysis revealed that unresponsiveness to chem* verapamil *chem defined as PRL < 7 % , discriminated anatomical or functional stalk effect ( sensitivity : 74 % , specificity : 73 % , AUC : 0 . 855 + / - 0 . 04 , P < 0 . 001 , CI : 0 . 768 - 0 . 942 ) associated with pseudoprolactinoma or chem* risperidone *chem - induced hyperprolactinemia , respectively .

column1: CONCLUSION : Verapamil responsiveness is not a reliable finding for the differential diagnosis of hyperprolactinemia .
column2: CONCLUSION : chem* Verapamil *chem responsiveness is not a reliable finding for the differential diagnosis of hyperprolactinemia .

column1: However , verapamil unresponsiveness discriminates stalk effect ( i . e . , anatomically or functionally inhibited dopaminergic tonus ) from other causes of hyperprolactinemia with varying degrees of responsiveness .
column2: However , chem* verapamil *chem unresponsiveness discriminates stalk effect ( i . e . , anatomically or functionally inhibited dopaminergic tonus ) from other causes of hyperprolactinemia with varying degrees of responsiveness .

column1: Blockade of endothelial - mesenchymal transition by a Smad3 inhibitor delays the early development of streptozotocin - induced diabetic nephropathy .
column2: Blockade of endothelial - mesenchymal transition by a Smad3 inhibitor delays the early development of chem* streptozotocin *chem - induced diabetic nephropathy .

column1: OBJECTIVE : A multicenter , controlled trial showed that early blockade of the renin - angiotensin system in patients with type 1 diabetes and normoalbuminuria did not retard the progression of nephropathy , suggesting that other mechanism ( s ) are involved in the pathogenesis of early diabetic nephropathy ( diabetic nephropathy ) .
column2: OBJECTIVE : A multicenter , controlled trial showed that early blockade of the renin - chem* angiotensin *chem system in patients with type 1 diabetes and normoalbuminuria did not retard the progression of nephropathy , suggesting that other mechanism ( s ) are involved in the pathogenesis of early diabetic nephropathy ( diabetic nephropathy ) .

column1: We have previously demonstrated that endothelial - mesenchymal - transition ( EndoMT ) contributes to the early development of renal interstitial fibrosis independently of microalbuminuria in mice with streptozotocin ( STZ ) - induced diabetes .
column2: We have previously demonstrated that endothelial - mesenchymal - transition ( EndoMT ) contributes to the early development of renal interstitial fibrosis independently of microalbuminuria in mice with chem* streptozotocin *chem ( chem* STZ *chem ) - induced diabetes .

column1: In the present study , we hypothesized that blocking EndoMT reduces the early development of diabetic nephropathy .
column2: In the present study , we hypothesized that blocking EndoMT reduces the early development of diabetic nephropathy .

column1: RESEARCH DESIGN AND METHODS : EndoMT was induced in a mouse pancreatic microvascular endothelial cell line ( MMEC ) in the presence of advanced glycation end products ( AGEs ) and in the endothelial lineage - traceble mouse line Tie2 - Cre ; Loxp - EGFP by administration of AGEs , with nonglycated mouse albumin serving as a control .
column2: RESEARCH DESIGN AND METHODS : EndoMT was induced in a mouse pancreatic microvascular endothelial cell line ( MMEC ) in the presence of advanced glycation end products ( AGEs ) and in the endothelial lineage - traceble mouse line Tie2 - Cre ; Loxp - EGFP by administration of AGEs , with nonglycated mouse albumin serving as a control .

column1: Phosphorylated Smad3 was detected by immunoprecipitation / Western blotting and confocal microscopy .
column2: Phosphorylated Smad3 was detected by immunoprecipitation / Western blotting and confocal microscopy .

column1: Blocking studies using receptor for AGE siRNA and a specific inhibitor of Smad3 ( SIS3 ) were performed in MMECs and in STZ - induced diabetic nephropathy in Tie2 - Cre ; Loxp - EGFP mice .
column2: Blocking studies using receptor for AGE siRNA and a specific inhibitor of Smad3 ( SIS3 ) were performed in MMECs and in chem* STZ *chem - induced diabetic nephropathy in Tie2 - Cre ; Loxp - EGFP mice .

column1: RESULTS : Confocal microscopy and real - time PCR demonstrated that AGEs induced EndoMT in MMECs and in Tie2 - Cre ; Loxp - EGFP mice .
column2: RESULTS : Confocal microscopy and real - time PCR demonstrated that AGEs induced EndoMT in MMECs and in Tie2 - Cre ; Loxp - EGFP mice .

column1: Immunoprecipitation / Western blotting showed that Smad3 was activated by AGEs but was inhibited by SIS3 in MMECs and in STZ - induced diabetic nephropathy .
column2: Immunoprecipitation / Western blotting showed that Smad3 was activated by AGEs but was inhibited by SIS3 in MMECs and in chem* STZ *chem - induced diabetic nephropathy .

column1: Confocal microscopy and real - time PCR further demonstrated that SIS3 abrogated EndoMT , reduced renal fibrosis , and retarded progression of nephropathy .
column2: Confocal microscopy and real - time PCR further demonstrated that SIS3 abrogated EndoMT , reduced renal fibrosis , and retarded progression of nephropathy .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : EndoMT is a novel pathway leading to early development of diabetic nephropathy .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : EndoMT is a novel pathway leading to early development of diabetic nephropathy .

column1: Blockade of EndoMT by SIS3 may provide a new strategy to retard the progression of diabetic nephropathy and other diabetes complications .
column2: Blockade of EndoMT by SIS3 may provide a new strategy to retard the progression of diabetic nephropathy and other diabetes complications .

column1: Cytostatic and anti - angiogenic effects of temsirolimus in refractory mantle cell lymphoma .
column2: Cytostatic and anti - angiogenic effects of chem* temsirolimus *chem in refractory mantle cell lymphoma .

column1: Mantle cell lymphoma ( MCL ) is a rare and aggressive type of B - cell non - Hodgkin ' s lymphoma .
column2: Mantle cell lymphoma ( MCL ) is a rare and aggressive type of B - cell non - Hodgkin ' s lymphoma .

column1: Patients become progressively refractory to conventional chemotherapy , and their prognosis is poor .
column2: Patients become progressively refractory to conventional chemotherapy , and their prognosis is poor .

column1: However , a 38 % remission rate has been recently reported in refractory MCL treated with temsirolimus , a mTOR inhibitor . Here we had the opportunity to study a case of refractory MCL who had tumor regression two months after temsirolimus treatment , and a progression - free survival of 10 months .
column2: However , a 38 % remission rate has been recently reported in refractory MCL treated with chem* temsirolimus *chem , a mTOR inhibitor . Here we had the opportunity to study a case of refractory MCL who had tumor regression two months after chem* temsirolimus *chem treatment , and a progression - free survival of 10 months .

column1: In this case , lymph node biopsies were performed before and six months after temsirolimus therapy .
column2: In this case , lymph node biopsies were performed before and six months after chem* temsirolimus *chem therapy .

column1: Comparison of the two biopsies showed that temsirolimus inhibited tumor cell proliferation through cell cycle arrest , but did not induce any change in the number of apoptotic tumor cells .
column2: Comparison of the two biopsies showed that chem* temsirolimus *chem inhibited tumor cell proliferation through cell cycle arrest , but did not induce any change in the number of apoptotic tumor cells .

column1: Apart from this cytostatic effect , temsirolimus had an antiangiogenic effect with decrease of tumor microvessel density and of VEGF expression .
column2: Apart from this cytostatic effect , chem* temsirolimus *chem had an antiangiogenic effect with decrease of tumor microvessel density and of VEGF expression .

column1: Moreover , numerous patchy , well - limited fibrotic areas , compatible with post - necrotic tissue repair , were found after 6 - month temsirolimus therapy .
column2: Moreover , numerous patchy , well - limited fibrotic areas , compatible with post - necrotic tissue repair , were found after 6 - month chem* temsirolimus *chem therapy .

column1: Thus , temsirolimus reduced tumor burden through associated cytostatic and anti - angiogenic effects . This dual effect of temsirolimus on tumor tissue could contribute to its recently reported efficiency in refractory MCL resistant to conventional chemotherapy .
column2: Thus , chem* temsirolimus *chem reduced tumor burden through associated cytostatic and anti - angiogenic effects . This dual effect of chem* temsirolimus *chem on tumor tissue could contribute to its recently reported efficiency in refractory MCL resistant to conventional chemotherapy .

column1: Effects of cromakalim and pinacidil on large epicardial and small coronary arteries in conscious dogs .
column2: Effects of chem* cromakalim *chem and chem* pinacidil *chem on large epicardial and small coronary arteries in conscious dogs .

column1: The effects of i . v . bolus administration of cromakalim ( 1 - 10 micrograms / kg ) and pinacidil ( 3 - 100 micrograms / kg ) on large ( circumflex artery ) and small coronary arteries and on systemic hemodynamics were investigated in chronically instrumented conscious dogs and compared to those of nitroglycerin ( 0 . 03 - 10 micrograms / kg ) .
column2: The effects of i . v . bolus administration of chem* cromakalim *chem ( 1 - 10 micrograms / kg ) and chem* pinacidil *chem ( 3 - 100 micrograms / kg ) on large ( circumflex artery ) and small coronary arteries and on systemic hemodynamics were investigated in chronically instrumented conscious dogs and compared to those of chem* nitroglycerin *chem ( 0 . 03 - 10 micrograms / kg ) .

column1: Nitroglycerin , up to 0 . 3 micrograms / kg , selectively increased circumflex artery diameter ( CxAD ) without simultaneously affecting any other cardiac or systemic hemodynamic parameter .
column2: chem* Nitroglycerin *chem , up to 0 . 3 micrograms / kg , selectively increased circumflex artery diameter ( CxAD ) without simultaneously affecting any other cardiac or systemic hemodynamic parameter .

column1: In contrast , cromakalim and pinacidil at all doses and nitroglycerin at doses higher than 0 . 3 micrograms / kg simultaneously and dose - dependently increased CxAD , coronary blood flow and heart rate and decreased coronary vascular resistance and aortic pressure .
column2: In contrast , chem* cromakalim *chem and chem* pinacidil *chem at all doses and chem* nitroglycerin *chem at doses higher than 0 . 3 micrograms / kg simultaneously and dose - dependently increased CxAD , coronary blood flow and heart rate and decreased coronary vascular resistance and aortic pressure .

column1: Cromakalim was approximately 8 - to 9 . 5 - fold more potent than pinacidil in increasing CxAD .
column2: chem* Cromakalim *chem was approximately 8 - to 9 . 5 - fold more potent than chem* pinacidil *chem in increasing CxAD .

column1: Vasodilation of large and small coronary vessels and hypotension induced by cromakalim and pinacidil were not affected by prior combined beta adrenergic and muscarinic receptors blockade but drug - induced tachycardia was abolished .
column2: Vasodilation of large and small coronary vessels and hypotension induced by chem* cromakalim *chem and chem* pinacidil *chem were not affected by prior combined chem* beta adrenergic and muscarinic receptors blockade *chem but drug - induced tachycardia was abolished .

column1: When circumflex artery blood flow was maintained constant , the increases in CxAD induced by cromakalim ( 10 micrograms / kg ) , pinacidil ( 30 micrograms / kg ) and nitroglycerin ( 10 micrograms / kg ) were reduced by 68 + / - 7 , 54 + / - 9 and 1 + / - 1 % , respectively .
column2: When circumflex artery blood flow was maintained constant , the increases in CxAD induced by chem* cromakalim *chem ( 10 micrograms / kg ) , chem* pinacidil *chem ( 30 micrograms / kg ) and chem* nitroglycerin *chem ( 10 micrograms / kg ) were reduced by 68 + / - 7 , 54 + / - 9 and 1 + / - 1 % , respectively .

column1: Thus , whereas nitroglycerin preferentially and flow - independently dilates large coronary arteries , cromakalim and pinacidil dilate both large and small coronary arteries and this effect is not dependent upon the simultaneous beta adrenoceptors - mediated rise in myocardial metabolic demand .
column2: Thus , whereas chem* nitroglycerin *chem preferentially and flow - independently dilates large coronary arteries , chem* cromakalim *chem and chem* pinacidil *chem dilate both large and small coronary arteries and this effect is not dependent upon the simultaneous beta adrenoceptors - mediated rise in myocardial metabolic demand .

column1: Finally , two mechanisms at least , direct vasodilation and flow dependency , are involved in the cromakalim - and pinacidil - induced increase in CxAD .
column2: Finally , two mechanisms at least , direct vasodilation and flow dependency , are involved in the chem* cromakalim *chem - and chem* pinacidil *chem - induced increase in CxAD .

column1: Cerebellar sensory processing alterations impact motor cortical plasticity in Parkinson ' s disease : clues from dyskinetic patients .

column1: The plasticity of primary motor cortex ( M1 ) in patients with Parkinson ' s disease ( PD ) and levodopa - induced dyskinesias ( LIDs ) is severely impaired .
column2: The plasticity of primary motor cortex ( M1 ) in patients with Parkinson ' s disease ( PD ) and chem* levodopa *chem - induced dyskinesias ( LIDs ) is severely impaired .

column1: We recently reported in young healthy subjects that inhibitory cerebellar stimulation enhanced the sensorimotor plasticity of M1 that was induced by paired associative stimulation ( PAS ) .
column2: We recently reported in young healthy subjects that inhibitory cerebellar stimulation enhanced the sensorimotor plasticity of M1 that was induced by paired associative stimulation ( PAS ) .

column1: This study demonstrates that the deficient sensorimotor M1 plasticity in 16 patients with LIDs could be reinstated by a single session of real inhibitory cerebellar stimulation but not sham stimulation .
column2: This study demonstrates that the deficient sensorimotor M1 plasticity in 16 patients with LIDs could be reinstated by a single session of real inhibitory cerebellar stimulation but not sham stimulation .

column1: This was evident only when a sensory component was involved in the induction of plasticity , indicating that cerebellar sensory processing function is involved in the resurgence of M1 plasticity .
column2: This was evident only when a sensory component was involved in the induction of plasticity , indicating that cerebellar sensory processing function is involved in the resurgence of M1 plasticity .

column1: The benefit of inhibitory cerebellar stimulation on LIDs is known .
column2: The benefit of inhibitory cerebellar stimulation on LIDs is known .

column1: To explore whether this benefit is linked to the restoration of sensorimotor plasticity of M1 , we conducted an additional study looking at changes in LIDs and PAS - induced plasticity after 10 sessions of either bilateral , real inhibitory cerebellar stimulation or sham stimulation .
column2: To explore whether this benefit is linked to the restoration of sensorimotor plasticity of M1 , we conducted an additional study looking at changes in LIDs and PAS - induced plasticity after 10 sessions of either bilateral , real inhibitory cerebellar stimulation or sham stimulation .

column1: Only real and not sham stimulation had an antidyskinetic effect and it was paralleled by a resurgence in the sensorimotor plasticity of M1 .
column2: Only real and not sham stimulation had an antidyskinetic effect and it was paralleled by a resurgence in the sensorimotor plasticity of M1 .

column1: These results suggest that alterations in cerebellar sensory processing function , occurring secondary to abnormal basal ganglia signals reaching it , may be an important element contributing to the maladaptive sensorimotor plasticity of M1 and the emergence of abnormal involuntary movements .
column2: These results suggest that alterations in cerebellar sensory processing function , occurring secondary to abnormal basal ganglia signals reaching it , may be an important element contributing to the maladaptive sensorimotor plasticity of M1 and the emergence of abnormal involuntary movements .

column2: We therefore investigated the long - term safety of chem* danazol *chem by performing a retrospective chart review of 60 female patients with hereditary angioedema treated with chem* danazol *chem for a continuous period of 6 months or longer .

column1: Incidence of postoperative delirium is high even in a population without known risk factors .

column1: PURPOSE : Postoperative delirium is a recognized complication in populations at risk .
column2: PURPOSE : Postoperative delirium is a recognized complication in populations at risk .

column1: The aim of this study is to assess the prevalence of early postoperative delirium in a population without known risk factors admitted to the ICU for postoperative monitoring after elective major surgery .
column2: The aim of this study is to assess the prevalence of early postoperative delirium in a population without known risk factors admitted to the ICU for postoperative monitoring after elective major surgery .

column1: The secondary outcome investigated is to identify eventual independent risk factors among demographic data and anesthetic drugs used .
column2: The secondary outcome investigated is to identify eventual independent risk factors among demographic data and anesthetic drugs used .

column1: METHODS : An observational , prospective study was conducted on a consecutive cohort of patients admitted to our ICU within and for at least 24 h after major surgical procedures .
column2: METHODS : An observational , prospective study was conducted on a consecutive cohort of patients admitted to our ICU within and for at least 24 h after major surgical procedures .

column1: Exclusion criteria were any preexisting predisposing factor for delirium or other potentially confounding neurological dysfunctions .
column2: Exclusion criteria were any preexisting predisposing factor for delirium or other potentially confounding neurological dysfunctions .

column1: Patients were assessed daily using the confusion assessment method for the ICU scale for 3 days after the surgical procedure .
column2: Patients were assessed daily using the confusion assessment method for the ICU scale for 3 days after the surgical procedure .

column1: Early postoperative delirium incidence risk factors were then assessed through three different multiple regression models .
column2: Early postoperative delirium incidence risk factors were then assessed through three different multiple regression models .

column1: RESULTS : According to the confusion assessment method for the ICU scale , 28 % of patients were diagnosed with early postoperative delirium .
column2: RESULTS : According to the confusion assessment method for the ICU scale , 28 % of patients were diagnosed with early postoperative delirium .

column1: The use of thiopentone was significantly associated with an eight - fold - higher risk for delirium compared to propofol ( 57 . 1 % vs . 7 . 1 % , RR = 8 . 0 , X2 = 4 . 256 ; df = 1 ; 0 . 05 < p < 0 . 02 ) .

column1: CONCLUSION : In this study early postoperative delirium was found to be a very common complication after major surgery , even in a population without known risk factors .

column1: This depressive - like profile induced by METH was accompanied by a marked depletion of frontostriatal dopaminergic and serotonergic neurotransmission , indicated by a reduction in the levels of dopamine , DOPAC and HVA , tyrosine hydroxylase and serotonin , observed at both 3 and 49 days post - administration .

column1: METHODS : A sample of 997 participants ( 52 % male ) was recruited to four control groups ( non - drug ( ND ) , alcohol / nicotine ( AN ) , cannabis / alcohol / nicotine ( CAN ) , non - ecstasy polydrug ( PD ) ) , and two ecstasy polydrug groups ( present ( MDMA ) and past users ( EX - MDMA ) .

column1: These data suggest that 1 ) apigenin delays the long - term forgetting but did not modulate the 24 h retention of fear memory and 2 ) the obtained beneficial effect of apigenin on the passive avoidance conditioning is mediated by mechanisms that do not implicate its action on the muscarinic cholinergic system .

column1: A Retrospective comparative study .

column1: BACKGROUND : In this retrospective comparative study , we aimed to compare the effectiveness of fentanyl , midazolam , and a combination of fentanyl and midazolam to prevent etomidate - induced myoclonus .

column1: MATERIAL AND METHODS : This study was performed based on anesthesia records .

column1: Depending on the drugs that would be given before the induction of anesthesia with etomidate , the patients were separated into 4 groups : no pretreatment ( Group NP ) , fentanyl 1 ug . kg - 1 ( Group F ) , midazolam 0 . 03 mg . kg - 1 ( Group M ) , and midazolam 0 . 015 mg . kg - 1 + fentanyl 0 . 5 ug . kg - 1 ( Group FM ) .
column2: Depending on the drugs that would be given before the induction of anesthesia with chem* etomidate *chem , the patients were separated into 4 groups : no pretreatment ( Group NP ) , chem* fentanyl *chem 1 ug . kg - 1 ( Group F ) , chem* midazolam *chem 0 . 03 mg . kg - 1 ( Group M ) , and chem* midazolam *chem 0 . 015 mg . kg - 1 + chem* fentanyl *chem 0 . 5 ug . kg - 1 ( Group FM ) .

column1: Patients who received the same anesthetic procedure were selected : 2 minutes after intravenous injections of the pretreatment drugs , anesthesia is induced with 0 . 3 mg . kg - 1 etomidate injected intravenously over a period of 20 - 30 seconds .
column2: Patients who received the same anesthetic procedure were selected : 2 minutes after intravenous injections of the pretreatment drugs , anesthesia is induced with 0 . 3 mg . kg - 1 chem* etomidate *chem injected intravenously over a period of 20 - 30 seconds .

column1: Myoclonic movements are evaluated , which were observed and graded according to clinical severity during the 2 minutes after etomidate injection .
