column1: The severity of pain due to etomidate injection , mean arterial pressure , heart rate , and adverse effects were also evaluated .
column2: The severity of pain due to chem* etomidate *chem injection , mean arterial pressure , heart rate , and adverse effects were also evaluated .

column1: RESULTS : Study results showed that myoclonus incidence was 85 % , 40 % , 70 % , and 25 % in Group NP , Group F , Group M , and Group FM , respectively , and were significantly lower in Group F and Group FM .
column2: RESULTS : Study results showed that myoclonus incidence was 85 % , 40 % , 70 % , and 25 % in Group NP , Group F , Group M , and Group FM , respectively , and were significantly lower in Group F and Group FM .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : We conclude that pretreatment with fentanyl or combination of fentanyl and midazolam was effective in preventing etomidate - induced myoclonus .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : We conclude that pretreatment with chem* fentanyl *chem or combination of chem* fentanyl *chem and chem* midazolam *chem was effective in preventing chem* etomidate *chem - induced myoclonus .

column1: This retrospective study describes toxicity associated with a protocol of lomustine ( CCNU ) and cyclophosphamide ( CTX ) in dogs with lymphoma .
column2: This retrospective study describes toxicity associated with a protocol of chem* lomustine *chem ( chem* CCNU *chem ) and chem* cyclophosphamide *chem ( chem* CTX *chem ) in dogs with lymphoma .

column1: CCNU was administered per os ( PO ) at a targeted dosage of 60 mg / m ( 2 ) body surface area on day 0 , CTX was administered PO at a targeted dosage of 250 mg / m ( 2 ) divided over days 0 through 4 , and all dogs received prophylactic antibiotics .
column2: chem* CCNU *chem was administered per os ( PO ) at a targeted dosage of 60 mg / m ( 2 ) body surface area on day 0 , chem* CTX *chem was administered PO at a targeted dosage of 250 mg / m ( 2 ) divided over days 0 through 4 , and all dogs received prophylactic antibiotics .

column1: Ninety treatments were given to the 57 dogs included in the study .
column2: Ninety treatments were given to the 57 dogs included in the study .

column1: Neutropenia was the principal toxic effect , and the overall frequency of grade 4 neutropenia after the first treatment of CCNU / CTX was 30 % ( 95 % confidence interval , 19 - 43 % ) .
column2: Neutropenia was the principal toxic effect , and the overall frequency of grade 4 neutropenia after the first treatment of chem* CCNU *chem / chem* CTX *chem was 30 % ( 95 % confidence interval , 19 - 43 % ) .

column1: The mean body weight of dogs with grade 4 neutropenia ( 19 . 7 kg + 13 . 4 kg ) was significantly less than the mean body weight of dogs that did not develop grade 4 neutropenia ( 31 . 7 kg + 12 . 4 kg ; P = . 005 ) .
column2: The mean body weight of dogs with grade 4 neutropenia ( 19 . 7 kg + 13 . 4 kg ) was significantly less than the mean body weight of dogs that did not develop grade 4 neutropenia ( 31 . 7 kg + 12 . 4 kg ; P = . 005 ) .

column1: One dog ( 3 % ) developed hematologic changes suggestive of hepatotoxicity .
column2: One dog ( 3 % ) developed hematologic changes suggestive of hepatotoxicity .

column1: No dogs had evidence of either renal toxicity or hemorrhagic cystitis .
column2: No dogs had evidence of either renal toxicity or hemorrhagic cystitis .

column1: Adverse gastrointestinal effects were uncommon .
column2: Adverse gastrointestinal effects were uncommon .

column1: On the basis of the findings reported herein , a dose of 60 mg / m ( 2 ) of CCNU combined with 250 mg / m ( 2 ) of CTX ( divided over 5 days ) q 4 wk is tolerable in tumor - bearing dogs .
column2: On the basis of the findings reported herein , a dose of 60 mg / m ( 2 ) of chem* CCNU *chem combined with 250 mg / m ( 2 ) of chem* CTX *chem ( divided over 5 days ) q 4 wk is tolerable in tumor - bearing dogs .

column1: Nelarabine neurotoxicity with concurrent intrathecal chemotherapy : Case report and review of literature .
column2: chem* Nelarabine *chem neurotoxicity with concurrent intrathecal chemotherapy : Case report and review of literature .

column1: Severe nelarabine neurotoxicity in a patient who received concurrent intrathecal ( IT ) chemotherapy is reported .
column2: Severe chem* nelarabine *chem neurotoxicity in a patient who received concurrent intrathecal ( IT ) chemotherapy is reported .

column1: A 37 - year - old Caucasian woman with a history of T - cell lymphoblastic lymphoma was admitted for relapsed disease .
column2: A 37 - year - old Caucasian woman with a history of T - cell lymphoblastic lymphoma was admitted for relapsed disease .

column1: She was originally treated with induction chemotherapy followed by an autologous transplant .
column2: She was originally treated with induction chemotherapy followed by an autologous transplant .

column1: She developed relapsed disease 10 months later with leukemic involvement .
column2: She developed relapsed disease 10 months later with leukemic involvement .

column1: She was re - induced with nelarabine 1500 mg / m ( 2 ) on days 1 , 3 , and 5 with 1 dose of IT cytarabine 100 mg on day 2 as central nervous system ( CNS ) prophylaxis .
column2: She was re - induced with chem* nelarabine *chem 1500 mg / m ( 2 ) on days 1 , 3 , and 5 with 1 dose of IT chem* cytarabine *chem 100 mg on day 2 as central nervous system ( CNS ) prophylaxis .

column1: At the time of treatment , she was on continuous renal replacement therapy due to sequelae of tumor lysis syndrome ( TLS ) .
column2: At the time of treatment , she was on continuous renal replacement therapy due to sequelae of tumor lysis syndrome ( TLS ) .

column1: She tolerated therapy well , entered a complete remission , and recovered her renal function .
column2: She tolerated therapy well , entered a complete remission , and recovered her renal function .

column1: She received a second cycle of nelarabine without additional IT prophylaxis one month later .
column2: She received a second cycle of chem* nelarabine *chem without additional IT prophylaxis one month later .

column1: A week after this second cycle , she noted numbness in her lower extremities .
column2: A week after this second cycle , she noted numbness in her lower extremities .

column1: Predominantly sensory , though also motor and autonomic , peripheral neuropathy started in her feet , ascended proximally to the mid - thoracic region , and eventually included her distal upper extremities .
column2: Predominantly sensory , though also motor and autonomic , peripheral neuropathy started in her feet , ascended proximally to the mid - thoracic region , and eventually included her distal upper extremities .

column1: A magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) of her spine demonstrated changes from C2 to C6 consistent with subacute combined degeneration .
column2: A magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) of her spine demonstrated changes from C2 to C6 consistent with subacute combined degeneration .

column1: Nelarabine was felt to be the cause of her symptoms .
column2: chem* Nelarabine *chem was felt to be the cause of her symptoms .

column1: Her neuropathy stabilized and showed slight improvement and ultimately received an unrelated , reduced - intensity allogeneic transplant while in complete remission , but relapsed disease 10 weeks later .
column2: Her neuropathy stabilized and showed slight improvement and ultimately received an unrelated , reduced - intensity allogeneic transplant while in complete remission , but relapsed disease 10 weeks later .

column1: She is currently being treated with best supportive care .
column2: She is currently being treated with best supportive care .

column1: To our knowledge , this is the first published case report of severe neurotoxicity caused by nelarabine in a patient who received concurrent IT chemotherapy .
column2: To our knowledge , this is the first published case report of severe neurotoxicity caused by chem* nelarabine *chem in a patient who received concurrent IT chemotherapy .

column1: Valproate - induced hyperammonemic encephalopathy in a renal transplanted patient .
column2: chem* Valproate *chem - induced hyperammonemic encephalopathy in a renal transplanted patient .

column1: Neurological complications after renal transplantation constitute an important cause of morbidity and mortality .
column2: Neurological complications after renal transplantation constitute an important cause of morbidity and mortality .

column1: Their differential diagnosis is difficult and essential for subsequent patient ' s management .
column2: Their differential diagnosis is difficult and essential for subsequent patient ' s management .

column1: Valproate - induced hyperammonemic encephalopathy is an uncommon but serious effect of valproate treatment .
column2: chem* Valproate *chem - induced hyperammonemic encephalopathy is an uncommon but serious effect of chem* valproate *chem treatment .

column1: Here , we describe the case of a 15 - year - old girl who was on a long - term therapy with valproate due to epilepsy and revealed impaired consciousness with hyperammonemia 12 days after renal transplantation .
column2: Here , we describe the case of a 15 - year - old girl who was on a long - term therapy with chem* valproate *chem due to epilepsy and revealed impaired consciousness with hyperammonemia 12 days after renal transplantation .

column1: After withdraw of valproate , patients ' symptoms resolved within 24 h .
column2: After withdraw of chem* valproate *chem , patients ' symptoms resolved within 24 h .

column1: Clinicians should increase their awareness for potential complication of valproate , especially in transplanted patients .
column2: Clinicians should increase their awareness for potential complication of chem* valproate *chem , especially in transplanted patients .

column1: Necrotising fasciitis after bortezomib and dexamethasone - containing regimen in an elderly patient of Waldenstrom macroglobulinaemia .
column2: Necrotising fasciitis after chem* bortezomib *chem and chem* dexamethasone *chem - containing regimen in an elderly patient of Waldenstrom macroglobulinaemia .

column1: Bortezomib and high - dose dexamethasone - containing regimens are considered to be generally tolerable with few severe bacterial infections in patients with B - cell malignancies .
column2: chem* Bortezomib *chem and high - dose chem* dexamethasone *chem - containing regimens are considered to be generally tolerable with few severe bacterial infections in patients with B - cell malignancies .

column1: However , information is limited concerning the safety of the regimen in elderly patients .
column2: However , information is limited concerning the safety of the regimen in elderly patients .

column1: We report a case of a 76 - year - old man with Waldenstrom macroglobulinaemia who suffered necrotising fasciitis without neutropenia after the combination treatment with bortezomib , high - dose dexamethasone and rituximab .
column2: We report a case of a 76 - year - old man with Waldenstrom macroglobulinaemia who suffered necrotising fasciitis without neutropenia after the combination treatment with chem* bortezomib *chem , high - dose chem* dexamethasone *chem and rituximab .

column1: Despite immediate intravenous antimicrobial therapy , he succumbed 23 h after the onset .
column2: Despite immediate intravenous antimicrobial therapy , he succumbed 23 h after the onset .

column1: Physicians should recognise the possibility of fatal bacterial infections related to bortezomib plus high - dose dexamethasone in elderly patients , and we believe this case warrants further investigation .
column2: Physicians should recognise the possibility of fatal bacterial infections related to chem* bortezomib *chem plus high - dose chem* dexamethasone *chem in elderly patients , and we believe this case warrants further investigation .

column1: An integrated characterization of serological , pathological , and functional events in doxorubicin - induced cardiotoxicity .
column2: An integrated characterization of serological , pathological , and functional events in chem* doxorubicin *chem - induced cardiotoxicity .

column1: Many efficacious cancer treatments cause significant cardiac morbidity , yet biomarkers or functional indices of early damage , which would allow monitoring and intervention , are lacking .
column2: Many efficacious cancer treatments cause significant cardiac morbidity , yet biomarkers or functional indices of early damage , which would allow monitoring and intervention , are lacking .

column1: In this study , we have utilized a rat model of progressive doxorubicin ( DOX ) - induced cardiomyopathy , applying multiple approaches , including cardiac magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) , to provide the most comprehensive characterization to date of the timecourse of serological , pathological , and functional events underlying this toxicity .
column2: In this study , we have utilized a rat model of progressive chem* doxorubicin *chem ( chem* DOX *chem ) - induced cardiomyopathy , applying multiple approaches , including cardiac magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) , to provide the most comprehensive characterization to date of the timecourse of serological , pathological , and functional events underlying this toxicity .

column1: Hannover Wistar rats were dosed with 1 . 25 mg / kg DOX weekly for 8 weeks followed by a 4 week off - dosing " recovery " period .
column2: Hannover Wistar rats were dosed with 1 . 25 mg / kg chem* DOX *chem weekly for 8 weeks followed by a 4 week off - dosing " recovery " period .

column1: Electron microscopy of the myocardium revealed subcellular degeneration and marked mitochondrial changes after a single dose .
column2: Electron microscopy of the myocardium revealed subcellular degeneration and marked mitochondrial changes after a single dose .

column1: Histopathological analysis revealed progressive cardiomyocyte degeneration , hypertrophy / cytomegaly , and extensive vacuolation after two doses .
column2: Histopathological analysis revealed progressive cardiomyocyte degeneration , hypertrophy / cytomegaly , and extensive vacuolation after two doses .

column1: Extensive replacement fibrosis ( quantified by Sirius red staining ) developed during the off - dosing period .
column2: Extensive replacement fibrosis ( quantified by Sirius red staining ) developed during the off - dosing period .

column1: Functional indices assessed by cardiac MRI ( including left ventricular ejection fraction ( LVEF ) , cardiac output , and E / A ratio ) declined progressively , reaching statistical significance after two doses and culminating in " clinical " LV dysfunction by 12 weeks .
column2: Functional indices assessed by cardiac MRI ( including left ventricular ejection fraction ( LVEF ) , cardiac output , and E / A ratio ) declined progressively , reaching statistical significance after two doses and culminating in " clinical " LV dysfunction by 12 weeks .

column1: Significant increases in peak myocardial contrast enhancement and serological cardiac troponin I ( cTnI ) emerged after eight doses , importantly preceding the LVEF decline to < 50 % .
column2: Significant increases in peak myocardial contrast enhancement and serological cardiac troponin I ( cTnI ) emerged after eight doses , importantly preceding the LVEF decline to < 50 % .

column1: Troponin I levels positively correlated with delayed and peak gadolinium contrast enhancement , histopathological grading , and diastolic dysfunction .
column2: Troponin I levels positively correlated with delayed and peak chem* gadolinium *chem contrast enhancement , histopathological grading , and diastolic dysfunction .

column1: In summary , subcellular cardiomyocyte degeneration was the earliest marker , followed by progressive functional decline and histopathological manifestations .
column2: In summary , subcellular cardiomyocyte degeneration was the earliest marker , followed by progressive functional decline and histopathological manifestations .

column1: Myocardial contrast enhancement and elevations in cTnI occurred later .
column2: Myocardial contrast enhancement and elevations in cTnI occurred later .

column1: However , all indices predated " clinical " LV dysfunction and thus warrant further evaluation as predictive biomarkers .
column2: However , all indices predated " clinical " LV dysfunction and thus warrant further evaluation as predictive biomarkers .

column1: Intradermal glutamate and capsaicin injections : intra - and interindividual variability of provoked hyperalgesia and allodynia .
column2: Intradermal chem* glutamate *chem and chem* capsaicin *chem injections : intra - and interindividual variability of provoked hyperalgesia and allodynia .

column1: Intradermal injections of glutamate and capsaicin are attractive to use in human experimental pain models because hyperalgesia and allodynia mimic isolated aspects of clinical pain disorders .
column2: Intradermal injections of chem* glutamate *chem and chem* capsaicin *chem are attractive to use in human experimental pain models because hyperalgesia and allodynia mimic isolated aspects of clinical pain disorders .

column1: The aim of the present study was to investigate the reproducibility of these models .
column2: The aim of the present study was to investigate the reproducibility of these models .

column1: Twenty healthy male volunteers ( mean age 24 years ; range 18 - 38 years ) received intradermal injections of glutamate and capsaicin in the volar forearm .
column2: Twenty healthy male volunteers ( mean age 24 years ; range 18 - 38 years ) received intradermal injections of chem* glutamate *chem and chem* capsaicin *chem in the volar forearm .

column1: Magnitudes of secondary pinprick hyperalgesia and brush - evoked allodynia were investigated using von Frey filaments ( gauges 10 , 15 , 60 and 100 g ) and brush strokes .
column2: Magnitudes of secondary pinprick hyperalgesia and brush - evoked allodynia were investigated using von Frey filaments ( gauges 10 , 15 , 60 and 100 g ) and brush strokes .

column1: Areas of secondary hyperalgesia and allodynia were quantified immediately after injection and after 15 , 30 and 60 min .
column2: Areas of secondary hyperalgesia and allodynia were quantified immediately after injection and after 15 , 30 and 60 min .

column1: Two identical experiments separated by at least 7 days were performed .
column2: Two identical experiments separated by at least 7 days were performed .

column1: Reproducibility across and within volunteers ( inter - and intra - individual variation , respectively ) was assessed using intraclass correlation coefficient ( ICC ) and coefficient of variation ( CV ) .
column2: Reproducibility across and within volunteers ( inter - and intra - individual variation , respectively ) was assessed using intraclass correlation coefficient ( ICC ) and coefficient of variation ( CV ) .

column1: Secondary pinprick hyperalgesia was observed as a marked increase in the visual analogue scale ( VAS ) response to von Frey gauges 60 and 100 g ( P < 0 . 001 ) after glutamate injection .
column2: Secondary pinprick hyperalgesia was observed as a marked increase in the visual analogue scale ( VAS ) response to von Frey gauges 60 and 100 g ( P < 0 . 001 ) after chem* glutamate *chem injection .

column1: For capsaicin , secondary pinprick hyperalgesia was detected with all von Frey gauges ( P < 0 . 001 ) .
column2: For chem* capsaicin *chem , secondary pinprick hyperalgesia was detected with all von Frey gauges ( P < 0 . 001 ) .

column1: Glutamate evoked reproducible VAS response to all von Frey gauges ( ICC > 0 . 60 ) and brush strokes ( ICC > 0 . 83 ) .
column2: chem* Glutamate *chem evoked reproducible VAS response to all von Frey gauges ( ICC > 0 . 60 ) and brush strokes ( ICC > 0 . 83 ) .

column1: Capsaicin injection was reproducible for secondary hyperalgesia ( ICC > 0 . 70 ) and allodynia ( ICC > 0 . 71 ) .
column2: chem* Capsaicin *chem injection was reproducible for secondary hyperalgesia ( ICC > 0 . 70 ) and allodynia ( ICC > 0 . 71 ) .

column1: Intra - individual variability was generally lower for the VAS response to von Frey and brush compared with areas of secondary hyperalgesia and allodynia .
column2: Intra - individual variability was generally lower for the VAS response to von Frey and brush compared with areas of secondary hyperalgesia and allodynia .

column1: In conclusion , glutamate and capsaicin yield reproducible hyperalgesic and allodynic responses , and the present model is well suited for basic research , as well as for assessing the modulation of central phenomena .
column2: In conclusion , chem* glutamate *chem and chem* capsaicin *chem yield reproducible hyperalgesic and allodynic responses , and the present model is well suited for basic research , as well as for assessing the modulation of central phenomena .

column1: Ocular - specific ER stress reduction rescues glaucoma in murine glucocorticoid - induced glaucoma .
column2: Ocular - specific ER stress reduction rescues glaucoma in murine glucocorticoid - induced glaucoma .

column1: Administration of glucocorticoids induces ocular hypertension in some patients .
column2: Administration of glucocorticoids induces ocular hypertension in some patients .

column1: If untreated , these patients can develop a secondary glaucoma that resembles primary open - angle glaucoma ( POAG ) .
column2: If untreated , these patients can develop a secondary glaucoma that resembles primary open - angle glaucoma ( POAG ) .

column1: The underlying pathology of glucocorticoid - induced glaucoma is not fully understood , due in part to lack of an appropriate animal model .
column2: The underlying pathology of glucocorticoid - induced glaucoma is not fully understood , due in part to lack of an appropriate animal model .

column1: Here , we developed a murine model of glucocorticoid - induced glaucoma that exhibits glaucoma features that are observed in patients .
column2: Here , we developed a murine model of glucocorticoid - induced glaucoma that exhibits glaucoma features that are observed in patients .

column1: Treatment of WT mice with topical ocular 0 . 1 % dexamethasone led to elevation of intraocular pressure ( IOP ) , functional and structural loss of retinal ganglion cells , and axonal degeneration , resembling glucocorticoid - induced glaucoma in human patients .
column2: Treatment of WT mice with topical ocular 0 . 1 % chem* dexamethasone *chem led to elevation of intraocular pressure ( IOP ) , functional and structural loss of retinal ganglion cells , and axonal degeneration , resembling glucocorticoid - induced glaucoma in human patients .

column1: Furthermore , dexamethasone - induced ocular hypertension was associated with chronic ER stress of the trabecular meshwork ( TM ) .
column2: Furthermore , chem* dexamethasone *chem - induced ocular hypertension was associated with chronic ER stress of the trabecular meshwork ( TM ) .

column1: Similar to patients , withdrawal of dexamethasone treatment reduced elevated IOP and ER stress in this animal model .
column2: Similar to patients , withdrawal of chem* dexamethasone *chem treatment reduced elevated IOP and ER stress in this animal model .

column1: Dexamethasone induced the transcriptional factor CHOP , a marker for chronic ER stress , in the anterior segment tissues , and Chop deletion reduced ER stress in these tissues and prevented dexamethasone - induced ocular hypertension .
column2: chem* Dexamethasone *chem induced the transcriptional factor CHOP , a marker for chronic ER stress , in the anterior segment tissues , and Chop deletion reduced ER stress in these tissues and prevented chem* dexamethasone *chem - induced ocular hypertension .

column1: Furthermore , reduction of ER stress in the TM with sodium 4 - phenylbutyrate prevented dexamethasone - induced ocular hypertension in WT mice .
column2: Furthermore , reduction of ER stress in the TM with chem* sodium 4 - phenylbutyrate *chem prevented chem* dexamethasone *chem - induced ocular hypertension in WT mice .

column1: Our data indicate that ER stress contributes to glucocorticoid - induced ocular hypertension and suggest that reducing ER stress has potential as a therapeutic strategy for treating glucocorticoid - induced glaucoma .
column2: Our data indicate that ER stress contributes to glucocorticoid - induced ocular hypertension and suggest that reducing ER stress has potential as a therapeutic strategy for treating glucocorticoid - induced glaucoma .

column1: Effects of ginsenosides on opioid - induced hyperalgesia in mice .
column2: Effects of chem* ginsenosides *chem on opioid - induced hyperalgesia in mice .

column1: Opioid - induced hyperalgesia ( OIH ) is characterized by nociceptive sensitization caused by the cessation of chronic opioid use .
column2: Opioid - induced hyperalgesia ( OIH ) is characterized by nociceptive sensitization caused by the cessation of chronic opioid use .

column1: OIH can limit the clinical use of opioid analgesics and complicate withdrawal from opioid addiction .
column2: OIH can limit the clinical use of opioid analgesics and complicate withdrawal from opioid addiction .

column1: In this study , we investigated the effects of Re , Rg1 , and Rb1 ginsenosides , the bioactive components of ginseng , on OIH .
column2: In this study , we investigated the effects of chem* Re , Rg1 , and Rb1 ginsenosides *chem , the bioactive components of ginseng , on OIH .

column1: OIH was achieved in mice after subcutaneous administration of morphine for 7 consecutive days three times per day .
column2: OIH was achieved in mice after subcutaneous administration of chem* morphine *chem for 7 consecutive days three times per day .

column1: During withdrawal ( days 8 and 9 ) , these mice were administered Re , Rg1 , or Rb1 intragastrically two times per day .
column2: During withdrawal ( days 8 and 9 ) , these mice were administered chem* Re *chem , chem* Rg1 *chem , or chem* Rb1 *chem intragastrically two times per day .

column1: On the test day ( day 10 ) , mice were subjected to the thermal sensitivity test and the acetic acid - induced writhing test .
column2: On the test day ( day 10 ) , mice were subjected to the thermal sensitivity test and the chem* acetic acid *chem - induced writhing test .

column1: Re ( 300 mg / kg ) inhibited OIH in both the thermal sensitivity test and the acetic acid - induced writhing test .
column2: chem* Re *chem ( 300 mg / kg ) inhibited OIH in both the thermal sensitivity test and the chem* acetic acid *chem - induced writhing test .

column1: However , the Rg1 and Rb1 ginsenosides failed to prevent OIH in either test .
column2: However , the chem* Rg1 and Rb1 ginsenosides *chem failed to prevent OIH in either test .

column1: Furthermore , Rg1 showed a tendency to aggravate OIH in the acetic acid - induced writhing test .
column2: Furthermore , chem* Rg1 *chem showed a tendency to aggravate OIH in the chem* acetic acid *chem - induced writhing test .

column1: Our data suggested that the ginsenoside Re , but not Rg1 or Rb1 , may contribute toward reversal of OIH .
column2: Our data suggested that the chem* ginsenoside Re *chem , but not chem* Rg1 *chem or chem* Rb1 *chem , may contribute toward reversal of OIH .

column1: A comparison of severe hemodynamic disturbances between dexmedetomidine and propofol for sedation in neurocritical care patients .
column2: A comparison of severe hemodynamic disturbances between chem* dexmedetomidine *chem and chem* propofol *chem for sedation in neurocritical care patients .

column1: OBJECTIVE : Dexmedetomidine and propofol are commonly used sedatives in neurocritical care as they allow for frequent neurologic examinations .
column2: OBJECTIVE : chem* Dexmedetomidine *chem and chem* propofol *chem are commonly used sedatives in neurocritical care as they allow for frequent neurologic examinations .

column1: However , both agents are associated with significant hemodynamic side effects .
column2: However , both agents are associated with significant hemodynamic side effects .

column1: The primary objective of this study is to compare the prevalence of severe hemodynamic effects in neurocritical care patients receiving dexmedetomidine and propofol .
column2: The primary objective of this study is to compare the prevalence of severe hemodynamic effects in neurocritical care patients receiving chem* dexmedetomidine *chem and chem* propofol *chem .

column1: DESIGN : Multicenter , retrospective , propensity - matched cohort study .
column2: DESIGN : Multicenter , retrospective , propensity - matched cohort study .

column1: SETTING : Neurocritical care units at two academic medical centers with dedicated neurocritical care teams and board - certified neurointensivists .
column2: SETTING : Neurocritical care units at two academic medical centers with dedicated neurocritical care teams and board - certified neurointensivists .

column1: PATIENTS : Neurocritical care patients admitted between July 2009 and September 2012 were evaluated and then matched 1 : 1 based on propensity scoring of baseline characteristics .
column2: PATIENTS : Neurocritical care patients admitted between July 2009 and September 2012 were evaluated and then matched 1 : 1 based on propensity scoring of baseline characteristics .

column1: INTERVENTIONS : Continuous sedation with dexmedetomidine or propofol .
column2: INTERVENTIONS : Continuous sedation with chem* dexmedetomidine *chem or chem* propofol *chem .

column1: MEASUREMENTS AND MAIN RESULTS : A total of 342 patients ( 105 dexmedetomidine and 237 propofol ) were included in the analysis , with 190 matched ( 95 in each group ) by propensity score .
column2: MEASUREMENTS AND MAIN RESULTS : A total of 342 patients ( 105 chem* dexmedetomidine *chem and 237 chem* propofol *chem ) were included in the analysis , with 190 matched ( 95 in each group ) by propensity score .

column1: The primary outcome of this study was a composite of severe hypotension ( mean arterial pressure < 60 mm Hg ) and bradycardia ( heart rate < 50 beats / min ) during sedative infusion .
column2: The primary outcome of this study was a composite of severe hypotension ( mean arterial pressure < 60 mm Hg ) and bradycardia ( heart rate < 50 beats / min ) during sedative infusion .

column1: No difference in the primary composite outcome in both the unmatched ( 30 % vs 30 % , p = 0 . 94 ) or matched cohorts ( 28 % vs 34 % , p = 0 . 35 ) could be found .
column2: No difference in the primary composite outcome in both the unmatched ( 30 % vs 30 % , p = 0 . 94 ) or matched cohorts ( 28 % vs 34 % , p = 0 . 35 ) could be found .

column1: When analyzed separately , no differences could be found in the prevalence of severe hypotension or bradycardia in either the unmatched or matched cohorts .
column2: When analyzed separately , no differences could be found in the prevalence of severe hypotension or bradycardia in either the unmatched or matched cohorts .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Severe hypotension and bradycardia occur at similar prevalence in neurocritical care patients who receive dexmedetomidine or propofol .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Severe hypotension and bradycardia occur at similar prevalence in neurocritical care patients who receive chem* dexmedetomidine *chem or chem* propofol *chem .

column1: Providers should similarly consider the likelihood of hypotension or bradycardia before starting either sedative .
column2: Providers should similarly consider the likelihood of hypotension or bradycardia before starting either sedative .

column1: Use of argatroban and catheter - directed thrombolysis with alteplase in an oncology patient with heparin - induced thrombocytopenia with thrombosis .
column2: Use of chem* argatroban *chem and catheter - directed thrombolysis with alteplase in an oncology patient with chem* heparin *chem - induced thrombocytopenia with thrombosis .

column1: PURPOSE : The case of an oncology patient who developed heparin - induced thrombocytopenia with thrombosis ( HITT ) and was treated with argatroban plus catheter - directed thrombolysis ( CDT ) with alteplase is presented .
column2: PURPOSE : The case of an oncology patient who developed chem* heparin *chem - induced thrombocytopenia with thrombosis ( HITT ) and was treated with chem* argatroban *chem plus catheter - directed thrombolysis ( CDT ) with alteplase is presented .

column1: SUMMARY : A 63 - year - old Caucasian man with renal amyloidosis undergoing peripheral blood stem cell collection for an autologous stem cell transplant developed extensive bilateral upper - extremity deep venous thrombosis ( DVT ) and pulmonary embolism secondary to heparin - induced thrombocytopenia .
column2: SUMMARY : A 63 - year - old Caucasian man with renal amyloidosis undergoing peripheral blood stem cell collection for an autologous stem cell transplant developed extensive bilateral upper - extremity deep venous thrombosis ( DVT ) and pulmonary embolism secondary to chem* heparin *chem - induced thrombocytopenia .

column1: A continuous i . v . infusion of argatroban was initiated , and the patient was managed on the general medical floor .
column2: A continuous i . v . infusion of chem* argatroban *chem was initiated , and the patient was managed on the general medical floor .

column1: After one week of therapy , he was transferred to the intensive care unit with cardiopulmonary compromise related to superior vena cava ( SVC ) syndrome .
column2: After one week of therapy , he was transferred to the intensive care unit with cardiopulmonary compromise related to superior vena cava ( SVC ) syndrome .

column1: A percutaneous mechanical thrombectomy and CDT with alteplase were attempted , but the procedure was aborted due to epistaxis .
column2: A percutaneous mechanical thrombectomy and CDT with alteplase were attempted , but the procedure was aborted due to epistaxis .

column1: The epistaxis resolved the next day , and the patient was restarted on argatroban .
column2: The epistaxis resolved the next day , and the patient was restarted on chem* argatroban *chem .

column1: A second percutaneous mechanical thrombectomy was performed six days later and resulted in partial revascularization of the SVC and central veins .
column2: A second percutaneous mechanical thrombectomy was performed six days later and resulted in partial revascularization of the SVC and central veins .

column1: Postthrombectomy continuous CDT with alteplase was commenced while argatroban was withheld , and complete patency of the SVC and central veins was achieved after three days of therapy .
column2: Postthrombectomy continuous CDT with alteplase was commenced while chem* argatroban *chem was withheld , and complete patency of the SVC and central veins was achieved after three days of therapy .

column1: Alteplase was discontinued , and the patient was reinitiated on argatroban ; ultimately , he was transitioned to warfarin for long - term anticoagulation .
column2: Alteplase was discontinued , and the patient was reinitiated on chem* argatroban *chem ; ultimately , he was transitioned to chem* warfarin *chem for long - term anticoagulation .

column1: Although the patient recovered , he experienced permanent vision and hearing loss , as well as end - stage renal disease .
column2: Although the patient recovered , he experienced permanent vision and hearing loss , as well as end - stage renal disease .

column1: CONCLUSION : A 63 - year - old man with renal amyloidosis and SVC syndrome secondary to HITT was successfully treated with argatroban and CDT with alteplase .
column2: CONCLUSION : A 63 - year - old man with renal amyloidosis and SVC syndrome secondary to HITT was successfully treated with chem* argatroban *chem and CDT with alteplase .

column1: Effects of dehydroepiandrosterone in amphetamine - induced schizophrenia models in mice .
column2: Effects of chem* dehydroepiandrosterone *chem in chem* amphetamine *chem - induced schizophrenia models in mice .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To examine the effects of dehydroepiandrosterone ( DHEA ) on animal models of schizophrenia .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To examine the effects of chem* dehydroepiandrosterone *chem ( chem* DHEA *chem ) on animal models of schizophrenia .

column1: METHODS : Seventy Swiss albino female mice ( 25 - 35 g ) were divided into 4 groups : amphetamine - free ( control ) , amphetamine , 50 , and 100 mg / kg DHEA .
column2: METHODS : Seventy Swiss albino female mice ( 25 - 35 g ) were divided into 4 groups : chem* amphetamine *chem - free ( control ) , chem* amphetamine *chem , 50 , and 100 mg / kg chem* DHEA *chem .

column1: The DHEA was administered intraperitoneally ( ip ) for 5 days .
column2: The chem* DHEA *chem was administered intraperitoneally ( ip ) for 5 days .

column1: Amphetamine ( 3 mg / kg ip ) induced hyper locomotion , apomorphine ( 1 . 5 mg / kg subcutaneously [ sc ] ) induced climbing , and haloperidol ( 1 . 5 mg / kg sc ) induced catalepsy tests were used as animal models of schizophrenia .
column2: chem* Amphetamine *chem ( 3 mg / kg ip ) induced hyper locomotion , chem* apomorphine *chem ( 1 . 5 mg / kg subcutaneously [ sc ] ) induced climbing , and chem* haloperidol *chem ( 1 . 5 mg / kg sc ) induced catalepsy tests were used as animal models of schizophrenia .

column1: The study was conducted at the Animal Experiment Laboratories , Department of Pharmacology , Medical School , Eskisehir Osmangazi University , Eskisehir , Turkey between March and May 2012 .
column2: The study was conducted at the Animal Experiment Laboratories , Department of Pharmacology , Medical School , Eskisehir Osmangazi University , Eskisehir , Turkey between March and May 2012 .

column1: Statistical analysis was carried out using Kruskal - Wallis test for hyper locomotion , and one - way ANOVA for climbing and catalepsy tests .
column2: Statistical analysis was carried out using Kruskal - Wallis test for hyper locomotion , and one - way ANOVA for climbing and catalepsy tests .

column1: RESULTS : In the amphetamine - induced locomotion test , there were significant increases in all movements compared with the amphetamine - free group .
column2: RESULTS : In the chem* amphetamine *chem - induced locomotion test , there were significant increases in all movements compared with the chem* amphetamine *chem - free group .

column1: Both DHEA 50 mg / kg ( p < 0 . 05 ) , and 100 mg / kg ( p < 0 . 01 ) significantly decreased all movements compared with the amphetamine - induced locomotion group .
column2: Both chem* DHEA *chem 50 mg / kg ( p < 0 . 05 ) , and 100 mg / kg ( p < 0 . 01 ) significantly decreased all movements compared with the chem* amphetamine *chem - induced locomotion group .

column1: There was a significant difference between groups in the haloperidol - induced catalepsy test ( p < 0 . 05 ) .
column2: There was a significant difference between groups in the chem* haloperidol *chem - induced catalepsy test ( p < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: There was no significant difference between groups in terms of total climbing time in the apomorphine - induced climbing test ( p > 0 . 05 ) .
column2: There was no significant difference between groups in terms of total climbing time in the chem* apomorphine *chem - induced climbing test ( p > 0 . 05 ) .

column1: CONCLUSION : We observed that DHEA reduced locomotor activity and increased catalepsy at both doses , while it had no effect on climbing behavior .
column2: CONCLUSION : We observed that chem* DHEA *chem reduced locomotor activity and increased catalepsy at both doses , while it had no effect on climbing behavior .

column1: We suggest that DHEA displays typical neuroleptic - like effects , and may be used in the treatment of schizophrenia .
column2: We suggest that chem* DHEA *chem displays typical neuroleptic - like effects , and may be used in the treatment of schizophrenia .

column1: Availability of human induced pluripotent stem cell - derived cardiomyocytes in assessment of drug potential for QT prolongation .
column2: Availability of human induced pluripotent stem cell - derived cardiomyocytes in assessment of drug potential for QT prolongation .

column1: Field potential duration ( FPD ) in human - induced pluripotent stem cell - derived cardiomyocytes ( hiPS - CMs ) , which can express QT interval in an electrocardiogram , is reported to be a useful tool to predict K ( + ) channel and Ca ( 2 + ) channel blocker effects on QT interval .
column2: Field potential duration ( FPD ) in human - induced pluripotent stem cell - derived cardiomyocytes ( hiPS - CMs ) , which can express QT interval in an electrocardiogram , is reported to be a useful tool to predict chem* K *chem ( + ) channel and chem* Ca *chem ( 2 + ) channel blocker effects on QT interval .

column1: However , there is no report showing that this technique can be used to predict multichannel blocker potential for QT prolongation .
column2: However , there is no report showing that this technique can be used to predict multichannel blocker potential for QT prolongation .

column1: The aim of this study is to show that FPD from MEA ( Multielectrode array ) of hiPS - CMs can detect QT prolongation induced by multichannel blockers .
column2: The aim of this study is to show that FPD from MEA ( Multielectrode array ) of hiPS - CMs can detect QT prolongation induced by multichannel blockers .

column1: hiPS - CMs were seeded onto MEA and FPD was measured for 2min every 10min for 30min after drug exposure for the vehicle and each drug concentration .
column2: hiPS - CMs were seeded onto MEA and FPD was measured for 2min every 10min for 30min after drug exposure for the vehicle and each drug concentration .

column1: IKr and IKs blockers concentration - dependently prolonged corrected FPD ( FPDc ) , whereas Ca ( 2 + ) channel blockers concentration - dependently shortened FPDc .
column2: IKr and IKs blockers concentration - dependently prolonged corrected FPD ( FPDc ) , whereas chem* Ca *chem ( 2 + ) channel blockers concentration - dependently shortened FPDc .

column1: Also , the multichannel blockers Amiodarone , Paroxetine , Terfenadine and Citalopram prolonged FPDc in a concentration dependent manner .
column2: Also , the multichannel blockers chem* Amiodarone *chem , chem* Paroxetine *chem , chem* Terfenadine *chem and chem* Citalopram *chem prolonged FPDc in a concentration dependent manner .

column1: Finally , the IKr blockers , Terfenadine and Citalopram , which are reported to cause Torsade de Pointes ( TdP ) in clinical practice , produced early afterdepolarization ( EAD ) .
column2: Finally , the IKr blockers , chem* Terfenadine *chem and chem* Citalopram *chem , which are reported to cause Torsade de Pointes ( TdP ) in clinical practice , produced early afterdepolarization ( EAD ) .

column1: hiPS - CMs using MEA system and FPDc can predict the effects of drug candidates on QT interval .
column2: hiPS - CMs using MEA system and FPDc can predict the effects of drug candidates on QT interval .

column1: This study also shows that this assay can help detect EAD for drugs with TdP potential .
column2: This study also shows that this assay can help detect EAD for drugs with TdP potential .

column1: Dermal developmental toxicity of N - phenylimide herbicides in rats .
column2: Dermal developmental toxicity of N - phenylimide herbicides in rats .

column1: BACKGROUND : S - 53482 and S - 23121 are N - phenylimide herbicides and produced embryolethality , teratogenicity ( mainly ventricular septal defects and wavy ribs ) , and growth retardation in rats in conventional oral developmental toxicity studies .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* S - 53482 *chem and chem* S - 23121 *chem are N - phenylimide herbicides and produced embryolethality , teratogenicity ( mainly ventricular septal defects and wavy ribs ) , and growth retardation in rats in conventional oral developmental toxicity studies .

column1: Our objective in this study was to investigate whether the compounds induce developmental toxicity via the dermal route , which is more relevant to occupational exposure , hence better addressing human health risks .
column2: Our objective in this study was to investigate whether the compounds induce developmental toxicity via the dermal route , which is more relevant to occupational exposure , hence better addressing human health risks .

column1: METHODS : S - 53482 was administered dermally to rats at 30 , 100 , and 300 mg / kg during organogenesis , and S - 23121 was administered at 200 , 400 , and 800 mg / kg ( the maximum applicable dose level ) .
column2: METHODS : chem* S - 53482 *chem was administered dermally to rats at 30 , 100 , and 300 mg / kg during organogenesis , and chem* S - 23121 *chem was administered at 200 , 400 , and 800 mg / kg ( the maximum applicable dose level ) .

column1: Fetuses were obtained by a Cesarean section and examined for external , visceral , and skeletal alterations .
column2: Fetuses were obtained by a Cesarean section and examined for external , visceral , and skeletal alterations .

column1: RESULTS : Dermal exposure of rats to S - 53482 at 300 mg / kg produced patterns of developmental toxicity similar to those resulting from oral exposure .
column2: RESULTS : Dermal exposure of rats to chem* S - 53482 *chem at 300 mg / kg produced patterns of developmental toxicity similar to those resulting from oral exposure .

column1: Toxicity included embryolethality , teratogenicity , and growth retardation .
column2: Toxicity included embryolethality , teratogenicity , and growth retardation .

column1: Dermal administration of S - 23121 at 800 mg / kg resulted in an increased incidence of embryonic death and ventricular septal defect , but retarded fetal growth was not observed as it was following oral exposure to S - 23121 .
column2: Dermal administration of chem* S - 23121 *chem at 800 mg / kg resulted in an increased incidence of embryonic death and ventricular septal defect , but retarded fetal growth was not observed as it was following oral exposure to chem* S - 23121 *chem .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Based on the results , S - 53482 and S - 23121 were teratogenic when administered dermally to pregnant rats as were the compounds administered orally .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Based on the results , chem* S - 53482 *chem and chem* S - 23121 *chem were teratogenic when administered dermally to pregnant rats as were the compounds administered orally .

column1: Thus , investigation of the mechanism and its human relevancy become more important .
column2: Thus , investigation of the mechanism and its human relevancy become more important .

column1: Rates of Renal Toxicity in Cancer Patients Receiving Cisplatin With and Without Mannitol .
column2: Rates of Renal Toxicity in Cancer Patients Receiving chem* Cisplatin *chem With and Without chem* Mannitol *chem .

column1: BACKGROUND : Cisplatin is a widely used antineoplastic .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* Cisplatin *chem is a widely used antineoplastic .

column1: One of the major complications of cisplatin use is dose - limiting nephrotoxicity .
column2: One of the major complications of chem* cisplatin *chem use is dose - limiting nephrotoxicity .

column1: There are many strategies to prevent this toxicity , including the use of mannitol as a nephroprotectant in combination with hydration .
column2: There are many strategies to prevent this toxicity , including the use of chem* mannitol *chem as a nephroprotectant in combination with hydration .

column1: OBJECTIVE : We aimed to evaluate the rates of cisplatin - induced nephrotoxicity in cancer patients receiving single - agent cisplatin with and without mannitol .
column2: OBJECTIVE : We aimed to evaluate the rates of chem* cisplatin *chem - induced nephrotoxicity in cancer patients receiving single - agent chem* cisplatin *chem with and without chem* mannitol *chem .

column1: METHODS : This single - center retrospective analysis was a quasi experiment created by the national mannitol shortage .
column2: METHODS : This single - center retrospective analysis was a quasi experiment created by the national chem* mannitol *chem shortage .

column1: Data were collected on adult cancer patients receiving single - agent cisplatin as an outpatient from January 2011 to September 2012 .
column2: Data were collected on adult cancer patients receiving single - agent chem* cisplatin *chem as an outpatient from January 2011 to September 2012 .

column1: The primary outcome was acute kidney injury ( AKI ) .
column2: The primary outcome was acute kidney injury ( AKI ) .

column1: RESULTS : We evaluated 143 patients who received single - agent cisplatin ; 97 . 2 % of patients had head and neck cancer as their primary malignancy .
column2: RESULTS : We evaluated 143 patients who received single - agent chem* cisplatin *chem ; 97 . 2 % of patients had head and neck cancer as their primary malignancy .

column1: Patients who did not receive mannitol were more likely to develop nephrotoxicity : odds ratio [ OR ] = 2 . 646 ( 95 % CI = 1 . 008 , 6 . 944 ; P = 0 . 048 ) .
column2: Patients who did not receive chem* mannitol *chem were more likely to develop nephrotoxicity : odds ratio [ OR ] = 2 . 646 ( 95 % CI = 1 . 008 , 6 . 944 ; P = 0 . 048 ) .

column1: Patients who received the 100 mg / m ( 2 ) dosing and patients who had a history of hypertension also had a higher likelihood of developing nephrotoxicity : OR = 11 . 494 ( 95 % CI = 4 . 149 , 32 . 258 ; P < 0 . 0001 ) and OR = 3 . 219 ( 95 % CI = 1 . 228 , 8 . 439 ; P = 0 . 017 ) , respectively .
column2: Patients who received the 100 mg / m ( 2 ) dosing and patients who had a history of hypertension also had a higher likelihood of developing nephrotoxicity : OR = 11 . 494 ( 95 % CI = 4 . 149 , 32 . 258 ; P < 0 . 0001 ) and OR = 3 . 219 ( 95 % CI = 1 . 228 , 8 . 439 ; P = 0 . 017 ) , respectively .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : When limited quantities of mannitol are available , it should preferentially be given to patients at particularly high risk of nephrotoxicity .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : When limited quantities of chem* mannitol *chem are available , it should preferentially be given to patients at particularly high risk of nephrotoxicity .

column1: Our analysis suggests that those patients receiving the dosing schedule of 100 mg / m ( 2 ) cisplatin every 3 weeks and those with hypertension are at the greatest risk of nephrotoxicity and would benefit from the addition of mannitol .
column2: Our analysis suggests that those patients receiving the dosing schedule of 100 mg / m ( 2 ) chem* cisplatin *chem every 3 weeks and those with hypertension are at the greatest risk of nephrotoxicity and would benefit from the addition of chem* mannitol *chem .

column1: Metformin protects against seizures , learning and memory impairments and oxidative damage induced by pentylenetetrazole - induced kindling in mice .
column2: chem* Metformin *chem protects against seizures , learning and memory impairments and oxidative damage induced by chem* pentylenetetrazole *chem - induced kindling in mice .

column1: Cognitive impairment , the most common and severe comorbidity of epilepsy , greatly diminishes the quality of life .
column2: Cognitive impairment , the most common and severe comorbidity of epilepsy , greatly diminishes the quality of life .

column1: However , current therapeutic interventions for epilepsy can also cause untoward cognitive effects .
column2: However , current therapeutic interventions for epilepsy can also cause untoward cognitive effects .

column1: Thus , there is an urgent need for new kinds of agents targeting both seizures and cognition deficits .
column2: Thus , there is an urgent need for new kinds of agents targeting both seizures and cognition deficits .

column1: Oxidative stress is considered to play an important role in epileptogenesis and cognitive deficits , and antioxidants have a putative antiepileptic potential .
column2: Oxidative stress is considered to play an important role in epileptogenesis and cognitive deficits , and antioxidants have a putative antiepileptic potential .

column1: Metformin , the most commonly prescribed antidiabetic oral drug , has antioxidant properties .
column2: chem* Metformin *chem , the most commonly prescribed antidiabetic oral drug , has antioxidant properties .

column1: This study was designed to evaluate the ameliorative effects of metformin on seizures , cognitive impairment and brain oxidative stress markers observed in pentylenetetrazole - induced kindling animals .
column2: This study was designed to evaluate the ameliorative effects of chem* metformin *chem on seizures , cognitive impairment and brain oxidative stress markers observed in chem* pentylenetetrazole *chem - induced kindling animals .

column2: Male C57BL / 6 mice were administered with subconvulsive dose of chem* pentylenetetrazole *chem ( 37 mg / kg , i . p . ) every other day for 14 injections .

column1: Metformin was injected intraperitoneally in dose of 200mg / kg along with alternate - day PTZ .
column2: chem* Metformin *chem was injected intraperitoneally in dose of 200mg / kg along with alternate - day chem* PTZ *chem .

column1: We found that metformin suppressed the progression of kindling , ameliorated the cognitive impairment and decreased brain oxidative stress .
column2: We found that chem* metformin *chem suppressed the progression of kindling , ameliorated the cognitive impairment and decreased brain oxidative stress .

column1: Thus the present study concluded that metformin may be a potential agent for the treatment of epilepsy as well as a protective medicine against cognitive impairment induced by seizures .
column2: Thus the present study concluded that chem* metformin *chem may be a potential agent for the treatment of epilepsy as well as a protective medicine against cognitive impairment induced by seizures .

column1: P53 inhibition exacerbates late - stage anthracycline cardiotoxicity .
column2: P53 inhibition exacerbates late - stage chem* anthracycline *chem cardiotoxicity .

column1: AIMS : Doxorubicin ( DOX ) is an effective anti - cancer therapeutic , but is associated with both acute and late - stage cardiotoxicity .
column2: AIMS : chem* Doxorubicin *chem ( chem* DOX *chem ) is an effective anti - cancer therapeutic , but is associated with both acute and late - stage cardiotoxicity .

column1: Children are particularly sensitive to DOX - induced heart failure .
column2: Children are particularly sensitive to chem* DOX *chem - induced heart failure .

column1: Here , the impact of p53 inhibition on acute vs . late - stage DOX cardiotoxicity was examined in a juvenile model .
column2: Here , the impact of p53 inhibition on acute vs . late - stage chem* DOX *chem cardiotoxicity was examined in a juvenile model .

column1: METHODS AND RESULTS : Two - week - old MHC - CB7 mice ( which express dominant - interfering p53 in cardiomyocytes ) and their non - transgenic ( NON - TXG ) littermates received weekly DOX injections for 5 weeks ( 25 mg / kg cumulative dose ) .
column2: METHODS AND RESULTS : Two - week - old MHC - CB7 mice ( which express dominant - interfering p53 in cardiomyocytes ) and their non - transgenic ( NON - TXG ) littermates received weekly chem* DOX *chem injections for 5 weeks ( 25 mg / kg cumulative dose ) .

column1: One week after the last DOX treatment ( acute stage ) , MHC - CB7 mice exhibited improved cardiac function and lower levels of cardiomyocyte apoptosis when compared with the NON - TXG mice .
column2: One week after the last chem* DOX *chem treatment ( acute stage ) , MHC - CB7 mice exhibited improved cardiac function and lower levels of cardiomyocyte apoptosis when compared with the NON - TXG mice .

column1: Surprisingly , by 13 weeks following the last DOX treatment ( late stage ) , MHC - CB7 exhibited a progressive decrease in cardiac function and higher rates of cardiomyocyte apoptosis when compared with NON - TXG mice .
column2: Surprisingly , by 13 weeks following the last chem* DOX *chem treatment ( late stage ) , MHC - CB7 exhibited a progressive decrease in cardiac function and higher rates of cardiomyocyte apoptosis when compared with NON - TXG mice .

column1: p53 inhibition blocked transient DOX - induced STAT3 activation in MHC - CB7 mice , which was associated with enhanced induction of the DNA repair proteins Ku70 and Ku80 .
column2: p53 inhibition blocked transient chem* DOX *chem - induced STAT3 activation in MHC - CB7 mice , which was associated with enhanced induction of the DNA repair proteins Ku70 and Ku80 .

column1: Mice with cardiomyocyte - restricted deletion of STAT3 exhibited worse cardiac function , higher levels of cardiomyocyte apoptosis , and a greater induction of Ku70 and Ku80 in response to DOX treatment during the acute stage when compared with control animals .
column2: Mice with cardiomyocyte - restricted deletion of STAT3 exhibited worse cardiac function , higher levels of cardiomyocyte apoptosis , and a greater induction of Ku70 and Ku80 in response to chem* DOX *chem treatment during the acute stage when compared with control animals .

column1: CONCLUSION : These data support a model wherein a p53 - dependent cardioprotective pathway , mediated via STAT3 activation , mitigates DOX - induced myocardial stress during drug delivery .
column2: CONCLUSION : These data support a model wherein a p53 - dependent cardioprotective pathway , mediated via STAT3 activation , mitigates chem* DOX *chem - induced myocardial stress during drug delivery .

column1: Furthermore , these data suggest an explanation as to how p53 inhibition can result in cardioprotection during drug treatment and , paradoxically , enhanced cardiotoxicity long after the cessation of drug treatment .
column2: Furthermore , these data suggest an explanation as to how p53 inhibition can result in cardioprotection during drug treatment and , paradoxically , enhanced cardiotoxicity long after the cessation of drug treatment .

column1: Aconitine is a major bioactive diterpenoid alkaloid with high content derived from herbal aconitum plants .

column1: In this study , we explored the importance of pathological Ca ( 2 + ) signaling in aconitine poisoning in vitro and in vivo .
column2: In this study , we explored the importance of pathological chem* Ca *chem ( 2 + ) signaling in chem* aconitine *chem poisoning in vitro and in vivo .

column1: We found that Ca ( 2 + ) overload lead to accelerated beating rhythm in adult rat ventricular myocytes and caused arrhythmia in conscious freely moving rats .
column2: We found that chem* Ca *chem ( 2 + ) overload lead to accelerated beating rhythm in adult rat ventricular myocytes and caused arrhythmia in conscious freely moving rats .

column1: To investigate effects of aconitine on myocardial injury , we performed cytotoxicity assay in neonatal rat ventricular myocytes ( NRVMs ) , as well as measured lactate dehydrogenase level in the culture medium of NRVMs and activities of serum cardiac enzymes in rats .

column2: To confirm the pro - apoptotic effects , we performed flow cytometric detection , cardiac histology , transmission electron microscopy and terminal deoxynucleotidyl transferase - mediated chem* dUTP *chem - chem* biotin *chem nick end labeling assay .

column1: The results showed that aconitine stimulated apoptosis time - dependently .
column2: The results showed that chem* aconitine *chem stimulated apoptosis time - dependently .

column2: Furthermore , increased phosphorylation of MAPK family members , especially the P - P38 / P38 ratio was found in cardiac tissues .

column1: Standard operating procedures for antibiotic therapy and the occurrence of acute kidney injury : a prospective , clinical , non - interventional , observational study .
column2: Standard operating procedures for antibiotic therapy and the occurrence of acute kidney injury : a prospective , clinical , non - interventional , observational study .

column1: INTRODUCTION : Acute kidney injury ( AKI ) occurs in 7 % of hospitalized and 66 % of Intensive Care Unit ( ICU ) patients .
column2: INTRODUCTION : Acute kidney injury ( AKI ) occurs in 7 % of hospitalized and 66 % of Intensive Care Unit ( ICU ) patients .

column1: It increases mortality , hospital length of stay , and costs .
column2: It increases mortality , hospital length of stay , and costs .

column1: The aim of this study was to investigate , whether there is an association between adherence to guidelines ( standard operating procedures ( SOP ) ) for potentially nephrotoxic antibiotics and the occurrence of AKI .
column2: The aim of this study was to investigate , whether there is an association between adherence to guidelines ( standard operating procedures ( SOP ) ) for potentially nephrotoxic antibiotics and the occurrence of AKI .

column1: METHODS : This study was carried out as a prospective , clinical , non - interventional , observational study .
column2: METHODS : This study was carried out as a prospective , clinical , non - interventional , observational study .

column1: Data collection was performed over a total of 170 days in three ICUs at Charite - Universitaetsmedizin Berlin .
column2: Data collection was performed over a total of 170 days in three ICUs at Charite - Universitaetsmedizin Berlin .

column1: A total of 675 patients were included ; 163 of these had therapy with vancomycin , gentamicin , or tobramycin ; were > 18 years ; and treated in the ICU for > 24 hours .
column2: A total of 675 patients were included ; 163 of these had therapy with chem* vancomycin *chem , chem* gentamicin *chem , or chem* tobramycin *chem ; were > 18 years ; and treated in the ICU for > 24 hours .

column1: Patients with an adherence to SOP > 70 % were classified into the high adherence group ( HAG ) and patients with an adherence of < 70 % into the low adherence group ( LAG ) .
column2: Patients with an adherence to SOP > 70 % were classified into the high adherence group ( HAG ) and patients with an adherence of < 70 % into the low adherence group ( LAG ) .

column1: AKI was defined according to RIFLE criteria .
column2: AKI was defined according to RIFLE criteria .

column1: Adherence to SOPs was evaluated by retrospective expert audit .
column2: Adherence to SOPs was evaluated by retrospective expert audit .

column1: Development of AKI was compared between groups with exact Chi2 - test and multivariate logistic regression analysis ( two - sided P < 0 . 05 ) .
column2: Development of AKI was compared between groups with exact Chi2 - test and multivariate logistic regression analysis ( two - sided P < 0 . 05 ) .

column1: RESULTS : LAG consisted of 75 patients ( 46 % ) versus 88 HAG patients ( 54 % ) .
column2: RESULTS : LAG consisted of 75 patients ( 46 % ) versus 88 HAG patients ( 54 % ) .

column1: AKI occurred significantly more often in LAG with 36 % versus 21 % in HAG ( P = 0 . 035 ) .
column2: AKI occurred significantly more often in LAG with 36 % versus 21 % in HAG ( P = 0 . 035 ) .

column1: Basic characteristics were comparable , except an increased rate of soft tissue infections in LAG .
column2: Basic characteristics were comparable , except an increased rate of soft tissue infections in LAG .

column1: Multivariate analysis revealed an odds ratio of 2 . 5 - fold for LAG to develop AKI compared with HAG ( 95 % confidence interval 1 . 195 to 5 . 124 , P = 0 . 039 ) .
column2: Multivariate analysis revealed an odds ratio of 2 . 5 - fold for LAG to develop AKI compared with HAG ( 95 % confidence interval 1 . 195 to 5 . 124 , P = 0 . 039 ) .

column1: CONCLUSION : Low adherence to SOPs for potentially nephrotoxic antibiotics was associated with a higher occurrence of AKI .
column2: CONCLUSION : Low adherence to SOPs for potentially nephrotoxic antibiotics was associated with a higher occurrence of AKI .

column1: Protocols of conversion from cyclosporin A ( CsA ) to sirolimus ( SRL ) have been widely used in immunotherapy after transplantation to prevent CsA - induced nephropathy , but the molecular mechanisms underlying these protocols remain nuclear .

column1: Optimal precurarizing dose of rocuronium to decrease fasciculation and myalgia following succinylcholine administration .

column1: BACKGROUND : Succinylcholine commonly produces frequent adverse effects , including muscle fasciculation and myalgia .
column2: BACKGROUND : chem* Succinylcholine *chem commonly produces frequent adverse effects , including muscle fasciculation and myalgia .

column1: The current study identified the optimal dose of rocuronium to prevent succinylcholine - induced fasciculation and myalgia and evaluated the influence of rocuronium on the speed of onset produced by succinylcholine .
column2: The current study identified the optimal dose of chem* rocuronium *chem to prevent chem* succinylcholine *chem - induced fasciculation and myalgia and evaluated the influence of chem* rocuronium *chem on the speed of onset produced by chem* succinylcholine *chem .

column1: METHODS : This randomized , double - blinded study was conducted in 100 patients randomly allocated into five groups of 20 patients each .
column2: METHODS : This randomized , double - blinded study was conducted in 100 patients randomly allocated into five groups of 20 patients each .

column1: Patients were randomized to receive 0 . 02 , 0 . 03 , 0 . 04 , 0 . 05 and 0 . 06 mg / kg rocuronium as a precurarizing dose .
column2: Patients were randomized to receive 0 . 02 , 0 . 03 , 0 . 04 , 0 . 05 and 0 . 06 mg / kg chem* rocuronium *chem as a precurarizing dose .

column1: Neuromuscular monitoring after each precurarizing dose was recorded from the adductor pollicis muscle using acceleromyography with train - of - four stimulation of the ulnar nerve .
column2: Neuromuscular monitoring after each precurarizing dose was recorded from the adductor pollicis muscle using acceleromyography with train - of - four stimulation of the ulnar nerve .

column1: All patients received succinylcholine 1 . 5 mg / kg at 2 minutes after the precurarization , and were assessed the incidence and severity of fasciculations , while myalgia was assessed at 24 hours after surgery .
column2: All patients received chem* succinylcholine *chem 1 . 5 mg / kg at 2 minutes after the precurarization , and were assessed the incidence and severity of fasciculations , while myalgia was assessed at 24 hours after surgery .

column1: RESULTS : The incidence and severity of visible muscle fasciculation was significantly less with increasing the amount of precurarizing dose of rocuronium ( P < 0 . 001 ) .
column2: RESULTS : The incidence and severity of visible muscle fasciculation was significantly less with increasing the amount of precurarizing dose of chem* rocuronium *chem ( P < 0 . 001 ) .

column1: Those of myalgia tend to decrease according to increasing the amount of precurarizing dose of rocuronium , but there was no significance ( P = 0 . 072 ) .
column2: Those of myalgia tend to decrease according to increasing the amount of precurarizing dose of chem* rocuronium *chem , but there was no significance ( P = 0 . 072 ) .

column1: The onset time of succinylcholine was significantly longer with increasing the amount of precurarizing dose of rocuronium ( P < 0 . 001 ) .
column2: The onset time of chem* succinylcholine *chem was significantly longer with increasing the amount of precurarizing dose of chem* rocuronium *chem ( P < 0 . 001 ) .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Precurarization with 0 . 04 mg / kg rocuronium was the optimal dose considering the reduction in the incidence and severity of fasciculation and myalgia with acceptable onset time , and the safe and effective precurarization .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Precurarization with 0 . 04 mg / kg chem* rocuronium *chem was the optimal dose considering the reduction in the incidence and severity of fasciculation and myalgia with acceptable onset time , and the safe and effective precurarization .

column1: Anticonvulsant actions of MK - 801 on the lithium - pilocarpine model of status epilepticus in rats .
column2: Anticonvulsant actions of chem* MK - 801 *chem on the chem* lithium *chem - chem* pilocarpine *chem model of status epilepticus in rats .

column1: MK - 801 , a noncompetitive N - methyl - D - aspartate ( NMDA ) receptor antagonist , was tested for anticonvulsant effects in rats using two seizure models , coadministration of lithium and pilocarpine and administration of a high dose of pilocarpine alone .
column2: chem* MK - 801 *chem , a noncompetitive chem* N - methyl - D - aspartate *chem ( chem* NMDA *chem ) receptor antagonist , was tested for anticonvulsant effects in rats using two seizure models , coadministration of chem* lithium *chem and chem* pilocarpine *chem and administration of a high dose of chem* pilocarpine *chem alone .

column1: Three major results are reported .
column2: Three major results are reported .

column1: First , pretreatment with MK - 801 produced an effective and dose - dependent anticonvulsant action with the lithium - pilocarpine model but not with rats treated with pilocarpine alone , suggesting that different biochemical mechanisms control seizures in these two models .
column2: First , pretreatment with chem* MK - 801 *chem produced an effective and dose - dependent anticonvulsant action with the chem* lithium *chem - chem* pilocarpine *chem model but not with rats treated with chem* pilocarpine *chem alone , suggesting that different biochemical mechanisms control seizures in these two models .

column1: Second , the anticonvulsant effect of MK - 801 in the lithium - pilocarpine model only occurred after initial periods of seizure activity .
column2: Second , the anticonvulsant effect of chem* MK - 801 *chem in the chem* lithium *chem - chem* pilocarpine *chem model only occurred after initial periods of seizure activity .

column1: This observation is suggested to be an in vivo demonstration of the conclusion derived from in vitro experiments that MK - 801 binding requires agonist - induced opening of the channel sites of the NMDA receptor .
column2: This observation is suggested to be an in vivo demonstration of the conclusion derived from in vitro experiments that chem* MK - 801 *chem binding requires agonist - induced opening of the channel sites of the chem* NMDA *chem receptor .

column1: Third , although it is relatively easy to block seizures induced by lithium and pilocarpine by administration of anticonvulsants prior to pilocarpine , it is more difficult to terminate ongoing status epilepticus and block the lethality of the seizures .
column2: Third , although it is relatively easy to block seizures induced by chem* lithium *chem and chem* pilocarpine *chem by administration of anticonvulsants prior to chem* pilocarpine *chem , it is more difficult to terminate ongoing status epilepticus and block the lethality of the seizures .

column1: Administration of MK - 801 30 or 60 min after pilocarpine , i . e . , during status epilepticus , gradually reduced electrical and behavioral seizure activity and greatly enhanced the survival rate .
column2: Administration of chem* MK - 801 *chem 30 or 60 min after chem* pilocarpine *chem , i . e . , during status epilepticus , gradually reduced electrical and behavioral seizure activity and greatly enhanced the survival rate .

column1: These results suggest that activation of NMDA receptors plays an important role in status epilepticus and brain damage in the lithium - pilocarpine model .
column2: These results suggest that activation of chem* NMDA *chem receptors plays an important role in status epilepticus and brain damage in the chem* lithium *chem - chem* pilocarpine *chem model .

column1: This was further supported by results showing that nonconvulsive doses of NMDA and pilocarpine were synergistic , resulting in status epilepticus and subsequent mortality .
column2: This was further supported by results showing that nonconvulsive doses of chem* NMDA *chem and chem* pilocarpine *chem were synergistic , resulting in status epilepticus and subsequent mortality .

column1: There were 125 infectious episodes in 116 cancer patients receiving myelosuppressive chemotherapy .
column2: There were 125 infectious episodes in 116 cancer patients receiving myelosuppressive chemotherapy .

column2: The overall cure rate was 70 % .

column1: Pneumonia was the most common infection and 61 % of 59 episodes were cured .
column2: Pneumonia was the most common infection and 61 % of 59 episodes were cured .

column1: Gram - negative bacilli were the most common causative organisms and 69 % of these infections were cured .
column2: Gram - negative bacilli were the most common causative organisms and 69 % of these infections were cured .

column2: The most common pathogen was Klebsiella pneumoniae and this , together with Escherichia coli and Pseudomonas aeruginosa , accounted for 74 % of all gram - negative bacillary infections .

column1: However , failure of the neutrophil count to increase during therapy adversely affected response .
column2: However , failure of the neutrophil count to increase during therapy adversely affected response .

column1: Azotemia was the major side effect recognized , and it occurred in 11 % of episodes .
column2: Azotemia was the major side effect recognized , and it occurred in 11 % of episodes .

column2: Major azotemia ( serum chem* creatinine *chem greater than 2 . 5 mg / dl or BUN greater than 50 mg / dl ) occurred in only 2 % .

column1: Incidence of solid tumours among pesticide applicators exposed to the organophosphate insecticide diazinon in the Agricultural Health Study : an updated analysis .

column1: OBJECTIVE : Diazinon , a common organophosphate insecticide with genotoxic properties , was previously associated with lung cancer in the Agricultural Health Study ( AHS ) cohort , but few other epidemiological studies have examined diazinon - associated cancer risk .
column2: OBJECTIVE : chem* Diazinon *chem , a common chem* organophosphate *chem insecticide with genotoxic properties , was previously associated with lung cancer in the Agricultural Health Study ( AHS ) cohort , but few other epidemiological studies have examined chem* diazinon *chem - associated cancer risk .

column1: We used updated diazinon exposure and cancer incidence information to evaluate solid tumour risk in the AHS .
column2: We used updated chem* diazinon *chem exposure and cancer incidence information to evaluate solid tumour risk in the AHS .

column1: METHODS : Male pesticide applicators in Iowa and North Carolina reported lifetime diazinon use at enrolment ( 1993 - 1997 ) and follow - up ( 1998 - 2005 ) ; cancer incidence was assessed through 2010 ( North Carolina ) / 2011 ( Iowa ) .
column2: METHODS : Male pesticide applicators in Iowa and North Carolina reported lifetime chem* diazinon *chem use at enrolment ( 1993 - 1997 ) and follow - up ( 1998 - 2005 ) ; cancer incidence was assessed through 2010 ( North Carolina ) / 2011 ( Iowa ) .

column1: Among applicators with usage information sufficient to evaluate exposure - response patterns , we used Poisson regression to estimate adjusted rate ratios ( RRs ) and 95 % CI for cancer sites with > 10 exposed cases for both lifetime ( LT ) exposure days and intensity - weighted ( IW ) lifetime exposure days ( accounting for factors impacting exposure ) .
column2: Among applicators with usage information sufficient to evaluate exposure - response patterns , we used Poisson regression to estimate adjusted rate ratios ( RRs ) and 95 % CI for cancer sites with > 10 exposed cases for both lifetime ( LT ) exposure days and intensity - weighted ( IW ) lifetime exposure days ( accounting for factors impacting exposure ) .

column1: RESULTS : We observed elevated lung cancer risks ( N = 283 ) among applicators with the greatest number of LT ( RR = 1 . 60 ; 95 % CI 1 . 11 to 2 . 31 ; Ptrend = 0 . 02 ) and IW days of diazinon use ( RR = 1 . 41 ; 95 % CI 0 . 98 to 2 . 04 ; Ptrend = 0 . 08 ) .
column2: RESULTS : We observed elevated lung cancer risks ( N = 283 ) among applicators with the greatest number of LT ( RR = 1 . 60 ; 95 % CI 1 . 11 to 2 . 31 ; Ptrend = 0 . 02 ) and IW days of chem* diazinon *chem use ( RR = 1 . 41 ; 95 % CI 0 . 98 to 2 . 04 ; Ptrend = 0 . 08 ) .

column1: Kidney cancer ( N = 94 ) risks were non - significantly elevated ( RRLT days = 1 . 77 ; 95 % CI 0 . 90 to 3 . 51 ; Ptrend = 0 . 09 ; RRIW days 1 . 37 ; 95 % CI 0 . 64 to 2 . 92 ; Ptrend = 0 . 50 ) , as were risks for aggressive prostate cancer ( N = 656 ) .
column2: Kidney cancer ( N = 94 ) risks were non - significantly elevated ( RRLT days = 1 . 77 ; 95 % CI 0 . 90 to 3 . 51 ; Ptrend = 0 . 09 ; RRIW days 1 . 37 ; 95 % CI 0 . 64 to 2 . 92 ; Ptrend = 0 . 50 ) , as were risks for aggressive prostate cancer ( N = 656 ) .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Our updated evaluation of diazinon provides additional evidence of an association with lung cancer risk .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Our updated evaluation of chem* diazinon *chem provides additional evidence of an association with lung cancer risk .

column2: Daily predicted pollutant concentrations were used to derive surrogates of long - term exposure and link them to study participants ' geocoded addresses .

column1: RESULTS : We observed positive associations of Parkinson ' s disease with ozone ( odds ratio = 1 . 39 ; 95 % CI : 0 . 98 to 1 . 98 ) and fine particulate matter ( odds ratio = 1 . 34 ; 95 % CI : 0 . 93 to 1 . 93 ) in North Carolina but not in Iowa .
column2: RESULTS : We observed positive associations of Parkinson ' s disease with chem* ozone *chem ( odds ratio = 1 . 39 ; 95 % CI : 0 . 98 to 1 . 98 ) and fine chem* particulate matter *chem ( odds ratio = 1 . 34 ; 95 % CI : 0 . 93 to 1 . 93 ) in North Carolina but not in Iowa .

column2: CONCLUSIONS : The plausibility of an effect of ambient concentrations of these pollutants on Parkinson ' s disease risk is supported by experimental data demonstrating damage to dopaminergic neurons at relevant concentrations .

column1: CML has a well - documented association with ionizing radiation , but reports of associations with chemical exposures have been questioned .
column2: CML has a well - documented association with ionizing radiation , but reports of associations with chemical exposures have been questioned .

column1: Ionizing radiation is capable of inducing the requisite CML - associated t ( 9 : 22 ) translocation ( Philadelphia chromosome ) in appropriate cells in vitro but , thus far , chemicals have not shown this capacity .
column2: Ionizing radiation is capable of inducing the requisite CML - associated t ( 9 : 22 ) translocation ( Philadelphia chromosome ) in appropriate cells in vitro but , thus far , chemicals have not shown this capacity .

column1: In order to conduct reliable testing in this regard , it is essential that a positive control for induction be available .

column1: We have used ionizing radiation to develop such a control .
column2: We have used ionizing radiation to develop such a control .

column2: UNASSIGNED : chem* Metolachlor *chem , a widely used herbicide , is classified as a Group C carcinogen by the U . S .

column1: Environmental Protection Agency based on increased liver neoplasms in female rats .
