column1: Epidemiologic studies of the health effects of metolachlor have been limited .
column2: Epidemiologic studies of the health effects of chem* metolachlor *chem have been limited .

column1: The Agricultural Health Study ( AHS ) is a prospective cohort study including licensed private and commercial pesticide applicators in Iowa and North Carolina enrolled 1993 - 1997 .
column2: The Agricultural Health Study ( AHS ) is a prospective cohort study including licensed private and commercial pesticide applicators in Iowa and North Carolina enrolled 1993 - 1997 .

column1: We evaluated cancer incidence through 2010 / 2011 ( NC / IA ) for 49 , 616 applicators , 53 % of whom reported ever using metolachlor .
column2: We evaluated cancer incidence through 2010 / 2011 ( NC / IA ) for 49 , 616 applicators , 53 % of whom reported ever using chem* metolachlor *chem .

column2: We used Poisson regression to evaluate relations between two metrics of chem* metolachlor *chem use ( lifetime days , intensity - weighted lifetime days ) and cancer incidence .

column1: A similar pattern was observed for follicular cell lymphoma , but no other lymphoma subtypes .
column2: A similar pattern was observed for follicular cell lymphoma , but no other lymphoma subtypes .

column1: Mechanisms Underlying Latent Disease Risk Associated with Early - Life Arsenic Exposure : Current Research Trends and Scientific Gaps .
column2: Mechanisms Underlying Latent Disease Risk Associated with Early - Life chem* Arsenic *chem Exposure : Current Research Trends and Scientific Gaps .

column1: BACKGROUND : Millions of individuals worldwide , particularly those living in rural and developing areas , are exposed to harmful levels of inorganic arsenic ( iAs ) in their drinking water .
column2: BACKGROUND : Millions of individuals worldwide , particularly those living in rural and developing areas , are exposed to harmful levels of chem* inorganic arsenic *chem ( chem* iAs *chem ) in their drinking water .

column1: Inorganic As exposure during key developmental periods is associated with a variety of adverse health effects including those that are evident in adulthood .
column2: chem* Inorganic As *chem exposure during key developmental periods is associated with a variety of adverse health effects including those that are evident in adulthood .

column1: There is considerable interest in identifying the molecular mechanisms that relate early - life iAs exposure to the development of these latent diseases , particularly in relationship to cancer .
column2: There is considerable interest in identifying the molecular mechanisms that relate early - life chem* iAs *chem exposure to the development of these latent diseases , particularly in relationship to cancer .

column1: OBJECTIVES : This work summarizes research on the molecular mechanisms that underlie the increased risk of cancer development in adulthood that is associated with early - life iAs exposure .
column2: OBJECTIVES : This work summarizes research on the molecular mechanisms that underlie the increased risk of cancer development in adulthood that is associated with early - life chem* iAs *chem exposure .

column1: DISCUSSION : Epigenetic reprogramming that imparts functional changes in gene expression , the development of cancer stem cells , and immunomodulation are plausible underlying mechanisms by which early - life iAs exposure elicits latent carcinogenic effects .
column2: DISCUSSION : Epigenetic reprogramming that imparts functional changes in gene expression , the development of cancer stem cells , and immunomodulation are plausible underlying mechanisms by which early - life chem* iAs *chem exposure elicits latent carcinogenic effects .

column1: CONCLUSIONS : Evidence is mounting that relates early - life iAs exposure and cancer development later in life .
column2: CONCLUSIONS : Evidence is mounting that relates early - life chem* iAs *chem exposure and cancer development later in life .

column1: Future research should include animal studies that address mechanistic hypotheses and studies of human populations that integrate early - life exposure , molecular alterations , and latent disease outcomes .
column2: Future research should include animal studies that address mechanistic hypotheses and studies of human populations that integrate early - life exposure , molecular alterations , and latent disease outcomes .

column1: He was found to have atrial flutter at a ventricular rate of 70 / min which slowed down to 30 - 40 / min when nifedipine ( 60 mg ) in 3 divided doses , during which he was paced at a rate of 70 / min .
column2: He was found to have atrial flutter at a ventricular rate of 70 / min which slowed down to 30 - 40 / min when chem* nifedipine *chem ( 60 mg ) in 3 divided doses , during which he was paced at a rate of 70 / min .

column1: This is inconsistent with the well - established finding that nifedipine induces tachycardia in normally innervated hearts .

column1: In this model , toxic effects were induced by intraperitoneal ( i . p . ) injection of amphetamine 75 mg / kg ( 100 % death rate ) or cocaine 70 mg / kg ( 82 % death rate ) .
column2: In this model , toxic effects were induced by intraperitoneal ( i . p . ) injection of chem* amphetamine *chem 75 mg / kg ( 100 % death rate ) or chem* cocaine *chem 70 mg / kg ( 82 % death rate ) .

column1: Haloperidol failed to prevent amphetamine - induced seizures , but did lower the mortality rate at most doses tested .
column2: chem* Haloperidol *chem failed to prevent chem* amphetamine *chem - induced seizures , but did lower the mortality rate at most doses tested .

column1: Haloperidol decreased the incidence of cocaine - induced seizures at the two highest doses , but the lowering of the mortality rate did not reach statistical significance at any dose .
column2: chem* Haloperidol *chem decreased the incidence of chem* cocaine *chem - induced seizures at the two highest doses , but the lowering of the mortality rate did not reach statistical significance at any dose .

column1: These data suggest a protective role for the central dopamine blocker haloperidol against death from high - dose amphetamine exposure without reducing the incidence of seizures .

column1: Cyclophosphamide cardiotoxicity : an analysis of dosing as a risk factor .
column2: chem* Cyclophosphamide *chem cardiotoxicity : an analysis of dosing as a risk factor .

column1: Patients who undergo bone marrow transplantation are generally immunosuppressed with a dose of cyclophosphamide ( CYA ) which is usually calculated based on the patient ' s weight .
column2: Patients who undergo bone marrow transplantation are generally immunosuppressed with a dose of chem* cyclophosphamide *chem ( chem* CYA *chem ) which is usually calculated based on the patient ' s weight .

column1: At these high doses of CYA , serious cardiotoxicity may occur , but definitive risk factors for the development of such cardiotoxicity have not been described .
column2: At these high doses of chem* CYA *chem , serious cardiotoxicity may occur , but definitive risk factors for the development of such cardiotoxicity have not been described .

column1: Since chemotherapeutic agent toxicity generally correlates with dose per body surface area , we retrospectively calculated the dose of CYA in patients transplanted at our institution to determine whether the incidence of CYA cardiotoxicity correlated with the dose per body surface area .
column2: Since chemotherapeutic agent toxicity generally correlates with dose per body surface area , we retrospectively calculated the dose of chem* CYA *chem in patients transplanted at our institution to determine whether the incidence of chem* CYA *chem cardiotoxicity correlated with the dose per body surface area .

column1: Eighty patients who were to receive CYA 50 mg / kg / d for four days as preparation for marrow grafting underwent a total of 84 transplants for aplastic anemia , Wiskott - Aldrich syndrome , or severe combined immunodeficiency syndrome .
column2: Eighty patients who were to receive chem* CYA *chem 50 mg / kg / d for four days as preparation for marrow grafting underwent a total of 84 transplants for aplastic anemia , Wiskott - Aldrich syndrome , or severe combined immunodeficiency syndrome .

column1: Fourteen of 84 ( 17 % ) patients had symptoms and signs consistent with CYA cardiotoxicity within ten days of receiving 1 to 4 doses of CYA .
column2: Fourteen of 84 ( 17 % ) patients had symptoms and signs consistent with chem* CYA *chem cardiotoxicity within ten days of receiving 1 to 4 doses of chem* CYA *chem .

column1: Six of the 14 patients died with congestive heart failure .
column2: Six of the 14 patients died with congestive heart failure .

column1: The dose of CYA per body surface area was calculated for all patients and the patients were divided into two groups based on daily CYA dose : Group 1 , CYA less than or equal to 1 . 55 g / m2 / d ; Group 2 , CYA greater than 1 . 55 g / m2 / d .
column2: The dose of chem* CYA *chem per body surface area was calculated for all patients and the patients were divided into two groups based on daily chem* CYA *chem dose : Group 1 , chem* CYA *chem less than or equal to 1 . 55 g / m2 / d ; Group 2 , chem* CYA *chem greater than 1 . 55 g / m2 / d .

column1: Cardiotoxicity that was thought to be related to CYA occurred in 1 / 32 ( 3 % ) of patients in Group 1 and in 13 / 52 ( 25 % ) patients in Group 2 ( P less than 0 . 025 ) .
column2: Cardiotoxicity that was thought to be related to chem* CYA *chem occurred in 1 / 32 ( 3 % ) of patients in Group 1 and in 13 / 52 ( 25 % ) patients in Group 2 ( P less than 0 . 025 ) .

column1: Congestive heart failure caused or contributed to death in 0 / 32 patients in Group 1 v 6 / 52 ( 12 % ) of patients in Group 2 ( P less than 0 . 25 ) .
column2: Congestive heart failure caused or contributed to death in 0 / 32 patients in Group 1 v 6 / 52 ( 12 % ) of patients in Group 2 ( P less than 0 . 25 ) .

column2: There was no difference in the rate of engraftment of evaluable patients in the two groups ( P greater than 0 . 5 ) .

column1: We conclude that the CYA cardiotoxicity correlates with CYA dosage as calculated by body surface area , and that patients with aplastic anemia and immunodeficiencies can be effectively prepared for bone marrow grafting at a CYA dose of 1 . 55 g / m2 / d for four days with a lower incidence of cardiotoxicity than patients whose CYA dosage is calculated based on weight .
column2: We conclude that the chem* CYA *chem cardiotoxicity correlates with chem* CYA *chem dosage as calculated by body surface area , and that patients with aplastic anemia and immunodeficiencies can be effectively prepared for bone marrow grafting at a chem* CYA *chem dose of 1 . 55 g / m2 / d for four days with a lower incidence of cardiotoxicity than patients whose chem* CYA *chem dosage is calculated based on weight .

column1: This study reaffirms the principle that drug toxicity correlates with dose per body surface area .

column1: Experimental studies in healthy human volunteers indicate aminoglycosides cause proximal tubular damage in most patients , but rarely , if ever , cause glomerular or tubular dysfunction .
column2: Experimental studies in healthy human volunteers indicate chem* aminoglycosides *chem cause proximal tubular damage in most patients , but rarely , if ever , cause glomerular or tubular dysfunction .

column1: Clinical trials of aminoglycosides in seriously ill patients indicate that the relative risk for developing acute renal failure during therapy ranges from 8 to 10 and that the attributable risk is 70 % to 80 % .
column2: Clinical trials of chem* aminoglycosides *chem in seriously ill patients indicate that the relative risk for developing acute renal failure during therapy ranges from 8 to 10 and that the attributable risk is 70 % to 80 % .

column1: Further analysis of these data suggests that the duration of therapy , plasma aminoglycoside levels , liver disease , advanced age , high initial estimated creatinine clearance and , possibly , female gender all increase the risk for nephrotoxicity .
column2: Further analysis of these data suggests that the duration of therapy , plasma chem* aminoglycoside *chem levels , liver disease , advanced age , high initial estimated chem* creatinine *chem clearance and , possibly , female gender all increase the risk for nephrotoxicity .

column1: Other causes of acute renal failure , such as shock , appear to have an additive effect .
column2: Other causes of acute renal failure , such as shock , appear to have an additive effect .

column1: The changes in renal prostaglandin synthesis were accompanied by evidence of renal damage in aspirin - treated jj but not jJ rats as evidenced by : increased incidence and severity of hematuria ( p less than 0 . 01 ) ; increased serum creatinine ( p less than 0 . 05 ) ; and increase in outer medullary histopathologic lesions ( p less than 0 . 005 compared to either sham - treated jj or aspirin - treated jJ ) .

column1: During the 1 hour after administration of the drug the incidence of ventricular fibrillation or sustained ventricular tachycardia among the 204 patients with acute myocardial infarction was low , 1 . 5 % .
column2: During the 1 hour after administration of the drug the incidence of ventricular fibrillation or sustained ventricular tachycardia among the 204 patients with acute myocardial infarction was low , 1 . 5 % .

column1: Lidocaine , given in a 300 mg dose intramuscularly followed by 100 mg intravenously , did not prevent sustained ventricular tachycardia , although there was a significant reduction in the number of patients with warning arrhythmias between 15 and 45 minutes after the administration of lidocaine ( p less than 0 . 05 ) .

column2: The average plasma chem* lidocaine *chem level 10 minutes after administration for patients without a myocardial infarction was significantly higher than that for patients with an acute infarction .

column1: Evidence for a cholinergic role in haloperidol - induced catalepsy .

column1: Experiments in mice tested previous evidence that activation of cholinergic systems promotes catalepsy and that cholinergic mechanisms need to be intact for full expression of neuroleptic - induced catalepsy .
column2: Experiments in mice tested previous evidence that activation of cholinergic systems promotes catalepsy and that cholinergic mechanisms need to be intact for full expression of chem* neuroleptic *chem - induced catalepsy .

column1: Large doses of the cholinomimetic , pilocarpine , could induce catalepsy when peripheral cholinergic receptors were blocked .
column2: Large doses of the cholinomimetic , chem* pilocarpine *chem , could induce catalepsy when peripheral cholinergic receptors were blocked .

column1: Low doses of pilocarpine caused a pronounced enhancement of the catalepsy that was induced by the dopaminergic blocker , haloperidol .
column2: Low doses of chem* pilocarpine *chem caused a pronounced enhancement of the catalepsy that was induced by the dopaminergic blocker , chem* haloperidol *chem .

column1: A muscarinic receptor blocker , atropine , disrupted haloperidol - induced catalepsy .
column2: A muscarinic receptor blocker , chem* atropine *chem , disrupted chem* haloperidol *chem - induced catalepsy .

column1: Intracranial injection of an acetylcholine - synthesis inhibitor , hemicholinium , prevented the catalepsy that is usually induced by haloperidol .
column2: Intracranial injection of an chem* acetylcholine *chem - synthesis inhibitor , chem* hemicholinium *chem , prevented the catalepsy that is usually induced by chem* haloperidol *chem .

column1: These findings suggest the hypothesis that the catalepsy that is produced by neuroleptics such as haloperidol is actually mediated by intrinsic central cholinergic systems .
column2: These findings suggest the hypothesis that the catalepsy that is produced by chem* neuroleptics *chem such as chem* haloperidol *chem is actually mediated by intrinsic central cholinergic systems .

column1: Alternatively , activation of central cholinergic systems could promote catalepsy by suppression of dopaminergic systems .

column1: Cardiovascular dysfunction and hypersensitivity to sodium pentobarbital induced by chronic barium chloride ingestion .
column2: Cardiovascular dysfunction and hypersensitivity to chem* sodium pentobarbital *chem induced by chronic chem* barium chloride *chem ingestion .

column1: Barium - supplemented Long - Evans hooded rats were characterized by a persistent hypertension that was evident after 1 month of barium ( 100 micrograms / ml mineral fortified water ) treatment .
column2: chem* Barium *chem - supplemented Long - Evans hooded rats were characterized by a persistent hypertension that was evident after 1 month of chem* barium *chem ( 100 micrograms / ml mineral fortified water ) treatment .

column1: Analysis of in vivo myocardial excitability , contractility , and metabolic characteristics at 16 months revealed other significant barium - induced disturbances within the cardiovascular system .
column2: Analysis of in vivo myocardial excitability , contractility , and metabolic characteristics at 16 months revealed other significant chem* barium *chem - induced disturbances within the cardiovascular system .

column1: The most distinctive aspect of the barium effect was a demonstrated hypersensitivity of the cardiovascular system to sodium pentobarbital .
column2: The most distinctive aspect of the chem* barium *chem effect was a demonstrated hypersensitivity of the cardiovascular system to chem* sodium pentobarbital *chem .

column1: Under barbiturate anesthesia , virtually all of the myocardial contractile indices were depressed significantly in barium - exposed rats relative to the corresponding control - fed rats .
column2: Under chem* barbiturate *chem anesthesia , virtually all of the myocardial contractile indices were depressed significantly in chem* barium *chem - exposed rats relative to the corresponding control - fed rats .

column1: The lack of a similar response to ketamine and xylazine anesthesia revealed that the cardiovascular actions of sodium pentobarbital in barium - treated rats were linked specifically to this anesthetic , and were not representative of a generalized anesthetic response .
column2: The lack of a similar response to chem* ketamine *chem and chem* xylazine *chem anesthesia revealed that the cardiovascular actions of chem* sodium pentobarbital *chem in chem* barium *chem - treated rats were linked specifically to this anesthetic , and were not representative of a generalized anesthetic response .

column1: Other myocardial pathophysiologic and metabolic changes induced by barium were manifest , irrespective of the anesthetic employed .
column2: Other myocardial pathophysiologic and metabolic changes induced by chem* barium *chem were manifest , irrespective of the anesthetic employed .

column1: The contractile element shortening velocity of the cardiac muscle fibers was significantly slower in both groups of barium - treated rats relative to the control groups , irrespective of the anesthetic regimen .
column2: The contractile element shortening velocity of the cardiac muscle fibers was significantly slower in both groups of chem* barium *chem - treated rats relative to the control groups , irrespective of the anesthetic regimen .

column1: Similarly , significant disturbances in myocardial energy metabolism were detected in the barium - exposed rats which were consistent with the reduced contractile element shortening velocity .
column2: Similarly , significant disturbances in myocardial energy metabolism were detected in the chem* barium *chem - exposed rats which were consistent with the reduced contractile element shortening velocity .

column1: In addition , the excitability of the cardiac conduction system was depressed preferentially in the atrioventricular nodal region of hearts from barium - exposed rats .
column2: In addition , the excitability of the cardiac conduction system was depressed preferentially in the atrioventricular nodal region of hearts from chem* barium *chem - exposed rats .

column1: Overall , the altered cardiac contractility and excitability characteristics , the myocardial metabolic disturbances , and the hypersensitivity of the cardiovascular system to sodium pentobarbital suggest the existence of a heretofore undescribed cardiomyopathic disorder induced by chronic barium exposure .
column2: Overall , the altered cardiac contractility and excitability characteristics , the myocardial metabolic disturbances , and the hypersensitivity of the cardiovascular system to chem* sodium pentobarbital *chem suggest the existence of a heretofore undescribed cardiomyopathic disorder induced by chronic chem* barium *chem exposure .

column1: These experimental findings represent the first indication that life - long barium ingestion may have significant adverse effects on the mammalian cardiovascular system .
column2: These experimental findings represent the first indication that life - long chem* barium *chem ingestion may have significant adverse effects on the mammalian cardiovascular system .

column1: Propranolol antagonism of phenylpropanolamine - induced hypertension .

column1: Phenylpropanolamine ( PPA ) overdose can cause severe hypertension , intracerebral hemorrhage , and death .

column2: Subjects received chem* propranolol *chem either by mouth for 48 hours before chem* PPA *chem or as a rapid intravenous infusion after chem* PPA *chem .

column1: PPA , 75 mg alone , increased blood pressure ( 31 + / - 14 mm Hg systolic , 20 + / - 5 mm Hg diastolic ) , and propranolol pretreatment antagonized this increase ( 12 + / - 10 mm Hg systolic , 10 + / - 7 mm Hg diastolic ) .
column2: chem* PPA *chem , 75 mg alone , increased blood pressure ( 31 + / - 14 mm Hg systolic , 20 + / - 5 mm Hg diastolic ) , and chem* propranolol *chem pretreatment antagonized this increase ( 12 + / - 10 mm Hg systolic , 10 + / - 7 mm Hg diastolic ) .

column1: Intravenous propranolol after PPA also decreased blood pressure .
column2: Intravenous chem* propranolol *chem after chem* PPA *chem also decreased blood pressure .

column1: Left ventricular function ( assessed by echocardiography ) showed that PPA increased the stroke volume 30 % ( from 62 . 5 + / - 20 . 9 to 80 . 8 + / - 22 . 4 ml ) , the ejection fraction 9 % ( from 64 % + / - 10 % to 70 % + / - 7 % ) , and cardiac output 14 % ( from 3 . 6 + / - 0 . 6 to 4 . 1 + / - 1 . 0 L / min ) .
column2: Left ventricular function ( assessed by echocardiography ) showed that chem* PPA *chem increased the stroke volume 30 % ( from 62 . 5 + / - 20 . 9 to 80 . 8 + / - 22 . 4 ml ) , the ejection fraction 9 % ( from 64 % + / - 10 % to 70 % + / - 7 % ) , and cardiac output 14 % ( from 3 . 6 + / - 0 . 6 to 4 . 1 + / - 1 . 0 L / min ) .

column1: Intravenous propranolol reversed these effects .
column2: Intravenous chem* propranolol *chem reversed these effects .

column1: Systemic vascular resistance was increased by PPA 28 % ( from 1710 + / - 200 to 2190 + / - 700 dyne X sec / cm5 ) and was further increased by propranolol 22 % ( to 2660 + / - 1200 dyne X sec / cm5 ) .
column2: Systemic vascular resistance was increased by chem* PPA *chem 28 % ( from 1710 + / - 200 to 2190 + / - 700 dyne X sec / cm5 ) and was further increased by chem* propranolol *chem 22 % ( to 2660 + / - 1200 dyne X sec / cm5 ) .

column1: We conclude that PPA increases blood pressure by increasing systemic vascular resistance and cardiac output , and that propranolol antagonizes this increase by reversing the effect of PPA on cardiac output .
column2: We conclude that chem* PPA *chem increases blood pressure by increasing systemic vascular resistance and cardiac output , and that chem* propranolol *chem antagonizes this increase by reversing the effect of chem* PPA *chem on cardiac output .

column1: That propranolol antagonizes the pressor effect of PPA is in contrast to the interaction in which propranolol enhances the pressor effect of norepinephrine .
column2: That chem* propranolol *chem antagonizes the pressor effect of chem* PPA *chem is in contrast to the interaction in which chem* propranolol *chem enhances the pressor effect of chem* norepinephrine *chem .

column1: This is probably because PPA has less beta 2 activity than does norepinephrine .
column2: This is probably because chem* PPA *chem has less beta 2 activity than does chem* norepinephrine *chem .

column2: Glomeruli of chem* PAN *chem rats contained significantly more CC than glomeruli of controls .

column1: CC was preferentially localized within the sclerotic areas of the affected glomeruli .
column2: CC was preferentially localized within the sclerotic areas of the affected glomeruli .

column1: Since mesangial CC clearance from the mesangium did not change during chronic PAN treatment , we conclude that this preferential CC localization within the lesions is caused by an increased CC uptake shortly after injection in apparent vulnerable areas where sclerosis will develop subsequently .

column1: Relationship between nicotine - induced seizures and hippocampal nicotinic receptors .

column1: A controversy has existed for several years concerning the physiological relevance of the nicotinic receptor measured by alpha - bungarotoxin binding .
column2: A controversy has existed for several years concerning the physiological relevance of the nicotinic receptor measured by alpha - bungarotoxin binding .

column1: Using mice derived from a classical F2 and backcross genetic design , a relationship between nicotine - induced seizures and alpha - bungarotoxin nicotinic receptor concentration was found .
column2: Using mice derived from a classical F2 and backcross genetic design , a relationship between chem* nicotine *chem - induced seizures and alpha - bungarotoxin nicotinic receptor concentration was found .

column1: Mice sensitive to the convulsant effects of nicotine had greater alpha - bungarotoxin binding in the hippocampus than seizure insensitive mice .

column1: The binding sites from seizure sensitive and resistant mice were equally affected by treatment with dithiothreitol , trypsin or heat .
column2: The binding sites from seizure sensitive and resistant mice were equally affected by treatment with chem* dithiothreitol *chem , trypsin or heat .

column1: The authors conclude by affirming the undoubted efficacy of the anabolizing steroids in experimental myopathic disease , but they have reservations as to the transfer of the results into the human field , where high dosage cannot be carried out continuously because of the effects of the drug on virility ; because the tissue injury too often occurs at an irreversible stage vis - a - vis the " regeneration " of the muscle tissue ; and finally because the dystrophic injurious agent is certainly not the lack of vitamin E but something as yet unknown .

column1: Chronic administration of estrogen to the Fischer 344 ( F344 ) rat induces growth of large , hemorrhagic pituitary tumors .

column1: Ten weeks of diethylstilbestrol ( DES ) treatment caused female F344 rat pituitaries to grow to an average of 109 . 2 + / - 6 . 3 mg ( mean + / - SE ) versus 11 . 3 + / - 1 . 4 mg for untreated rats , and to become highly hemorrhagic .
column2: Ten weeks of chem* diethylstilbestrol *chem ( chem* DES *chem ) treatment caused female F344 rat pituitaries to grow to an average of 109 . 2 + / - 6 . 3 mg ( mean + / - SE ) versus 11 . 3 + / - 1 . 4 mg for untreated rats , and to become highly hemorrhagic .

column1: The same DES treatment produced no significant growth ( 8 . 9 + / - 0 . 5 mg for treated females versus 8 . 7 + / - 1 . 1 for untreated females ) or morphological changes in Brown Norway ( BN ) rat pituitaries .
column2: The same chem* DES *chem treatment produced no significant growth ( 8 . 9 + / - 0 . 5 mg for treated females versus 8 . 7 + / - 1 . 1 for untreated females ) or morphological changes in Brown Norway ( BN ) rat pituitaries .

column2: An F1 hybrid of F344 and BN exhibited significant pituitary growth after 10 weeks of chem* DES *chem treatment with an average mass of 26 . 3 + / - 0 . 7 mg compared with 8 . 6 + / - 0 . 9 mg for untreated rats .

column1: Surprisingly , the F1 hybrid tumors were not hemorrhagic and had hemoglobin content and outward appearance identical to that of BN .
column2: Surprisingly , the F1 hybrid tumors were not hemorrhagic and had hemoglobin content and outward appearance identical to that of BN .

column1: Expression of both growth and morphological changes is due to multiple genes .
column2: Expression of both growth and morphological changes is due to multiple genes .

column1: Effects of CD - 832 on isoproterenol ( ISO ) - induced myocardial ischemia were studied in dogs with partial coronary stenosis of the left circumflex coronary artery and findings were compared with those for nifedipine or diltiazem .
column2: Effects of chem* CD - 832 *chem on chem* isoproterenol *chem ( chem* ISO *chem ) - induced myocardial ischemia were studied in dogs with partial coronary stenosis of the left circumflex coronary artery and findings were compared with those for chem* nifedipine *chem or chem* diltiazem *chem .

column1: In the presence of coronary artery stenosis , 3 - min periods of intracoronary ISO infusion ( 10 ng / kg / min ) increased heart rate and maximal rate of left ventricular pressure rise , which resulted in a decrease in percentage segmental shortening and ST - segment elevation of the epicardial electrocardiogram .
column2: In the presence of coronary artery stenosis , 3 - min periods of intracoronary chem* ISO *chem infusion ( 10 ng / kg / min ) increased heart rate and maximal rate of left ventricular pressure rise , which resulted in a decrease in percentage segmental shortening and ST - segment elevation of the epicardial electrocardiogram .

column1: After the control ISO infusion with stenosis was performed , equihypotensive doses of CD - 832 ( 3 and 10 micrograms / kg / min , n = 7 ) , nifedipine ( 1 and 3 micrograms / kg / min , n = 9 ) or diltiazem ( 10 and 30 micrograms / kg / min , n = 7 ) were infused 5 min before and during the second and third ISO infusion .
column2: After the control chem* ISO *chem infusion with stenosis was performed , equihypotensive doses of chem* CD - 832 *chem ( 3 and 10 micrograms / kg / min , n = 7 ) , chem* nifedipine *chem ( 1 and 3 micrograms / kg / min , n = 9 ) or chem* diltiazem *chem ( 10 and 30 micrograms / kg / min , n = 7 ) were infused 5 min before and during the second and third chem* ISO *chem infusion .

column1: Both CD - 832 and diltiazem , but not nifedipine , significantly reduced the increase in heart rate induced by ISO infusion .

column1: In contrast to nifedipine , CD - 832 ( 10 micrograms / kg / min ) prevented the decrease in percentage segmental shortening from 32 + / - 12 % to 115 + / - 26 % of the control value ( P < . 01 ) and ST - segment elevation from 5 . 6 + / - 1 . 0 mV to 1 . 6 + / - 1 . 3 mV ( P < . 01 ) at 3 min after ISO infusion with stenosis .
column2: In contrast to chem* nifedipine *chem , chem* CD - 832 *chem ( 10 micrograms / kg / min ) prevented the decrease in percentage segmental shortening from 32 + / - 12 % to 115 + / - 26 % of the control value ( P < . 01 ) and ST - segment elevation from 5 . 6 + / - 1 . 0 mV to 1 . 6 + / - 1 . 3 mV ( P < . 01 ) at 3 min after chem* ISO *chem infusion with stenosis .

column1: Diltiazem ( 30 micrograms / kg / min ) also prevented the decrease in percentage segmental shortening from 34 + / - 14 % to 63 + / - 18 % of the control value ( P < . 05 ) and ST - segment elevation from 4 . 7 + / - 0 . 7 mV to 2 . 1 + / - 0 . 7 mV ( P < . 01 ) at 3 min after ISO infusion with stenosis .
column2: chem* Diltiazem *chem ( 30 micrograms / kg / min ) also prevented the decrease in percentage segmental shortening from 34 + / - 14 % to 63 + / - 18 % of the control value ( P < . 05 ) and ST - segment elevation from 4 . 7 + / - 0 . 7 mV to 2 . 1 + / - 0 . 7 mV ( P < . 01 ) at 3 min after chem* ISO *chem infusion with stenosis .

column1: These data show that CD - 832 improves myocardial ischemia during ISO infusion with stenosis and suggest that the negative chronotropic property of CD - 832 plays a major role in the beneficial effects of CD - 832 .

column1: We recently demonstrated that recombinant hGH exacerbates renal functional and structural injury in chronic puromycin aminonucleoside ( PAN ) nephropathy , an experimental model of glomerular disease .
column2: We recently demonstrated that recombinant hGH exacerbates renal functional and structural injury in chronic chem* puromycin aminonucleoside *chem ( chem* PAN *chem ) nephropathy , an experimental model of glomerular disease .

column1: Therefore , we examined whether recombinant human ( rh ) IGF - I is a safer alternative for the treatment of growth failure in rats with chronic PAN nephropathy .

column1: The glomerulopathy was induced by seven serial injections of PAN over 12 wk .

column1: Experimental animals ( n = 6 ) received rhIGF - I , 400 micrograms / d , whereas control rats ( n = 6 ) received the vehicle .
column2: Experimental animals ( n = 6 ) received rhIGF - I , 400 micrograms / d , whereas control rats ( n = 6 ) received the vehicle .

column1: rhIGF - I improved weight gain by 14 % ( p < 0 . 05 ) , without altering hematocrit or blood pressure in rats with renal disease .
column2: rhIGF - I improved weight gain by 14 % ( p < 0 . 05 ) , without altering hematocrit or blood pressure in rats with renal disease .

column1: Urinary protein excretion was unaltered by rhIGF - I treatment in rats with chronic PAN nephropathy .
column2: Urinary protein excretion was unaltered by rhIGF - I treatment in rats with chronic chem* PAN *chem nephropathy .

column1: In normal rats with intact kidneys , rhIGF - I administration ( n = 4 ) did not alter weight gain , blood pressure , proteinuria , GFR , glomerular planar area , renal cortical malondialdehyde content , or glomerular or tubulointerstitial damage , compared with untreated animals ( n = 4 ) .
column2: In normal rats with intact kidneys , rhIGF - I administration ( n = 4 ) did not alter weight gain , blood pressure , proteinuria , GFR , glomerular planar area , renal cortical chem* malondialdehyde *chem content , or glomerular or tubulointerstitial damage , compared with untreated animals ( n = 4 ) .

column1: rhIGF - I treatment reduced the steady state renal IGF - I mRNA level but did not modify gene expression of the IGF - I or GH receptors .

column1: BACKGROUND : Four studies published since December , 1995 , reported that the incidence of venous thromboembolism ( VTE ) was higher in women who used oral contraceptives ( OCs ) containing the third - generation progestagens gestodene or desogestrel than in users of OCs containing second - generation progestagens .
column2: BACKGROUND : Four studies published since December , 1995 , reported that the incidence of venous thromboembolism ( VTE ) was higher in women who used chem* oral contraceptives *chem ( chem* OCs *chem ) containing the third - generation chem* progestagens chem* gestodene *chem or chem* desogestrel *chem than in users of chem* OCs *chem containing second - generation chem* progestagens *chem .

column2: However , confounding and bias in the design of these studies may have affected the findings .

column1: The aim of our study was to re - examine the association between risk of VTE and OC use with a different study design and analysis to avoid some of the bias and confounding of the earlier studies .
column2: The aim of our study was to re - examine the association between risk of VTE and chem* OC *chem use with a different study design and analysis to avoid some of the bias and confounding of the earlier studies .

column2: The study was based on the medical records of about 540 , 000 women born between 1941 and 1981 .

column2: All women who had a recorded diagnosis of deep - vein thrombosis , venous thrombosis not otherwise specified , or pulmonary embolus during the study period , and who had been treated with an anticoagulant were identified as potential cases of VTE .

column1: We did a cohort analysis to estimate and compare incidence of VTE in users of the main OC preparations , and a nested case - control study to calculate the odds ratios of VTE associated with use of different types of OC , after adjustment for potential confounding factors .
column2: We did a cohort analysis to estimate and compare incidence of VTE in users of the main chem* OC *chem preparations , and a nested case - control study to calculate the odds ratios of VTE associated with use of different types of chem* OC *chem , after adjustment for potential confounding factors .

column2: In the case - control study , we matched cases to controls by exact year of birth , practice , and current use of chem* OCs *chem .

column1: We used a multiple logistic regression model that included body - mass index , number of cycles , change in type of OC prescribed within 3 months of the event , previous pregnancy , and concurrent disease .
column2: We used a multiple logistic regression model that included body - mass index , number of cycles , change in type of chem* OC *chem prescribed within 3 months of the event , previous pregnancy , and concurrent disease .

column1: OBJECTIVE : We wanted to test whether assessment of both a central pain - related signal ( chemo - somatosensory evoked potential , CSSEP ) and a concomitantly recorded peripheral signal ( negative mucosal potential , NMP ) allows for separation of central and peripheral effects of NSAIDs .

column1: RESULTS : As described earlier , administration of ibuprofen was followed by a decrease in tonic pain but - relative to placebo - an increase in correlates of phasic pain , indicating a specific effect of ibuprofen on the interaction between the pain stimuli under these special experimental conditions .

column1: With cocaine , the drug concentration in blood obtained from the coronary sinus was 3 . 0 + / - 0 . 4 ( mean + / - SD ) mg / L , similar in magnitude to the blood cocaine concentration reported in abusers dying of cocaine intoxication .

column1: Cocaine induced no significant change in heart rate , LV dP / dt ( positive or negative ) , or LV end - diastolic volume , but it caused an increase in systolic and mean arterial pressures , LV end - diastolic pressure , and LV end - systolic volume , as well as a decrease in LV ejection fraction .

column1: Ascending dose tolerance study of intramuscular carbetocin administered after normal vaginal birth .
column2: Ascending dose tolerance study of intramuscular chem* carbetocin *chem administered after normal vaginal birth .

column1: OBJECTIVE : To determine the maximum tolerated dose ( MTD ) of carbetocin ( a long - acting synthetic analogue of oxytocin ) , when administered immediately after vaginal delivery at term .
column2: OBJECTIVE : To determine the maximum tolerated dose ( MTD ) of chem* carbetocin *chem ( a long - acting synthetic analogue of chem* oxytocin *chem ) , when administered immediately after vaginal delivery at term .

column1: MATERIALS AND METHODS : Carbetocin was given as an intramuscular injection immediately after the birth of the infant in 45 healthy women with normal singleton pregnancies who delivered vaginally at term .
column2: MATERIALS AND METHODS : chem* Carbetocin *chem was given as an intramuscular injection immediately after the birth of the infant in 45 healthy women with normal singleton pregnancies who delivered vaginally at term .

column1: Dosage groups of 15 , 30 , 50 , 75 , 100 , 125 , 150 , 175 or 200 microg carbetocin were assigned to blocks of three women according to the continual reassessment method ( CRM ) .
column2: Dosage groups of 15 , 30 , 50 , 75 , 100 , 125 , 150 , 175 or 200 microg chem* carbetocin *chem were assigned to blocks of three women according to the continual reassessment method ( CRM ) .

column1: RESULTS : All dosage groups consisted of three women , except those with 100 microg ( n = 6 ) and 200 microg ( n = 18 ) .
column2: RESULTS : All dosage groups consisted of three women , except those with 100 microg ( n = 6 ) and 200 microg ( n = 18 ) .

column1: Recorded were dose - limiting adverse events : hyper - or hypotension ( three ) , severe abdominal pain ( 0 ) , vomiting ( 0 ) and retained placenta ( four ) .
column2: Recorded were dose - limiting adverse events : hyper - or hypotension ( three ) , severe abdominal pain ( 0 ) , vomiting ( 0 ) and retained placenta ( four ) .

column1: Serious adverse events occurred in seven women : six cases with blood loss > or = 1000 ml , four cases of manual placenta removal , five cases of additional oxytocics administration and five cases of blood transfusion .
column2: Serious adverse events occurred in seven women : six cases with blood loss > or = 1000 ml , four cases of manual placenta removal , five cases of additional oxytocics administration and five cases of blood transfusion .

column1: Maximum blood loss was greatest at the upper and lower dose levels , and lowest in the 70 - 125 microg dose range .
column2: Maximum blood loss was greatest at the upper and lower dose levels , and lowest in the 70 - 125 microg dose range .

column1: Four out of six cases with blood loss > or = 1000 ml occurred in the 200 microg group .
column2: Four out of six cases with blood loss > or = 1000 ml occurred in the 200 microg group .

column1: The majority of additional administration of oxytocics ( 4 / 5 ) and blood transfusion ( 3 / 5 ) occurred in the dose groups of 200 microg .
column2: The majority of additional administration of oxytocics ( 4 / 5 ) and blood transfusion ( 3 / 5 ) occurred in the dose groups of 200 microg .

column1: All retained placentae were found in the group of 200 microg .
column2: All retained placentae were found in the group of 200 microg .

column1: CONCLUSION : The MTD was calculated to be at 200 microg carbetocin .
column2: CONCLUSION : The MTD was calculated to be at 200 microg chem* carbetocin *chem .

column1: Heparin - induced thrombocytopenia , paradoxical thromboembolism , and other side effects of heparin therapy .
column2: chem* Heparin *chem - induced thrombocytopenia , paradoxical thromboembolism , and other side effects of chem* heparin *chem therapy .

column1: Although several new anticoagulant drugs are in development , heparin remains the drug of choice for most anticoagulation needs .
column2: Although several new anticoagulant drugs are in development , chem* heparin *chem remains the drug of choice for most anticoagulation needs .

column1: The clinical effects of heparin are meritorious , but side effects do exist .
column2: The clinical effects of chem* heparin *chem are meritorious , but side effects do exist .

column1: Important untoward effects of heparin therapy including heparin - induced thrombocytopenia , heparin - associated osteoporosis , eosinophilia , skin reactions , allergic reactions other than thrombocytopenia and alopecia will be discussed in this article .
column2: Important untoward effects of chem* heparin *chem therapy including chem* heparin *chem - induced thrombocytopenia , chem* heparin *chem - associated osteoporosis , eosinophilia , skin reactions , allergic reactions other than thrombocytopenia and alopecia will be discussed in this article .

column1: Nonopaque crystal deposition causing ureteric obstruction in patients with HIV undergoing indinavir therapy .
column2: Nonopaque crystal deposition causing ureteric obstruction in patients with HIV undergoing chem* indinavir *chem therapy .

column1: OBJECTIVE : We describe the unique CT features of ureteric calculi in six HIV - infected patients receiving indinavir , the most commonly used HIV protease inhibitor , which is associated with an increased incidence of urolithiasis .
column2: OBJECTIVE : We describe the unique CT features of ureteric calculi in six HIV - infected patients receiving chem* indinavir *chem , the most commonly used HIV protease inhibitor , which is associated with an increased incidence of urolithiasis .

column1: CONCLUSION : Ureteric obstruction caused by precipitated indinavir crystals may be difficult to diagnose with unenhanced CT .
column2: CONCLUSION : Ureteric obstruction caused by precipitated chem* indinavir *chem crystals may be difficult to diagnose with unenhanced CT .

column1: The calculi are not opaque , and secondary signs of obstruction may be absent or minimal and should be sought carefully .
column2: The calculi are not opaque , and secondary signs of obstruction may be absent or minimal and should be sought carefully .

column1: Images may need to be obtained using i . v . contrast material to enable diagnosis of ureteric stones or obstruction in patients with HIV infection who receive indinavir therapy .
column2: Images may need to be obtained using i . v . contrast material to enable diagnosis of ureteric stones or obstruction in patients with HIV infection who receive chem* indinavir *chem therapy .

column1: Ischemic colitis and sumatriptan use .
column2: Ischemic colitis and chem* sumatriptan *chem use .

column1: Sumatriptan succinate , a serotonin - 1 ( 5 - hydroxytryptamine - 1 ) receptor agonist , is an antimigraine drug that is reported to act by selectively constricting intracranial arteries .
column2: chem* Sumatriptan succinate *chem , a chem* serotonin *chem - 1 ( chem* 5 - hydroxytryptamine *chem - 1 ) receptor agonist , is an antimigraine drug that is reported to act by selectively constricting intracranial arteries .

column1: Recently , vasopressor responses that are distinct from the cranial circulation have been demonstrated to occur in the systemic , pulmonary , and coronary circulations .
column2: Recently , vasopressor responses that are distinct from the cranial circulation have been demonstrated to occur in the systemic , pulmonary , and coronary circulations .

column1: Cases have been published of coronary vasospasm , myocardial ischemia , and myocardial infarction occurring after sumatriptan use .

column1: We report on the development of 8 serious cases of ischemic colitis in patients with migraine treated with sumatriptan .
column2: We report on the development of 8 serious cases of ischemic colitis in patients with migraine treated with chem* sumatriptan *chem .

column1: Pallidotomy with the gamma knife : a positive experience .
column2: Pallidotomy with the gamma knife : a positive experience .

column1: 51 patients with medically refractory Parkinson ' s disease underwent stereotactic posteromedial pallidotomy between August 1993 and February 1997 for treatment of bradykinesia , rigidity , and L - DOPA - induced dyskinesias .
column2: 51 patients with medically refractory Parkinson ' s disease underwent stereotactic posteromedial pallidotomy between August 1993 and February 1997 for treatment of bradykinesia , rigidity , and chem* L - DOPA *chem - induced dyskinesias .

column1: In 29 patients , the pallidotomies were performed with the Leksell Gamma Knife and in 22 they were performed with the standard radiofrequency ( RF ) method .
column2: In 29 patients , the pallidotomies were performed with the Leksell Gamma Knife and in 22 they were performed with the standard radiofrequency ( RF ) method .

column1: Clinical assessment as well as blinded ratings of Unified Parkinson ' s Disease Rating Scale ( UPDRS ) scores were carried out pre - and postoperatively .
column2: Clinical assessment as well as blinded ratings of Unified Parkinson ' s Disease Rating Scale ( UPDRS ) scores were carried out pre - and postoperatively .

column1: Mean follow - up time is 20 . 6 months ( range 6 - 48 ) and all except 4 patients have been followed more than one year .
column2: Mean follow - up time is 20 . 6 months ( range 6 - 48 ) and all except 4 patients have been followed more than one year .

column1: 85 percent of patients with dyskinesias were relieved of symptoms , regardless of whether the pallidotomies were performed with the Gamma Knife or radiofrequency methods .
column2: 85 percent of patients with dyskinesias were relieved of symptoms , regardless of whether the pallidotomies were performed with the Gamma Knife or radiofrequency methods .

column1: About 2 / 3 of the patients in both Gamma Knife and radiofrequency groups showed improvements in bradykinesia and rigidity , although when considered as a group neither the Gamma Knife nor the radiofrequency group showed statistically significant improvements in UPDRS scores .
column2: About 2 / 3 of the patients in both Gamma Knife and radiofrequency groups showed improvements in bradykinesia and rigidity , although when considered as a group neither the Gamma Knife nor the radiofrequency group showed statistically significant improvements in UPDRS scores .

column1: One patient in the Gamma Knife group ( 3 . 4 % ) developed a homonymous hemianopsia 9 months following treatment and 5 patients ( 27 . 7 % ) in the radiofrequency group became transiently confused postoperatively .
column2: One patient in the Gamma Knife group ( 3 . 4 % ) developed a homonymous hemianopsia 9 months following treatment and 5 patients ( 27 . 7 % ) in the radiofrequency group became transiently confused postoperatively .

column1: No other complications were seen .
column2: No other complications were seen .

column1: Gamma Knife pallidotomy is as effective as radiofrequency pallidotomy in controlling certain of the symptoms of Parkinson ' s disease .
column2: Gamma Knife pallidotomy is as effective as radiofrequency pallidotomy in controlling certain of the symptoms of Parkinson ' s disease .

column1: It may be the only practical technique available in certain patients , such as those who take anticoagulants , have bleeding diatheses or serious systemic medical illnesses .
column2: It may be the only practical technique available in certain patients , such as those who take anticoagulants , have bleeding diatheses or serious systemic medical illnesses .

column1: It is a viable option for other patients as well .

column1: Centrally mediated cardiovascular effects of intracisternal application of carbachol in anesthetized rats .
column2: Centrally mediated cardiovascular effects of intracisternal application of chem* carbachol *chem in anesthetized rats .

column1: The pressor response to the intracisternal ( i . c . ) injection of carbachol ( 1 mug ) in anesthetized rats was analyzed .
column2: The pressor response to the intracisternal ( i . c . ) injection of chem* carbachol *chem ( 1 mug ) in anesthetized rats was analyzed .

column1: This response was significantly reduced by the intravenous ( i . v . ) injection of guanethidine ( 5 mg ) , hexamethonium ( 10 mg ) or phentolamine ( 5 mg ) , and conversely , potentiated by i . v . desmethylimipramine ( 0 . 3 mg ) , while propranolol ( 0 . 5 mg ) i . v . selectively inhibited the enlargement of pulse pressure and the tachycardia following i . c . carbachol ( 1 mug ) .
column2: This response was significantly reduced by the intravenous ( i . v . ) injection of chem* guanethidine *chem ( 5 mg ) , chem* hexamethonium *chem ( 10 mg ) or chem* phentolamine *chem ( 5 mg ) , and conversely , potentiated by i . v . chem* desmethylimipramine *chem ( 0 . 3 mg ) , while chem* propranolol *chem ( 0 . 5 mg ) i . v . selectively inhibited the enlargement of pulse pressure and the tachycardia following i . c . chem* carbachol *chem ( 1 mug ) .

column1: On the other hand , the pressor response to i . c . carbachol ( 1 mug ) was almost completely blocked by i . c . atropine ( 3 mug ) or hexamethonium ( 500 mug ) , and significantly reduced by i . c . chlorpromazine ( 50 mug ) but significantly potentiated by i . c . desmethylimipramine ( 30 mug ) .
column2: On the other hand , the pressor response to i . c . chem* carbachol *chem ( 1 mug ) was almost completely blocked by i . c . chem* atropine *chem ( 3 mug ) or chem* hexamethonium *chem ( 500 mug ) , and significantly reduced by i . c . chem* chlorpromazine *chem ( 50 mug ) but significantly potentiated by i . c . chem* desmethylimipramine *chem ( 30 mug ) .

column1: The pressor response to i . c . carbachol ( 1 mug ) remained unchanged after sectioning of the bilateral cervical vagal nerves but disappeared after sectioning of the spinal cord ( C7 - C8 ) .
column2: The pressor response to i . c . chem* carbachol *chem ( 1 mug ) remained unchanged after sectioning of the bilateral cervical vagal nerves but disappeared after sectioning of the spinal cord ( C7 - C8 ) .

column1: From the above result it is suggested that the pressor response to i . c . carbachol ortral and peripheral adrenergic mechanisms , and that the sympathetic trunk is the main pathway .
column2: From the above result it is suggested that the pressor response to i . c . chem* carbachol *chem ortral and peripheral adrenergic mechanisms , and that the sympathetic trunk is the main pathway .

column1: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome and methylphenidate .
column2: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome and chem* methylphenidate *chem .

column1: A 1 - year - old female presented with neuroleptic malignant syndrome probably caused by methylphenidate .
column2: A 1 - year - old female presented with neuroleptic malignant syndrome probably caused by chem* methylphenidate *chem .

column1: She had defects in the supratentorial brain including the basal ganglia and the striatum ( multicystic encephalomalacia ) due to severe perinatal hypoxic - ischemic encephalopathy , which was considered to be a possible predisposing factor causing neuroleptic malignant syndrome .
column2: She had defects in the supratentorial brain including the basal ganglia and the striatum ( multicystic encephalomalacia ) due to severe perinatal hypoxic - ischemic encephalopathy , which was considered to be a possible predisposing factor causing neuroleptic malignant syndrome .

column1: A dopaminergic blockade mechanism generally is accepted as the pathogenesis of this syndrome .
column2: A dopaminergic blockade mechanism generally is accepted as the pathogenesis of this syndrome .

column1: However , methylphenidate is a dopamine agonist via the inhibition of uptake of dopamine , and therefore dopaminergic systems in the brainstem ( mainly the midbrain ) and the spinal cord were unlikely to participate in the onset of this syndrome .
column2: However , chem* methylphenidate *chem is a chem* dopamine *chem agonist via the inhibition of uptake of chem* dopamine *chem , and therefore dopaminergic systems in the brainstem ( mainly the midbrain ) and the spinal cord were unlikely to participate in the onset of this syndrome .

column1: A relative gamma - aminobutyric acid - ergic deficiency might occur because diazepam , a gamma - aminobutyric acid - mimetic agent , was strikingly effective .
column2: A relative chem* gamma - aminobutyric acid *chem - ergic deficiency might occur because chem* diazepam *chem , a chem* gamma - aminobutyric acid *chem - mimetic agent , was strikingly effective .

column1: This is the first reported patient with neuroleptic malignant syndrome probably caused by methylphenidate .
column2: This is the first reported patient with neuroleptic malignant syndrome probably caused by chem* methylphenidate *chem .

column1: Differential effects of 17alpha - ethinylestradiol on the neutral and acidic pathways of bile salt synthesis in the rat .
column2: Differential effects of chem* 17alpha - ethinylestradiol *chem on the neutral and acidic pathways of chem* bile salt *chem synthesis in the rat .

column1: Effects of 17alpha - ethinylestradiol ( EE ) on the neutral and acidic biosynthetic pathways of bile salt ( BS ) synthesis were evaluated in rats with an intact enterohepatic circulation and in rats with long - term bile diversion to induce BS synthesis .
column2: Effects of chem* 17alpha - ethinylestradiol *chem ( chem* EE *chem ) on the neutral and acidic biosynthetic pathways of chem* bile salt *chem ( chem* BS *chem ) synthesis were evaluated in rats with an intact enterohepatic circulation and in rats with long - term bile diversion to induce chem* BS *chem synthesis .

column1: For this purpose , bile salt pool composition , synthesis of individual BS in vivo , hepatic activities , and expression levels of cholesterol 7alpha - hydroxylase ( CYP7A ) , and sterol 27 - hydroxylase ( CYP27 ) , as well as of other enzymes involved in BS synthesis , were analyzed in rats treated with EE ( 5 mg / kg , 3 days ) or its vehicle .
column2: For this purpose , chem* bile salt *chem pool composition , synthesis of individual chem* BS *chem in vivo , hepatic activities , and expression levels of chem* cholesterol *chem 7alpha - hydroxylase ( CYP7A ) , and chem* sterol *chem 27 - hydroxylase ( CYP27 ) , as well as of other enzymes involved in chem* BS *chem synthesis , were analyzed in rats treated with chem* EE *chem ( 5 mg / kg , 3 days ) or its vehicle .

column1: BS pool size was decreased by 27 % but total BS synthesis was not affected by EE in intact rats .
column2: chem* BS *chem pool size was decreased by 27 % but total chem* BS *chem synthesis was not affected by chem* EE *chem in intact rats .

column1: Synthesis of cholate was reduced by 68 % in EE - treated rats , while that of chenodeoxycholate was increased by 60 % .
column2: Synthesis of chem* cholate *chem was reduced by 68 % in chem* EE *chem - treated rats , while that of chem* chenodeoxycholate *chem was increased by 60 % .

column1: The recently identified Delta22 - isomer of beta - muricholate contributed for 5 . 4 % and 18 . 3 % ( P < 0 . 01 ) to the pool in control and EE - treated rats , respectively , but could not be detected in bile after exhaustion of the pool .
column2: The recently identified Delta22 - isomer of beta - muricholate contributed for 5 . 4 % and 18 . 3 % ( P < 0 . 01 ) to the pool in control and chem* EE *chem - treated rats , respectively , but could not be detected in bile after exhaustion of the pool .

column1: A clear reduction of BS synthesis was found in bile - diverted rats treated with EE , yet biliary BS composition was only minimally affected .
column2: A clear reduction of chem* BS *chem synthesis was found in bile - diverted rats treated with chem* EE *chem , yet biliary chem* BS *chem composition was only minimally affected .

column1: Activity of CYP7A was decreased by EE in both intact and bile - diverted rats , whereas the activity of the CYP27 was not affected .
column2: Activity of CYP7A was decreased by chem* EE *chem in both intact and bile - diverted rats , whereas the activity of the CYP27 was not affected .

column1: Hepatic mRNA levels of CYP7A were significantly reduced by EE in bile - diverted rats only ; CYP27 mRNA levels were not affected by EE .
column2: Hepatic mRNA levels of CYP7A were significantly reduced by chem* EE *chem in bile - diverted rats only ; CYP27 mRNA levels were not affected by chem* EE *chem .

column1: In addition , mRNA levels of sterol 12alpha - hydroxylase and lithocholate 6beta - hydroxylase were increased by bile diversion and suppressed by EE .
column2: In addition , mRNA levels of chem* sterol *chem 12alpha - hydroxylase and lithocholate 6beta - hydroxylase were increased by bile diversion and suppressed by chem* EE *chem .

column1: This study shows that 17alpha - ethinylestradiol ( EE ) - induced intrahepatic cholestasis in rats is associated with selective inhibition of the neutral pathway of bile salt ( BS ) synthesis .
column2: This study shows that chem* 17alpha - ethinylestradiol *chem ( chem* EE *chem ) - induced intrahepatic cholestasis in rats is associated with selective inhibition of the neutral pathway of chem* bile salt *chem ( chem* BS *chem ) synthesis .

column1: Simultaneous impairment of other enzymes in the BS biosynthetic pathways may contribute to overall effects of EE on BS synthesis .
column2: Simultaneous impairment of other enzymes in the chem* BS *chem biosynthetic pathways may contribute to overall effects of chem* EE *chem on chem* BS *chem synthesis .

column1: Glibenclamide - sensitive hypotension produced by helodermin assessed in the rat .
column2: chem* Glibenclamide *chem - sensitive hypotension produced by chem* helodermin *chem assessed in the rat .

column1: The effects of helodermin , a basic 35 - amino acid peptide isolated from the venom of a lizard salivary gland , on arterial blood pressure and heart rate were examined in the rat , focusing on the possibility that activation of ATP sensitive K + ( K ( ATP ) ) channels is involved in the responses .
column2: The effects of chem* helodermin *chem , a basic 35 - chem* amino acid *chem peptide isolated from the venom of a lizard salivary gland , on arterial blood pressure and heart rate were examined in the rat , focusing on the possibility that activation of chem* ATP *chem sensitive chem* K *chem + ( chem* K *chem ( chem* ATP *chem ) ) channels is involved in the responses .

column1: The results were also compared with those of vasoactive intestinal polypeptide ( VIP ) .
column2: The results were also compared with those of vasoactive intestinal polypeptide ( VIP ) .

column1: Helodermin produced hypotension in a dose - dependent manner with approximately similar potency and duration to VIP .
column2: chem* Helodermin *chem produced hypotension in a dose - dependent manner with approximately similar potency and duration to VIP .

column1: Hypotension induced by both peptides was significantly attenuated by glibenclamide , which abolished a levcromakalim - produced decrease in arterial blood pressure .
column2: Hypotension induced by both peptides was significantly attenuated by chem* glibenclamide *chem , which abolished a chem* levcromakalim *chem - produced decrease in arterial blood pressure .

column1: Oxyhemoglobin did not affect helodermin - induced hypotension , whereas it shortened the duration of acetylcholine ( ACh ) - produced hypotension .
column2: Oxyhemoglobin did not affect chem* helodermin *chem - induced hypotension , whereas it shortened the duration of chem* acetylcholine *chem ( chem* ACh *chem ) - produced hypotension .

column1: These findings suggest that helodermin - produced hypotension is partly attributable to the activation of glibenclamide - sensitive K + channels ( K ( ATP ) channels ) , which presumably exist on arterial smooth muscle cells .
column2: These findings suggest that chem* helodermin *chem - produced hypotension is partly attributable to the activation of chem* glibenclamide *chem - sensitive chem* K *chem + channels ( chem* K *chem ( chem* ATP *chem ) channels ) , which presumably exist on arterial smooth muscle cells .

column1: EDRF ( endothelium - derived relaxing factor ) / nitric oxide does not seem to play an important role in the peptide - produced hypotension .
column2: EDRF ( endothelium - derived relaxing factor ) / chem* nitric oxide *chem does not seem to play an important role in the peptide - produced hypotension .

column1: Long - term efficacy and adverse event of nifedipine sustained - release tablets for cyclosporin A - induced hypertension in patients with psoriasis .
column2: Long - term efficacy and adverse event of chem* nifedipine *chem sustained - release tablets for chem* cyclosporin A *chem - induced hypertension in patients with psoriasis .

column1: Thirteen psoriatic patients with hypertension during the course of cyclosporin A therapy were treated for 25 months with a calcium channel blocker , sustained - release nifedipine , to study the clinical antihypertensive effects and adverse events during treatment with both drugs .
column2: Thirteen psoriatic patients with hypertension during the course of chem* cyclosporin A *chem therapy were treated for 25 months with a chem* calcium *chem channel blocker , sustained - release chem* nifedipine *chem , to study the clinical antihypertensive effects and adverse events during treatment with both drugs .

column1: Seven of the 13 patients had exhibited a subclinical hypertensive state before cyclosporin A therapy .
column2: Seven of the 13 patients had exhibited a subclinical hypertensive state before chem* cyclosporin A *chem therapy .

column1: Both systolic and diastolic blood pressures of these 13 patients were decreased significantly after 4 weeks of nifedipine therapy , and blood pressure was maintained within the normal range thereafter for 25 months .
column2: Both systolic and diastolic blood pressures of these 13 patients were decreased significantly after 4 weeks of chem* nifedipine *chem therapy , and blood pressure was maintained within the normal range thereafter for 25 months .

column1: The adverse events during combined therapy with cyclosporin A and nifedipine included an increase in blood urea nitrogen levels in 9 of the 13 patients and development of gingival hyperplasia in 2 of the 13 patients .
column2: The adverse events during combined therapy with chem* cyclosporin A *chem and chem* nifedipine *chem included an increase in chem* blood urea nitrogen *chem levels in 9 of the 13 patients and development of gingival hyperplasia in 2 of the 13 patients .

column1: Our findings indicate that sustained - release nifedipine is useful for hypertensive psoriatic patients under long - term treatment with cyclosporin A , but that these patients should be monitored for gingival hyperplasia .
column2: Our findings indicate that sustained - release chem* nifedipine *chem is useful for hypertensive psoriatic patients under long - term treatment with chem* cyclosporin A *chem , but that these patients should be monitored for gingival hyperplasia .
